title: Superb hotel!!
text: Best hotel, spacious as compared to other Times Sqaure hotels which are very cramped. It had a kitchenette which made my stay with a special need kid with distinct food requirements very easy and comfortable.  Being in midst of Times Sqaure all prime attractions of New York were so easily approachable and made our stay most memorable and most comfortable ❤️

title: Very dissapointed. No kitchen for 5 days.
text: Refrigerator and dishwasher was out of order inn our completely stay, the technical staff tried to fix it 5 times without being able to fix it. Incredible poor service and no interest to help us with new room or any compensation. Was promised 100 USD for the food we had to throw away, but even after 1 month we have not received it. What kind of service/support is this?. We have sent complain by mail/telephone and we wrote down all things that was wrong when we was there. We had mould inside our refrigerator then you sent up somebody to clean it when we told you. Coffee machine was out of order, it was replaced, missing the remote control and you came up with a new one. But 5 days without kitchen and no compensation. Unbelievable after traveling properly 20 times in the US this was the worst customer support we have experienced. The worst was that we vere honest and respectful with you and not even trying to understand us or help us. Have tried to send you several mails both directly and true our booking sites and not even sending us an answer or a compensation we believe we have entitled to get.

title: Great Stay and Location
text:
We had a wonderful stay at this great hotel. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out, we were treated with a friendly, professional manner. Flavia checked us in quickly. Our room was not huge, but plenty of room for 2 people who planned to eat most meals out anyway. Fully stocked kitchen complete with full size toaster, microwave, and dishwasher. 

Within an hour we discovered that our air conditioning wasn't working well. An engineer responded quickly and everything was fixed to our satisfaction. 

And free ice cream in the lobby on Sunday! What a surprise! It was a great and unexpected treat. Jamie was right, it's never too cold for ice cream! 

A friendly bellman helped us with subway info and we were able to navigate almost like locals. Tip: you access the 57th Street station on 55th. LOL

They advertise free American breakfast buffet, and trust me, it is huge! 4 or 5 hot options, salads, lunch meat, granola bars, cereals, yogurts, 
pastries, breads, fruit, juices. 

Checkout was also a breeze. I rang for a bellman and for my car from the valet service at 10:40. A very pleasant bellman showed up 7 minutes later. We had a TON of bags as we were visiting for a race weekend. Athletes don't pack light, ha ha.  We were in the car and pulling away before 11:00. 

We will definitely stay here again, assuming the NY Road Runners pulls my daughter's name for the marathon lottery!

title: Relatively good value
text: I've stayed at all of the Bonvoy properties in the area and, in my opinion, this one is the best value. Rooms are bright and clean. Common hallways are somewhat dystopian but the rooms are not so. Corner rooms offer some really nice views. Individual temperature controls work well.

title: What an excellent stay at a hotel.
text:
I had an excellent stay at the Residence Inn when I spent the night in Manhattan. 

I was in for the evening with a friend and they gave me a room on the 62nd floor of the hotel. Normally I do not like to be this high up but the view was spectacular and the views of Midtown and downtown were mind blowing.

The bed in the room was so comfortable that I slept soundly and woke up perfectly refreshed to the beautiful view. The sunrise from this room was well worth the stay.

The breakfast was really good with a wonderful selection of items. The eggs , potatoes and breakfast pastries were excellent and what a nice selection of breakfast items. The service at the hotel was wonderful and what nice and well trained and welcoming staff.

I highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Manhattan.

title: Dirty and cold hotel !
text: Extra dirty hotel , rooms are super dirty and old like house keeping doesnt exist !Breakfast is delicious , in fact , is the only good thing about this hotel ! Also the front desk stuff was very nice and trying to help but that didnt help us too much ! It was very cold no matter what temp u set , everything will go automatically .

title: Fantastic location with city views
text:
I was very happy with my stay, from the moment I checked in staff were extremely welcoming and accommodating. Luis on reception had assisted myself and my sister who was also staying, by kindly arranging rooms across from one another. The room itself was very spacious and had views overlooking Central Park. Location wise, I cannot fault the hotel. It's close to all the major tourist attractions and there's a multitude of amenities' on your doorstep. My only issue I encountered was that the fridge in the kitchenette was quite noisy at night and wasn't cold enough. There was an additional freezer that I could use to cool beverages.

Breakfast was included in the price and I was really happy with the options each morning. It did get very busy from 8:30am onwards but that's to be expected. For the price, I think it was very fair and I would stay again.

title: Hotel well located between Manhattan and Times Square
text:
We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. On the other hand, don't expect to have someone who speaks French.
Breakfast offered something sweet (waffles or pancakes and fruit) and especially something savory (omelette, bacon, cheese, etc.)
The room is a little dated but functional. On the other hand, we only had two knives and a spoon as tableware.
It's not easy to eat just with that.
On the other hand, the view was just great.
A little away from Times Square but yet close, we appreciated the location of the hotel. And on the other side Central Park, super practical.
For a reasonable price for New York.

title: Just ok
text: Great location.  Lobby was very nice .  The actual rooms were old and outdated.  Bathroom just felt dirty.  I wouldnt sit in the tub.  Paid off season price so not too bad.  Bed not very  comfortable.  Probably could have gotten something a little better 2 blocks over.

title: Awesome visits!!
text: Beautiful hotel, a room with an impressive view, good and clean bathroom, kitchen, refrigerator, complete. Very friendly staff. The location is unbeatable, steps from Time Square and Central Park, surrounded by restaurants, bars and fast food. We had a beautiful stay. Thank you so much!!

title: Fantastic location combined with spectacular views
text: This hotel exceeded my expectations. It’s in a great location and it’s walkable from Penn Station. We spent 2 nights just before Christmas here and we could walk everywhere from here. The room was on the small side but the corner window views day and night made the room experience incredible. Front desk staff couldn’t do enough for us. Typical quality Marriott breakfast. Room was clean and modern.

title: The rooms need some TLC and more thorough cleaning
text: I’ve stayed here a number of times before and I remember being wowed by the rooms, location and views!  It’s been a few years and this trip was a little disappointing. The size of the room and kitchenette were both great for me and the views were spectacular as ever! One minor thing was I didn’t have toiletries in the room when I arrived (no hand soap) so I had to call down to get some, and they were very prompt in bringing them up. However, the room itself has seen better days. There was a chunk of carpet missing right next to the tile of the kitchenette and the solution there was a piece of duct tape with strings from the frayed carpet hanging out. There’s a liner/bedskirt around the box spring of the mattress that is flaking off and missing chunks of the blue color in some places. The mattress is obviously old and had massive indentations and squeaked when getting into bed. The pillows and bedding smelled old and like thousands of people had slept on them without being washed/replaced, upon arrival there was hair in the shower, on top of the duvet and also on the arm chair by the window, there were stains all over the carpet - one particularly gross one that was right next to the bed and sticky - and there was an old French fry underneath the night stand next to the bed. Additionally, the shower head was spewing water every direction and the shower liner and curtain were obviously dirty - one stain looked like it was dried blood. However, the bellmen were fantastic.

title: Contemporary Art Vibe Plus Walkable to Broadway, Times Square, Central Park and Subway Stops
text:
The Residence Inn New York Mahattan/Central Park has got a late 90's contemporary art vibe - the lobby, elevators, breakfast area and common spaces have wall murals and elongated sculptures, I believe by the artist William DeBilzan. While the art is colorful, the rest of the spaces that the art occupies is rather dark. Just a personal preference, I respond better to bright and airy environments.

The hotel room - a studio with a city view, has a cute boutique feel. The kitchen has a fridge and microwave which is great for microwaving leftover NYC pizza. The location is ideal if you are in town to watch a Broadway show. Walk in one direction for Times Square and the other direction for Central Park. 

We chose this hotel because it was the best priced and located hotel from the Marriott Bonvoy chain in the Manhattan area. It also included free breakfast. The breakfast area gets rather busy, but everything in Manhattan gets rather busy. If I were to stay in the city again, I'm on the fence about whether or not I'd return here, just because I'd like to compare it to another Marriott Bonvoy hotel. Otherwise, if you like the art vibe and are collecting Marriott Bonvoy points, this is a good city stay.

title: Over The Top Stay and Customer Service
text: The whole experience, from beginning to end, was excellent.  Check in was easy, the room was clean and comfortable, the breakfasts were well executed and provide a wide variety of options.  The location was extremely convenient to so many fun and interesting entertainment options, sights and events.  Believe it or not, I left my brand new Apple tablet in my room, and the hotel Ops Manager Anca Marginean was able to swiftly retrieve it and get it to the hotel doorman Taurean Mathias, who quickly passed it to a hotel driver (Ruth) and had it delivered to LaGuardia airport.  I met the driver at the passenger dropoff at USAir and had my tablet safely back in my hands in plenty of time to catch my flight.  Now that is "above and beyond" customer service.  A special thanks to all three of you and to the Residence Inn - NY Central Park.

title: Самое ужасное место!
text:
Во первых этот отель мне оплатили друзья в подарок на Новый год. Но по приезду, с меня сняли снова всю сумму за проживание. Потом извинились, сказали, что вернут мне деньги. Но когда я уехала из отеля, они снова списали деньги с моей карты! Ужасный сервис. 
Во вторых, отель очень грязный. На полках в кухне пыль, из кондиционера летит пыль, потому что фильтр весь покрыт пылью, шторы в пятнах, шумно очень, слышно все, что делают соседи, двери закрываются очень громко! Завтрак не вкусный, обед и ужин тоже. В общем худшего отеля в своей жизни я еще не встречала! Никому не посоветую останавливаться в этом отвратительном месте. Этот отель - позор Нью Йорка!

title: Super Blick und Lage. Preis-Leistung für NY sehr gut.
text:
+ Lage Perfekt
+ Zimmer modern ausgestattet
+ Guter Blick in allen Zimmerkategorien 
+ Alle Zimmer vom „Residence Inn“ im oberen Hotelabschnitt = perfekte Aussicht 

o Frühstück ist okay aber leider eine Müllschlacht mit Verpackungen und Plastikbesteck 

- Die Rezeption arbeitet sehr langsam und hat auf „Wünsche“ (z.B. eine weitere Decke) oder Reklamationen (bei Bezug des Zimmers wurde die Bettwäsche nicht gewechselt)  entweder garnicht oder erst nach 2-3 Erinnerungen reagiert.

title: Beautiful views, that’s all you get
text: Smallest hotel room ever, most expensive price. Description says “studio, 1 king bed”. It’s exactly that.  Very small, and to be a newer hotel, they’ve not kept up with the polish of most Marriott properties. Agreed it’s in a wonderful location at the top of Times Square, however, and the views are amazing as our room was on the 57th floor.  But either it’s lazy maintenance or a general manager that does not perform random checks……the place needs updating.  Very sad when it’s not an old hotel.

title: A wonderful stay!
text: We stayed here for 5 nights over Thanksgiving. As essentially novice NYC tourists,  I debated a lot about where in Manhattan to stay. We are Bonvoy members, so I narrowed it down to Marriott family properties. The positive reviews and amenities won me over for the Residence Inn. It was also appealing that it wasn't completely in Times Square.  It's conveniently located on 54th right off Broadway,about 5 blocks south of Columbus Circle and Central Park, and about 5 blocks north of Times Square. I'm not sure why they use Central Park in the name, it's really more Midtown. Upon our arrival, the valet took care of our vehicle quickly. I felt $60 a day for valet parking was pretty reasonable.  I had requested a high up floor when I made the reservation,  and we were placed on the 62nd floor. What a view! It's the tallest hotel in North America with 65 floors. Our room had a full size bed and a twin. The full size seemed even smaller than a typical full. Other than that, the room was really nice and had everything we needed. It was clean and aesthetically pleasing too. We had cleaning services daily with all toiletries restocked. The little kitchenette was very nice to have, but we ended up not using it as much as I thought we would.  We were not in the room much, breakfast was included and we ate dinner out each night. The breakfast buffet was a highlight.  Very well stocked with food, plates, utensils,  everything you could need. There's a huge area to eat in with many tables and chairs.  It wasn't at all what I imagined. They had a bar that also served starbucks drinks in the morning.  They also served really good quick bites in the evening- we ate there one night when our other dinner plans fell through.  Lots of friendly employees around.  The lobby was also very nice and well staffed - and on parade day they had baskets of complimentary hand warmers and a kind gentleman serving up hot cocoa! Delightful! It was a pricey stay but very much in line with prevailing rates at comparable properties in the vicinity.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Espetacular!
text:
Hospedagem maravilhosa. Foi a minha 5a vez na cidade e, sem dúvida, foi o melhor hotel que já fiquei em NYC. 
Front desk excepcional, com destaque para Gwen e Anka, que foram amáveis o tempo todo comigo e minha bebê. 
Café da manhã ótimo e super organizado. Mesmo se tratando de um hotel com muitos quartos, não enfrentei problemas para essa refeição. Frutas frescas deliciosas. O hotel estimula o "to go" com o café da manhã, o que me ajudou com a alimentação da bebe ao longo do dia. O responsável pelo salão do café, cujo nome não perguntei, é extremamente amável. Nossa família se sentiu super acolhida no hotel, especialmente minha bebê.
 Quarto excepcional! Vista de tirar o fôlego. O berço fornecido atende muito bem.
Máquinas de lavar roupa disponíveis no andar 35, mediante pagamento por lavagem/secagem (sabão é fornecido como cortesia do hotel!). Ótimo para quem viaja em família. 
Garrafas de água a vontade disponíveis na recepção. 
Cozinha do quarto atende bem.
O hotel fica a 3 quadras do Central Park e ao lado tem um market que vende tudo (estilo whole foods) e é 24h!

title: Wonderful
text: This was not my first stay at this hotel. After a two year pause, I have encountered the same professional and friendly attitude of the staff members. I should like to thank Flavia for the room upgrade and the fast check-in that was highly appreciated after an eight hour transatlantic flight. I should also like to thank Pam for lending me her Apple adapter to allow me to charge the Apple Watch battery. The breakfast is also great and it’s a short walk to Central Park and Times Square, in addition to the various subway stations and buses. I am already looking forward to my next stay.

title: Wonderful views and super service.
text:
Had a wonderful stay at the Residence Inn by Marriott, Central Park Manhattan. The room was very comfortable and the views could not be beat. We couldn’t hardly bring ourselves to close the curtains because of the fantastic setting. 

The staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. A special shout out to Farida who was doing the room service for our floor. She did a fantastic job , was very pleasant and worked with our variable schedule to ensure that the room was cleaned while we were out. It made the trip even more relaxing. 

We will definitely be coming back!!

title: Great location and views of the city
text: The views from this hotel on the highest floors are spectacular. The other huge plus is the location. It is a short walk to Central Park, Times Square, the theater district, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State building, shopping and restaurants. The subway stops nearby also. The breakfast buffet was good with a large selection of foods. The rooms are small but efficient with a small galley kitchenette. The bed was comfortable and the HVAC kept the air temperature comfortable as well. The hotel is showing a bit of wear since our last stay, but we would definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent property, location and staff....
text: Situated between Times Square and Central Park, a perfect location for visitors. Very large breakfast buffet is included. Subway #1 is at 50th and Broadway. View is from 42 nd floor ..4208. highly recommend this hotel. There is a Starbucks on the same floor as the breakfast buffet.

title: Closet For a Room
text: We stayed at this hotel for s short trip to NYC.  It was billed as Manhattan/Central Park but it is really Broadway near Times Square.  The reviews for the most part were positive and since I am a Marriott Preferred Guest we booked the room.  The hotel contains both a residence inn and a comfort inn in the same building just different floors.  Our room was as small as a closet literally about 10x10 with the bed encompassing the entire room except for an over large chair.  There is no dresser in the room so you are forced to keep your clothes in the suitcase or stack them on a closet shelf.  The bathroom can not fit a door that closes so that it has a sliding door that does not close shut.  The service at this hotel is nonexistent.  If you try to call on the phone down to the front desk no one answers.  This is definitely not a couples hotel.  The street that it is on, 54th St., is crowded and dirty.  All this for over $500 a night.  What more can I say!

title: Great Staff
text: Great staff! Every staff member was beyond nice and helpful. From the fronk desk staff to the house cleaning staff. Excellent group, obviously trained great! The location was perfect. Very close to everthing in the midtown area. Within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway theaters!

title: Just OK
text:
I'll start this review by saying I've stayed at this hotel many times in the past but not in the last 6 years.  Returned this week for a short 2 night stay.

PROS:

Tallest hotel in North America (65th floor is top)
Great location
Amazing views from any room (higher the better)
Nice staff
HVAC that has a fan ON option (white noise)

CONS:

Showing its age
Massive WIFI problem (not just me and was out 75% of my stay)
Towels were stained
Provided shampoo bottle was full of hair
Door to bathroom was broken
Not the cleanest room

In short I would stay again but just know its for the location and views.

title: Lage, Lage, Lage
text: Ein traumhaftes Zimmer in einem tollen Hotel in perfekter Lage, Times Square, Broadway, Central Park , Rockefeller Center, St. Patricks Cathedral, Carnegie Hall, alles fußläufig erreichbar. Frühstück reichhaltig, Personal ausgesprochen freundlich

title: Exceptional property in the heart of Manhattan!
text:
Wonderful property, perfect location, with fabulous views from the 51st floor!  Breakfast is excellent and hotel staff went out of their way to accommodate, including changing the coffee maker in the room to a Kuerig upon request. 
We left behind a full garment bag in the closet when we checked out and their loss prevention staff arranged with ILeftMyStuff to have it boxed and shipped to our home. 
We will definitely stay at this property on our next visit to Manhattan!

title: Overall a great stay. I’d stay in this hotel again.
text:
Great location. Efficient check in and out.  Pleasant front desk staff. The included breakfast was satisfactory. Clean rooms and comfortable bed and pillows. We did not use the small kitchen but I would have if we stayed longer. 

The room lighting could have been better. 

I recommend this hotel for those visiting NYC.

title: Muy bueno, pero ya no tanto
text: Es un hotel muy bien ubicado, a pocas cuadras del Central Park y de Times Square. Muy cerca de estaciones de metro y lineas de buses. La vista es muy bonita pues está en los pisos altos de un edificio ubicado en Brodway, pero con entrada por la calle 54. El desayuno es muy bueno y completo. La habitación (pedí la con una cama doble y una simple) Tiene todo para cocinar. Cubiertos, vasos, micro hondas, lava vajillas, cafetera y otras. Pero se nota que ya es un hotel que está muy usado. Hay un pequeño deterioro y falta de limpieza (ejemplo debajo de la cafetera). Es un poco caro (cerca de US$ 500 por noche, por ello debiese ser siempre impecable, lo que no logra) Pero aun así sigue siendo un muy buen hotel. Era mi segunda vez en este hotel (la primera el 2016) y se nota cómo pasa el tiempo por el uso de las instalaciones.

title: AMAZING STAFF!
text:
Customer service from the front desk and bell desk was second to none! They were so friendly and accommodating! Loved our stay here! We were on the 52 floor and loved the view. It's refreshing to have such great customer service and can't say enough good things about it.

Breakfast was decent and clean so that's all that mattered to us.

Only negative thing was the hallways were dark and creepy looking. Didn't reflect the feel of the hotel at all.

 We would definitely stay here again. It was close to everything we wanted to do so it was great!

title: Amazing customer service!
text:
Stayed at this hotel for one night before flying to Europe. Excellent location and view in room. 
The best part was the amazing customer service I received. The Uber driver failed to put my suitcase in the trunk. I failed to see that it didn’t come with me. Marriott (William Rodriguez from security) mailed my entire suitcase, at their expense, to my home. 
I appreciated their outstanding customer service!

title: Nice option for tourists
text:
I ended up here under very unfortunate circumstances—my second cancelled flight in just a few days.  I don’t normally stay in midtown, but this was one of the only options left on a night of multiple flight cancellations during the US Open and Fashion Week.

Checkin was wonderful.  Fast, courteous.  More than courteous.  They even provided me with a bottle of wine because of what I had been through.  It really made a bad night a little better and made me feel appreciated as an ambassador.

Because of the lack of availability, I had a “family” studio with a double and twin bed.  Bed is comfortable.  Decent linens.  And usually when I stay at a Residence Inn or a three star Marriott property, I would never consider using the tub.  The tub here is spotless!  I was really impressed!  I plan on soaking in it tomorrow.

Plenty of drawers, closet space, storage.  The kitchen isn’t a full suite like many Residence Inn properties, but it’s very functional, efficient, and sleek.  There is a small dual fridge/freezer, a dishwasher, a microwave, and a cabinet of dishes.

Airflow/temperature regulation is good.  Plenty of lighting to meet whatever wishes you have—lamps galore in all parts of the room.

My room had a nice city view.  Windows insulated well and keeps the noise out.  My room has been really quiet!

The only bummer is that their laundry room is under renovation so I couldn’t do my laundry, but lucky future patrons will get a nice new laundry room.

They do have larger rooms and suites and a number of options to meet the needs of various families, groups, etc.

I unfortunately ended up paying a surge pricing of sorts, around 550 a night, but generally prices are lower.  Near Times Square and Broadway and a lot of tourist attractions.

I’m not a midtown girl, but this is a nice, clean, comfortable spot, especially for families and groups who want to do the tourist thing.

title: Sole proprietor care from a big city hotel
text: Good overall experience. Left my iPad in my room. Every one with whom I communicated was helpful and prompt to facilitate returning my possession to me quickly. I’m very grateful for their friendly, personal service. I didn’t expect to receive such caring help.

title: Bad service and disgusting cleaning
text: Me and my family recently stayed, we had booked 2 rooms. 1 of the rooms had 2 separate beds, and besides one of the pillows in the smaller bed. there we’re disgusting old gum from the previous guests. there were three pieces, and we told the receptionist at around 11am. we come home around 5pm and the gum was still not removed. i went down then 2 times again and told the in a polite way if they please could send someone up. they said they contacted someone to do it, well funny enough they didn't i waited 2 hours more until i called via the phone in the room. the manager picked up and i explained, he said that he would send someone up the next day. again no one showed up, such a bad experience. plus the carpet in the room between the beds weren’t cleaned either, there were old food from the previous guests again. the staff definitely disappointed me, i have never felt more disgusting sleeping in a bed knowing someones else's old gum is next to my head. my family is ambassador elite and we had some of the worst cleaned rooms i have ever been in.

title: Best View / Excelente Experience / Highly Recommended
text: Best view in NY, floor to ceiling window in a corner room on top floor with an amazing view to Central Park and Manhattan. Also the breakfast option was great. Good variety with quality products and nice dinning area on Broadway. Staff was so helpful Victor went above and beyond to make sure I get the best room. Rashad bell man was so helpful and found a limo to take me to The airport with a better price comparing to Uber. Definitely I will be back thanks for the great service

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We loved this hotel.Had a great big breakfast everyday.Great location to lots of attractions and subway stations.The rooms were clean and excellent housekeeping service everyday.We loved the kitchenette area.We are so glad we picked this hotel!

title: Awesome Hotel & Service from Flavia!
text:
My wife & I were in NY on 7/20/23 & had a fantastic experience at the Residence Inn Central Park. First, I have to thank Flavia at the front desk, who went out of her way to get us checked into our room early so that we could get changed for our 4:30 plans. Flavia could not have been more helpful and friendly! As a Lifetime Titanium Bonvoy member, I travel a lot & rarely ask for special treatment but when I needed it, Flavia came through!

And that room she assigned us was a gorgeous, modern & huge! We had a corner on the 48th floor that overlooked the "ball drop" tower in Times Square with Central Park views in the distance. Wonderful!

Finally, the hotel has an amazing lounge on the 2nd floor that is open 24 hours. There is a nice bar and they serve a delicious free breakfast every morning.

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel & will definitely stay there the next time I am in the area.

title: Consider the price, location
text:
I've seen some negative reviews of this hotel and I think -- for the most part -- they are way off base.  First consider the price (reasonable) and location (amazing) -- they should factor into some of these reviews, but often they don't.  People demand too much even though they have not splurged for the St. Regis or Mandarin Oriental.

Yes, the rooms can be a bit small, etc., but we had a great time at the residence Inn.  It was walking distance to most of midtown, Columbus circle, MOMA, Times Square, the park, etc.  You cannot beat the location.

The Air Con and TV and wifi were all good.  The TV let my child stream Netflix.  

My only real gripe with the hotel is the breakfast.  It's just okay.  It's a buffet and will do for most people, but you won't be impressed.

The lobby is also a bit small and crowded at times, but for the average tourist, who cares -- you won't be hanging about in the lobby anyway.  

Overall, a good price... and I almost forgot to mention the staff are super-trained and friendly.

title: Super friendly staff
text: We stayed here for a week in May and loved it!  We were nervous after reading negative reviews but really can't understand what reviewers were complaining about as that was not our experience at all.  As 3 females travelling we always felt safe here - Central Park was 10 minutes one way and Times Square was 10 minutes the other way, it's a perfect location.  We loved the view from our room at night time when New York was all lit up.  Our room was spacious with a big bathroom, always well stocked with plenty of towels and toiletries.  The little kitchenette was very handy when we bought drinks and groceries, or took boxes up from breakfast.  Talking of breakfast this was fantastic - a huge room with plenty of seating and a massive array of fresh food always being restocked by the plenty of staff milling around answering any queries and cleaning up.  There was a gentleman who was always clearing away tables and emptying the bins and was friendly and helpful.  He obviously loved little kids and would pay special attention  to families who were juggling their kids while also trying to have breakfast.  A couple of times we saw him produce a packaged cookie from his back pocket to give to a little one and their little faces lit up and the parents were always so pleased that someone was paying attention to their kids - we thought this was lovely and such a personal touch.  We've read other reviews that the breakfast room was too small with a limited range but that is not the case at all - it was brilliant - best of all they provide boxes so that you can take foodstuffs away with you which we did all the time and could then store in our in room fridge.  We never saw the cleaners but they did an amazing job and twice they did our washing up!  We never had that before and it was a pleasant surprise as we were intending to do it when we got back in the evening.  The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and one young lady receptionist always gave us a wave and a smile as we passed by as she recognised us after a couple of days, though she always struggled to understand our English accents!  The concierge guys were brilliant and so helpful.  I can't remember their names except for the one with a film star name - Orlando.  They answered all our annoying tourist questions and one of the guys, when we asked about a cab, took us up to the corner and used his whistle to stop a cab, opened the door and sent us on our way - such a nice personal touch which made us feel cared for.  The air conditioning in our room was very effective and was not noisy at all so maybe the people who mentioned it were just unlucky.  Yes the elevators did make a noise but not that you couldn't sleep.  We loved New York and would like to return and will definitely stay here again - I would 100% recommend staying here.

title: Great view, great hotel
text: We booked this hotel because it's the tallest one in New York City and the view from Room 6204 was amazing. Everything about the hotel was great. The room was very clean, large by NY standards and included a fully stocked kitchenette. Beds (a double and a twin) were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious and was included in the cost. Everyone was very helpful, particularly Errol, who saw my husband is blind and helped me get his meal and food to take back to the room for my son. The midtown location was excellent, with restaurants and a supermarket just a block away. We had a wonderful weekend!

title: Filthy, moldy room at Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park
text: My daughter had an appointment with a doctor in Manhattan who is a well-known specialist for chronic mold illness and Lyme’s Disease.  They stayed at the Marriott on our suggestion, as we have been members for over 40 years.  This hotel was filthy, garbage had not been removed, mold was in the kitchen and shower, and the kitchen was not equipped as advertised.  She was so ill by the next day she had to check out early.  She contacted the front desk and nothing was done.  I do not understand why this hotel has 5 star ratings.

title: All-Around Great Property, Outstanding Customer Service (Errol Is Awesome!)
text:
I stayed at this property with my family during the Independence Day holiday. As always, let's go Pros and Cons.

PROS
1. I'll start this review by praising Errol! He's the lead breakfast manager. His spirit and energy is everything you would want in someone who works in the service industry. He welcomed everyone who entered the breakfast area and would check on you to make sure you and your family had everything you needed. Over several days, I watched his interaction with guests who stayed multiple nights. He remembered names and checked on folks as if they were his family. My son is a very picky eater and Errol prepared pancakes for him even though pancakes weren't available that morning. Marriott's management should have Errol train all of its employees because he's that good. From little kids to grandparents to all ages in between, everyone showed their appreciation. Interacting with Errol served as a great start to each morning. You can tell that he loves his job. I hope he's there if and when we visit this property again. Outstanding! 
2. Speaking of breakfast, plenty of different food options were available. I was pleasantly surprised as it's free for guests.
3. Location: The hotel is close to nearly everything you'd want to see in Midtown - Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, Rockefeller Center. You'll also find many restaurants within a short walking distance, including chain restaurants (Chick-Fil-A, Sweetgreen, Chipotle) and many others. 
4. Customer Service: In addition to Errol, the entire team provided outstanding service from start to finish. Thank you to Lani at the front desk as she made us feel at home from the moment we arrived.
5. The workout room has ample space and more equipment than most hotels. Again, I was pleasantly surprised.
6. We stayed on the 48th floor and enjoyed a great view of Central Park and the Hudson River.
7. The shower water pressure was strong (but not too strong) and also included a thermometer that allowed you to read the water temperature. Also, major kudos to the tall shower head which is great for anyone who stands taller than 6-3. 
8. The air conditioning unit worked great and wasn't loud, which can be an issue for some rooms.

CONS
1. This is nitpicky, but the temperature in the workout room was extremely cold, which is uncomfortable when you're working out and sweating.
2. Breakfast can be busy with the combination of the Residence Inn and Courtyard guests. We ate around 30 minutes before breakfast closed and it was a better experience.

OVERALL: I may have found my new go-to Marriott hotel in New York City. It has everything you need.

title: 眺望が良くアクセスも良いホテルです！
text:
初めてのNY旅行、夫婦で６泊利用しました。前もってリクエストしていたので57階の部屋で、眺望も素晴らしく初めハドソン川やタイムズスクエアが見えてテンションが上がりました！
ハドソン川やタイムズスクエアが見えてテンションが上がりました！
タイムズスクエアまでは徒歩10分少々で、ブロードウェイの劇場にもすぐに行けます。メトロの駅も近いです。初めての方にも分かりやすいと思います。
部屋は広くはありませんがとても便利な場所なのでそこは許容範囲だと思います。キッチンもついていたので日本から持参したパックご飯やお味噌汁なども簡単に食べられましたし、おかずはすぐ近くのスーパーで調達できました。（好きなものを詰め込んで計量して買う形式です）
無料の朝食については大変美味しく、清潔に提供されていて毎朝の楽しみでした。各種パンやオートミール、デニッシュ、シリアル、ソーセージやベーコン、卵、野菜もありましたし、果物も毎朝出ていました。飲み物もコーヒー紅茶以外にジュースもありました。
テーブル使用後もすぐに綺麗にしてくれていて汚れたままという事はなかったです。
これは日本では当たり前ですが外国では汚い事も多いので、素晴らしいと思います。
ベーグルが美味しかったので他の方にならってテイクアウト用のボックスでランチボックスを作って出先で食べたりもしました。思っていた以上にクオリティーが高い朝食でした。
部屋の清掃について、私たちの部屋は毎日きれいにされていて問題はなかったです。スタッフさんは皆さんフレンドリーで笑顔で挨拶を交わしたりできて楽しかったです。ランチボックスやコーヒーを抱えていた時、笑顔でペーパーバッグを持ってきてくれたり、清掃係の女性が明るく話しかけてきたり、些細な事が思い出に残ります。フロントのGEMさんもチェックイン、チェックアウト時の業務が迅速で対応も丁寧で、彼女の美しさと笑顔も印象に残っています。ホテルの良し悪しで旅の印象は変わります。今回は本当に楽しい旅行になりました。評価を4にしたのは、部屋のエアコンの音が大きくて温度調整が難しかった事と、お風呂の栓が女性にはとても固くてうまく締められない事、キッチンの流しが詰まりやすいという点です。でも総合的にとても良いホテルです！また泊まりたいと思うホテルでした。ありがとうございました！

title: MOLD! FILTHY! NO KITCHEN! BAD FOR PHYSICAL DISABILITY! HARD TO FIND!
text:
This hotel was filthy!!!!!! The room had not been cleaned well and there was trash. The shower had MOLD everywhere! The room ventilation system was full of dust and visible MOLD. We stayed for one night. After about 30 minutes in the room, we were incredibly stuffed up and could barely breathe. The next morning we were very sick. 

There is no kitchen!!!! There is a drawer-pull dishwasher, fridge, freezer, a microwave. I am unsure why there are pots and pans considering you can not use them in a microwave. There is no hot plate or cooktop, there isn't even a toaster oven. 

You have to use a hotel key card to push the handicap button on the handicapped entrance to the hotel lobby! Even with the hotel key card the button would not work. 

We used 3 GPS systems and both the mailing address for the hotel and the GPS address provided on their website that they say to use for travel. The GPS address sent me to another Marriot Residence in NY entirely and their website is confusing, it should be clear that the hotel is both a Residence and a Courtyard. It was incredibly hard to find, the GPS address was incorrect, and eventually, we had to use the mailing address, our eyes, and map reading, thankfully my partner was there to help me navigate so I could focus on the road.

title: Exceptionnel!
text:
Fantastique!
Habitué à séjourner au Novotel qui à désormais changé de nom, j'ai tenté le Residence Inn by Mariott.
Déjà, c'est très bien placé, entre Central Park et Time Square. 
L'accueil s'est parfaitement déroulé mais dommage que le jour de notre arrivé il n'y ai pas eu d'interlocuteur Français au comptoir. En revanche, une distribution de glaces était offerte, ça c'est cool!
Nous avions réservé une chambre en hauteur et on aura été gâté, le 64ème étage avec une vue inoubliable, un rêve!
La chambre était spacieuse et confortable, prendre sa douche en voyant l'Hudson, énorme!
J'avais lu des critiques sur le petit déjeuner, moi je l'ai trouvé très complet et très bon, franchement, c'était une réussite encore de ce côté.
Je tiens tout particulièrement à souligner et remercier Farida qui avait en charge notre chambre. ADORABLE, disponible, souriante (et parlant Français), rigoureuse, elle était pour moi une fantastique ambassadrice de cet hôtel!!
Bref, un sans faute, j'y reviendrais sans la moindre hésitation, c'était parfait.

title: Nice views not so good breakfast
text: Great views from the sixty- first floor. Room was clean, but in need of of a refurbishment. Breakfast was a Huge disappointment. Paper plates and plastic cutlery  is not what I'd  expect  at a 4* hotel anywhere  in the world.

title: Modern and clean hotel. Excellent location. Wonderful customer service. Walkable distance to Midtown attractions. And al
text:
We arrived at the hotel around 1 o’clock, and we’re pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. My daughter and I traveled into the city to celebrate her 16th birthday. When I told the lady at the front desk, Kim, she made sure we had a room on the 54th floor with a view of Times Square! She even let my daughter pick out a snack. 
The room was very modern and clean. And the views of the Hudson river in Times Square were beautiful. 
The evening happy hour was very nice with a reasonably priced drinks. And breakfast in the morning had a lot of different food options. My daughter loved the eggs and potatoes.
It was convenient to the Columbus Circle and also seventh Avenue subway. It was walkable distance to Times Square.

title: Great 4 night stay
text:
From checking in until leaving the reception staff could not do enough for you, they were fantastic. We were a little concerned about reading reviews about the elevators but we went to breakfast approx 8.30 each morning and never had to wait. There were always plenty of tables to sit at and a very enjoyable breakfast. All of the staff were extremely friendly. The location is fantastic.  On the last day the taxi didn't turn up to take us to the airport & the lady on reception (Wioleta?) was brilliant, sorry if l have your name wrong but thankyou for all your help.
Only negatives, yes the decor is a little tired & the elevators are a bit noisy, take ear plugs. (Room 4205)
Thank you for a great stay
I didn't receive a survey from the hotel therefore l have written a review here.

title: Our home away from home in New York
text:
The best location, wonderful modern room with a view, excellent breakfast with plenty of healthy choices. In case you fancy to cook, there is an Instant Pot, dishwasher, sink, glasses, plates, microwave, tea kettle, coffee maker and what not in the room. 

Have already stayed twice (and countless times at the Courtyard by Marriott located in the same beautiful high rise building on the lower floors) and will definitely return.

title: Great Location and Service
text:
Loved the location - between Times Square and Central Park. Close to Metro stations to get to all there us to see. Staff very friendly and helpful.
Great breakfast included in stay - Errol fantastic in breakfast - giving helpful advice and always welcoming every morning.

title: Don't expect to be able to leave the hotel or go to breakfast easily between 8am-10 am
text:
The hotel elevators simply do not operate correctly. We waited between 20 and 45 minutes for an elevator that we could fit in to arrive. they go to the high floors first and then fill up . so on the 45th floor they were always full to go down to breakfast and then to leave the hotel at around 9;30-10-30 am was impossible. we resorted to pressing up button as well (which the front desk suggested!) riding to the top and then back down again. sometimes we walked up 10 flights to catch an elevator back down to the lobby as it was quicker. On the final day, despite leaving extra time, we got to the stage where we were getting tight for time for our airline. Front desk said they couldn't help and said I would have to carry my bags down the stairwell. 
Other than that the location is great on the edge of Hell's kitchen and close to Times square. The breakfast is good if you can actually get the elevator down. The décor is tired the room was scruffy but clean with broken furniture trims etc. 
The room was noisy, the elevators echo around the building (on our floor we had the room furthest from the elevators) and the fridge freezer seems powered by a small jet engine. at least the elevators don't seem to get used much after about 11pm. AC was very noisy and on/off cold air blast with thermostat.
Overall about a 3 star hotel with dysfunctional elevators. I think there are nicer options at this price point.

title: UN DISASTRO ! MAI PIU ‘ ….
text:
Come da titolo. 
Premetto che allo stesso civico ( nella stessa torre )  convivono due alberghi : questo ( nei piani più alti ) ed il Courtyard ( nei piani più bassi ) dello stesso gruppo ( anche se di fascia clienti e prezzo più basso)
Accoglienza fredda. Camera microscopiche anche per essere a NYC soprattutto perchè ho prenotato una camera premium. 
Purtroppo le foto mi avevano ingannato …
Arredi un poco datati ed usurati dal tempo , pulizia migliorabile , comunque il tutto accettabile.
Buona connessione internet anche se non stabile.
La parte peggiore della mia esperienza è stata la colazione … : una vera bolgia da girone dantesco …perchè una zona dove coesistono gli abitanti dei due alberghi e la peggio cosa è il fatto che è una formula “all can you eat” …anzi peggio … qui la formula invita anche a portarsi via il cibo ! Una cosa assurda oltre che uno spreco mai visto nella storia.
Un albergo anonimo , impersonale che non consiglio agli europei in genere.
Rapporto qualità prezzo scarso.
Non infierisco oltre … perchè la vista dai piani alti sul fiume Hudson ( oltre che sulla zona di Broadway ) non è davvero niente male.
NON CONSIGLIO in zona c’è di meglio.

title: A Real Find
text: Very much enjoyed staying here during a quick trip to NYC. We were given a very high room with a great view looking north toward Central Park. The room was perfect for our needs and was very quiet. We LOVED the shower -- fantastic water pressure. The staff could not have been nicer. Although we were not in town for theater, the location can't be beat. Easy to walk in many directions, or use the subway. A real find.

title: Great location
text: Great location for everything we planned to see & do. Lifts take some time so be prepared. Buffet breakfast was ideal to set you up for the day. Reception staff & breakfast staff friendly & helpful. Room was fully fitted with kitchen area, fridge & microwave

title: ¡Espectacular, superó expectativas, súper experiencia!
text:
Este hotel nos ha sorprendido gratamente.
A la llegada nos recibieron con mucha amabilidad. Fue muy cálida la atención de Karina en la recepción y la todo el personal de la zona del desayuno. ¡Qué gran servicio!
Contrario a lo que leíamos en algunos comentarios, el desayuno nos pareció súper acertado. Muy variado. Hay ciertos alimentos que siempre se repiten y algunos otros van rotando. Hay fruta, granola, avena, verduras, huevo, tocineta, chorizo, panes normales e integrales, muchos quesos y jamones distintos, varios jugos, café y diferentes tipos de leche. Nos encantó.
Otros comentarios también hablaban de la espera excesiva en los ascensores. Nunca nos sucedió. Siempre llegó rápido y contamos con la suerte de tener la habitación en el último piso (el 65), y el ascensor bajaba como cohete ¡Rapidísimo!
¿La habitación? Espectacular. Las vistas más soñadas a toda la ciudad de Nueva York, hacia el lado que mira a New Jersey y en ventana veíamos la parte de Central Park. ¡Impresionante!
La habitación contaba con cama doble extragrande, súper cómoda. Teníamos una mini cocina con todo lo básico para cocinar o calentar comidas de afuera. Microhondas, airfryer, nevera, cafetera, cubiertos y vajilla. Todo lo necesario.
El baño muy bien. Con la posibilidad de abrir la ventana y ver NY mientras te bañas ¡Toda una experiencia!.
Lo único era la ducha un poco pegada a la pared. Pero la verdad es un detalle mínimo frente a todo lo otro tan positivo.
Contamos con caja fuerte donde cabía el computador, armario con suficientes ganchos y varios espejos en la habitación.

En cuanto a ubicación, mejor no puede estar. A 2 cuadras de la estación del metro. Muy cerca de Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center. En la zona hay supermercados y restaurantes.

El hotel no es económico, pero si quieres tener una estancia cómoda, agradable con tu propio mirador a la ciudad y en una ubicación perfecta, esta es la opción sin lugar a dudas.

title: Wonderful Location, Views, and Service
text: This is our favorite hotel in NYC. Perfect location near both Central Park and Broadway Theaters. The rooms are large and the views are magnificent. We stayed on the 55th floor with a wonderful view of Central Park. As a Marriott Lifetime Platinum member, I received a complimentary upgrade to a corner room with the view described above. Great service. Great room. Great breakfast buffet. And a perfect location (the corner of Broadway & W. 54th. This is where we always stay in NYC. If you go, try to get tickets to Moulin Rouge, the best musical on Broadway!

title: Great visit - great property
text: We had a wonderful visit at this property. Friendly staff constantly greeted us and helped make our stay more enjoyable.  The property itself is well kept up and just up the street from all the major attractions. Thanks for a great stay!!!!!!

title: Excellent hotel, location couldn't be better!
text:
This is a really good hotel in an excellent location.
We considered the Courtyard in the same building/reception etc but the Residence are on the higher floors with subsequent spectacular views, have a kitchen area within the room and also include breakfast.
We weren't disappointed - the room was really well appointed, spotlessly clean and of course we never tired of looking out of the windows!
The breakfast included a really good selection - it was a bit chaotic on the first morning as we had it a bit later than we normally would due to jetlag, but the next day was fine. There are take away boxes/cups etc if you wanted to take your food back to your room which a lot of people did.
The best part of the hotel though is the staff. They are all friendly, professional and efficient.  Particular shout out to Anca who, via a request from a friend who used to work there,  helped us secure a high floor corner room which was amazing - it couldn't have been easy to do this given the demand for these rooms but it was very much appreciated  - thank you very much Anca!
Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

title: Superb location for an amazing time in New York.
text:
The hotel is in a super location (54th Street) for an amazing time in New York. My advice would be to request a higher floor that looks over Times Square and the Hudson River.

 On arrival we were warmly greeted by Gen who then checked us in.  I had contacted Pamela before our arrival to request a suite on a higher floor.

The suite had a fully equipped  kitchenette, well appointed en-suite and large comfortable bed.  The room also has a TV but this was not required as the views were spectacular.

The 4th floor is where the bar and restaurant is located.  Starbucks coffee and other goods are available to purchase.  The included breakfast had a wide variety of choices to please everyone.

Check out was by 11:00 and  our luggage was stored securely with the concierge until we were collected to go to the airport.

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
I've stayed at dozens of NYC Marriotts. But THIS hotel totally wowed me. Can you imagine have a thermostat in your shower? A perfectly laid out small but cleaver room, and service where every doorman, front desk, and breakfast aide makes you feel incredibly special?  The hotel starts on the 35th floor, so all rooms are quiet.

And BTW - the best free breakfast in Manhattan.

title: vacanza spettacolare
text: Aver scelto questo hotel per la nostra prima volta a new york è stato davvero stupendo. la posizione è ottima, gli arredi bellissimi, curato in ogni dettaglio, tutti super gentili a ogni nostra richiesta, la colazione ottima e quello che non potrò mai dimenticare la vista su time square dal 61 piano. Lo consiglio vivamente e non vedo l'ora di ritornarci

title: Mostly Excellent
text: We just returned from our 4th stay here and the hotel has become our New York City favorite.  The staff is always cheerful, personable and helpful.  Our view was spectacular, the bed exceptionally comfortable and the included breakfast always impresses although I suggest going early to avoid the crowds.  We did have one surprising issue.  The room had no dresser or drawer/storage space. We had never come across this on previous visits.   We spoke to someone at the front desk and an offer was made to switch rooms.  We declined the offer knowing that we would have to repack and spend unnecessary time  waiting for and making the change.  We made do and got creative.  We moved things around from a kitchen cupboard and counter space  and also stored things on top of that cupboard so we didn't have to live out of suitcases during our visit.  It does seem as if there is ample space to add a narrow dresser to the room.  When we return we will be sure to request a room with proper storage options.  We shall return.

title: Fantastic experience, breathtaking views!
text:
Myself and my wife visited from the UK.  The hotel was absolutely fantastic.  Lani from reception was so helpful in getting us everything we needed.  We had a room on the 64th floor, which we realised was the second highest hotel floor in the entire USA.  The view was incredible of Times Square and we spent hours just gazing out!  

Everything about the hotel feels very premium.  The room was clean and modern, with amenities such as a refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave etc. The gym again has incredible views and has lots of treadmills, Peleton bikes etc. There always seemed to be a bit of a scramble for the free weights and weights machines and they could do with a few more as these were very popular. 

Breakfast was excellent, with lots of choice of food.  The whole environment felt very modern and relaxing, with great music and views over the city.  They would have days where French toast, or muffins were served.  

Even little things were noticed, such as cookies and iced team being served to guests in the lobby on various afternoons and staff always very willing to help even with basic things like subways cards or directions.

100% would stay here again and in fact we plan to in the future!

title: Nice and Clean
text:
My room was nice and clean and was on a high floor. Breakfast is very much appreciated and set me up for a busy day. All staff were polite and efficient, though I had to wait in line almost every time I had a quick question. 

A bit of sour grapes here. I stayed for 6 nights and booked a Time Square view room. The view was just ok and off to the side. I ran into 2 different guests who got some deal so they paid almost 1/ 3 of what I paid. They were on the same floor and had even better views. One would think that I might have been upgraded, given the premium price and length of stay. Soured me a bit on the place.

title: Wonderful view and wonderful stay!
text:
The included hot breakfast buffet had many choices, the front desk staff were all very kind and generous (our snack were $1 over the $20 included piece and they just let it slide and said not to worry about it or the tax and the next day after we had checked out and were just picking our luggage up, my husband wanted a diet clear soda - something he couldn’t find at any store or food truck - and they didn’t charge him for that either!).

We had a room right by the elevator and I wondered if we would hear it, but we never did once. 

The Times Square and port views were amazing in our room, and the kitchen was very well appointed. We weren’t sure what the pans were for as we saw no stove or such, but they had an electric kettle in addition to a coffee maker, a dishwasher, microwave, small fridge and freezer about the same size (we were told the top was the freezer but that seemed reversed in our room).

The king bed was comfortable and we slept great. The location just down from The Colbert Show was excellent. Our room on the 60th floor was ready for us when we got there at around noon. Everything was just wonderful! 

The shower also had a neat thermometer to see how hot the water was.

title: Good place for a stay in Manhattan
text: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days and appreciated the young lady called Gen at the front desk arranging for a great corner room with a view. She was great. Super friendly and cheerful at all times. She even helped us with the late check out. The hotel's facilities are ok. As other people mentioned, the elevators can be slow, but that's something happening at many Manhattan hotels. The room is ok in size. Cleanliness and maintenance could be better. Curtains and carpets need a re-do. Breakfast in terms of offering is great. Unfortunately it is a little too busy after 8am which makes the experience like a war zone. Overall the stay was pleasant and we would come back.

title: You had us at "get in another line."
text: Nothing says welcome to our hotel like "I'm going to be a while (on the phone).  You need to get in another line."  No "hello."  No "my apologies but I am tied up with this phone call, if you don't mind waiting." Or how about place the phone call on hold, so you can actually greet and meet the real life person standing in front of you, who has travelled all day and selected your hotel - out of a bazillion other choices in NYC - as their choice of stay. And if the front desk manager, JAMIE, greets his ambassador level guests with this type of "welcome," you know your stay isn't going to be stellar.   The "suite" was fine, although rough around the edges.  Not exactly the Ritz, but not the shoebox, you might expect in NYC.  The location is okay but somewhat charmless.  The free breakfast buffet was soured by the fact that the potatoes were raw.  And the garbage bins were full and overflowing (which was remedied by the time we had thrown out our raw potatoes).  Everyone knows the challenges in the hospitality industry post-COVID, but I do think you can do better elsewhere.  We won't be back.

title: Good location and clean
text:
Clean rooms and nice bar area. 
Good location and quiet in the rooms. 
Front desk could be a little friendlier I felt rushed checking in and the “market place” is crammed to the side area. Extras were delivered quickly to our room.

title: Super..
text:
Very good hotel,very good location ,very good person especially Gemtina Bibaj at recaption… 

Breakfast is very nice,clean and comfortable rooms,we stay top view was perfect

İf we cam again we will stay here again

Thank you very much all employers
 
Kaan

title: GREAT SERVICE, FABULOUS VIEWS, AMAZING LOCATION
text:
Stayed here on an extended work trip in NYC. Was there for several days before realizing that this was the tallest Marriott in North America 🤩 that explained the stunning views of the city right from my hotel window. 
Truly appreciated the personable service from Lani, Anthony, Ricardo, Yesena, Ray, Eric and Security young man who looked out for my many Amazon packages 😁 I left too early for breakfast most days, but was always a sumptuous spread when i could stop by.  Was nice to return to the “smell of clean” after my requested weekly clean. 
Definitely recommend, was very comfortable there, and look forward to my return.

title: Very good location, good room, with kitchen, clean, breakfast included.
text: A few blocks from Central Park, excellent location. The room is good, clean, confortable bed, a small kitchen. Breakfast is included, daily, in a big noisy room. The courtesy of Mrs. Gentiana Bibaj of the front desk is remarkable.I recommend

title: Poor for Marriott
text: On arrival we were greeted by a pleasant lady who spoke hardly a word on English. She billed us $60 and couldn't even explain what it was for. First impressions of the hotel are that it was scruffy and not well maintained. Everything scratched, paint missing. Next we went up to our match box room. The view was good but despite paying for an upgrade we couldn't see the benefit. There were pots and pans but no oven or stove. There was a microwave and a fridge which made a lot of noise but barely got cold. A/C was good but very noisy. Breakfast left a lot to be desired, plastic cups, cutlery and plates. If you took longer than 5 minutes your food was cold. The coffee was bitter, eggs often undercooked and sausage was just foul. Its not like any Marriott I've ever seen and certainly does not deserve to carry its name. We would not return, even for free.

title: Our go to family friendly hotel in NYC
text: This is our go-to hotel in NYC for our family.  Location is great, rooms are super comfortable, and the staff are amazing.  In particular, we love that the rooms are modern, comfortable, and have kitchenettes that we can use to cook our kids (aged 8, 5 and 4) pasta etc... when they don't feel like a long sit down dinner.  The staff are always so great and accommodating with Frank being particularly helpful during this last visit with making sure we had everything we needed and allowing us a late checkout so we could stay in the room until the bus came.  All of this combined with a reasonable price makes this our absolute go-to hotel in NYC

title: Great 6 night stay at the Residence Inn Central park/Manhattan.
text:
Great 6 night stay at the Residence Inn Central park/Manhattan.
Access was easy with short walks to multiple subway stations. 
We stayed on the 55th floor in a partial park view room, which was great, providing a view north to the park and east into the city. I would definitely recommend this room type. The storey height was great, towering above most buildings but still way below billionaires row buildings. 
The king size bed was great, room with air con so perfect temperature, and the TV had all the apps if you wanted it. 
The bathroom was great with powerful hot shower and bath facilities. 
The kitchen was stocked with various facilities such as kettle, slow cooker, fridge and cutlery etc, although we hardly used it other than for water and the fridge. 
The staff were great and very attentive, always with a smile. 
The free breakfast in the mornings was also a great help, it made getting up and going straight out so easy, and especially helped fuel an early run around Central Park which was a short walk away. The breakfast provided varied throughout the week which was also good, albeit there were various options so you could vary yourself anyways. 
I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel. My only regret is not getting images of the room and bathroom but these are on the website and accurate.

title: Amazing views, great hotel!
text: Hotel is very close to Times Sq and to the park too. I had a room on the 59th floor with panoramic views of the city. It was breathtaking. Room was called Times Sq Grand King. Reception area is very small and the bar/restaurant is forgettable. Room was well equipped and comfortable. Very good stay and probably best views in NY.

title: Central Park Family Suite Rm 4809
text:
This is our favorite Manhattan hotel. All of our prior to 2019, we stayed here. This was our first trip back since then. 
We arrived at the hotel around 10am. Concierge held our luggage. We checked in at the desk, knowing our room wouldn't be ready until after 4pm. The receptionist (super friendly and very accommodating) told us there was a room on the 38th floor - beautiful room ~ I passed on that room and told her we would wait until 4pm for a higher floor. She agreed and we went about our day. 

When we arrived around 3:30pm, the room was ready. We went upstairs and were so happy with the view. For your reference, if you ever book the family suite, it always comes with a Tub and all the rooms are in the same location with the same type of view. 

(Note: covid, shut the hotel down for a long time and is now just getting back to 'normal') 
I noticed there was a replacement fridge (small dorm fridge) that was located where the fridge drawers used to be. I didn't think anything of it, until I tried putting food inside. It took a while for the fridge to cool down. All items were there for us to make small meals and a quick breakfast; plates, glasses, bowls, bottle opener, mugs, toaster, kettle, etc. 

I went to use the bathroom and noticed the toilet seat was very loose. I attemted to tighten the bolts behind the seat; no such luck. The bolts were rusted and we needed new nuts and bolts to repair the toilet. The shower was a challenge as well to get the water to turn on - it's been off for a while. Once we were able to turn on the water, it worked just fine. Excellent water pressure.
 
We decided to call Maintenance about the minor issues. Hubby and daughter explored the hotel while I waited for the repairman to come. Time span from the call placed to a repairman arriving - less than 30 minutes. He was so nice, professional and was able to repair all of our issues quickly. 

Breakfast was interesting. 
Prior to covid, Residence guests ate separate from Courtyard guests. We were now merged with Courtyard guests and they eliminated the waffle makers, which is a selling point to my daughter.

Staff was very friendly. Plenty of places to sit and eat. The vibe was peaceful enough at breakfast to sit and do work on my computer. 

I truly love this hotel. The views are unmatched and the staff make us feel right at home. I will always come back with hope that they bring  back the waffle makers. 

Thank you to all staff & management!

title: The Good, The Bad and The Awful
text:
Here's a review of my recent stay at Residence Inn - 

The Good: 

The location, fantastically located for all the tourist spots and very central ...... and thats about it for the good! 

The Bad: 

The shower door didn't seal, leading to a small flood in the bathroom and into the kitchen area.

Charging extra for bottled water in the room. 

The breakfast was average at best, certainly not worth $20. 

The furniture in the room has seen better days, worn out and damaged, as many have mentioned, the bedding is long past it's sell by date. 

The whole room felt like it needed a lick of paint and the shower area definitely needed a make over. 

Also, don't be fooled by the pictures on the website and Tripadvisor,I was expecting to receive a room with floor to ceiling windows, stretching round the corner, what I was given was a small window blocked by a desk, somewhat ruining the view. 

The Awful: 

Door slamming at all hours and the lift was incredibly noisy. 

Paper thin walls, meaning you were disturbed at all hours by people in adjoining rooms. 

But worst of all, one resident had decided to bring a dog into the hotel, the dog was clearly left in a room on its own as it spent around 5 hours barking in distress. Despite a phone call to reception, the dog continued to bark until 2am in the morning, which is completely unacceptable, and the lack of action from the receptionist suggested they couldn't care less about customer experience. 

I am really surprised at the amount of 5 star reviews on this page, there certainly wasn't anything 'Excellent' about my stay.

title: Great stay
text:
Stayed for 5 nights, had a great room on the 41st floor, great views times square to the right, central park to the left. 
The hotel has a good location 5 mins from central park, 10 mins from the square.
The rooms are clean and comfortable,  with the advantage of a small kitchen, kettle , coffee maker , fridge and dishwasher microwave,  the food prices in NY restaurants are expensive and this helped reduce our food bill.
Iron and board and a safe are all in the room, this and air con, are sometimes extra payable items in other hotels.
Breakfast is included, and is plentiful,  from continental to hot items, never queued , never did the hotel run short of anything, if your planning to eat breakfast on the go, fill a box and leave
The staff are attentive and polite, and will go the extra mile for guests.
4 lifts are available,  and we never had to queue for them
I would wholeheartedly reccomend the residence inn, we had a great time in NY , and the hotel was a fantastic base for us.

title: NYC visit 2023
text:
We visited New York February of this year for a 7 night break, staying at the residence inn Central Park. 
On arrival we were greeted by the reception staff and check in was quick and straight forward. We were shown to the lifts and headed to the 53rd floor. The rooms was lovely, my husband had treated me to a welcome of flowers champagne and chocolates which was just perfect. We had a nice kitchen area with kettle coffee machine, sink, fridge and freezer. The bathroom off of the kitchen was a great size, everything clean, shower was powerful and a good temperature.  The bedroom was a nice size and had everything we needed, enough drawers, wardrobe in kitchen area. We put our cases behind the curtain on the window cill so they were out of the way for the week. 
Housekeeping were brilliant, came every day and changed towels, made beds etc. 
We were very impressed with the breakfast offered. So much choice from cooked to bagels, meats, cheeses, eggs, cereal, fruit, cakes, bottled juices. There was even boxes provided so we were able to box up breakfast for our last early morning start. 

Overall we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City. The location is perfect, near a lot of attractions and subways near by with Times Square only being a couple of minutes walk away.

title: Highly recommend
text: This is a really great hotel in a very convenient location. The facilities are excellent. Great breakfast, nice fitness room, renovated rooms. Highly recommend. The staff was very helpful and nice....

title: Excellent Location With Gorgeous View
text: My daughter and I needed to crash in the city for one night and used our Bonvoy points to do so.  After perusing our choices I decided on this location.  This hotel was located near many train lines and eateries.   We had a corner room with incredible views.  It was a freezing night so we wound up spending more time in the room that we normally would have. We opened the curtains and enjoyed the view. Check in was quick and the elevator wait wasn’t terrible for a city hotel with lots of floors. It was close to Gershwin Theater but not in the madness of Times Square.

title: Decline on all fronts
text: Decline. It’s been 3 years since my last stay.. and there has been an unfortunate decline. Sheets are tattered and stained, not enough personnel to change sheets, service is lacking, cleanliness is an issue in the bathroom and for some reason on 62nd floor the elevator sounds like the clanging of a rollercoaster …shouldn’t that concern management?.. past the fact that it makes it hard to sleep?

title: Good value Hotel
text:
Good Location walking distance to Central Park and Times Square

Booked into a Times Square View room. Level 59.
Perfect to watch the lights after a hard days sight seeing.

The kitchenette is a bonus. Microwave/ kettle / coffee machine / fridge and freezer./dishwasher .
Ice machine on 35th floor alongside washing and drying facilities 

Room decor is dated and could do with a lick of paint.

Housekeeping - could improve bedding quality - looking a tad worn.

Breakfast on the 4th floor was excellent value. It was included at the time of booking.

We only had to wait a while on one occasion for the lift. A few guests had a ‘take out’ and their food would certainly be cold by the time they got back to  the room. Good job there is a microwave there.

A great value hotel .

title: Very good hotel
text: I stayed 4 nights with my 15yo daughter. The staff is very nice and did help us a lot! The room had a nice view and was big for a city hotel! Furniture in the bathroom was bit old, but the bedroom was newly renovated. Everything was clean! Would stay here again.

title: Стоит чтобы вернуться
text:
Я в этот отель возвращаюсь 3й раз, в декабре нас заселили в крошечный номер, без красивого вида и углового окна, но по просьбе сразу же нашли номер угловой с высоким этажом- хотя был Крисмас и загрузка 100%. Спасибо администратору- вы не дали испортится нашему отпуску. 
Так же взяли депозит наличными всего 100$- наши карты российские не работают , турецкая тоже не прошла. 
Уборка отличная! Завтраки тоже, кто пишет что плохие- видимо много едят, там было все, мы жили неделю- и каждый день все было разным. Так же там есть коробочки и можно без проблем брать с собой в номер, я брала семгу, яйца, тост- и ланч 🥪 был готов) спасибо, я вернусь еще не раз ❤️

title: Excellent Views and Location!
text: Stayed during the New Year's Eve weekend just to experience the NYC Ball Drop and the hotel didn't disappoint. Booked a Time Square View Room and Gen from the Front Desk hooked me up with a room with the most amazing views. One Time Square right outside my windows and Hudson River on the right. Thank you Gen! Hotel was centrally located too. Just a short walk to the Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and of course Time Square=) Would stay in this hotel again just for the views!

title: No vayan
text:
Desayuno sin personal, un descontrol, todo descartable de plasrico y carton
Ascensores una tortura la espera
Cero medidas covid
Cuartos con cortinas rotas, toallas y sabanas viejas, camas incomodas y almohadas mas
El servicio es malisimo y te tratan mal y te dicen textual: si queres ya te hago el check out y te vas
Me dijeron q tuviera paciencia que por la pandemia no han echo mantenimiento pero los precios aumentaron bastante
No vuelvo mas. Estuvimos SIN AGUA medio dia con 20 grados bajo cero!!!

title: Not bad
text:
Great service all around, the breakfast is very good with lots of options, it has amazing views of time square and other areas of the city.

I don’t know if it was because of the rush of NYE bur the room was not very clean, The room looks like it need a refresh.

title: Like staying in a noisy subway station
text:
If you like a room where you do not get much sleep due to the loud elevators constantly running this is your place to stay. We were above the 40th floor. The room was freezing cold. It was raining outside and moisture was coming through the windows and water was sitting on the window sills. The shower leaked onto the floor as the shower door did not seal tight.

You are definitely not getting the value for what you have to pay for your room (sound proof walls would be a great benefit).

One good thing about the hotel was the location it was perfect for the activities we wanted to do in New York. It was south of Central Park and North of Times Square, close to Radio City Music Hall, and Rockefeller Centre.

title: Two part review - Part 1 Hotel review Part 2 - How they handled a massive leaf on 12/26
text:
Part 1 - Hotel Review

The hotel is in a great location if you are going to the theater with great views. We were in a corner room on the 49th and had a great view of the city and jersey. 

The staff at check was great and asked without prompting if we want a late checkout, which we took advantage of.  We were able to also do early check-in via the mobile app which I highly recommend 

Things nearby 
     1 block down on 8th avenue is a Gristedes and a liquor store if that's your things
      Carnegie  Diner  is on 57th and 7th - make a reservation as it gets crowded
      Starbucks is across the street
      Angelina bakery is on 53 street at the corner its an Italian Bakery 
      Dim Sum Palace is on 56 between the 6th and 5th ave

This is our goto hotel when going to a show in NYC 

Part 2 - "massive leak on 12/26 

As we were getting ready to leave to catch a train from Penn Station, there was a building-wide alert of a leak that rendered the elevators inoperable. Needless to say we missed our 3 pm train and had to rebook on the 5 pm train. 

The Good 
        A message was broadcast every 10-15 minutes about the situation 
         The Front Desk did answer the phone and gave an honest update
The Bad 
.        The broadcast message when from a leak to Massive Leak to Leak - confusing
          Did not mention that the front desk and lobby were significantly impacted by the 
          leak
          NO updates were provided on the timeline for elevator service restoration were 
          ever mentioned.  In a 60+ story building, this was unacceptable.
I realize this was a one-off  event but couple of things could have been handles better

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC!
text:
We checked into this hotel after our flights were cancelled on SWA Christmas Eve. Little did we know we would be “residents” here for 6 days. We have always been customers of the Hilton Midtown but saw this one was available and not far so wanted to give it a try. This hotel, their staff, the amenities are AMAZING! They were SO accommodating as our flights kept canceling and we would have to keep our room (I am Marriott Platinum) for longer and longer. While the rate increased during our stay, we were able to secure our room with no problems. 

I had to communicate with the staff quite a bit due to crowds/lines in the lobby via the Bonvoy App and they were incredibly helpful and responded quickly. THANK YOU! The stress of not being able to fly out was made easier because of this wonderful hotel and their staff. 

The breakfast was perfect every morning and anything we needed, the staff was friendly and helpful. I recommend getting to breakfast by 7 as it’s set up beautifully but after 8/8:30 it is a zoo with so many people. The housekeeping was friendly and brought extra towels, toiletries as we needed them. Rooms were clean and comfortable (we had three in a Queen/Twin room).

The location is perfect—a block from Times Square, a few blocks from the theater district and an easy walk to Central Park. It was the winter storm so while it was cold during our visit, there’s a wonderful 24 hour grocery around the corner for all your needs and plenty of great restaurants close by. This will be our new “go to” in the city. Loved it in every way.

title: Location and view
text:
The room was pretty small, but we expect this of New York City. Everything was pretty standard, with some bits feeling a bit worn. We had some problems with our TV, opening the curtains would knock the cable just enough to disconnect the TV, but it would not reconnect easily. The staff fixed it each day. However, we thought the hotel could do with some refurbishment and refreshment.

The complimentary breakfast was average, but convenient and we were encouraged to take food out for later snacking.

The view (63rd floor) and central location more than made up for the minimal problems with the hotel, and the service was very good.

title: NYC holiday visit
text: We just returned from a four night stay at this NYC Residence Inn. What did they do right? It’s a great location, the staff provides great service, and the rooms are clean. What did they do wrong?  When we arrived on Friday evening at 10:30pm, the hotel only had king rooms available instead of the double room I booked. For two nights, I had to share a bed with my teen until we could finally move to a room with two beds on the third morning of our stay.  Both rooms we stayed in had seen better days. The furniture and bathroom vanity in both rooms showed lots of wear and tear. The bedding in both rooms was threadbare and should have been replaced long ago.  We didn’t try the complimentary breakfast, so I can’t offer any insight there. In summary, this isn’t the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in but I should be able to get a better value for $400+ per night at another hotel. We won’t be back.

title: Consistently well-run hotel with amazing views
text:
I have stayed several times in this hotel since 2015. The staff is always friendly and approachable, despite this being a very busy hotel. I always feel valued when I stay.
