The Courtyard hotel is on the lower floors (5-34); the Residence occupies the upper part of the hotel up to the 65th floor. Both hotels share a beautiful and spacious breakfast area on the 4th floor. The breakfast experience is upscale for a Residence Inn - couches and upholstered chairs, plus high bar seating that overlooks the city. Food options are plentiful and include extra touches, such as meat and cheeses, greens, oatmeal with several toppings, eggs, breakfast potatoes, sausage, etc. There are TVs and a bar, so this is also a gathering space (which is appreciated considering the tight and busy lobby). 

The rooms are always well maintained. The elevators almost always run efficiently--crucial for a skyscraper hotel. The decor is lovely. Even though the rooms are a bit small, the finishes and the storage areas make up for it. Plus, the kitchenettes provide convenience for longer stays. 

The best part of the hotel is the amazing views (of Central Park, midtown, and Times Square). I have stayed at 10+ different Marriott properties in NYC, and RI-Central Park has the best views. 

The hotel is centrally located, just north of the Times Square chaos. It is within a few blocks of several subway stations so access to the entire island is convenient. It is within walking distance of the theatre district, Lincoln Square, Carnegie Hall, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue shops.

On this recent visit, Kimberly and Pamela ensured that we had a wonderful stay. I called to inquire about the possibility of upgrading to a two-bed room (most rooms are kings), and Kimberly assured me she would do all she could over a sell-out weekend. At check-in Pamela assisted in orchestrating a surprise: a two-bed room on the 65th floor. The views were spectacular! Once again, the staff went the extra mile at this hotel, which is still one of my favorites.

title: Best hotel
text:
This has become my favorite hotel in NYC.  I visit NY frequently and have stayed at many different hotels in the city.  To begin with every staff member I have ever encountered here has always been nothing but pleasant, helpful and always accommodating.  I just returned from 5 nights at the hotel.  Victor at the front desk checked me in.  I had 3 different reservations pieced together for the 5 nights I would be there and he set it up for me so that I would not have to be bothered checking in and out and was able to give me the same room for the entire stay.  I even asked if he was able to get me a corner room (they have an amazing view) and he found one for me and I was even able to check in earlier than the 4 pm check in time.  Victor was great to deal with.  A little later I went down to the desk to request a blanket for the room and Victor took care of that too and I had it in no time.  While I'm discussing helpful staff I have to mention Wioleta.  Due to an impending snow storm I tried to get out of NY a day early.  I went to the desk and explained this to her and she checked me out assuring me I wouldn't be penalized for an early check out.  Three hours later I found out that due to the storm the flight I rebooked was already cancelled and I could not get out til the next day.  I went back to the hotel and asked Wioleta if I could get my room back and she took care of that for me causing me to be very relieved.  She was so helpful and pleasant and truly seemed concerned for my situation.  
  The hotel itself is in a great location.  Close to subway stations, Central Park and the theater district, without being so close to the craziness of Times Square.  As I previously stated the views from the rooms are just amazing.  The rooms are not huge but they are big enough and who really spends lots of time in their room in NY and to me the views make up for any lack of space.  
  There is a breakfast buffet that is included on the fourth floor of the hotel.  They have hot items such as eggs, breakfast meats and potatoes as well as pastries, bagels, oatmeal, fruit and a number of other things.  The seating area is spacious and comfortable.  
  I highly recommend the Residence Inn NY Central Park.

title: Very nice stay with a great location!
text: Comfortable, modern accommodations,  and a perfect Midtown location for walking north to Central Park & South to the Theater District/Time Square. Corner view room was nice, and front desk team member Wioleta offered friendly and helpful service.  Very nice stay!

title: Great Deal in Midtown
text:
The Residence Inn was one of the more reasonable rates for a mid-week stay between Times Square and Central Park (many hotels were charging double or more).  The hotel shares a building with a Courtyard franchise, but the Residence Inn gets the higher floors.  My room had a great view of the Times Square ball (note to those looking for a New Year's Eve room without being in the center of it all).  

For those used to the typical full kitchen Residence Inn studio, this is not for you.  The room was very small, with just a plush armchair and a desk in the combined bed/living area.  There is no stove in the kitchenette (though hot plates might be available) but there was a two-drawer refrigerator/freezer and a drawer (!) dishwasher, as well as a microwave and a few small appliances in a drawer.  The bathroom had a thermostat for the shower (so you know your water temperature).  The only issue I had was an HVAC system that only seemed to blow cold air (I don't think there was an AC/heat selection and it still tripped with cool air when I raised the temperature).  There was enough radiant heat from the appliances and building that it wasn't a major issue.

Breakfast is in a fourth floor bistro area shared with the Courtyard.  While Courtyard guests pay $20 for the buffet, it is still free for Residence Inn guests.  The variety was much better than most RI breakfasts, including scrambled eggs, cold cuts, potatoes, and andouille sausage (though they still had the prepackaged sandwiches many RI locations have switched to).  The quality wasn't the great and there didn't seem to be anyone actively replenishing, but I can't complain much for not paying for it.  I'd be much more upset if I had paid $20.

The one head scratcher is the wifi systems for each hotels are not interconnected, even though they use the same network name.  I had no issue logging in and using the system in my room but I was asked to log in again both in the lobby and the 4th floor bistro, and my room number was not recognized, probably because it was the Courtyard's system.  I would think having one Bonvoy network with both sets of rooms integrated would be an easy fix.

Overall, we had a very pleasant stay and I now have a go-to place in the event I cannot find any other reasonable rates in the area.

title: Centrally located property with great views - some service concerns, but overall not bad!
text:
Summary: the hotel was in a nice location close to subway stations. The Residence Inn occupies higher floors, so most rooms have a nice view. Staff was friendly, but housekeeping and service was pretty poor. Parts of the room definitely felt a bit aged and worn. Breakfast was nice and convenient.

Price: considering the view and location, I would say the price was quite fair.

Location: I like staying in Midtown, so I liked this hotel's location. Subway stations were close by too. Area felt safe and not too touristy even though it was close to Times Square.

Check-in/out: average. Fast but never received a phone call from the staff when our room was ready for check-in.

Room: the best part of the room was the nice view and the large windows, which was a priority for us. The room was definitely a bit aged. The TV was not working upon check-in (no signal). The wardrobe/closet doors were not opening smoothly. The built-in fridge/freezer combo did not appear to be working at all. The food we stored in there was not chilled. We ended up tossing all of our leftovers. 

Amenities: the gym on the 35th floor was well equipped. Two Peloton bikes (although I think only one was working). Several treadmills with I think 3 slat belt treadmills.

Service: this was probably the only subpar part of my stay. We had some dirty sheets that we noticed upon check-in (very minor). Housekeeping changed the sheets but the person appeared quite grumpy and looked like they did not want to be there. On a Sunday night, we requested some laundry bags be sent up to the room at 10pm. Called the front desk twice, waited over an hour, and ultimately had to go downstairs to the lobby myself to get them at 11pm. I sent a few chat messages using the Marriott app and compared to my stay at a Marriott property in September, responses at this property were far, far slower. Hours went by before I received a response.

Staff: though service was subpar, I would say most staff we interacted with were friendly. Everyone was very courteous and polite.

Overall, we would likely return to this property in the future given the location and views. Hopefully we have a better service experience next time. However unlike previous stays, we might shop around several Marriott properties for future stays in NYC.

title: Enjoyable hotel stay
text: Enjoyed my stay here as part of the New York City Marathon 2022. The views of the city from my 57th floor were amazing. The room was slightly smaller than hoped for, but still quite sizeable. Most importantly, the room was really clean from start to finish, so much appreciation to the wonderful and friendly housekeeping. The breakfast buffet spread was quite good too. Just be prepared for several lift stops sometimes as there are many floors. The service was great too. Excellent location around Broadway which really makes things easy. Thank you!

title: Un hotel en una ubicación fenomenal
text:
Excelente ubicación, personas atentas que nos hacen sentir en casa cada vez que vamos a NY.
La vista al Central Park desde mi habitación , el desayuno estuvo muy bien y completo .
El Staff muy agradable . Las habitaciones son cómodas , y la ducha  reparadora !!!

title: Superb choice in Manhattan
text:
Shout out to the Residence Inn Central Park location in NYC. 
Other than a hohumm breakfast, everything about my stay was above average for Manhattan. 
• Super convenient location. 
• Helpful and friendly staff. 
• Acknowledged my status at check in, including my request for late checkout. 
• Beautiful 62nd floor corner room with views of both the Hudson River and Times Square.
• I wasn’t going to cook so the counter in the kitchen gave me extra space to spread out. 
• Fridge was very cold. Lovely! Appliances looked new and well cared for. 
• Roomy and convenient bathroom with great hot water temp control and handheld shower head. 
• A comfortable chair and ottoman convenient for relaxing by the window. 
• Just enough extra square footage in the room to be significant in a city where such things are in short supply. 
• The elevators were speedy. 
• Good bar on the fourth floor.

title: Amazing experience
text:
Second time here well happy for the choice. Room view was amazing (fam double bed 5904).
Space in the room was just right for the standards of the city. Cleanliness was OK. Staff was always awesome and accommodating. Breakfast is various and plenty we were ok for the day. The elevator are crazy fast and also during rush hour you manage to get up or down in a reasonable amount of time. Can’t wait to come back (I will!!!)

title: Great location.unbelievable views
text: Researched a lot of NYC hotels before deciding on this one. One block from 53rd street subway which serves the E subway line from JFK. On arrival we were greeted by Amanda who could not have been more cheery and helpful with loads of advice and directions.She kindly obliged our request for a corner view room -Wow, what a view from our room 5002. We also chose this hotel because of the kitchenette as we new we would be eating in our room on a few nights( NYC can be very expensive to eat eat, especially with £ so weak against $) . Plenty of Chinese , Mexican and Pizza takeaways nearby plus a great wine shop just near Columbus Circle. Plus with the views from our room , why would you spend more to eat eat-nowhere’s going to beat the view!! Great location for Downtown and Brooklyn subway trains too. Highly Recommended

title: A great stay!
text:
Great location just north of Times Square, close subway options, high rise, no resort fees, free breakfast, pet friendly, excellent views, mini kitchens, what more can you ask for?! 

We are merely Gold status. We asked for a park view and they accommodated upon arrival. Hot breakfast options were pretty typical. It can get pretty busy but you can bring food back to your room. I would definitely consider coming back.

title: Perfect stay & perfect location!
text: From the minute we arrived, all the staff we encountered was incredibly kind & helpful. Our room was beyond breathtaking as we had almost panoramic views from Times Square to the Hudson River (King Suite city view). We could easily see the 2022 Times Square ball from our window. Our room was immaculate and felt recently updated.  I can’t say enough. The free buffet breakfast had a huge selection in a city view large seating area with windows everywhere.  The location of this hotel was perfect!  We walked to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue & Rockefeller Center with ease.  We are already planning a fall trip next year and will definitely be staying here again!

title: Très Mitigé
text: La vue ne fait pas tout dans un hôtel. Pour notre 4eme séjour dans cet établissement, je pensais que nous aurions un minimum de considération. J’avais demandé 10 mois (!!) auparavant un étage élevé pour un événement spécial, on m’a répondu que ça serait en fonction de la disponibilité ( qu’est ce qui passe avant quand on fait une demande 10 mois à l’avance??), et mauvaise surprise , étage beaucoup moins élevé qu’esperé..Donc petite demande au desk à la remise du pass, « je vois ce que je peux faire dans la matinée et je vous tiens au courant»….résultat, aucune réponse, franchement pas correct, surtout quand on paye près de 600 euros la nuit pour la meilleure chambre possible…Ensuite le petit déjeuner, très très loin des standards de ce tarif. C’est dommage car l’emplacement est idéal, malgré une climatisation très bruyante, on entend très peu les bruits de la rue, et la literie est bonne. On est déçu, nous allons probablement changer d’hôtel à notre prochain séjour.

title: Great Location
text:
I chose this hotel over others for its kitchenette - it's not a 'full' kitchen as it has no oven - but it does have enough bits and pieces to be sufficient (Toaster, Kettle, Coffee Maker, Microwave, Fridge, Dish Washer and a good selection of crockery.  Considering there is no oven the dish washer is a bit unnecessary).  I couldn't get the fridge to switch on, but someone appeared within 20 mins of me telling reception - it wasn't broken but needed to be switched on in a certain way (A small set of instructions wouldn't go amiss)

The location of this hotel is great, it's a short walk from Central Park and Times Square, and one of the subway lines from the airport stops very close by.  A good amount of the other lines aren't far away either.

Check in was quick and easy, which was lovely after a 7 hour flight, 2 hours stood in passport control, an hour in a cab battling NYC traffic and the time difference from the UK.  The guy who checked me in was friendly and efficient.

The room was fine, it was clean and well appointed.  There are a few knocks on the furniture, but it didn't make enough of a difference to matter.  I asked for a Times Square view and I could just about see it from the 52nd floor.    There are a few odd design flaws - the wardrobe does not fit in long women's dresses (I had to hang them on the shower door) and its door hits the main doors closing mechanism.  The showerhead is very high up - I am 5'8" and could just about reach it to get it out of its holder and use it that way - by the time the water reached my head it wasn't with enough force to remove the conditioner.  It also has a slightly slippery floor when wet - OK for me but if you are elderly or slightly dodgery it might make for an interesting time.   Other than these few little foibles the room did its job well for the 6 nights I was there.  It was quiet - I didn't hear a thing from other rooms although I know they were occupied, and the bed was extremely comfortable.  If I was to add anything it would be a small table and chair, or maybe lose the dishwasher and replace it with a gap and a bar stool.

There is a buffet breakfast with a surprisingly good selection.  Tea, coffee, juice, cereal, three hot items (usually scrambled egg, potato and either bacon or sausage), fruit, packaged bagels and pastries, bread for toasting, hams, sort of cheeses (being from the UK I can't call US cheese, cheese.  Sorry guys! It's no good anywhere, not just here! You must have a shock if you come to the UK and eat it!), salad items and yogurts.  There's enough to keep you going for a good bit of the day.  I arrived early (usually for opening time) as I was still half on UK time, it did start to get busy around 7:30/8am.

The four lifts were quick and never took long to arrive, despite the hotel being very busy (I heard one of the guys on reception informing a walk up that they had no rooms left).

Check out was also quick, and the guys held my case for a few hours until I was ready to leave for JFK.  When I was ready, they sent a message to the yellow cab group, and one was ready for me within 10 mins.  That saved me wandering about with my case trying to flag one down or taking the subway in the heat. I also had an hour's chat with a very friendly NY cabbie who lived in The Bronx and gave me an interesting running commentary the whole way to the airport.  

The staff without exception were friendly and helpful, although that does seem to by the NYC way across the board.  I felt safe at the hotel, being a lone female, I am very aware of potential issues - you can only access the lifts with your room card, the room has a peep hole and a mechanism that allows the door to be safely partly opened.

All in all, very pleased with my choice of hotel - nowhere in NYC is cheap but in comparison to some of the other places I investigated, The Residence Inn NY Manhattan/Central Park was a good deal

title: Todo lo que necesitas!!!!
text:
Viajamos el 9 de agosto, la pasamos genial.
Todo el personal amoroso, bien predispuesto a responder sobre todas las consultas, inclusive sin hablar español. 
El desayuno muy rico, con lo suficiente para sentirse bien. El lugar muy bien puesto. Comodo
Cada día te recibían por la tarde con algún gesto de cortesía, refrescos, helados, café etc.
La habitación en el piso 44, increíble, cómoda, amplia, perfectamente higienizada.
Solo podría decir algo sobre el ruido que generan los ascensores, pero no entorpece el descanso.Volvería sin dudas!!!!!

title: Pleasant Place to Stay and Convenient Location.
text: Residence Inn by Marriott New York Manhattan/Central park is located a few blocks from Central Park with main entrance on West 54th Street (not Broadway). The sixty-one floor hotel is a combination Marriott Courtyard (located on the lower floors) and Residence Inn floors on the upper levels. Hotel is within walking distance of several theaters but several blocks from Times Square and the Theatre District. Hotel staff are consistently busty, friendly, and knowledgeable yet a bit stressed. Lobby appeared clean despite heavy foot traffic. Elevators sometimes had long wait times in the morning and late afternoon. Guest rooms had worn, but functional, amenities and the room and bathroom were generally clean. Guest room kitchen and bathroom fixtures were a bit worn but functional. Corridor fixtures and floor carpets were a bit worn. Lounge, bar. and breakfast buffet were located on the fourth floor. Breakfast buffet was good quality fare with limited selection. Many take-out and restaurant options within close proximity of hotel; many other guests relied upon food delivery services at the time of my stay. Vehicle traffic noise is prevalent as the hotel is proximal to busy medical and first responder units yet upper floors were surprisingly quiet. Overall, excellent experience. The hotel is an ideal place for families and tourists. I would consider returning to this hotel when conducting business in midtown Manhattan in the future.

title: Шикарный вид на централ парк
text:
Отель можно сказать не оправдал себя, но, его вид из окна перекрывал все минусы!
Сам номер очень маленький, небольшая кухня (не понятно зачем, плиты нет) зато есть кастрюли 😂 ужасно шумный холодильник, я по ночам взрагивала просыпалась, потом привыкла, жила я 2 недели. 
Шкаф- туда не влезет ничего, зачем он там не ясно, уборка нормальная. Нет воды кофе/чая- ничего. Таскать на себе как ишак из магазина приходилось, тк за бутылочку цена там была запредельная. На завтрак не ходила, не знаю. Ресепшн не понятно какую функцию выполняет, вообщем ощущение что сняла апартаменты крохотные. Вернутся можно, тк цена за вид, и все таки какая-никакая кухня есть. Но для двоих наверно маловато, если есть бюджет- мне в Трамп централ парк больше нравится

title: Business Travel NYC
text: I had a great experience checking in with William and Sabrina! This was one of the best check-in's I have had with any Residence Inn properties. They both were helpful with explaining the hotel's features and recommended places to visit after my work hours. Whenever I returned to the hotel, they greeted me with smiles and this made my day to be perfect. William and Sabrina are WONDERFUL and need more staff like them! I asked will for a room with a view and stayed in room 6408, 64th Floor, excellent view!!

title: Pleasant Surprise at the Residence Inn Central Park.
text:
I stay at this hotel when I come to New York. I had the most delightful person check me in - Sabrina. She welcomed me with the best attitude. I jokingly asked for something I know the didn’t carry in the store in the lobby. After I returned from dinner, I found a bag on the door. Included in the bag was the item I requested along with candy and other snacks. 

I’ve stayed at the Ritz Carlton, where they are known for service, but Sabrina provided a moment that mattered and differentiated herself from the 100’s of others who have checked me in over many years. Sabrina, you are a unicorn!

title: Excellent!
text: You can make your reservation at this property and be confident you will have a wonderful stay.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff members are very helpful and the view from the 51st floor is amazing.  The room’s tiny kitchen could take care of all our needs.  And you’re in the heart of everything.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent hotel for your NYC adventures
text:
This hotel was wonderfully located and well within walking distance to tons of attractions, broadway shows and subway stations. The room itself was very nice. We ended up in a handicap room with a roll in shower which made it challenging not to flood the bathroom. Otherwise, the room was great, with a wonderful view and nice little kitchen area. We were on the 59th floor so we did have to wait for and in elevators a lot, but that just comes with the territory.

The breakfast was very adequate, but I must say after a week it does get boring and repetitive. It would be nice if they rotated more than just the breakfast meat. 

Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I found myself in NYC.

title: Spectacular view
text:
43 floor, amazing view. Very discreet, smiling, polite  and helpful staff. 
We were delighted with our stay in this beautiful hotel so well situated next to Central Park. 
The view at night was spectacular and our daughters even watched tv with the curtain wide open. 
We highly recommend.

title: Soggiorno meraviglioso a New York City!
text: Abbiamo trascorso 5 giorni a New York al Residence Inn Manhattan Central Park. Dato che siamo una famiglia di 4 persone, abbiamo prenotato due camere doppie allo stesso piano (57°). Entrambe le camere avevano un'ottima vista su New York! Il Residence si trova a Midtown in una splendida posizione, ben servita da metropolitana e autobus. Le camere erano molto confortevoli, pulite e silenziose, con un letto King size molto confortevole. La cucina era molto ben attrezzata. La colazione era inclusa, con una buona scelta di cibo. È stato fantastico soggiornare al Residence Inn New Yoirk Manhattan Central Park! Lo consigliamo!

title: excellent experience
text: We had a great time at the property.  Well situated. Very quiet. Good customer service.  The views were amazing. The bed was very comfortable and the room was adequately stocked for what we needed.  I would return.

title: NYC size hotel room and great view
text:
It's NYC so your hotel room will be small in comparison to Residence Inn's around the country.  Room was clean and had a GREAT view.  (All their rooms are on higher levels so if you're afraid of heights or going on elevators that go high floors do not recommend)

Tip for drivers!  Front desk is busy since it serves two hotels and there was a wait at check in.  Also there really isn't much of a place to unload so if you are parking allow for time to find the valet staff who is hard to find (it's a two person job if you have a second person to find the valet drop off them off on Broadway to check in and find the valet while the other person behind the wheel goes around the block.  Once at the front door you will have to unload quickly as everyone will honk at you if there isn't an open spot and you are blocking traffic.

title: Great place to stay
text: First of all, every employee that we met was very, very friendly and helpful. Every request was quickly taken care of. This is a beautiful property. Our room had  ceiling to floor windows and at the 58th floor magnificent views of the Husdon and Central Park. The breakfast is a step up from the usual Residence Inns. A wonderful place to stay

title: Wonderful hotel!!
text: My room on the 64th floor was clean, had a well equipped kitchen, and the view was spectacular! This hotel is in a great location.  It is near Carnegie Hall, Central Park, and not far from Times Square. The breakfast buffet was great!  It had many choices and was well maintained.  One can eat breakfast in a large dining area or use one of the provided to-go containers to eat in one's room.  The staff was very friendly, and I was very pleased to be able to check in early.  Lovely hotel!

title: Nie wieder!
text:
Ernüchternd!
Wir haben dieses Hotel aufgrund seiner super Bewertungen ausgesucht-Fehler! 

Obdachlose wühlen  vor dem Hotel im Müll und man fühlt sich bei der Ankunft einfach schon unwohl. 

Wir haben um 23 Uhr eingecheckt-uns wurde ein schönes Zimmer (welches definitiv nicht so aussah wie das eigentlich gebuchte) mit schöner Aussicht gegeben. Schon auf dem Zimmer hörten wir alle 5 Minuten einen schrillen mehrere Sekunden anhaltenden „Piepton“ in der Küche. Schlafen somit unmöglich! Wir konnten dieses Problem nicht selbst beheben und es sollte ein Techniker kommen-vergebens! Als wir unsere Koffer wieder gepackt haben und runter an die Rezeption sind wurde uns von unfreundliches Personal erklärt, dass jede Küche einen Kühlschrank hat-weitere Ausführungen zu dieser Diskussion erspare ich mir. Nach mehrmaligem hin und her wurde uns ein anderes Zimmer gegeben- dieses passt noch weniger zu denen im Internet beworbenen Zimmern! 
Wieder auschecken o. nur diese Nacht bleiben wurde uns versagt und uns mitgeteilt, dass zwei Nächte gebucht sind und wir diese auch zahlen müssen! 
Man sollte sich hier nicht von all den guten Bewertungen blenden lassen so wie wir es getan haben.

title: Pessimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text: Evito di dare solo una stella perchè la posizione è perfetta, centralissima, vicino a diverse linee di metro e a pochi passi da TS e Central Park. Receptionist gentilissimi, ma confusionari. All'arrivo ci viene addebitato sulla carta un importo pari ad una delle due camere che avevamo prenotato, ma ci dicono che è solo un blocco. Dopo due giorni abbiamo deciso di controllare meglio e alla reception ci informano che si trattava di un loro errore. Male, avrebbero dovuto accorgersene loro e non noi! Passiamo alle camere: l'impressione è che le pulizie vengano fatte (in modo approssimativo) ogni 2/3 giorni, fanno solo il letto e portano via gli asciugamani usati. L'arredamento è ormai vetusto e polveroso, decisamente da sostituire. Abbiamo avuto un inconveniente con una perdita in bagno e ci hanno subito sostituito la camera, anche questa aveva un leggerissimo gocciolamento in doccia, ma abbiamo preferito lasciar perdere. Il mobile sotto il lavandino in camera era rotto e faceva davvero una brutta impressione. Ascensori lentissimi ai limiti dell'imbarazzante, una volta abbiamo atteso 12 minuti per scendere dal 53esimo al 4 piano. Riassumendo, per la cifra che si spende si pretende la quasi perfezione, che purtroppo non abbiamo trovato.

title: Excelente hotel
text: excellent hotel very well located and from you can walk to the most important places, very friendly team, clean and very comfortable facilities.  spacious room with everything you need and wonderful views.  complete breakfast and of very good quality something unusual in new york hotels. we made some purchases online and they were received and delivered without problems.  without a doubt we will return.  Thank you

title: great view from the room
text: lovely stay right near the times square. our room was on the 65th floor 6509. it was a corner room with the greatest view night and day. you can see all the way over the hudson and on the other side the central part. we easily walked to times square. the breakfast had a lot of options, plus take away boxes were provided.

title: Excelente hotel!!
text: La recibida de Kim fue fantástica,nos dio una habitación en el piso 50(5006) con una vista espectacular!!! La cama,el baño,el desayuno,la ubicación y sobre todo la gente,todos los empleados son muy cordiales. Y la despedida de Megan Wright, dejándonos un ratito más en el hotel fue muy importante para nosotras!! Gracias Megan,Kim y a todo el equipo de este maravilloso hotel!!! Vuelvo a elegirlo!!!!!

title: Super Lage, toller Ausblick, im Vergleich akzeptables Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis
text:
Die Lage ist super, insbesondere wenn man in den oberen Stockwerken wohnt. Seitlich sieht man den Central Park. Der Blick auf die Skyline ist top. Der Weg zur 5th Av. vergleichsweise kurz.

Es ist zwar nur ein 3*-Hause. Aber im Vergleich zu einigen doppelt so teuren, abgewohnten 4*-Häusern, bei denen man mehr erwartet, würde ich immer dieses Hotel bevorzugen. Die Zimmer sind funktional, haben aber dennoch Stil und sind sauber. Auch die kleine Küche kann durchaus nützlich sein. 

Das Fitnessstudio erfüllt seinen Zweck.

Das Frühstück ist allerdings wirklich schlecht und der Frühstücksraum ungemütlich und dreckig. Selbst wenn es nicht die Welt kostet oder gar inkludiert ist, würde ich empfehlen, lieber anderswo zu essen.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the end of March. The customer service prior to arrival was excellent. The trip was for a special occasion travelling from the UK. The Hotel management put myself at ease prior to the rearranged visit. We stayed on the 57th floor with a great view of the New York skyline. Thank you to all at the Residence Inn, I would not look to stay anywhere else on a return to NYC.

title: Disappointing
text: The hotel already has serious maintenance problems. Some elevators didn't work. Part of the infrastructure of the rooms was not working properly. In my room there was not the small stove that appears in the photos on the hotel's website. Towels provided to guests in poor condition. The dishwasher didn't work. The water from the little kitchen sink comes out very little. Cleaning in general seemed to be very superficial or practically non-existent. Most front-desk employees didn't seem to care about complaints. It doesn't seem worth anything at this place if you're a Marriott Bonvoy member. The positive points are the excellent location and breakfast included in the rate, which despite being simple, was very well served.

title: Busy
text: Busy high rise hotel with shared lobby/amenities.  Well located just north of Times Sq and steps from two subway stations.  Rooms are modern as one would expect given age of hotel.  Breakfast functional and good value though shocking plastic waste presumably due to Covid.  Elevators could be slow at peak times.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Nice Breakfast
text: We stayed at the Residence Inn Central Park  just one night. We found the staff to be very friendly and welcoming, especially the front desk employees and the bellhops. Room was very clean and seemed new. Bed was very comfortable. Shower was great - spacious, good water pressure and temperature control. We were on the 37th floor and had a city view. Room was quiet. I was impressed with the breakfast which included a variety of options: cereal, hot items (eggs, very tasty potatoes, breakfast meats), oatmeal as well as juice, bagels and bread/toast and muffins individually wrapped. They included boxes for those on the go. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again. Excellent location!

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Lovely hotel, with super staff. 
Room was spotless clean. Bed comfortable and Netflix in tv nice extra. 
Amenities, specially shampoo, very good quality. 
Good coffee in the room. Breakfast ok for me. 
And the view from the room - Wow! I had corner room with times square view. It was exactly like in photos and really was worth it.

title: Love this hotel
text: I go to NY regularly and this hotel has become my new favorite.  Located in midtown it's very close to a few subway stations, Central Park, Broadway theaters ,museums and Times Square yet it's just removed enough from all the craziness in Times Square.  The rooms are on the small side (which is not unusually for NYC) but they make the most of the space and the views from your room are amazing.  The staff at this hotel is top notch.  I have never encountered an employee here who is any less than pleasant.  On my recent stay Merlinda checked me in, she was so welcoming and friendly and quickly got me into my room.  Checking out I had the pleasure of dealing with Kimberly.  I recognized her from previous stays and she always stands out as offering you any help you may need.  A basic breakfast is available on the 4th floor which comes with the room rate at the Residence Inn.  It's nice to be able to go downstairs and grab breakfast before starting your day and relax in the nice room where it is served.  I will continue to book here on future trips to the city.

title: Comedy of errors
text: Great location, but a comedy of errors during our stay.  The front of the hotel was blocked by two large linen trucks making drop off impossible.  Upon our arrival to our room, we found all phones and clocks in the room disconnected .  Second day, the elevators went down (we were on the 52nd floor) and they remained out for over an hour.  Requested additional towels, pillows in my reservation and nothing had been added to the room until I requested them at the front desk.  One day, they skipped any room clean up and towel changes.  And the final item was the 6AM Fire Alarm.  Can't blame the hotel on all the items outlined here, but no efforts were made by the staff to at least apologize for the multiple comedy of errors during our stay.

title: Bon emplacement mais hôtel décevant
text:
Les points positifs : emplacement top, ménage impeccable dans la chambre.
Hélas beaucoup de points négatifs : déco très belle mais vieillie et abîmée (socle de lit en simili cuir marine déchiré, porte d'un meuble de cuisine cassée) ; parties communes sales ; petit-déjeuner horrible (chaque tranche de pain emballée sous plastique, pas de pain frais ni de "vraie" confiture, uniquement couverts en plastique et vaisselle en carton, salle de petit-dej minuscule que se partagent deux hôtels, pas de fromage, pas de granola, pour résumer uniquement de la junk food !) ; personnel à la réception désagréable (aucune fourchette en arrivant dans notre kitchenette, 30 mn d'attente pour qu'un employé vienne et nous avions volé les fourchettes ! et encore 10 mn pour avoir enfin 4 fourchettes en métal) ; et le bouquet : pas d'accès au salon commun (photos magnifiques sur le site de l'hôtel pourtant). 
Nous étions au 46ème étage.

title: Non tutto perfetto
text: Con la mia famiglia, nella settimana che finiva con Pasqua , abbiamo preso due stanze a cancellazione gratuita (una tripla per i ragazzi e una doppia per noia). Al check in abbiamo chiesto cortesemente camere ai pinai alti e le abbiamo avute (55 e 61 piano). questo e la vista emozionante e piena di atmosfera, farebbe dimenticare qualsiasi difetto. Sembra tutto abbastanza pulito, il letto è comodo, bella TV , clima gradevole, molto silenzio. Cucinina scarsamente utilizzabile (mancano i fornelli e c'é una elettropentola sola) . Bagno paragonabile a quello di un due/tre stelle italiano (come arredo...ad esempio , doccia a pavimento con tendalino ), ma ampio, funzionale e ben dotato di prodotti e morbida biancheria). La colazione non soddisfa il gusto continentale o italiano : pochi dolci, neanche uno straccio di croissant o di biscotto, esigua la scelta di marmellate ( a volte c'era solo mirtilli)  . Anche il lato salato era scarso. Solo una mattina c'era del bacon , negli altri giorni una specie di mini hamburger ( o forse salsiccia a fette) poco sapido, uova strapazzate e patate con peperoni. Impossibile farsi un caffellatte decente se non a pagamento (caro prezzo) al banco  della sala dove servono Starbuks (ovverosia grossi BIDONI di caffellatte , molto buoni, in cui possono bere 3/4 persone ). Comunque considerando che la colazione è offerta da pochi hotel, non ci si può lamentare.  Nell'area della colazione self QUASI NESSUNO , salvo pochi italiani, porta la mascherina. Quale è il principale lato negativo ? L'assistenza al desk. La prenotazione è stata operata via Booking. In particolare, a fronte di una spesa preventivata in $ 6140, avevo temuto che, non  avendo alcuna delle nostre carte con tale capienza, potessero esservi problemi di plafond. Pertanto ho avvertito la direzione del problema via mail (risposte piuttosto tardive e sempre e solo in inglese) chiedendo se era possibile il pagamento con carte di debito , bancomat ed offrendomi, dichiarando che volevo essere al riparo  da conseguenze negative,  di pagare in anticipo una delle due camere. Tale facolta', prima ammessa con tanto di indicazioni di moduli da compilare, mi è stata successivamente negata via  mail , ma con ampie rassicurazioni sulla capacita' dei metodi di pagamento dichiarati (sempre via mail) . Al Check in si verifica che : la camera appoggiata alla prima carta (con plafond di 5000 Dollari ) per $.  2.800  va bene, ma la carta non può essere usata per pagare una parte della seconda (il cui costo era circa 3350 Dollari). Ricorriamo allora alla carta di debito (con caricati quasi 4000 dollari) , la quale però ha un limite giornaliero di €. 10000 . CI risolvono dicendo che avremmo dovuto portare la carta ogni tot in modo da consentire il carico della giusta quota. Così abbiamo fatto e ci è sembrato di capire che , nei primi quattro giorni, abbiamo fatto più prelievi fino alla somma dovuta per la camera meno 1000 Euro dollari All'uscita dall'albergo  (Domenica di Pasqua ) il dramma: le somme che credevamo attinte dalla carta di debito , ci si riferiva che erano solo bloccate ma non incassate. Tuttavia, ci spiega l'addetto al desk, avevano consumato il nostro plafond (per cui non potevamo pagare quanto mancante). Insomma, sti soldi non erano più ne nostri ne loro fin o al martedì successivo (due giorni lavorativi). Mostriamo le email con le quali anticipavamo il problema ed offrivamo una soluzione, nonché la rassicurazione finale della loro impiegata e chiediamo una soluzione e ci si dice di provare con gli ATM esterni (avendo 3/4 bancomat) . Dopo avere raggranellato circa la meta' della somma mancante  in contanti, l'impiegata contattata via mail prima dell'arrivo, ci fa sapere che è tutto risolto, e che manca solo il saldo dei mille euro (1100 dollari mancanti)  . Glieli diamo in contanti e la cosa finisce li . In sostanza portatevi carte di credito ben tarate perchè questi non sono affatto chiari . Commento finale: grande paura , tensione, stress.  Scarsissimo senso di accoglienza e di relax, indifferenza di alcuni impiegati al banco (anche in relazione alle difficolta' linguistiche rispetto alle quali non c'é soluzione . Non ho sentito una parola di francese, tedesco od altro, figuriamoci l'italiano ). Scuse finali della povera Pamela  (che ci aveva risposto alle mail iniziali) e ci ha confermato che eravamo a posto. L'ospitalita' è UN'ALTRA COSA . Breve post scriptum : un giorno è mancato il servizio ascensore per alcune ore (alle 9 di mattina): scendere dal 61^ piano a piedi è possibile, ma le gambe e i piedi vi ricorderanno l'impresa per i successivi 10 giorni!

title: Non un 4 stelle
text:
Sicuramente cercare un buon albergo centrale con vista e arredi nuovi e ottima colazione  è un po’ difficile se non vuoi sborsare più di 800 dollari a notte.
Noi qui ne abbiamo sborsati più di 430 a notte e le pecche ci sono , il giudizio positivo va alla vista impeccabile e alla posizione comoda vicino a time square central park e alla metro ,ma veniamo alle cose negative le camere non sono enormi ma dicono che la media di Manhattan sia questa , dentro la stanza si soffoca dal caldo nonostante fuori siano al massimo 14 gradi e quindi si è costretti ad accendere L aria condizionata che fa un rumore esagerato da non riuscire a dormire oltre che a un forte vento chiaramente non regolabile (non so’ d ‘agosto come fanno)
Gli arredi sono consumati abbiamo lo scotch ad alcune vetrate una tenda visivamente strappata in due ma il peggio arriva dalla colazione.. siamo stati qui 7 notti e per 7 colazioni c’erano solo uova sode uova strapazzate patate in padella e salsicce .. poi un po’ di burro e marmellata e uno yogurt non si può mangiare uova e salsicce per sette giorni! .
Sicuramente tutto questo è dovuto al fatto che questo è un residence non è un vero e propio hotel con servizi . 
Comunque noi non ci ritorneremo a voi la scelta!!!

title: Excellent hotel, ideal location, friendly staff and great facilities!
text:
Stayed here for 5 night stay as a couple exploring NYC. Amazing views on the 52nd floor and the noise cancellation was excellent! We stayed in a Grand Times Square room and the views were breaktaking - even had a cheeky small glipse of Central Park.
Despite not having paid for breakfast, we were told this was complimentary which was a nice surprise! The breakfast was a little basic for hot choice - scrambled egg, basic sausage and potatoes but was a good start to the day! 
The room was clean, well equiped - however the bins did not have bags, not sure if this is a thing! Excellent service to sort taxi and hold bags on the last day.

The only shame was there not being a bath despite there being plenty of room for one...would definitely stay here again!

title: Great Location and Modern Amenities
text: Ideally located close to subways (and steps from Stephen Colbert's show) as well as all kinds of public transportation, this modern hotel offers rooms that, while small, offer great features such as a fridge, microwave and dishwasher. Mine had a single bed and a double/queen. They were both very close together, but would suit a 3-person family. There is an in-room safe, a very comfortable bed and linens, a good size flat screenTV, a bit of a finicky temperature gauge on the shower and lots of outlets. Unfortunately, some were very loose and could not hold the plug. There is a bit of noise from the HVAC and appliances. I heard no noise from the street, and was on the 41st floor. An access card is needed to operate the lights and once removed, the lights go out after a few minutes. It must be an energy saving feature, but I did not like it. My room had a great city view and it felt like a quintessential NY experience. The free breakfast is high quality and offers take-away containers. The lobby is split with a sister property and includes a place to pick up a few convenience items. You are steps from theatres, drugstores, vendors, banks and restaurants. One of the best locations for sightseeing in all directions. I will definitely return.

title: Viaje en Junio
text: Tengo un viaje en Junio (3 al 12) con mi familia, 2 habitaciones, y estoy un poco preocupado por algunos comentarios con respecto al ruido y los espacios. Por ahora tengo reservación en el Residence Inn y también en el Mondrian, tendré que confirmar solo una. ¿Alguna recomendación?

title: Excellent location
text: Location was excellent with all NYC attractions within walking distance. We had a corner room with a fabulous view on 56th floor. The room was convenient with a mini kitchen and nice size bathroom. Staff efficient and friendly. Breakfast is very very basic, can be improved by charging for it. It is an excellent choice if you want to stay in midtown.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
New York is one of our favourite places to visit and this was our 5th time visiting.
I have to say this is THE BEST hotel I’ve stayed at in NYC!
We booked a King Studio with Park view.
We arrived a bit early to check in so had to wait for our room.  David at front desk was really nice and assured me that the room would be worth the wait. He was not wrong!  Our room was 6402 so right near the top.  We were blown away by the view from our room.  The room had a kitchenette with dishwasher, fridge, freezer, microwave, plates, etc. 
The room was spotless, bed was huge and comfortable and the TV was a smart TV so we could watch Netflix, prime etc.  Shower was great with good water pressure.
Breakfast had a good selection to allow us to grab a quick bite before heading out for the day.
All staff were really friendly and approachable.  We found someone’s apple AirPods in the safe of our room and handed them in to David at front desk who assured us he would get them back to the previous guests which showed the staff are always willing to go above and beyond for the guests.
I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again and will be my first choice for future stays in NYC.

title: NYC March 2022
text: Just got back from a four night stay in NYC. Our hotel was located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, just short of a 5 minute walk from Times Square. On arrival we were given a room upgrade to the 65th floor, the top floor of the highest hotel in the USA with a view of Times Square (attached pics speak for themselves!!). Decor of rooms a little outdated, most hotel rooms have USB ports for charging phones etc now, we had a bit of an issue with the plug sockets, which was quickly fixed by a trip to 7 Eleven. The shower had a big crack in the tile but the water pressure was fantastic. Smart TV in room with kitchenette, great for bringing food back to your hotel room. One of the biggest things for me though was the strange noise coming from one of the walls, it may possibly have been the wind due to being so high up but we couldn’t figure out where it was coming from, therefore it was a little noisy at night. Breakfast was included every morning of our stay and available from 06:30, great for us when trying to get used to the time difference. On reflection however, we would return to this hotel on future stays as the staff couldn’t have been more helpful and welcoming.

title: Great Customer Sevice
text:
The hotel is a little confusing as it is two hotels in one building. We originally had a reservation in the Courtyard part of the hotel. That room was really small for two people. I went to the front desk to see if there was a larger room and they were able to move me into a larger room with two beds in the Residence side. The hotel is right downtown so the views can not be beat. At check out the lady at the front desk remembered me and was very nice. Everyone at the front desk that I encountered was very nice. 
The only negatives that I could say is that the bath soaps, shampoos, etc have palm derivatives in them. This is one of the worst things for the environment. Please find palm and SLS free alternatives. Also, I don't appreciate all of the marriott properties having the Book of Mormon in the rooms. There should not be any religious books in the rooms (including the Bible). If people want the religious books they can ask for them to be delivered to the room during their stay but other people should not be subjected to them. These are the only things holding this hotel back from getting a 5 star rating from me.

title: Returning to a previous favorite
text: This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel in the last few years, and the first time since COVID. The location, amenities, and view are perfect. It has been a few years since this hotel has been renovated, but it is still in good shape. You don’t have to wait long for an elevator, and the kitchenette is amazing. It has what you need. I would have liked one more chair at the kitchen table (there is only one). The staff is friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay again.

title: Great hotel
text: I have stayed here a number of times and just getting around to writing a review. I can’t say anything negative. The location is terrific. So close to subway stations and right between theater district and Central Park and close enough that it’s an easy walk to both. I like the fact that it’s not right in the d craziness of Times Square. From the time you check in to the time you leave everyone at this hotel is pleasant and accommodating. I’d like to make special mention of Kimberly at the front desk. She always does whatever she can to help you out and make sure you are happy. The rooms are a bit small but not much smaller than the typical NY hotel room. The view more than makes up for the size of the room. The corner rooms have floor to ceiling windows and you get the best view of NYC. The rooms are always clean and have everything you need. A basic buffet is included with the room at the Residence inn and it is enough to get you going. I found it to be a good way to start my day so I don’t have to run out to a restaurant. I’ve been coming to NY for many years and first stayed here last May. I’m usually in the city once a month and this is my new favorite NYC hotel.

title: Positive surprise, would return anytime
text: First time ever in a Resident Inn. Incredible value for money (250/n) in perfect NYC location. Rooms were not smaller than any of the 4* in NYC I would typically default to, fantastic view from 57th floor corner room, well maintained, great kitchen equipment, quiet, comfortable beds (we had 2 rooms and they were both really nice and good standard). Big shout out to the wonderful at the reception who were v helpful and accommodating, porters etc etc - just awesome. Nothing to complain about.

title: Excellent service in the morning
text: We were greeted every morning very nicely by Claudia and Carlos at the breakfast room. I had requested gluten free bread and muffins and they went the extra mile to make sure I had it. Great Job! Hotel stay very good overall.

title: Delayed visit!
text:
The hotel is well placed, entrance JUST off Broadway on 54th. Ideal spot. Easy walk to Times Sq, loads of food local.  Had Grand King times sq studio, 50th floor. Stunning views. Very nice room.  Fridge isn't COLD. Freezer also not awesome, ice cream was soft.  Shower is fab and kitchen very functional.  Not huge choice on TV. Can hear the lift but its not too bad. Staff were amazing.  Breakfast is OK. Hot Spicy sausage(very spicy)/sausage/Canadian bacon/crispy bacon depending on day. Yummy scrambled egg and breakfast potatoes (wedges) boiled egg and various drinks and cereals and fruit. Also bagels.  Give the muffins a miss..claggy. Eric the bellman kept our luggage after check out until we left
 Sorted us a big car to go to airport. Extra but worth it.
 A

title: Fantastic views
text: We stayed here for three nights, the best of the hotel, the views which are fantastic. These are the best in NYC. We stayed in the 52th  floor. The room 5/10, nothing special. The breakfast 4/10, location 8/10. Near Central Park and Times Square.

title: Terrible first night experience.....Night #2 much better...
text: First let me say that I stayed at the Residence Inn in Providence, RI the week before I changed my hotel to the Residence Inn NYC/Central Park....I was so impressed with the RI location that I thought it would be a fabulous experience in NYC also....WRONG!  Think we had the WORST room in the hotel....I am a Bonvoy member, so I filled out their questionnaire as to what rooms etc. would be best.....AWAY from the ELEVATORS.  Not only did it sound like a jet plane was flying overhead, but the room was no better than a motel room   Bathroom door was completely scratched and had to put your fingers/hand into a black hole to close the door..  I went down to complain about the noise and they said they were completely booked??for the night, and check in with them in the a.m. for availability....next morning I was there bright and early with circles under my eyes.....no sleep...and they changed my room immediately....thought they were booked??????  Night number 2 was night and day....luxurious and lovely...  Room #1 needs rehabbing it was NOT a Marriott experience....Why why why?  Costs for these room exceed $450 according to hotels.com....EEEEEEK!

title: Superior stay at an efficiently-run, well-located midtown hotel
text:
The website claims this is the tallest hotel in the U.S. We would't know since we were in one of the lower floors, but since the Residence Inn is on the upper floors of a building that also houses a Courtyard, even one of the lower floors of the Residence Inn offered great city views. We were upgraded to a corner room that had a bit of a view of the Hudson River as well. Lovely. (See photos.)

Our room was not large but it did have room for an easy chair near the window, a desk, some shelves, a small kitchenette area, microwave, minifridge, sink, dishwasher, cabinets with dishes, etc., and a fairly large bathroom.

Due to the pandemic, breakfast is grab and go, but you can choose from various breads, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, some fruit, juice and coffee.

The location is terrific for tourists. Close to several subway lines, an easy walk to Broadway theaters, Times Square, Central Park, MOMA, Carnegie Hall, and tons of restaurants and shops.

title: Affordable and Awesome
text: Really loved this hotel. The room was fabulous. Clean, modern and well equipped. We had an amazing view of the city and Hudson River. That view really impressed us. Also had complimentary breakfast. Location is ideal. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Good Location
text:
Good location. Clean Hotel. Friendly staff. 
Close walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. Great views from the 38th floor. Held our luggage the next morning after check out while we did a bus tour. Retrieved it with five minutes of returning. Would stay again.

title: Great views, good location, small rooms
text: I spent 6 nights at this Residence Inn located on 54th St. and Broadway. Location was good, near everything and subway stops. The building itself is very high, they claim the highest hotel in the USA, and our room had a great view. Service at the reception desk and room cleaning was very good. However, the rooms are very small. The bed was comfortable, in the bathroom we had very few toiletries but they gave us more right away when we asked. Many of the fixtures in the hotel in general and in our room needed repairs. I saw at least 4 light fixtures broken, the bath mirror corner patched up with duct tape, a non working bathroom fan and so on. Small details but altogether it looks like the hotel needs a little bit of maintenance. Additionally, the entrance of the hotel on Broadway was closed. Breakfast was marginal but this is due to the pandemic, and since it was free it was overall ok. A solid hotel for Manhattan with good prices but not a first choice for me.

title: Great hotel
text: Quality hotel in a great location.  Stayed in a partial park view king room on a high floor--room is modern and good sized.  Comfy pillows and beds.  The staff we encountered were all friendly and helpful--especially Eric who handled checking our bags before our room was ready.

title: Nice Hotel, good location
text:
We usually stay at the Residence Inn Midtown by Bryant Park but wanted to change it up this trip. 
Great location close to Columbus Circle (Whole Foods!), Central Park South lots of dining, and the Subway.
The Staff were very courteous and helpful, and our request for an upper floor was honored. Skip the Grab and Go Breakfast unless you wish to spend a lot of time waiting for elevators. The hot breakfasts (pre-pandemic) were always excellent so I don't fault the hotel for having to do what they can. There is a small grocery a half block away so stock up that fridge!
The room was VERY small, however laid out with a Tokyo-type sensibility. The kitchenette proved very handy. The bed was very comfy. Housekeeping did a good job as we were there for a week.

Being Primo Marriott Bonvoy Members, I expected a little bigger room. We will probably return to the 6th Ave property next visit which includes a full kitchen and sofa area.

title: Amazing view but charge for packages
text: The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to both Times Square and Central park and is one of the reasons we chose this hotel. We booked the grand times square view room and I will never book other rooms. The view from the room is amazing and you can see both the Hudson river and Times Square. While the room is very small, the storage layout helps make the room size ok. Another reason we booked the hotel is because it has kitchenette in the room and laundry facilities in the hotel. The only reason I am not giving it a 5 star is because before booking I tried to see if they charge for packages sent to the hotel for the guests but nowhere can I see any information. I looked all over their website but can’t find any information. I saw a post here in TA that they receive packages for free so I booked the hotel instead of Hilton for this sole reason. But then I get there and they charged me $10 per packages even for small packages. When I asked where is this fee stated in their website, they showed me  something on their phone that does not even look like their current website. The guys was nice and we tried to meet in the middle so I did not press any further as I don’t want more stress. But I am sure it wasn’t in the website and they can’t show me where exactly in the website. Moreover most hotels charge for packages only when receive before the stay but packages received during the stay are free but in this hotel, even very small packages sent during the stay is charge $10. Had I known this I would not have booked this hotel because there are hilton hotels with similar facilities that do not charge for packages and those that do only charge for $2 per package.

title: ANOTHER WONDERFUL STAY
text: I just returned from another wonderful stay at the Residence Inn Manhattan Central Park. Up until my arrival, my trip was not going well. My plane got diverted overnight to Pittsburgh due to bad weather, so I could not attend the Broadway show and High Line walking tour that I had prepurchased.  But, Mathura at the front desk immediately made me feel welcome and assigned me a room with a breathtaking view.  Thanks also to Mirlinda at reception who was also very helpful.  I'm still amazed at the convenience of this location. You can walk to many Broadway theaters and MOMA, there are three subway stations nearby providing access to several lines,  and there are tons of restaurants from fast food to fine dining.  I plan to stay here whenever I visit NYC.

title: Pretty good
text: We made a reservation almost a year ago so I wasn't too happy with being on the 30th floor. I called the front desk and was moved to a room on the 50th floor which was better but still not what I reserved and requested. It was clean and housekeeping came every day. The location is great and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The water never got hot in the shower. Just semi warm. For the price I'm not sure I would stay here again just because it was nothing special. We stayed in the village for much cheaper.

title: Не соответсвовал ожиданиям
text:
Хорошее расположение, прекрасные виды из окна, персонал приветлив. На этом плюсы закончились. Номер неудобный и маленький, в шкаф поместить вещи нереально, всё валялось на стуле и кресле, вешалок мало опять же. Зачем нужна кухня непонятно, зачем кастрюля сковорода, ведь плиты нет) Отдельная песня это климатическая установка в виде дыры в стене из которой дует так, что сдувает с ног. Причём регулировать кроме температуры ничего не получается и шум такой, что как будто в самолёте, кстати и холодильник тоже сильно шумел, чтобы нормально спать, приходилось всё отключать. Завтрак в отеле никакой, я бы назвал это издевательством . Надо набрать в пакет еды
и есть у себя в номере, а набирать собственно нечего, из всего съедобного, только яйца варёные. И в завершении всего на карте случайно заблокировали аж 800 долларов, зачем непонятно, от чего хотели себя обезопасить??? и теперь ждать чуть ли не месяц, когда деньги вернутся . В общем больше ни ногой в этот отель. И никому не рекомендую

title: Great stay in a great location at the tallest hotel in the United States!
text:
The Residence Inn shares a lobby with the Courtyard at the same address. The lobby can get very busy at times, but the limited amount of staff handles it as best as they can. 

This hotel is the tallest hotel in the United States, and no matter what floor you receive, you are likely to get a great city view. The Courtyard takes up the lower half of the building, while the Residence Inn occupies the upper floors. (65th Floor is the highest) 

I booked a Grand Times Square View room, which is a great corner room. The room # ends in "05". I had a partial view of Central Park. A great view of Times Square and toward the east, and I could also see the Hudson River. 

The room is a bit small, but has a very functional kitchenette, desk with chair, small but nice bathroom, and a chair with table near the floor to ceiling windows. I also like that the window opens, although it can be tricky to open sometimes. 

I had a few cleanliness issues with housekeeping, and attention to detail when cleaning the room was lacking. 

The public space on the 4th floor where Residence Inn guests have a "grab-n-go" breakfast, is where the Starbucks is located. This room was a big disappointment. I was there in the late afternoon/early evening, and the room still hadn't been cleaned from the breakfast rush. Every table was dirty and it was not a pleasant experience to try to find a clean spot to sit.

The location is great, being right in between Central Park and Times Square. Subway access is very close by.

title: Modern small accommodations with some issues
text:
Plus: Modern apartments/studios. 
Minus: Accommodation at the smaller end when compared to other Residence Inn properties
Minus: Room only ready at maximum check-in time, ie at 4 PM
Minus: No cooking option besides microwave 
Minus: Covid safety protocol not enforced, ie a large amount of guests not wearing face masks indoors (lobby, lifts, hallways)

title: Прекрасно
text:
Вот отель прям как надо. 
Высокие этажи – шикарный вид из окна. 
Номера не большие, но всё удобно и комфортно. Убирают на 5 и делают это каждый день 
Завтрак средний, обычный для Америки. 
Багаж можно оставить, что большой плюс. 

Единственное но — ужасный WiFi. Прям откровенно плохо работал. 
Чем выше номер возьмёте, тем красивее будет вид (, 

Локация так же прекрасна. Всё рядом, все удобно.

title: Excellentissime!
text:
Une expérience au top du haut du 61e étage avec une super vue sur Times Square. Un rêve !

Le personnel est super accueillant. Nous avons discuté via messenger quelques semaines avant notre arrivée qu'il s'agissait de notre lune de miel et que j'apporterai ma robe de mariée pour une shooting photo "Honeymoon". Ils ont carrément ajouter une garde robe temporaire à la chambre pour me permettre de l'accrocher.

Les chambres sont spacieuses et tout est fait pour qu'on s'y sente bien. Le lit est super confortable. 

La salle de bain est petite mais très correcte. 

Il existe également un espace kitchenette dont nous n'avons pas eu l'utilisation. 

Le petit déjeuner est copieux.

Nous devrions y retournez ce mois d'août avec les enfants mais les frontières en ont décidé autrement. 

J'espère pouvoir y retourner à l'été 2022!

Je recommande vivement !

title: MARAVILHOSO
text: O hotel é divino, os quartos são super confortáveis e grandes para o padrão de Nova Iork. A vista é espetacular e não dá vontade de sair da janela. Banheiro super limpo e uma ótima infraestrutura na parte de baixo, com lanchonetes, starbucks e lojas de conveniência.

title: Residence Inn Central Park. A Hotel-W/conveniences of home. Rooms begin @37th floor, W/floor 2ceiling windows-THE VIEWS!
text: The lobby is well kept, well lit & filled W/incredibly patient, kind & efficient men & women greeting each guest @check in, Marthura made sure My room matched the photo of room type I showed her in a photo. Meghan, Pamela, Joe all helped me when I called fromt desk requesting help W/ items from detergent-to room supplies, an engineer to set up HDMI on TV etc.. And Daniel The Front desk manager was extremely helpful, patient, efficient throughout my stay & accommodating my requests relating to check out. I enjoyed the sky loft gym, BRK room & my own room as all are well lit W/floor to ceiling windows & beautiful views of the city!

title: Good location, BUT....
text: Viewed at least 5 rooms before finding one where everything was clean and worked.  One room viewed had half-eaten bowl of ice cream in the freezer.  Other fridge/freezers were warm.  Noisy everywhere due to elevators close to rooms.  Front desk staff nice most of the time. Daniel the night manager on check-in was the very best and so professional and kind whilst helping me find a decent room.  Great views from high floors.  Tiny but cleverly efficient rooms.  Safe locked, couldn't use it, no time to wait for maintenance.  Microwave compartment door would not stay up in any room I saw, and this door landed on my head ever time I opened it.  Brown water in toilet and sink two days.  Electric outlet on desk fell out and hung by wires; another wall socket also loose.  AC not usable at night due to blasting bed area with cold air.  Thin doors and walls - heard everything on my floor.  Ice maker in freezer dropped cubes in middle of night, waking me.  Maintenance people entered my room despite "do not disturb" sign on door, after I told front desk not to let people in unless I was in the room.  Very upset that my instructions were ignored and staff could see my personal belongings all over the room, and I don't know if the workers kept their masks on.  I don't allow housekeeping when I travel during the pandemic - not needed for a few days.  Doubt I would ever stay here again.

title: Fantastic NYC Weekend Stay!
text:
We had a great time at the Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park hotel over the Memorial Day weekend.  

The location is great for an immersive NYC tourist experience - close to Times Square, Central Park, and the subway to get you almost anywhere else.  The area felt safe even late night and early morning.  

The hotel rooms are typical size for NYC and the view from the higher floors is ANYTHING BUT typical! The bed was comfortable and did I mention the view?  Hotel amenities are still a bit limited due to COVID-19 protocols.

The hotel staff throughout the hotel was great.  Everyone  was always friendly and accommodating to all our requests, especially Joseph at the Front Desk.  They all seemed genuinely happy to have guests back in the hotel.  

My only critique would be hot water took a while to reach my 56th floor room and that the flatware in the kitchen needs to be fully restocked after each guest (e.g. we had 1 fork and 1 butter-knife provided but 4 settings of plates and glasses).

Overall I would recommend this property to anyone wanting to visit NYC and wanting to be close to the tourist action.  I am looking forward to my next visit in NYC in a few weeks and will definitely be staying here then.

title: They cancelled my reservation and moved me to another hotel.  Did not honor my certificate or points!!!
text:
I have a lot to say, but I am mainly reaching out on here hoping that someone from Marriott will contact me to help me.  I've tried calling the hotel but get put on hold by the front desk forever... no one gets back on the phone after 15 minutes on hold.  I've tried calling the main number and can't get to a representative.  I left a message for the billing dept at the hotel today hoping someone will get back to me.  I originally had booked a room at Residence in Times Square using my annual certificate for one night and my points for a second night.  (June 1 and June 2)  .  

On May 20 I received an email from Rebecca McDonald stating that the hotel was under renovation and they would have to cancel my reservation, but they would be happy to book me at the same rate at the sister hotel Residence Central Park.  From the email..."Our reopening has been postponed. We are truly sorry to have to share this information with you, but unfortunately we will have to cancel your reservation with us....Please consider my sister property, Courtyard/ Residence Inn Central Park.  I can confirm they can match your rate and will match the room type as close as possible."

This was fine with me, so I emailed her back and she booked us a room at Central Park.  On June 1 (the day were to check in), I received an email from Marriott stating that I had insufficient points to stay in the Central Park Hotel.  When I we got to the hotel I asked at the front desk and they said that I was not going to be charged for the room, and my original reservation at Times Square was being honored.  I did use the valet parking and I knew that I would be charged for that.  I requested a late check out on June 3, which I was granted as a Silver Member, and when I checked out at the front desk at 1pm, I was presented with the bill for the $140 and I paid it.  Yesterday, June 18, I check my Bonvoy credit card and noticed that I was charged $770 dollars for the room!  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE somebody from Marriott contact me to straighten this out or tell me who to contact! 

On top of this our first room was so noisy with a banging sound which was most likely coming from the plumbing, and our shower stopped a couple times too, that I asked to be moved to another room the second day.

title: Marriott changed my reservation, didn't provide enought beds!
text:
We had booked another Marriott closer to Bryant Park, and I had spent a lot of time choosing a hotel with a king suite that had a sofa bed for my teenage daughter. 
Exactly 1 week before my stay, we got an email saying they were switching us as the reserved hotel was not yet re-opened, and we were booked for a similar room. 
Arrived at noon and our room only had a king bed, and after 2 different discussions with the front desk they said they don't have any other rooms available with more than 1 bed.  We ended up asking for extra blankets and my teenage daughter slept on the floor. I had reserved a King Suite and they switched us to a King as a "similar" room.
Another issue, our second room had food in the fridge from the previous guest, and our room had a goldfish cracker on the floor and dried out contact lenses stuck to the night stand.  Really wondering about their cleaning procedures.
Positives to this hotel are the location, decent continental breakfast, and comfortable beds.  
This is my first real disappointment with Marriott.

title: Great Location; Just OK hotel
text: The location on Broadway between Times Square and Columbus Circle is fantastic.  But the hotel is just OK.  We checked in after a long wait.  Kimberly at the front desk was very nice, helpful, and courteous.  We paid for a "Grand View" but were on a lower floor.  The room itself was tiny, particularly for a Residence Inn, even by New York standards.  The kitchen was nice, with fridge, freezer and dishwasher drawers.  The air conditioning didn't work properly, requiring visits from maintenance.  Then the lights and plugs on one side of the room didn't work. This meant the alarm clock didn't work.  We just didn't want to deal with more people in the room, so we lived with it.  The overall condition of the room was a bit tired.  While I get COVID restrictions, the breakfast was a joke.  It was inconsistent day to day, no spoons one day, no knives the next, no drinks one day, only plain stale bagels one day--nothing else!  Then our bill on the last day was $300 more than the reservation.  It got resolved, but shouldn't have needed to be done.  One has expectations of a Residence Inn based on some degree of consistency around the world, but this one didn't live up to expectations.

title: Fab hotel
text: Excellent location, half way between Central Park and Times Square and our room on the 50th floor had a partial view of both. Beds really comfy and clean. Staff at reception, mostly helpful. Lovely touch birthday cupcakes left as a treat which was really nice. This hotel has free breakfast which is a nice touch and one of the reasons we booked but it wasn't the best. Some kids cereals, better coffee and some freshly made options would be nice. The eating area for breakfast had great views to watch the world go by. I would definitely recommend this hotel for comfort, views and location.

title: Not what I’d expect from a Marriott
text:
Stating here as I write. We originally were to stay at a different Residence closer to Times Square. I booked and paid for a high floor corner room. I received an email from the property saying they aren’t open yet but can stay here and they’ll try to give me a comparable room. Great , I say. 
I’m on a floor under the 50th , so not a high floor, and crammed on a floor with all rooms occupied so I can hear the other guests. And is certainly not close to a corner room in size or view. 
Ok, not a problem.... I guess. First problem- there’s no hair dryer. We call down after I’m out of the shower..: wait over 10 mins and call  again and say that we can come downstairs to get it. No problem , we’ll be right there. 30 mins later, no hairdryer. For a wish with wavy hair, I need to start drying it while it’s wet. Plus why am I still waiting?? We go downstairs and ask for them just to give it to us. 
The TV keeps shutting off for some reason, and then the volume hors out. It’s after 11pm, I don’t want someone here in the room to fix di now we have to make do.
But no hairdryer, a TV that’s jacked up... what next??
So the thermostat didn’t work at first. Showed the room temp as 80. We finally finagled it. 
Really?? All of these issues?? We are finally traveling again and have been loyal marriot customers, but this stay was not good.

title: We got engaged!
text: It was a sweet little room with amazing an view and a little kitchen with silverware, glasses and plates. Boyfriend surprised me with rose petals and candles (fake) with a photographer to ask me to marry him!

title: Ötimo custo/beneficio- excelente vista e cafe da manha.
text:
Quarto- muito bem arrumado, limpos, decoracao contemporanea e clean. Tamanho medio ( por volta de 25m) mas supera a media e NY.
Vista- uma das vistas mais lindas que vi de NY. Quartos altos e grandes janelas proporcionam uma vista linda independente do lado que vc escolha( times sq, central parque, rio hudson)
Atendimento: bom. o hotel sempre cheio impede um atendimento mais criterioso e personalizado, mas nada que comprometa ou desabone.
Lobby e outras areas- Boa academia.. pequena mas uitl e com quase tudo que se precisa. lobby bem pequeno e confuso..mas ok
Cafe da manha: um dos poucos hoteis que oferecem cafe da manha incluido. Vale a pena. nada de muito chique e inovador. o basico..mas muito bom..
Voltaria com certeza se quisesse ficar nessa area de novo. Mas esse é o problema. A area, apesar de ficar entre central P e Times Sq, nao tem nada empolgante ao redor. Alguns restaurantes, lojas mas nada famoso ou marcante. De qualquer forma, tem um metro ao lado. No balanço geral é uma escolha muito boa..

title: Just Awesome
text: I've heard about this hotel through several articles and recommended through people who've stayed here, and did it live up to the hype.  I had a great view looking into Times Square and coming back towards the park.  The room itself could be considered "small" but I thought it was right for me for 3 nights as I was pretty much on the go.

title: Room with a view
text: Mooi, modern hotel. Studio op de 60ste verdieping met een prachtig uitzicht over Manhattan. Prima ontbijt. Vriendelijk personeel. Op loopafstand van Times Square en de theaters. Metro (7the Avé.) op slechts 200 meter. Aanrader!

title: A fantastic fifth stay.
text:
As an amateur photographer, I always look forward to my annual stay at the Residence Inn NY and the awesome and breathtaking views from my room. The check in was a breeze and I was delighted when David remembered me and he also mentioned that I had stayed in one of the Central Park view suites the former year. I had booked a City View room this year and David upgraded me to a magnificent double room facing the Hudson River, a partial view of Central Park and plenty of drawers. 
During my one week stay he also went above and beyond to comply with my requests. The staff is all extremely professional and friendly.  The rooms are clean and well appointed and the bed is very comfy. Location is excellent and it’s nice to have a complimentary breakfast.

title: Excelente opção, otima localização!
text:
Quartos confortáveis, ficamos no 56o. andar, vista deslumbrante de NY.
O quarto quando chegamos estava com limpeza a desejar. Não fizemos nenhum pedido e em todos os demais dias o quarto estava impecavel
Bom e agradavel cafe da manha, hotel sem ruido e com funcionários bastante simpáticos e gentis

title: Great hotel in excellent location
text: I stayed here for two nights. The room was small but comfortable and well appointed. I had a room on the 51st floor with a great view. The kitchen was nice and the breakfast decent. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. It was walkable to Lincoln Center and Broadway shows as well as museums. Highly recommend.

title: 5 Night business stay
text:
My wife and I stayed for 5 nights including a weekend on business. Location is great for broadway, Central Park, Shopping and transport.

Staff were all friendly and helpful. Room was clean. No issues or problems to report.

Breakfast is basic/simple but wouldn't expect too much more for a complimentary service.

title: Bemerkenswert
text: Zimmer in der 58. Etage. Je Etage gibt es nur 6-8 Zimmer, es ist also angenehm ruhig. Aufzug ist extrem schnell, man wartet nie lange.
