Zimmer sind etwas klein aber ausreichend, gut ausgestattet mit gut funktionierender Dusche, schnellem WiFi, guter Aircon/Heizung und sehr bequemen Kingsize Bett. Man kann nicht klagen für das Geld. Besonders hervorzuheben ist die einzigartige Lage sowohl zu Theatern des Broadway als auch den grossen Museen oder dem Central Parc und zu zig Metro-Stationen. Selbst das kostenlose Frühstück ist für amerikanische Verhältnisse als sehr sehr üppig zu bezeichnen. Personal ist freundlich und flott. Housekeeping ist dem Niveau des Hauses (3 Sterne) angemessen. Sowas wie Pool etc. darf man zu dem Preis in der Lage auch nicht erwarten. Alles in allem für hiesige Verhältnisse ein hervorragendes Hotel - wir waren positiv überrascht...

title: Tolle Lage, immer in oberen Etagen, sauber,  mit gutem Frühstück
text:
Als Familie  hatten wir 2 Zimmer gebucht und bekamen sie in der selben 56. Etage. Die Aussicht war wunderbar und der Strassenlärm sehr gering. Die Lage top neben Subway Stationen am Broadway. Die eher neueren Zimmer könnten grösser sein, aber für 2 Personen ausreichend. Ein Zimmer war in der nähe des Liftschachts. Die Geräusche waren anfangs etwas störend. Besser beim check in darauf achten. Die Zimmer wurden täglich gut gereinigt. Besonders praktisch war das gute inklusive Frühstück. Somit waren wir alle am Morgen zeitsparend gut versorgt. Die Zimmer haben einen Kühlschrank, Mikrowelle und Geschirr. Somit hatten wir die Möglichkeit am Abend auch mal ein Mikrowellengericht zu machen und es im Zimmer oder Frühstücksraum zu essen. Das war sehr praktisch. New York ist leider sehr teuer geworden, das Hotel hat jedoch faire Preise für das, was man bekommt. Ein grosses Plus: Keine  Resort Gebühren, welche man am Schluss noch bei anderen Hotels für unnötige Dinge zahlen muss.
Wir würden dieses Hotel auf jedenfall wieder buchen und können es sehr empfehlen.

title: 現時点では最高のホテル、次回もリピート予定
text:
キッチン付き・朝食付き・眺望・立地、この条件でいつも探していますが、今まで泊まったニューヨークのホテルの中では今のところ1番です。宿泊者全員対象の無料朝食も充実し、野菜もありました。（野菜はアメリカの無料のビュッフェ朝食ではあまりみかけない）
56階に泊まりましたが、レジデンスインは、下層階のコートヤードとエレベータが分かれており、非常に高速のエレベータでストレスなく上下できました。
バスタブもありました。水回りやキッチンも広く、その分、部屋は狭かったですが、なんとかスーツケースが広げられるだけはあります。
デメリットをあえてあげると、部屋が若干狭い、価格は高め、ポイント予約だとコーナールームなどの眺望がより良い部屋にならない場合があるなど。
朝食会場になるラウンジは他の時間帯は閉鎖はされず、PCなどは使えますがコーヒーなどドリンクのサービスはありません。フロントのスペースに自由に飲めるお水などはあります。
ランドリーはマシンが有料ですが洗剤は置いてあります。フィットネスセンターはありますがプールはありません。
それと電気のコンロはチェックインの時か、ハウスキーピングに言えば持ってきてもらえます。キッチンのシンクは非常に詰まりやすかったので、調理したら食材の汚れはできるだけキッチンペーパーで拭き取り、流さないようにしないと後が大変です。というか大きな食器洗い機があるので全部入れて洗ってました。
調理した料理を置くテーブルがなく、スツールの裏側が小さなテーブルになっている程度なので、その点も残念です。
コロンバスサークルのホールフーズが徒歩圏内ですし、通りを渡ったところにもglossaryがあるので暮らすように滞在できます。冷蔵庫も冷凍庫もそこそこ大きめです。
お風呂のシャワーですがハンドルを回して水圧と水量を同時に決定するタイプ。アメリカではよくみかけますが日本人には慣れないかも。このホテルはちゃんと温度計がついており、温度を見ながら調節できるので安全です。
ここ数年バスタブ無しの部屋に泊まっていたので寒い日のバスタブ付きはうれしかったです。
室温は同じ設定にしていても外気温によって冷房になったり暖房になったりしていました。高層階で窓も大きいせいか、気温の高かった最初の数日は冷房が入っており、最後の日は氷点下になったせいか暖房になりました。空調機器も新しいです。

title: Not a bad stay, but a few let downs.
text: First let me say that the service here has been impeccable, and the staff is very polite. I do recommend staying here. My only complaint is the fact that since this is a Residence Inn, an extended stay, the room is lacking storage to be considered an extended stay. No draws to put clothing, the wardrobe has the safe in the center so you can't really store much on the lower portion. For this to be an extended stay its poorly designed. The kitchenette has one outlet to put the provided hotplate, but theres isnt real space for the cooktop to sit. If you're an overpacker, good luck finding a place to put your things. Even my suitcase doesn't have a real place to go. Would I stay here again? Yes I would.  Also, keep in mind that the higher up you are, the longer the elevator wait will be in the morning, but it's not a deal breaker. I did wait 5 minutes for the elevator at one point and in the moment it was frustrating, but I would still ask for a room on the higher floors even with the wait time, views are too nice to not accept the elevator wait times. - Petty complaint - breakfast should go until 10am.

title: Great location, nice rooms
text:
Just spent three nights here. Check in staff are all very nice and accommodating.

Included breakfast was very good with a large selection. Happy hour in the lounge
was a good (for NYC) deal and a very pleasant space. 

The corner room was very nice with fantastic view. The shower was great, large and great water pressure. It was nice to have a fridge and freezer. 

The location can't be beat for touring around. Easy walk to Central Park, Broadway/Times Square, subway and lots of shopping.

title: Um Hotel agradável
text:
O Hotel é muito central, a cinco minutos de Times Square e perto de Central Park. Muito bem servido de transportes. O metro fica próximo. 
Destaco o profissionalismo e simpatia do David Grossman, Guest Service Agent.
Quarto muito confortável, com uma vista maravilhosa para Times Square e rio Hudson. Dispõe de uma pequena Kitchnette. 
O pequeno almoço poderia ser melhor para o valor que cobram. Tem pouca variedade e a qualidade dos alimentos é fraca. 
Todavia, será um Hotel a ponderar, numa próxima viagem a NYC.

title: Emplacement au top
text:
Hôtel sympa, bel emplacement dans Manhattan! A 2 pas de Times Square. Le personnel est très gentil. 
Petit bémol : pas trop de choix au petit déjeuner.. je conseille tout de même les gaufres qui sont excellentes ! 
Les chambres sont fonctionnelles avec kitchenette, pas de plaque de cuisson à moins de la demander à l’accueil mais sinon il y a un frigo, micro-ondes, lave vaisselle, évier. Chambre propre avec femme de ménage qui passe tout les jours. 
On recommande cet hôtel.

title: Perfect home base for your NYC experience
text: Location is a major consideration for me when choosing a hotel and this one cannot be beat.  Walking distance to Central Park, many Broadway theatres and high end retail.  Multiple subway stops nearby make it easy to get around.  If you like a high-floor cityscape view, this is the place for you.  Both the day and night views from my 38th floor corner room were spectacular.  I also enjoyed watching the street below while sitting in the large third floor lounge where breakfast is served.  To have a clean, modern, relatively new property in this location is amazing.  Such a great value. I’’ll definitely be back!

title: Great location!
text: This is the tallest hotel in North America and was the perfect location for us to get around NYC easily. The blue lights atop the hotel made it easy to navigate and find our way back every night! The hotel is clean and modern, comfortable beds with quality linens.  Shower more than large enough for 2 people with excellent water pressure. Small kitchen area with refrigerator, microwave, and well stocked with dishes and silverware. We stayed 6 nights and the staff was responsive and friendly, always willing go the extra mile for us.  Highly recommended and will definitely stay there again!

title: An "ok" hotel with nice views
text:
We stayed at this hotel in january. We booked grand studio (Times square view) and got a room which wasnt like the one in pictures while booking. We were told the room we got with a lot smaller windows is in same category though. So we asked to change the room and waited for new one from 9am till 5pm. All that time we basically had no hotel room and we were told 9am the room will be ready around noon. The staff were not friendly and we felt like we were last ones on the list since wanting the room we booked. Overall the staff had arrogant attitude which we finns found really weird.

Breakfast was ok and they had some fruits but not really veggies or other green stuff. Coffee was good.

Location is good and view from higher floors (when u get the right room) is nice.

title: Vista deslumbrante
text:
Hotel com equipamentos de cozinha ( geladeira, freezer, microondas, lava-louças e utensílios) no mesmo ambiente das camas/ banheiro. Interessante para famílias com estadia mais longa.
Peca pela limpeza ( carpete e janelas sujas).
Bom café da manhã com lugares suficientes e amplos.
Ponto positivo para a vista do Central Park ( ficamos no 45 andar), 4 elevadores extremamente velozes e sem filas e Wi-Fi veloz.

title: If you are going to Manhattan, this is the place to stay!!!
text:
It all started with Kimberley checking us in.  She was so friendly and helpful. She was able to find us the perfect room with a beautiful view and took the time to smile or say hi every every time we left the hotel.  

The location is centrally located to so many things.  You can easily walk to most of the attractions. Central Park is only a few block North.  Its an easy walk to the Met.  Walk a few blocks south and you are in the heart of Times Square.  A bit further up and you are at Bryant Park, Macy's and the Empire State Building.  If you head a few blocks east, you are in Rockefeller Center.  This really is the perfect location.

Make sure to enjoy the fresh American breakfast.  They serve a huge spread with literally something for everyone.
 
The amenities and location are great; cant be beat, but all of the employees are what makes this our favorite place to stay while in Manhattan.

title: Excellent Value, Comfortable, Convenient Location
text:
For $160 a night,  this is a great option for NYC for a comfortable, updated and spacious room. 

Location: 54th and Broadway, close walking distance from Central Park and Theatre District (~10 blocks from Times Square).  Subway station within 2 blocks. 

Lobby:  Shared lobby for Courtyard Marriott (lower floors) and Residence Inn.  Check in was quick and elevators were fast.

Room:  we had a standard room, which had a nice little kitchenette space at the entrance,  king bed fills up most of the bedroom space, there’s a desk and small chair, and small closet.  There not much floor space in the bedroom, but entry way has nice open space in front of try kitchenette. 

Bathroom: decent size and has bathtub.  Decent bath products that smells nice. 

Everything is fairly updated and has modern feel.  Clean and simple.  Bedding was not the most Lux but comfortable.  

Breakfast:  free buffet breakfast is included.  

For the price, this is a great value and I would stay here again.  Not as posh as The Edition or W, but I like this hotel better than the Sheraton 3 blocks away. Will definitely be back.

title: Caro e ruim
text: Ficamos em dois quartos, pois não cabiam dois adultos e duas crianças em apenas um quarto. Quarto pequeno e apertado. Limpeza mal feita. Em um dos dias, deixaram de fazer a limpeza de um dos quartos. Funcionários da recepção não fazem questão nenhuma de ajudar os hóspedes. Para piorar, o alarme de incêndio disparou as 4 da manhã e a orientação foi a de permanecer no quarto aguardando a investigação do corpo de bombeiros. Ora, para que orientar os hóspedes e assusta-lós desta maneira? Se há alarme, o certo é orientar para todos descerem até q se esclareça a situação. No final, descobriram que era um vazamento ocorrido e os bombeiros liberaram o hotel. Como não dormimos a partir das 4 da manhã em virtude do ocorrido, pedi que o hotel, como compensação, nos deixasse fazer um late check out as 17 hs, horário que sairíamos para o aeroporto. Mas a recepcionista nos respondeu que ficaria feliz em nos dar o late check out no máximo às 12 horas. Ou seja, cordialidade e eficiência nota zero.

title: Excellent location and spacious room - slow elevators
text: I sprung for a room facing time square. The room was large and I had no complaints about size, however during my stay a squall hit nyc. It was very windy outside - the windows leaked. It was pretty noisy plus cold within the room. Pluses - large room, decent size bathroom, kitchen, hot water in bathroom with strong pressure and free breakfast. Plus close to subway and Central Park. Negatives - not much - it’s not a fancy hotel, but decent. The elevators were a bit slow. Breakfast, while free, was nothing to write home about and I preferred to pop in to grab a cup of tea - that was all I would consume. Location is convenient to many nyc iconic sites.

title: Sauber, freundlich, gute Lage
text:
Die Zimmer sind alle oberhalb der 35. Etage. Wir hatten in der 53. Etage ein Eckzimmer  mit Blick auf den Times Square. Irre super Ausblick. Bodentiefe Fenster. Der Roomservice hat auch jeden Tag gute Arbeit geleistet.
Das Frühstücksbuffet hat uns doch ein wenig positiv überrascht für amerikanische Verhältnisse. Allerdings dürfte das Personal gerne mal die Porzellantassen spülen und nicht nachdem alle verbraucht sind durch Pappbecher ersetzen. 
Die Lage des Hotels ist für ein NewYork Trip perfekt!

Es ist meckern auf hohem Niveau.

ABER: Wenn einem hotelseitig das Zimmer storniert wird und man dies erst kurz vor Abflug aus Deutschland durch einen Zufall erfährt bzw herausbekommt erwartet man schon ein gewisses Goodie bzw ein gewisses Entgegenkommen. Das ist leider nicht erfolgt :( Sehr schade. Deswegen keine volle Punktzahl!

title: Idéal !!!
text:
Cette hôtel est vraiment bien placé pour visiter Manhattan 
Le petit déjeuner est très copieux bien que identique tous les matin (il faut y être pour 7h30 Max au risque de se retrouver dans les bouchons)
Les chambres les plus hautes ont une vue splendide

title: Quarto sujo
text:
É a quarta vez que nos hospedamos nesse hotel   A localização é ótima, mas é impressionante como o hotel piorou. Ficamos no quarto 4804.  

 Quarto dito familiar é muito pequeno, com uma cama double e uma solteiro.  Quarto muito sujo, cortinas imundas! É notório que está sem Manutencao há muito tempo.

title: Отель на несколько ночей максимум
text:
Были в этом отеле с супругом на новогодние праздники (15 ночей).
Изначально нам все понравилось,номер достаточно просторный для Нью -Йорка. Но спустя время стали замечать минусы.
1)Уборка качественная происходит видимо только перед заездом новых жильцов. За 2 недели пыль не протиралась,ковёр не пылесосили. Завалявшийся кусок печенья пролежал весь отдых и никто не собирался его убирать. 
2)Завтрак действительно не рассчитан на количество проживающих в отеле,места всем не хватает 
3)Очень мало мест хранения в номере. Приезжая зимой,в шкаф влезает максимум 3-4 тёплые вещи. Из-за этого номер превращается в склад. Редко менялось постельное белье.

Из плюсов могу выделить ,безусловно,вид,61 этаж -это превосходно,много полотенец,докладывают банные принадлежности.

title: Проблемы с повышением стоимости после отъезда
text: Были в отеле с 27.01.19 по 11.01.20 вдвоем с девушкой. После check-out списали 6 $ за бутылку воды и прислали финальный чек за проживание. Все было оплачено. Но через 10 часов (мы уже были в Москве),попытались списать с кредитной карты ещё 1 683$. Не можем связаться с отелем,нет контактной информации. Звонки из России платные и не проходят. Номер комнаты 6109. Свяжитесь с нами ,пожалуйста!

title: 早餐很簡單
text: 總體還不錯，離哪裡都不遠，交通也方便。有燒水壺和鍋碗，烤箱。電磁爐需要要求才給拿，因為廚區實在太小了，放了電磁爐，別的都要拿走。還好我只是簡單煮個面，要是正經做是伸展不開的。早餐很簡單，還好有熱的燕麥粥，要不這中國胃也是無法消受。

title: Great view, location and cost benefit
text: Extremely well located. Great views. Breakfast ok. Staff was super helpful. Will be back ! Close from Time Square and Central Park. Tallest hotel in america, even the gym has a view. Rooms are very huge for NYC. Worth the price.

title: AMAZING! SO IMPRESSED
text:
My husband and I arrived on the 27th December to celebrate a special occasion and booked the hotel for 8 nights to explore NYC, see shows, shop etc! 
The whole experience has been fantastic, we got upgraded to a room on the 53rd floor which had a view of Central Park, Times Sq and Hudson River. It was a corner room with spectacular views. The room was big enough for our cases and our shopping unlike most rooms in NYC hotels where you can barely move. The staff surprised us with some desserts and a bottle of bubbly one night which was very kind. On NYE we had an amazing view on times sq, we couldn’t see the ball but could see everything else!! We left the hotel at 7pm for a party otherwise we wouldn’t have enjoyed the fireworks from the room! 
Location is perfect, 5-10 mins to Times Square and some great bars right across the road if you fancy a drink. 
The breakfast was ok, I mainly had fruit and yoghurt as the cooked options didn’t look great but it wouldn’t put me off visiting again. 
Rooms are stocked with coffee, popcorn and tea and kitchen facilities included toaster, microwave, fridge freezer plates and cutlery!! 
This was our 3rd visit to NYC and this is by far the best hotel we’ve stayed at! 
5 stars to the front desk team, super friendly and helpful. 
Thank you for an incredible stay

title: Wedding and 50th birthday trip
text:
We booked this hotel to stay while our daughter was getting married in central park and my husband was celebrating his 50th birthday.
Check in was smooth and we got two lovely rooms on high floors.
Rooms were lovely , clean and more than
Everything you need.
Kitchen area had dishwasher, fridge and amenities.
Even had a microwave and popcorn to make in it.
Breakfast was enough to
Start your day.

Our room was cleaned daily and amenities stocked.

My husband got treats for his 50th birthday- cakes and bubbles.
Unfortunately there was a mix up and my daughter did not got any on her wedding day.
My daughters wedding day was beautiful in central park
And the hotel location was perfect for this 

Times square , restaurants are all within walking distance.
This is my 2nd stay in new york and i
Will stay at this hotel
When i come again.

Couple of restaurant recommendations

La masseria italian- excellent service 

K rico steakhouse/ wedding night meal
Excellent service, best steaks we have ever had.

If your thinking of getting married

Reverend annie lawrence is highly recomended.

title: Worth trying
text: Never stayed here before so decided to try it. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was spacious and well laid out. It was not to far from Times Square. The reception area was nice but the bedrooms could do with being renovated. It’s worth trying.

title: Super Location, guter Standard zu fairem Preis
text:
Das Hotel liegt zentral zwischen dem Broadway und der 6th Ave an der 54st. Von dort aus ist der Time Square innerhalb von wenigen Minuten zu erreichen. 
Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Die Zimmer sind sauber und geräumig und bieten einen tollen Ausblick. Ein Aufenthalt ist sehr wünschenswert!

title: One of our favorite hotels, but housekeeping staff needs improvement
text: We stayed at the hotel over Christmas week.   Always a great location.   Front desk staff helpful and friendly.   But, this year our room was not well maintained.   Drapery ripped (told the front desk).  No hang tag for the door to get our room cleaned (told the front desk twice -- never got one).  Bathroom was not cleaned very well.  Housekeeping didn't show up the next day (even after calling the front desk and leaving a message with the Concierge).    Finally at 10:30 pm a member of the evening staff brought us fresh towels and coffee.  We eventually hand wrote a note and taped to room door to have housekeeping come to our room.   Not sure where the communication gap was.   We have stayed at this hotel before, and this definitely was not the norm -- maybe the holiday staff was understaffed?   We were eligible for an upgrade and they never even offered it.

title: Michael at the front desk saved our lives!
text: This hotel saved our lives last week after a terrible check in experience at Novotel. Michael at the front desk felt so bad that he gave us free drinks. Thank you so much for being so helpful and caring! We will be back under better circumstances. Marriott NEVER disappoints!!!

title: Excellent Stay- Highly Recommend!
text: Thank you to the staff for making our stay excellent! I booked this hotel for a special night for my mother's 60th birthday and they went above and beyond accomodating us and making it feel special! We visited right after the Rockefeller Christmas Tree lighting Dec. 5th. Thank you Jamie for the extra touch with the surprise, delicious chocolate cupcakes & the popcorn for my mother. Our room was beautiful, clean, and had an incredible view. Small, but all NYC hotel rooms are and it was nicely appointed. Very quiet too! We were on the 58th floor corner unit. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC who wants a great location and a nice room. The breakfast was pretty good too the following morning and most "nicer" hotels in NYC do not include complimentary continental breakfast so that was a nice addition. Thanks for a great stay! -The Hardie's

title: Soggiorno da NewYorkese
text: Hotel in posizione strategica sulla Brodway, a 10 min. da Times Square e Central Park, fermate della metro a pochi passi... Stanze grandi e moderne con spettacolare vista su ogni lato della cittá sopratutto quelle angolari ai piani alti con grande vista su Times Square! Colazione compresa nel prezzo molto variata con dolce e salato; in piu un bar/caffetteria dove potersi rilassare e fare aperitivo. Terza volta a New York ma mai trovato un posto cosi bello come qui (stiamo scrivendo la recensione direttamente dalla nostra camera 6205)🤩

title: Sempre molto valido
text:
È la 3^ volta che utilizziamo questo hotel in occasione di viaggi a New York. La vista dalle camere alte (la nostra al 56^ piano) offre uno squarcio della città da mozzafiato. Ottima la colazione del mattino e la posizione strategica a ridosso di Times Square consente spostamenti a piedi in diverse direzioni. 
Consigliabile.

title: Not really a Residence Inn
text:
We recently stayed at this property. It is in an excellent location for touring. Convenient to Mid-town, broadway and all sorts of transportation. I am a Titanium level Marriott rewards member, so I have a lot of experience with Marriott. 
Our room had excellent views of both Times Square as well as the Hudson River. The room was very tight. It had a well equipped kitchen. The bathroom was adequate, although the shower valve was very difficult to operate.
My main complaint and the reason I say this isn’t a real Residence Inn is due to the lack of any complimentary food at happy hour. The typical Residence Inn has a nice selection of food available at happy hour Monday thru Thurs. It is usually so complete that it serves as dinner. This property didn’t even offer pretzels or nuts.

title: Great location and nice room
text: We stayed there for two nights. The room overlooked Times Square. The hotel was perfect walking distance to Radio City, Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle, Broadway, Central Park and Tavern on the Green. The shower was amazing and had great water pressure. Our room was very clean and decorated nicely. The free breakfast was pretty good and had a lot of healthy options. The gym was awesome and had a nice variety of fitness equipment- they even had spin bikes!!

title: Won't go back
text: Stayed one night and was disappointed with the room. Lacking toiletries, no shower cap, slippers etc. , had to call for tv remote, sink clogged up,  had to fix toxic perfume smell and the bed had no comforter, just sheets! Really and to top it off had to pay 50. for breakfast for 2, the only option offered.  This is my 3rd stay here and it definitely went down hill. When checking out they did not ask how I liked the stay, no surprise. Marriott I think you could do better!!

title: Clean, Compact and Extremely Quiet
text:
This was my first visit to this hotel and, unfortunately, I didn’t get the view that I had hoped from looking at some of the pictures, but I still loved the hotel. I arrived very early, about 10AM on a Saturday morning after a sold out Friday night, and my room wasn’t ready, but by the time I had breakfast, it was, which was quite impressive. Rooms are compact, which is typical in NYC, but clean, bright and very tastefully decorated. I was particularly impressed with how quiet the hotel was, especially considering it’s location. I’ve stayed in some pretty high end hotels in New York where everything you can imagine was offered and at your beck and call, except a good nights sleep because of the noise level outside. Over and above everything else, when I’m away from home, a good night’s sleep is what I value most and, from that perspective, this hotel was absolutely top notch.

Every employee I encountered during my stay was extremely pleasant and helpful. Hotel is just a couple blocks away from a subway station and within walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, Times Square and most attractions in Manhattan. Will definitely stay again in hopes, next time, of getting that corner room or Times Square view that I was hoping for this time!

title: Quality accommodation, location and conveniences
text: We are currently staying at this great hotel.  Thanks for making our stay so far so great.  Room is comfy with great amenities, hot and roomy showers, comfy bed and lots of pillows.  Very clean with great housekeeping. Conveniences in having a drawer refrigerator and dishwasher also microwave just add to the comfort room experience.  Its location is so great for sightseeing with lots of great restaurants, shops and subway stations nearby to take you everywhere.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Guest laundry, great gym well used by guests, complimentary breakfast, a great level 4 lounge with bar and Starbucks just makes this place the best to stay in NYC.  We have stayed in the area on previous visits nearby but the Residence Inn hotel is so much better for all of the above reasons.  Thanks for giving us a great experience so far.  If you want a great hotel experience stay at this hotel.

title: Beautiful views and great hotel!
text:
We had our own personal observation deck on our Times Square Grand view room.  The view was clear to the center of Times Square and we could also see the surrounding building and to the Hudson. We enjoyed lounging in the room and taking in the views.

Elevators were fast and one did get stuck while we were there because they are only designed to fit 6-8 adults but 11 people piled into one despite the elevator stating it was full.  People refuse to listen.  Not the Hotels fault!

Breakfast was included, several subway stations were nearby and we walked everywhere (Rockefeller, Radio City, Times Square, Central Park, Broadway Theaters). Highly Recommend!

title: Amazing view! Lovely hotel
text: We stayed in a Studio, Grand Times Square view on the 58th floor, the view was incredible! We could see times square but also had a view of the Hudson river which had an amazing sunset. This hotel is in a perfect location it takes around 15 minutes to walk to times square and you are in a fab location to get to central park and most of the sights. The reception staff were very polite and helpful and the room was cleaned daily whilst we were out exploring the city. The only thing I would note is that you cannot check in any earlier than 4pm which wasn't ideal when you have been travelling all day. But you can leave your suitcases with the doormen if you want to go explore the city until you can check in. I would and have been recommending this hotel to others. We would love to stay again.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text:
Need a hotel smack bang in the middle of the action in NYC? This is it! Fall out the door and into a show, time square or the subway... it’s just easy! 
Bedrooms are comfortable, quiet and cosy. Breakfast provides a nice selection of freshly cooked food to get you ready for your busy day..
Staff are friendly and accommodated my wife’s 50th birthday with a surprise cake and drinks on them. Nice touch 😊

title: 4th stay and still love it
text: After a disastrous one night stay at another hotel we checked out and changed back to the Residence inn . We have now stayed twice in the Courtyard on the lower floors and this is the second time at the Residence. Love this hotel , great staff and  rooms are always clean and tidy. Residence inn rooms are above the Courtyard and have the best views in the city , each room has a kitchen area which is great to prepare your own drinks or food . Location is fantastic , Times Square one way and Central Park to the other . Everywhere easily accessible on foot .Will continue to stay here for further visits ... can’t recommend this hotel enough to future guests.

title: very high, very expensive - a bit disappointed
text:
we paid the most money we have ever spent for three nights here on the 58th floor (£400 per night B&B).  The view was spectacular but not really as described. We expected to see Time Square but this was only visible looking back at an angle and there was very little to see (see photos), but the view of Hell's Kitchen and across the Hudson to New Jersey was spectacular.
The room was small as I had feared; the bed seemed very high which gave the illusion of filling the room. Little space to move although the bathroom was good and the kitchenette included a dishwasher & fridge but not a hob.
The buffet breakfast was fine but there is no restaurant. The bar was very expensive $25 for one beer and a glass of wine.
The decor was modern and the lift very fast but the corridor from the lift to the room was very dark with weird 'decoration' (see photo).
Staff were very helpful hence the 'good' score but on our last morning we took refuge in the lounge due to heavy rain and the ceiling started falling down due to water leak!

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: We stayed one night at the hotel and would select it again in the future. We enjoyed our view of the city and the Hudson River from the 40th floor, and loved our comfortable bed. Though we didn't used the kitchen, we appreciated the additional countertop space. The location is excellent. We had an easy check-in, and even got a room early so we could get to a matinee. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect Location
text:
I recently stayed at the Residence Inn for five nights, and was truly impressed with both the location and the staff.  We arrived in the early evening, and our room was ready when we checked in.  The front desk staff was efficient and polite, and really went out of their way to make us feel at home, especially Nicole and Kimberley.  The room itself was spacious for New York standards, and the kitchenette was perfect.   The breakfast was good and plentiful, and the seating for breakfast was very nice.  The only “low” on our visit was that we booked a Gray Line Hop-On-Hop-Off tour (at a cost of $94.40 US for two) with the woman (Shanel) in the Marriott lobby tour booth.  She told us that the buses ran every 15 to 20 minutes, but unfortunately this was not true.  After waiting for over 40 minutes at three of the stops in the freezing cold and wind, we gave up.  This is an expensive price to pay to go from the hotel to the Met to the Roosevelt Centre.    When we approached the booth the next day with our concern, another woman was manning the booth and she basically just directed us to the customer service line, which isn’t helpful at all.   While I realize this isn’t the hotel’s issue and it’s a separate company I feel that they and other travelers should be aware of this as it could negatively affect the Marriott brand and this particular property.
Other than that, our trip was great and I will certainly stay at this hotel again.

title: Completely average
text: Bonvoy Titanium Elite. Very lovely welcome by the helpful front desk staff. Decent continental breakfast downstairs isn’t bad. Room was on the very top floor (65). The building sways a bit as it’s a skyscraper and there is definitely noise at that level. The room shades also don’t really get the room as dark as you’d hope for. Some noise too. Not a bad hotel for the price but very average overall.

title: Nice building - nice price
text:
Considering the location and the price, this hotel has to be rated fairly. It can’t compete with the Marriott Marquis a couple of meters down the street, but it is nice. Has good rooms and an amazing view.

The breakfast is typical American, but it was free for me, so no complaints.

I will definitely come back here.

title: Excellent and first-class service
text:
The moment you enter the front door, you are greeted with a very warm and friendly team from the concierge (Eric, Orlando and the other guys etc) and they are very attentive and they are very engaging. And when you check in at the front desk, this group (Alla) made the extra effort to ensure you have all the information needed to get you settled in your room comfortably.
They are just part of the reasons why I choose to stay at the Residence Inn/Courtyard Central Park, every time I am in NYC.
Of course, the sales coordinator, Clara Cruz made it easier for me to get my rooms and she will go the extra mile to make my stay extra special. 

Thank you

title: Location was amazing!
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights in late October. The BEST part about this hotel is the location. It is SO close to everything. Short walk to Central Park in on direction, short walk to Times Square in the other. There are several subways stops nearby so it was never hard finding a route - but we really only needed to use it when we went downtown (9/11 museum, Battery Park for Statue of  Liberty tour). It was also only a 20 minute lovely walk through Central Park to/from the Met. 

The room itself was nice. For NY standards, it was probably considered large...but it was still much smaller than a normal hotel room in any other city. So adjust your expectations accordingly :)

It was really great to have the free breakfast available every morning. The food was so-so. Eggs, turkey sausage, breakfast potatoes, toast, bagels, cereal, deli meats/cheeses, pastries, fruit, coffee, water, juice. The only thing that seemed to change each day was the pastry selection, other than that it was pretty much consistent. Again, not a culinary experience, but it was helpful not to have to go find a breakfast place each morning. The dining room was also very pretty.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Report about my missing headphones in the residence inn.
text:
I was at the residence inn by mariot on holiday about three weeks ago. My stay in New York City was very nice just like the hotel. The only thing to criticize is the cleanliness of the tables at breakfast. 

On the day of departure we cleaned up our hotel room and went to the reception with all our things and asked the employees to put our suitcases and bags on the side, because we still had about 5 hours until our flight back home flew off. We explored the wonderful city of New York in the last 3 hours we had left. When we came back our taxi was ready to take us to the airport. We packed our luggage in the trunk and got in. After about ten minutes I noticed that my headphones were no longer in the bag I put them in four hours before.
Arriving at the airport I immediately called the hotel and reported my problem that my headphones were no longer there. They immediately asked for my e-mail and I gave them a description of my headphones.
When I arrived home I received an email from the hotel with a message that my headphones had been found. I was happy and asked them to send it to me. They sent me a link to the website Ileftmystuff.com. I filled out the forms on the website. When I finished, the price for getting my headphones back was $160. This price is much too high and I wrote it to the hotel. I asked the hotel to send me the headphones via UPS, which is between $20 and $30. The hotel agreed and asked for my exact address and phone number. I sent them my exact address and phone number and looked forward to having my headphones back. But I didn't get any feedback about my headphones for about three weeks.

title: Il cielo nella stanza, a New York!
text:
Dopo tanta ricerca, abbiamo optato per Hotel Residence Inn Central Palace, New York, 1717 Broadway. Posizione eccellente (100 metri da Times Square, vicino al Central Park) per muoversi a piedi nella zona di maggiori attrazioni e vicino a metropolitana per spostarsi più lontano. 
Abbiamo scelto le camere con cucinetta (tipo monolocale), piccola ma super attrezzata, con tutto (stoviglie, pentole, frigo, lavastoviglie, microonde..). 
Infatti abbiamo cucinato in camera 3 sere su 7, considerando il freddo a NY, soprattutto la sera a febbraio e il prezzo dei ristoranti!
Stanza piccola ma con vista MOZZAFIATO: eravamo al 53o piano! Avevamo NY ai nostri piedi in qualsiasi ora del giorno e della notte. Quante foto!!! 
C'È la colazione inclusa nel prezzo, cosa non scontata a NY: colazione a buffet. C'è di tutto, pure troppo. 
Reception 24 ore su 24.

Non a buon mercato ovviamente, ma a febbraio, periodo di bassa stagione, il prezzo è accessibile. 

Se andate a febbraio a NY copritevi molto bene...! Ma New York è sempre New York!

title: One week in NYC
text: We spent a week at the Residence Inn and loved it. The hotel was a delight to come back to each evening to rest our legs after a long day walking round the city! The rooms were clean, comfy and stylish. Breakfast was delicious and kept us going until mid afternoon. It was a prime location to do the majority of the tourist sights in New York! The staff were friendly and professional. We had a brilliant stay and would definitely return.

title: Tolles Hotel im Zentrum
text: alle Zimmer in oberen Stockwerken (darunter sind die Zimmer vom Courtyard), schöne Aussicht, bequemes schönes Zimmer, sehr gutes Frühstücksbuffet, perfekte Lage zum Central Park und zum Times Square und auch zu den Broadway-Theatern

title: SEJOUR AGREABLE ET MARQUANT
text:
1 semaine agréable et dépaysante en famille dans cet établissement "Apart Hôtel". Résidence en plein coeur de New York, très bien situé, proche de tout ; broadway, 5ème avenue, central park, Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockfeller Center, etc. Belle vue de notre chambre sur le quartier et tous les buildings !
Personnel très professionnel aux soins pour ses clients avec en plus un service de groom, concierge, centre fitness, etc.
Nous reviendrons dans cet établisssement pour un prochain voyage

title: Excellent stay!
text:
Location, location, location! Can’t beat this spot. The view from our room on the 44th floor was spectacular! I did get a little motion sick each time I rode the elevator which was a weird feeling for me. Room comes equipped with a full kitchenette with pots, pans, toaster, coffee pot, tea pot, plates, cups, crock pot, dishwasher, microwave, fridge, freezer, but no stove or oven so I’m not sure why you would need all the pots and pans. That was strange. Anyway, we never prepared anything in the room because we were eating out for every meal in one of the best food cities in the world!
I traveled there with my mother who is ill and currently on chemo. I had asked for a pack of bottled water to be in our room and was originally told no by the concierge. However, when I mentioned it at check-in they were very apologetic that I was told no to such a simple request for a special circumstance. When we returned to our room that night after dinner, we found three “I ❤️ NY” mugs filled with black and white cookies AND bottled water and a sweet note from Jamie. What amazing service!!! Breakfast was free and the standard fare. One morning we decided to eat egg sandwiches from the corner deli, BUT the breakfast buffet has deli meat/cheese and bread so we made sandwiches and wrapped them in paper towels and took them to eat in Central Park on a beautiful fall day! What a great idea on the sandwich stuff! Everything at this property was perfect for our trip to NYC. Will definitely stay here next time we come back.

title: Our go to hotel in NYC!!
text:
Our recent 8 night stay would be our 4th stay at the Residence Inn Central Park. While we were hoping to have a room on a higher floor, we got the 41st Floor, with rooms over looking the park. We had a couple of minor issues this trip but nothing serious. The fridge/freezer had to be changed and the cupboards had a habit of popping open, resulting in bruising our legs. The staff are always very helpful and quickly fix any issues. 

We love the location.  Around 4 blocks from Central Park and Whole Foods. Plus about 15 minutes walk from Lincoln Center and Times Square. Very close to our favorite restaurants like Basa 56, the Irish Pub, Vice Versa etc. It's also across the street from the new Nordstrom.

We will certainly be back again soon!

title: Neat hitel
text: Stayed here for a week in October with my wife. As it’s NYC, location is the most important thing. This hotel has it; midtown and a couple of blocks back from the park, walking distance from Times Sq but far enough from the tourist masses. Rooms are perfect, obv small as it’s NYC. Tall building so views are great tho. Staff lovely and couldn’t do enough to make our stay perfect. They left a few little birthday cupcakes in our room for us. Class touch. You can’t go wrong with this place. R&E

title: High expectations, failure on delivery....
text:
I had high expectations for this property considering that it is one of the highest rated Marriott properties in NYC.  Unfortunately, from beginning to end the staff was a complete failure and did not make my stay enjoyable.

Knowing how busy hotels in NYC are, I purposely waited until 4pm to check-in to the hotel (keeping myself busy wandering around the city).  Upon arrival, the large lobby was busy and there was a line but to the staff's credit, within minutes more staff appeared and I was directed to a young man for assistance.  

That's where the problems all began-----he first couldn't find my reservation as he looked at the Courtyard side first.  When he finally found it, he began telling me something about giving me 1k points and moving me----I finally figured out that he was saying that the Res. Inn was busy with U.N. visitors (despite my trying to come in 4 days before the U.N. start, I guess they were saying it was busy already) and that he wanted to transfer me to the Courtyard and give me 1k points for the inconvenience.  
Fine, except that he spent 10 minutes going back to the office to finally figure out that my reservation didn't allow that.  Then he said that there were no rooms ready yet (check-in is at 4 isn't it????) and asked for my contact number so he could call me when it was ready.  Despite my repeating my number 3 times, he kept writing down the wrong number!  

I headed out and after 90 minutes contacted the hotel via the Marriott app's chat feature  upon which they told me that my room was finally ready.  I was about 30 minutes away but when I arrived, I stood in line and was told by a young woman that she was going to find me a room (she apologized for the delay and promised me 1.5k more points which of course, I never received!).  I was really confused since they had told me the room was ready, yet when I arrived it suddenly wasn't again!!????  And then she proceeded to tell me that she was going to "upgrade" me to a LOWER floor.   How does that work if the hotel is known for it's views from the higher floors???

As for the room, it is small and most comfortable for 1 person.  It's not a full Residence Inn as it does not have any equipment for cooking other than a microwave but maybe that's a NYC regulation.  For a relatively newer property, the furniture and floors were already showing damage and need of repair.  As for my "upgrade" I received a southern view of Manhattan with a peek-a-boo view of the Hudson.  The elevators are small and there can be a wait but I didn't find the wait excessive as at some other properties (e.g. Element NYC).

Breakfast in the lounge was chaotic (too many people cutting in lines) and for me, not edible.  I've been to many Residence Inn's and I know that I'm not receiving a gourmet breakfast but this one was just not edible (I think they do actually use powdered eggs here).

Upon check-out, there was an issue with my bill which while quickly addressed came with a side of attitude (the woman told me that "she moved it somewhere else as I was supposed to tell them beforehand:).  I'm a loyal Marriott member and was looking forward to my stay here but based on this and my experience at the Hilton Garden Inn next door, I would most definitely stay at the Hilton Garden Inn instead!

title: Great location
text:
My wife and I stayed here on a trip to see some Broadway musicals.  The hotel says they are the tallest  hotel in NYC.  They may be right because we were on the 51st floor.  The hotel is a combination Marriott Courtyard and Residence Inn.  The Courtyard is on the lower floors.
The hotel is modern and the rooms clean.  We had a king room with city views.  Like most rooms in NYC, the room was a little small but it was still comfortable. The kitchen area had a microwave, dishwasher, small frig and freezer, coffee maker, toaster and kitchenware.  There was no stove or cooktop.
Breakfast was typical of a Residence Inn.  The staff did a good job of keeping refilling the offerings.  The hotel also has a Starbucks cafe that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner (more bar type food).
There are several subway stops within blocks of the hotel, Central Park is just several blocks away and it was an easy walk to the Broadway musicals on 45th and 47th streets.
I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good location
text:
Nice modern hotel very close to Central Park and Broadway.
Nice Breakfast included. Subway station also very close. 
Staff very accommodating. We picked up dinner at Whole Foods , Columbus Circle and microwaved it in the room.

title: Tallest Hotel in New York.
text: King size studio apartment on 39th floor with amazing city views.Breakfast was good,you could sit & watch life in New York through surrounding floor  ceiling windows,or sit in comfortable armchairs with tables situated on 5th floor.Very secure entry at reception,speedy elevators after the fifth floor.

title: Excellent Location
text: This hotel is right on broadway and hardly 10 minutes walk to the TIMES Square.Great breakfast area and spread as well. It is a very central location. Has a great view of the city form the rooms especially in the evenings with the lights on

title: Vista super!
text:
Bel hotel, Camere spaziose. La vista dalla camera al 55o piano era mozzafiato. È molto comodo il fatto di avere la cucinetta dotata di ciò che serve. Il bagno è dotato di doccia soffione e doccetta, ed è una rarità negli states.
Molto pulito.
La colazione è notevole, soprattutto per chi preferisce mangiare dolce la mattina, non ho mai trovato code per fare i waffle.
Personale cordiale. Deposito bagagli al check in e al check out più che funzionale. Buona la posizione, a qualche passo dal Columbus circle e central park, direttamente sul viale di broadway.

title: Erstklassig!
text: Das Zimmer war ein Traum - große Panoramafenster, direkter Blick auf den Central Park vom 57. Stock aus. Das Zimmer selbst war sehr schön, komplett mit moderner Küche ausgestattet - nicht nur Kaffeemaschine etc. sondern vom Gefrierschrank über Mikrowelle und Geschirrspüler... was wir ja eigentlich gar nicht gebraucht hätten. Das Personal war sehr freundlich, Frühstück haben wir nicht dort eingenommen, kann ich nicht beurteilen. Aber die Bar/Lounge war auch sehr schön und gemütlich. Und die Lage ist einfach perfekt!

title: Great Stay with Phenomenal Views
text: Room had a great view of the river and city.  Quite impressive at night. Close to everything, Times Square, Broadway shows, Central Park etc.  Staff very friendly and helpful from check in to check out.  Breakfast was adequate, did not encounter long lines at breakfast and was able to eat at one of the available tables.

title: Great Potential:  Location and view are tops.  Too bad they are letting it get worn out.
text:
Hmm.  This place has a great location and great views.  It really has immense potential.  The thing that holds it back is the maintenance.  They just aren’t taking care of things well.  Best example is the shower and bathroom.  Huge amounts of soap scum and mold.  See my pics.  Pretty gross.  Shoddy half-done fixes to valances.  

I’m staying here now and I want to ask for a room change, but don’t want to be that guy.

Early check in was cool, we got here at 1130 am and they had a room for us on the 63rd floor with a city view.  They acknowledged I’m a gold member which is nice.

title: Birthday surprise
text:
Just returned from our stay in New York! 

I booked this hotel has a surprise birthday present for my partner, and it did not disappoint! From the point of arrival we were greeted by friendly staff who were more than happy to help. I had emailed the hotel a few weeks before to say this was a surprise birthday present and they were very kind to leave some cakes, and Prosecco! thank you so much Jamie!  The rooms are quite big and have a small kitchenette with everything you’d need should you use it. The breakfast buffet is basic, but also pretty filling - only thing is the area itself is small so it felt like chaos sometimes. The location of the hotel is in walking distance of pretty much everything! We were lucky to have warm weather on our trip as well. 

Our flight home was late in the evening, but they kept hold of our luggage for the day, so that was one less thing to worry about. 

We really enjoyed our stay, and it added to our experience of New York City!

title: Luogo ideale
text: Un' ottimo hotel vicinisssimo a Times Square. Le stanze sono confortevoli ma non molto spaziose con i letti piccoli, considerando che a NY si passa poco tempo in stanza non è stato un problema. La stanza era al 65 piano con la finestra che dominava quella parte di Manhattan. Colazione buona ma non molto varia. Qualche problema sulla cauzione che è stata rilasciata dopo alcuni giorni e sulle bottiglie d'acqua addebitate anche se non bevute. Lo consiglio vivamente.

title: Wonderful stay - gorgeous views
text: Hotel was surprisingly great.   This was a points stay - I’m gold.  We were upgraded to a corner room with panoramic views from Central Park to Times Square to the Hudson.  Floor to ceiling windows.   Nice little kitchenette.  Good breakfast.    Only negative is that the bathroom has a bit of a mildew problem.  You can see the moisture buildup on the mirror on the outside of the bathroom.   Would I stay again? - yes.   Would I pay the suggested $500+/night.   Probably not.

title: Lights out stay!!!!
text:
If you’re in this area this is the place to stay. Clean new hotel with sick views of the city. Booked on hotel tonight for a reasonable rate. Staff was amazing from the first second I walked in. Thank you Michael, Joseph, and
Nicole. Appreciate your hospitality and knowledge of the area.

title: Views lived up to the hype!
text:
Staff was excellence during our 3 day stay. The views from our 64th floor Times Square room were breathtaking. So good we decided to save our time and money and not even attend Top of the Rock or the Empire State Building view decks. After our visit I learned it is the tallest hotel in North America!

Yes the room is a little small but with the floor to ceiling windows and that view who cares. In general NYC hotel rooms are typically smaller so that’s kind of to be expected.

The breakfast buffet was great as well!

We loved the short walk to Times Square and Central Park.

If and when we visit NYC again we will be staying here again!

title: Cuidar detalles
text: Es un hotel completo , con buenos servicios, wifi aceptable y buen desayuno. La sala de los desayunos es realmente chula. Atención del personal correcta. Lo que no puedo entender es que un cliente que va a estar nada menos que 9 noche seguidas en el hotel, se le dé una habitación con ruidos de ascensor, sin vistas ni a Central Park ni a Times Sq y con mal funcionamiento en la temperatura de los grifos del baño. Una lástima, buena opción en principio pero no volveré.

title: Phenomenal view
text: Nice hotel.  The floors had a small foot print, but everything was well appointed, with resort style amenities such as microwave and fridge.  Excellent staff, very friendly and knowledgeable.  The complimentary breakfast was great quality.

title: Красивые виды
text: Отель имеет очень хорошее расположение, везде можно дойти пешком, а если нет, то метро рядом. Очень приветливый персонал на рецепции, заселение прошло быстро и без проблем. Сам номер небольшой и достаточно шумный из-за климатической установки , который периодически шумел как самолёт)) Интернет летает, тапочки халаты отсутствуют, зато есть миникухня, чай кофе всегда можно попить, а также бесплатный завтрак. Сам завтрак вроде как не очень, но голодными не останетесь , каждый найдет себе , что поесть. Ну а виды , какие виды открываются из окон, особенно с высоких этажей! В общем особых недостатков не нашёл, отель не супер , но и неплох вполне можно рекомендовать.

title: Bellissimo Hotel
text:
Alloggiato qui dal 15 al 18 maggio. Camera al 63° piano con vista mozzafiato su Times Square e sul Fiume Hudson. Ottime rifiniture della stanza. Mobili curati e ben tenuti. Letto comodo. Bagno ordinato e funzionale. L'hotel prevede colazione a buffet, con buona scelta di cibi e bevande. Prezzo nella media per la città e la zona.
Ottima scelta se si vuole alloggiare vicino Times Square

title: Quarto 5203
text: Nossa terceira vez que nos hospedamos no Residence Inn e, como sempre, adoramos. Assim que chegamos, lá pelas 10:00hs, a recepcionista lberou o quarto, o que foi uma felicidade! Ficamos no quarto Estudio cama King Size. com janela simples, mas tivemos a sorte de ter um vistão.

title: Magnificence in Midtown
text:
One of my favorite hotels in NYC. The location was perfect -- close to my conference location as well as so many iconic New York locations. The Ed Sullivan Theater (where The Late Night Show is taped) is literally right around the corner. Central Park is a comfortable walk away -- it's nice to be in the heart of the city, but still so close to such a nice urban getaway.

The check-in lines can be long during peak hours, but the staff manages things well. Daniel is not only an impressive multi-tasker; he is friendly and efficient as well.

The gym on the 35th floor is solid, and the complimentary hot breakfast on weekends is a nice bonus. 5 stars across the board!

title: Apenas a localização é boa
text:
Fiquei 9 noites nesse hotel, tem excelente localização , perto dos pontos turísticos , porém o quarto em si , detestei , começando que meu quarto não havia box e sim cortina , sendo que ao reservar pelo Booking.com as fotos eram diferentes do quarto em que fiquei . Na hora do banho , tinha que ficar me preocupando se o banheiro estava alagado e realmente estava, o chuveiro molha todo o chão e por ser cortina e não box , não protege nada .
Roupas de cama e banho muito desgastadas, colchão e travesseiro que me causaram dores nas costas e torcicolo .
A limpeza é bem razoável , apenas secam a “lagoa” no banheiro, retiram o lixo e arrumam a cama , não tiraram o pó dos móveis nenhum dos dias que lá estive .
Não há apoio para as malas , ficam no chão , eu que  fiquei com dor nas costas pela as noites mal dormidas , tinha que ficar me abaixando toda hora . 
Pelo valor cobrado, que não é nada barato, fiquei bem decepcionada.
Não gostei , não recomendo e não volto, há outras opções no entorno bem melhores.

title: Tolle Lage
text:
Wir hatten eine angenehme Zeit hier, natürlich nutzt man das Hotel nicht viel. Die für mich wichtigsten Punkte hat dieses Hotel erfüllt.... sauber und ausreichend Platz im Zimmer. 
Das Frühstück ist für uns Europäer vielleicht nicht der Kracher, aber für den schnellen Start in die Stadt absolut ausreichend, selbst der Kaffee hat geschmeckt :) 
Die Aussicht aus den Zimmer ist spitze, vom Lärm der Großstadt ist nichts zu hören.

title: Hotel near Times Square & Central Park
text: Beautiful suite on the 59th floor with breathtaking views of the City! In between Times Square and Central Park and a view of the Hudson River not too far away. Employees are very helpful and polite. Comfortable bedding. So relaxing it’s hard to leave.

title: Perfetto!
text: Semplicemente perfetto! Location centralissima, ma allo stesso tempo tranquilla, svariate fermate metro nelle vicinanze, colazione molto buona, staff efficiente (soprattutto Daniel!), design particolare, monolocale funzionale con tutto il necessario, ed una vista pazzesca.

title: vergognoso
text: la stanza ha rispettato le aspettative: ampia pulita con  vista stupenda e zona cucinotto accessoriato. Questo era cio' che avevo prenotato e pagato in anticipo...cio' che non potevo immaginare e' che la struttura adducendo giustificazioni diverse fra loro mi hanno prelevato dalla carta di credito tutto il prezzo..le contestazioni fondate sui documenti in nostro possesso e anche provenienti dall'italia che dimostravano inequivocabilmente l'avvenuto pagamento sono state riconosciute fondate e veritiere ma nonostante cio' non hanno revocato il prelievo...dopo aver parlato con 5 persone e aver sentito giustificazioni contraddittorie, essere rimasti senza disponibilita' sulla carta di credito, essere stati ore a telefono ci siamo arresi...la spiegazione di tutto cio' e' che disconoscendo il pagamento fatto ben tre mesi prima tramite expedia l'albergo non ha pagato la commissione...in una parola sola VERGOGNOSO

title: Très mitigé
text: Nous avons réservé 2 studios et avons appeler pour demander d’être cote à cote ( 2 adultes et 3 enfants)et en étage élevé.. nous avons eu un étage pas très élevé et deux étages entre nous!! On nous a expliqué à l’arrivée qu’il n’y qu’un studio par étage ce qui nous a pas été précisé lors de notre appel.. finalement on nous a proposer une solution 4 jours après notre arrivée..bof bof ..la vue est top il est vrai.. pour le petit déjeuner c’est très moyen produit de base vraiment pas digne par rapport au prix de la chambre alors si en plus vous êtes un lève tard il faut jouer des coudes au buffet ! Je mettrai un carton rouge pour la propreté des chambres , pince à cheveux, petits détritus sous les lits etc..bref quand je les lis les commentaires laissés avant j’ai vraiment l’impression que nous avons séjourné dans un autre hôtel..nous ne reviendrons pas dans cet hôtel c’est sûr.

title: Amazing
text:
Très ravie de cet hôtel, l'un des plus haut d’Amérique du nord . 
Il est très bien situé, vous avez le métro, Times Square, Central Park et un centre commerciale à proximité. La vue est à coupé le souffle notamment si vous êtes situé en étage élevé.(65 eme étage) La chambre est spacieuse, propre avec une très bonne literie.
Le personnel de chambre est très courtois, le ménage est fait tous les jours avec rigueur.
Le seul bémol concerne le petit déjeuner, que vous le prenez à 8h ou à 9h très peu de choix, voir plus rien sur certains aliments.Bien évidement chacun ses goûts mais pour ma part ne pas avoir de lait chaud, de la confiture, du beurre autre que demi sel et des couverts car jamais de couteaux disponibles est un min pour un hôtel qui propose une petit déjeuner dit continental . Le personnel de ce lieu est quant à lui malheureusement pas très courtois et souriant. En revanche, la salle est spacieuse, vitrée avec vue sur la ville. 

Malgré ce petit point que vous mettrez de côté et qui diffère selon le ressenti et l'opinion de chacun , c'est un hotel que je conseille vivement pour toutes personnes décidant de voyager à New York. Vous en serez ravie et pas déçu. Le personnel accueillant, vos bagages transportés et gardés en cas de besoin et une direction à l'écoute et prête à tout pour que votre séjour se passe dans les meilleurs conditions possibles.

title: Très bon hôtel, foncez.
text: J'y ai passé 10 jours. L'hôtel est très bien placé entre Time Square et Central Park. Accès métro nombreux. Chambre propre, juste un peu petite mais suffisante. Le petit déjeuner est copieux et le bar au 4ème étage permet de boire un verre "au calme" après une journée de marche à NYC.

title: Killer Views
text:
From your 60-something floor room, you can see Times Square, downtown and NJ. Pay a little more and you get to see Central Park.

Studios are miniature compared to Residence Inns on the road; however, NYC is a bit more contemporary and less formica-prone. You get a microwave not a stove, but who is going to cook here with 1,000 restaurants in walking distance? 

The breakfast buffet is standard Residence Inn, and very crowded. Be there at least 15 minutes before closing. 

The bar floor has a lot of seating and places to work with your laptop. The lobby is shared with Courtyard by Marriott which is on the lower floors.

title: Fantastic Stay!
text: Just returned from an amazing 4-day stay at the Residence Inn/ Central Park. We could not been happier with the location, overall quality, services, breakfast, and above all, the staff at this fantastic Marriott property. We'd like to specifically thank the front desk guest service agents Kimberly and Rebecca! They were more than accommodating in making sure that our reservation exceeded our expectations! Thanks again for this wonderful New York experience! We will return!

title: Great location and great breakfast
text: Visited NY with a friend in March.  This hotel is in a great location; easy walking distance to restaurants and major art museums. Can get very heavy traffic in front of hotel so catch cabs on the corner.

title: A great location and property in NYC
text: This hotel is ideally located between Times Square and Central Park, allowing easy access to the trains and many of the sights by foot. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The lobby is very nice and the service was great.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Had an Amazing stay last week at the hotel! We went on a mother/daughter trip for my birthday and stay in New York for 9 days! Our stay was so perfect! The view from our room 5802 was breathtaking! 

Each morning and evenings the staff always acknowledged us when we walked past the lobby.
We received hand written Thankyou notes from the cleaners when we left a tip. We called the front desk for an extra blanket and tea bags and they were sent up within 10 minutes. Room was so beautifully cleaned every day! 

Eric the door man was so fantastic, he was so helpful and nothing ever seemed like too much trouble! 

The hotel left a beautiful surprise in our room for my birthday- champagne and 4 birthday cupcakes! It was arranged by the guest services manager Jamie. 

I would never hesitate ever again to stay at a Marriott hotel due to how amazing our experience was at the Residence Inn. Thankyou again to the staff and hotel that made our holiday so unforgettable.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights in July.  It was in a great location - close to Central Park, theaters, subway stops, many restaurants.  The staff was very friendly on the phone and in person.  There are many extras - candy and popcorn in the room, bathrobes if you ask for them (which was really nice), a nice gym, kitchenette in the room.  Breakfast is great with many choices, and not many NYC hotels include breakfast.  I was worried the breakfast area would be crowded, but on weekdays it was not crowded at all.

We had a corner room on the 44th floor which had spectacular views.  We could see the river, Central Park, the glow of Times Square, and tons of buildings.

There was actually a lot of storage for an NYC size room - closet, bedside table with drawers, dresser drawers, and bathroom drawers.  It was really nice to have a fridge and freezer, microwave and even a small dishwasher.  There were some dishes and silverware, too.  I thought the kitchenette was a very efficient use of space.

I looked at many hotels in the area, but I think it was well worth the price to stay at such a nice place.

title: My Favorite NYC Marriott Property
text:
RI Central Park may be my favorite Marriott property in NYC. Of the 30+ Marriott (and former Starwood) Manhattan-area hotels, I have stayed in 10+ different properties (including the Marriott, Renaissance, Fairfield Inn, Courtyard, Residence Inn, SpringHill Suites, and Pulse brands). 

Why I love it:
1) Staff is fantastic. Despite servicing both Residence Inn and Courtyard guests (both hotels are in the same tower), front-desk employees and are always friendly, efficient, and proactive. 
2) Views are incredible - city views and park views from 35+ floors up
3) Kitchen convenience - microwave, mini fridge, sink, dishwasher. Now you can eat your pasta leftovers! 
4) Subway convenience - perfectly situated between multiple stations so you can easily get anywhere, uptown or downtown
5) Walkability - close to theatre district, Carnegie Hall, Columbus Circle, Rockefeller Center (yes, and Times Square)
6) Well-designed rooms - rooms are average in size by NYC standards, but there is plenty of storage: bedside tables, tall closet, console drawers, even bathroom drawers
7) Sleep quality - situated on the edge of the busiest tourist area but very little street noise
8) Free breakfast - oatmeal, waffles, eggs, potatoes, sausage, deli meats and cheese, fruit, yogurt, bagels and pastries (usually, ample seating, as well)

A few negatives (to be objective): 
1) The main negative is the wait for the elevators. When you're up so high, taking the stairs is not practical. Plan accordingly at breakfast and check-out times. 
2) Most rooms have 1 king bed with occupancy for 2 guests (only a few doubles), so tricky if you're traveling with children. 
3) Based on the popularity of this hotel, availability can be low and rates can be high. Book in advance and consider using your Bonvoy points! 

During our recent stay with our teenaged children, Mathura ensured that we could get two rooms on the same floor--not an easy feat in the sold-out summer. But she made notes in the computer prior to our stay and even provided an update upon check-in (as she happened to be working at the time). We were in NYC during the July power outage, and staff handled the situation very proactively. They offered bottled water to people congregating in the lobby (initially, elevators weren't operating and obviously AC was not working), provided plenty of overhead announcements, and gave away snacks in the restaurant. Nicole did a fabulous job of calming and informing guests about the situation. Michael volunteered to check on one of our children who was stranded in our room (i.e., the generator hadn't kicked in yet, so no elevator access). We felt safe and reassured during these few hours of uncertainty. These are the moments you hope your hotel staff will shine! Bravo, RI Central Park staff!

title: Amazing indeed!
text: We got upgraded to the Times Square view room! The rooms were absolutely amazing. Location was great too as it was right smack in the middle of Midtown Manhattan. I would stay here if I’m here in NYC again!

title: Good hotel, unbeatable location
text:
Excellent location on street 54, which is midway between Central park and Times square, so you are in easy walking distance of both sides. Good breakfast but gets crowded during the last hour and items begin to run out. Friendly staff.

Some minor quibbles - one can hear doors slamming shut through the night. Rooms are tiny but that is typical of Manhattan. There is no place to open luggage. Lots of space is wasted in providing a full kitchennette which would've been more useful as room space.

title: Absolute stunning
text: Absolutely loved this hotel - I stayed 5 nights with my two teenagers, the views on 45th floor - as probably all the floors was amazing. Never had to wait long for elevators, the staff were extremely helpful - housekeeping service fantastic and the free breakfast was fabulous. Excellent location - walking distance to Rockerfeller building, Times Square, Central Park and nearest subway a 2 minute walk. THe 24 hour gym was also a hit with my son

title: Buena ubicacion, muy regular hotel.
text: Nos gusta mucho la cadena Residence Inn por la comodidad de la cocina, sin embargo en esta ubicación no nos sentimos comodos. La habitación demasiado chica e incomoda, la cocina, sin comentarios y la vista que ofrecen a Central Park es un engaño.

title: Great hotel with great location.
text:
Stayed with Residence Inn for a week and this hotel was everything. Stayed on the 37th floor with nice views of the Concrete Jungle. 

Great laundry service, was provided with free laundry powder. Can organise coins down at reception but there is also an awesome electronic machine where you can pay using your card and activating a washer or dryer from the machine.

Breakfast was great and complimentary to all guests with many hot options and cold. Waffle stations, pastries, fruit, eggs, bacon, sausages etc. 

Location is perfect for those visiting to see a Broadway Show or visiting NYC for the first time. Only a few blocks away from Central Park and Times Square you get the best of both worlds.

Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, great food truck on the corner of 54th and Broadway. Subway system only a few blocks away from the hotel.

On Saturday 13 July there was a massive power outage in the NYC district and special mention to all the staff who handled the situation so professionally and kept guests informed on what was happening. 

Will definitely be back in NY soon, and can definitely count that I will be staying at the Residence Inn.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Mr. Charles Weed,

I wanted to express my sincere gratitude and appreciation to you and your entire team of staff for your warm and kind welcome during my stay at the Residence Inn on Broadway from July 5th to the 9th. 

I am a Marriott Gold Elite member and  was initially visiting New York for a conference, but decided to extend my stay and stay a few extra days. While speaking to one of the gracious front desk agents,  Mathura Nagarula, I shared that m that my mother had just passed away right before I came out to New York, and after an evening out on Saturday night, I returned to my room where I found a beautiful and heartfelt handwritten condolence note and a lovely plate of chocolate chip cookies, with the entire team’s  condolences and well wishes. I was moved to tears and I just wanted to let you know just how special it was and how much it meant to me. Aa someone with many years of  working in retail myself, I understand the importance of appreciating customers and allowing them to feel valued and validated.  Please shower Mathura and your wonderful staff members with love and appreciation! I will also write a trip advisor review reflecting  my satisfaction and gratitude. 

Big Thanks,

Digby Leibovitz

title: Poor customer service
text:
We booked this hotel through Marriott agency for 3 nights, requesting two beds (me, my husband and a teenager kid). 

I did a mobile check-in early afternoon and got to the hotel around 6pm. The front desk lady told me that there was only one bed in the room and the room did't have sofa either. She acknowledged that the request for two beds and three guests were on the reservation, but there was no room with double beds available at that time. She also offered to call all other Marriott hotels nearby and they were all booked at that time. 

She and the other receptionist told me that the only choice I have is to pay for another room for one night. Then they will switch me to a two beds room the next day. 

As a long-term member with Marriot, I would think they should not let me pay for the second room, especially they have made the mistake. 

This is a nice hotel, in a nice location. But the customer service was not good.

title: MARRIOTT BONVOY ３５０００ポイントで宿泊！
text:
2019年6月の宿泊。ホテルの名前が長く覚えられませんが・・・・。宿泊費用が2人で591.87$でしたのでMARRIOTT BONVOYのポイントで宿泊することにしました。シェラトンニューヨークタイムズスクエアに２泊するつもりでしたがポイントでもデスティネーションアメニティ料金２５＄がかかってしまうので１泊はレジデンスにしました。こちらデスティネーションアメニティ料金がかかりません。ちなみにシェラトンもレジデンスも35000ポイントで宿泊できます。こちらのホテルは35階くらいまでがコートヤードニューヨークセントラルパークとなっており36階以上がレジデンスです。ポイントも同じ35000なのでレジデンスにしました。料金的にはコートヤードの方がリーズナブルです。フロントは１階でコートヤードとレジデンスが一緒です。
16時くらいの到着でスムーズにチェックインできました。笑顔の素敵な女性スタッフさんで英語できなくても親切丁寧でした。高層階60階でした。角部屋ですから景色は最高です。。。。が雨でしたので　　泣。１キングベット、バスタブ付きでしたが部屋は広くはありません、レジデンスなのでちょっとした台所があります。私たちは調理しないので使いませんでしたが。スーツケース２つは入り口のスペースに置きました。プラチナ特典でポイントOrマーケットと言われましたがよくわからないのでポイントにしました。朝食は無料でした。朝食の会場からの景色がとても最高です！天井までの窓が圧巻です。朝食のスクランブルエッグが卵豆腐を崩した感じの食感で残念。サラダ系はありません。果物はあります。朝食会場ではスーツを着た女性スタッフさんが1人1人声かけをされていまして・・・・英語の喋れないおばさん2人困りましたが、ニュアンス的には言われてることがなんとなくわかりました。あなたの今日のアイシャドウが素敵ね！私は昔資生堂に勤めていたのよ！でしたので私も今日のアイシャドウは資生堂なんです！と話しできました。
ホテルからは徒歩でタイムズスクエアや５番街に行けます。自転車レンタルでセントラルパークを散策したかったが雨なのでUberでメトロポリタン美術館巡りをしました。プラチナ特典のレイトチェックアウトも15時までして頂き次のホテルにスムーズに行くことができました。

title: Great Hotel and Really Helpful Staff
text:
We stayed here on the 50th floor.  At first we were concerned about the noise from the lift, as our room was behind it but we soon got used to it and managed to sleep.  It wasn’t in use all night. 

We had everything that we needed including a little kitchen area. The views were scarily amazing!   We had a double bed and a single bed and a desk and chair.  The room wasn’t massive but it was adequate for the 3 of us. 

The WiFi thankfully worked really well. 

The beds were high off the ground but comfortable and the air-con was a blessing,  (if a little noisy but aren’t they all), as it was really hot when we visited. 

The breakfast was really good. Lots of choice and no limit.  I’m really fussy about my coffee but the coffee was really nice.  In England I always put coffee mate and caramel syrup in my coffee and they had little tubs of coffee mate liquid which I had never seen before.  We filled up on breakfast, as we did lots of walking. 

I just want to say how great the staff were as our daughter was sick mid week.  They brought us extra bedding, extra towels, extra toilet paper, changed the beds several times and washed the bathroom floor.  Everything we asked for they provided us with even late at night.  Thank you so much.  It’s really hard when your child is ill in a hotel room but you helped us so much and made it easier to get through it.  She soon recovered and we continued our holiday.

title: Below average for the cost...
text: The staff was very friendly, however, the hotel fell short of my expectations for the remainder of the trip. I had to wait almost 15 minutes for an elevator when checking out on a Friday morning. The room was dirty, and the shower head was broken. The location, however, is ideal. The breakfast was probably the best part of my stay. There was a wide selection, and the dining area was very open. I will not choose to stay here when returning to Manhattan.

title: Great stay at a great location!
text: We walked from Grand Central Station to the Residence Inn with no problem.  Check in was absolutely smooth, having checked-in online the night before.  Our room requests were followed and we had a great room on a high floor with sweeping views of the city and the Hudson River.  The room was rather small but well equipped with lots of storage and amenities.  Sad that they nickel and dimed with the $7 bottles of water in the room - really??  A complimentary bottle of water or no bottle of water at all would have been much better.  The room and bathroom were clean.  The bed was so comfortable with crisp linens and cozy pillows.  With only a few rooms on each floor and so high up, it was completely quiet during our stay.  Breakfast was plentiful with many healthful items (contrary to reports in other reviews!) It was crowded during breakfast, but not impossible to navigate, choose what we wanted and find a seat.  All staff members were polite and friendly.  We checked our bags after our stay until our departure time with no problems.  Walk to Central Park was easy along with easy walks to subways and Times Square.  This is an ideal location and a great place to stay!

title: nice in every way
text:
super friendly staff, beautiful building, very well located, comfy bed and pillows, sparkly clean, love it!
our room was very nice, had a great view and a well utilized space, kitchenette conveniently equipped, enough space to feel comfortable , ours was on the 43th floor and the elevators were super fast, almost no time to wait inside or outside, there are 4 of them. At the lobby, a friendly staff is always prompt to help you. I would stay there again!!

title: Just perfect
text: We stayed here for 4 days/ 3 nights. We requested a high floor and were placed on the 61st floor, the views were breathtaking day and night. Facilities were great, clean and comfortable. There was a good choice of food for breakfast. Bar staff were friendly. Air conditioning and ice water in reception was very welcoming. We couldn’t fault this hotel at all, it made our stay in NYC very pleasant.

title: Great location!
text:
We stayed at Residence Inn for 7 days and the location was great! The staff was friendly, the room was clean but a bit on the small side (space is a luxury in New York). 
Breakfast was included but we decided not to use it after the first time because it wasn't the greatest or healthiest for us but if you're on a budget or you like the buffet style breakfast there's nothing wrong with it.
All in all it was a great hub for us.

title: Perfect hotel for theatre lovers and visitors
text:
We stayed at Residence Inn Marriott in central park to attend a conference and pleasure as well. The location is perfect for theatre goers it is in the middle of Broadway. It is only 2-3 minutes away from Time Square and 2-3  minutes to  Central Park. Our room has a view of central park. We took a shared shuttle from JFK which took almost 2 hours because of the usual traffic in the city and it was rush hour. The room is clean and beautiful with kitchen, dishwasher, and fridge; ideal for when you just want to self cater. There are convenience shops around.  All the staff are all friendly and helpful. Our room cleaning lady is lovely. There are plenty of options for the breakfast, includes cold and hot options. The breakfast lobby is so nice. being near Hell's Kitchen there plenty of trendy local bars and places to eat. The shopping area is only 5 minutes away from 5th Avenue.  
Marriott never fails me. They are always reliable and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel when you visit the city. I will stay not to visit the city unless I get availability to stay in this hotel.  I give them 5 stars out of 5.

title: Vale pela vista !!!
text:
Escolhi um quarto alto para ficar, mas tinha alguns problemas o quarto, barulho do ar condicionado, outro barulho de goteira e outro barulho de apito do aparelho, holder, do cartao magnetico, que apitava a cada 3 minutos. 
Ao chegar ao hotel, ja assustando com o atendimento impessoal, seco e grosseiro de NY, pensei que a recepcionista fosse pular do balcao e me dar uma voadora tamanha rispidez com que falava comigo, mas acabei achando engracado. O cafe da manha era bom, nada a poder reclamar.

title: A great place to stay!
text: Our wonderful holiday in NY was certainly enhanced by staying in this excellent, modern hotel. It is in a perfect location for access to so many NY sights and experiences. The staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. Our corner room on level 52 had extraordinary views. The included breakfast was a great bonus in a really modern dining space. The room was extremely comfortable with a well appointed kitchenette. It was my wife's birthday, and the hotel surprised us with a birthday cake in our room which was most appreciated. We would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Rainy View but wonderful
