text: Residence Inn is located just south of Central Park with great views of the Park and the City.  Great staff, extremely attentive and ready to be of assistance.  breakfast was fantastic with just about anything you could want. The room was spacious with great view.  Love it here! Great value!

title: Tolles Hotel/Super Lage
text: Ein tolles Hotel mit einer super Lage. Ich bin hier auf einen Kongress - habe nicht das Kongresshotel gewählt sondern das Residence Inn Central Park. Die Gründe liegen im freundlichen Personal, der tollen Lage,der sauberen Zimmer und einer super Aussicht. Wichtig Zimmer im oberen Bereich buchen; Checkin gewöhnungsbedürftig Frühstück nicht überwältigend aber zweckmäßig - zusammengefasst Preis/Leistung passt!

title: Loved this hotel!!
text: We stayed here for two nights on a weekend in mid-June. We arrived in the city early so I was just expecting to leave our suitcases and be on our way but was pleasantly surprised when we were told we could get in our room at 10:45am! The girl who checked us in was very friendly and informative. We went to our room which was a corner room on the 42nd floor. It was beautiful, clean and modern looking. We knew we wanted to get some cold drinks and snacks to bring back to the room so I looked for the fridge. I found it but unfortunately it was not working. We has seen housekeeping out in the hall so we went out to ask if there was something we were missing to turn it on. She looked but said she would call maintenance. We were not sure what to do as we couldn't stay and wait as we had reservations for the Circle Line Boat cruise. I suggested we head out and deal with it when we returned. Again, so pleasantly surprised when we returned to see it up and working! They had taken care of it while we were gone. The views were amazing and the location cannot be beat. I was concerned about getting a seat at breakfast since we went down on the later side but there were many and the selection was fantastic! I will definitely be looking to stay here my next trip to NYC.

title: Really nice stay
text:
Had four nights here and it was good.

Great rooms and not of the normal Residence Inn look and it was all the website showed so was pleasing to see that. Typical size room for NYC but heck it was still good.

On the 48th floor we had a city view and even with the storms we had it made for a great view in our case of the thunder lighting and fog ha.

Location is great easy walk to Central Park or Times Square or midtown thats for sure and a selection of MTA train stops handy as well which we used most days.

Room was clean and tidy and nice staff.

We choose to eat twice in the end at the fourth floor in house dinning bar and it was good hence we went back for the second night and yes the storms helped but it was nice food nice location as well.

Only major disappointment was the fact we had booked a town car for the airport for the departure day via the front desk and the front desk had booked it and confirmed with me but it turned out at 3:15am in fact it had not been booked and we did not have a ride for the airport. They were helpful in getting us a cab at that time of the day but it was bit of a let down thats for sure.

Hope to stay again on the next visit.

title: Chambre au 64 ème étage !!!!
text:
Nous avions demandé une chambre dans les étages supérieures pour notre séjour de 8 nuits,nous avons eu une chambre au 64 ème étage avec vue sur Times Squares,époustouflant !
La chambre disposait d'un coin cuisine,très pratique.
Merci au concierge de nous avoir aidé pour la réservation de notre navette.  
Petit déjeuner très bien.
Petit bémol dommage dans un hôtel de cette classe de ne pas trouver du personnel parlant français ,mais personnel accueillant et très agréable.

title: EXCELLENT STAY! Great Hotel & Location
text:
My husband and I had a trip to NYC for the dates of June 10th to June 14th (part business - for him & pleasure for me)  We checked in with Michael at the front desk.  From the very beginning we were greeted with a smile & warm welcome.  We felt incredibly safe, heard, valued, & comfortable!  

Michael upgraded us to one of the top floor, corner room, king suites declaring it was the biggest room they had!  We were thrilled especially since it was our 20th wedding anniversary however Michael did the upgrade without even knowing about our celebration!  Then when we told him we had experienced something disheartening earlier in the day (which happened before ever arriving at this hotel) He asked how he could help & offered to give us something free from the Market (its like a small grocery area near the check in area)   Talk about GREAT service!!!!!

We checked in to room 6109 and were just blown away!  It was GORGEOUS with windows everywhere overlooking the Hudson River in the distance, Central park in the distance, & Broadway below.  The room had a refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, Dishwasher, plates, utensils, pots and pans - really anything you would need!  The bathroom was large, bright, & clean.  The furniture & décor was modern and sleek.  To say we were delighted was an understatement.  

Every time we left the hotel and returned Michael always said some kind of greeting to us whether it be - "Welcome back" , "did you have a great day" " Have a great day" etc.
 One night we stopped by the desk to say hi to Michael and he enthusiastically said - "now listen is there anything I can do for you guys - seriously please let me know"   
Loved him - he needs a raise or promotion or SOMETHING !!!!

HOTEL OVERVIEW: Lobby is clean, open, well laid out traffic flow with clear and concise directions regarding check in procedure.  Lobby furniture is a white leather consisting of mostly chairs.  The tile is a sleek black.  The elevators require a room key to activate them which allows you access to your floor.  
Breakfast is FREE every morning.  It is a hot breakfast with eggs, potatoes, sausage, fresh made waffles, oatmeal, cereals, muffins, bagels, an assortment of meats, cheeses, & fruit as well as fruit juices, teas, coffees.  It was wonderful!  
The hotel is centrally located with only a short walk to either Times Square, Central Park, & is located right on Broadway for all the great shows including Hamilton!!  
It has a nice restaurant, fitness center, & conference rooms.  

We HIGHLY recommend staying here!  NO QUESTION about it!

title: Great Location - Great Staff - Great Room - Great View
text:
Residence Inn (upper floors of building shared with Courtyard) sits conveniently between Times Square and Central Park.  

Lobby / Check In:  welcoming, friendly staff (especially Michael)

Room:  floors 35 to 65, with great views the higher you go (this is the tallest hotel in US as of this writing)

Breakfast:  nice buffet to start the day 

Value:  great value relative to other similarly priced options

I have no reservation in recommending this location to business travelers, vacationers, and families

title: Great hotel with great location...
text:
I booked three nights at the Courtyard, which is the first 30+ floors of this high rise. When we checked in they offered to upgrade me to the Residence Inn, which occupies the next 30+ floors. We accepted and it was great. 

The corner room was large by NYC standards and had great views of Central Park and the river in the distance. There was great storage options for a small room. 

The lobby is modern and every employee we dealt with was friendly and accommodating. 

The breakfast room on the third floor gets busy in the mornings, but the offerings are decent. 

The bar on the fourth floor is huge, with plenty of seating and places to just hang out. 

The best part is the location. Short walk to Central Park. Short walk to Times Square. Close to several subway lines. It’s easy to get everywhere from this spot. 

I hope to stay here next time I am in the city. It was a great experience that I would recommend to everyone!

title: Always a favorite
text:
So impressed by the front desk team at this hotel.  Always positive, efficient and somehow they seem to remember repeat guests making a big hotel feel more intimate.  

For a little more money, the residence inn has slightly bigger space and usually much faster elevators (though they were running quite slow this trip).  

Nice central location for easy access to midtown, west side and east side.  

Highly recommend.

title: Memorable Stay
text: Booked with Marriot points 35k :) and applied the platinum voucher upgrade for the central park view suit. The upgrade was worth, awasome view of Manhattan and central park. Right on Broadway and four min walk to times square. Amenities top notch and service excellent from entry to exit. This hotel will be in my list whenever I visit.

title: Un hôtel fantastique
text:
Nous sommes restés une semaine au Residence Inn de central park.

L'emplacement de l'hôtel est parfait, en plein coeur de Manhattan, 2 mins de Time Square mais en étant un tout petit peu en retrait et donc plus au calme.

Lors du check in, la personne qui nous a accueilli, (Joseph je crois!) a été d'une très grande gentillesse. Nous avons eu droit à une chambre au 63ème étage sur 65 avec vue panoramique sur l'Hudson et Time Square.
La propreté des chambre est impeccable et elles sont très bien équipées (frigo, micro-onde, bouilloire..) De notre côté, aucun soucis en ce qui concerne les bruits des frigos ou chauffage, nous n'avons rien entendu!
Le lit est très confortable et moelleux.

En ce qui concerne le petit déjeuner, mon dieu que certaines personnes peuvent être difficiles! Alors oui nous ne sommes pas en France donc vous ne trouverez pas de baguette de pain bien frais pour vos tartines. Mais nous sommes à New York et il est agréable  de découvrir de nouvelles choses. Vous serez comblés que ça soit au niveau du salé (œufs brouillés, pommes de terre sautées, jambon, tomates, fromage, saucisses...) qu'au niveau sucré (pain de mie épais et moelleux, pain à muffins, mini muffins ou croissants, gaufres à faire vous même, et possibilité de demander des ingrédients sans gluten. La salle du petit déjeuner est très bien décorée et agréable avec sa vue sur la ville.

Merci au concierge de l'hôtel qui a su nous conseiller la meilleure pâtisserie de cupcake du coin (carlo's bakery, je vous la recommande!) Il se donne la peine de rechercher ce que vous demander, et même d'appeler pour vous pour être sûr que cela vous convienne.

Le seul petit point négatif, si je dois en trouver un, serait que le reste des personnes à l'accueil n'est pas tout le temps agréable...les sourires manquent..
Cependant, le service bagage est très pratique. Vous pouvez déposer gratuitement vos bagages le jour de votre départ lorsque votre avion part tard dans la journée.

En conclusion, vous conseille vraiment cet hôtel!

title: Consistently good
text: Nice new building with good sized rooms. Was able to score an upgraded corner room with great views of Central Park and the Hudson River. Rooms comes with a nice hot breakfast. There's also a nice fitness center and the location is excellent.

title: Current stay
text:
We are currently mid way through a ten day stay in Residence Inn, New York Manhattan/Central Park. We stayed in Crowne Plaza previously & wanted a change. The booking was very straight forward. Although I did send three seperate messages asking for a high floor due to our anniversary & birthday celebrations & to enquire about a late check out as we have a late flight back to Glasgow, which were never answered. Upon check-in, the staff at the front desk were very polite & professional. We booked a Times Square view & our room is on 54th floor on Broadway. It is very centrally located. 

Being the highest hotel building in America, the Residence Inn NY Manhattan/Central Park offers great views of the city. All the staff are very friendly and approachable.

The room is very comfortable & clean. The bed is amazing and there is no noise at all. There is added bonus of a kitchen area with fridge, freezer, dish washer. Coffee machine, toaster, kettle......and even a slow cooker!!

The shower is very good and powerful. There is a safe. 

There is free buffet style breakfast, which we have utilised on a few occasions. Lots of choices & this is excellent value. 

We were pleasantly surprised when returning to the room on Friday night as there was champagne & 2 desserts. We were not expecting this at all, which was a lovely touch. 

We still have a few days to go but the experience has been fab & would highly recommend.

We would definitely stay again!

title: Quiet, great location and accommodating!
text:
We stayed in November 2018 and it was a great location.

The room had ZERO traffic noise and we had an amazing view of Times square (we had a corner TS grand view room), higher up than going to any of the famous lookout buildings!

The only noise came from the bar fridge, which a few other reviews mentioned. And yes, it was quite loud but better than street noise.

Unfortunately I came down with pneumonia  from my flight over to NY, so I was hospitalised. 
The hotel was very accommodating and even though they were fully booked, they managed to allow us to keep the same room for a few extra days til I was able to fly home.

The room was kept pretty clean too.

We had such a great time as everything was within a few blocks, Studio 54 across the road, Central park a few blocks, Soupman one block away (highly recommend!) but we caught the subway alot which again was only one block away.

If we manage to get back to NY, we will definitely stay here again!

title: Empfehlenswert
text:
Gut gelegen zwischen Central Park und Time Square, UBahn Station in 2‘ erreichbar 

Freundliches Personal, Zimmergrösse für nyc ok,
Sauber, Standardausstattung 

Frühstücksbüffet üppig, stylisher Frühstücksraum

title: 値段が安ければいいかも
text:
カーネギーホールのコンサートへ行くために宿泊しました。
口コミで眺望が良いと思いましたが、一番下の階に案内されガッカリしました。

フロントの方は感じよく、その後少し上の階を調整いただきましたが、夜景はそれほど良くはなかったです。逆に昼間は雰囲気がよかったです。
せっかく良い感じのホテルですが、室内の設計や家具の配置などが良さを消しているのかも？

清掃はあまり良くはないです。

title: Great Location With A Pretty View
text:
2 nights to end our visit to NYC, and it was great. We arrived in the early afternoon, and the front desk staff was able to accommodate us and provide us with a room immediately. The Residence Inn and Courtyard share a lobby, but each has their own set of elevators (it seemed the Residence Inn had the higher floors).

The room was small (just as most NYC hotel rooms are), but they made good use of the space. It was fine for the 2 of us, and we're used to smaller spaces like cruise ship cabins. There was plenty of natural light, and we had a very nice view of the Hudson River (from the 39th floor). Our room was clean and comfortable, and there were plenty of pillows. Wifi worked well and was easy to log on.

Location is great on 54th Street and Broadway - walking distance to Central Park as well as many Broadway theaters if you plan to see a show.

We didn't have time to partake in the free breakfast, but I did walk into the area one morning on my way out, and it looked to be very nice. Hot and cold foods with plenty of selection. The seating area is nice and large with so many windows to enjoy the view.

The gym looked sufficient as well - large space with a few different rooms with plenty of equipment.

Great stay with helpful (though not overly friendly) and efficient staff. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great views and very friendly staff.
text: Just checked in a few hours ago.  Very helpful front desk.  Keyed entree to elevators, room and lights.  Very contemporary light and airy rooms but this is NYC.  Rooms are small but well designed.  Refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, small table with one chair.  One overstuffed chair with ottoman.  We have terrific views because we had a corner room which faced north and west. Free breakfast plus they have a large Starbucks on the fourth floor.  We had a shower no tub which is fine for us.  Don’t expect the Taj Mahal as far as space is concerned so you won’t be disappointed.  Convenient to everything in the tourist area including shows, Central Park and many good restaurants.

title: Una vista da sogno
text:
Quando sono entrata nella camera, ha superato le mie aspettative. Avevo prenotato un monolocale con vista, ma non mi aspettavo un panorama del genere. Due lati della camera avevano una enorme vetrata. 
La colazione permette  di risparmiare tempo e denaro, considerando i prezzi altissimi della città e della zona.
Vicino all'hotel in pochi minuti arrivi sia a Central Park che a Time Square, con la possibilità di diverse linee metro.

title: Convenient location, mediocre service, $7.00 bottles of water.
text:
The Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park, with its entrance on West 54th Street, is conveniently located between Times Square and Central Park.  Arriving early as the hotel was advised, although there was no room available, informed it would be OK to change my shoes in the lobby as there is plenty of fresh air and then to leave my luggage with the bell desk.  Unlike my experiences at other New York hotels there was no message to say when a room became available.  Returning in the evening, I was assigned a room on a high floor; no one was on duty in the lobby to retrieve my luggage that eventually was delivered to the room.  The well-equipped kitchenette stocked with coffee, a bag of popcorn, two bottles of water priced at $7 each with no complimentary bottled water provided.
The very light colored early washroom-style-design walls of the elevators contrasted with the dark corridors that led to the room.  The door opened onto a small kitchenette adjacent to the bedroom which had a separate bathroom with a shower.  The telephone in the room was not working. Using a mobile phone I contacted the front desk who sent up two engineers.  The engineers mentioned that earlier in the day room telephones in the same line of rooms were out of order requiring the service provider to come to the hotel to reprogram them.  Not all of the rooms in this line were checked; I was advised to wait until the next day to be moved since no other room was available.  A duty manager came up to the room to apologize.  He confirmed he would arrange to add points for the inconvenience and move me to another room that had a bath tub.  
The following evening I was assigned another room (with a shower and no bath tub) to which my luggage had already been relocated.  There was armchair which I used to place a suitcase as there was no luggage rack available; the same as with the previous room. 
The hotel has a laundry room for guests that is equipped with many washers ($2.75/load) and dryers (from $0.25/six minutes) but no laundry detergent.
The hotel provided complimentary copies of the USA Today newspaper.  When asked about the local newspaper, The New York Times, I was directed to an 8th Avenue news stand since the hotel didn’t offer that newspaper.
At breakfast in the morning, which ended at 09:30 am, there was an uninspired selection of hot and cold dishes.  Although the skim milk dispenser was empty every morning, on one occasion there was a skim milk container on the counter.  Replenishment was slow.  An empty fruit container with two fruits (oranges and bananas) was eventually replaced with a container of oranges.  On my last morning, there were no ceramic cups available; when departing a staff member told me she would get some, however when I returned an hour later there were still none available.  It was explained all ceramic cups put out had been used, the hotel being short staffed was given as a reason for not having any washed cups. Probably explaining why the breakfast tables were messy and not cleaned.
On the last day of my stay, I phoned guest services explaining I had a late check out and would appreciate the room being serviced if possible, which I was told it was.  Returning an hour later I repeated this request which was again accepted.  When checking out I was informed the room was not serviced because the hotel was not a full service hotel and it did not provide such courtesies. I was offered some more points for the various additional inconveniences.

title: Unbeatable view in NYC
text:
We had a two-night stay again in Residence Inn New York Manhattan / Central Park in March. Because of the excellent experience in September last year, we didn’t think twice and immediately decided to stay in the same Marriott property when planning for this spring trip. There was a little hiccup upon checkin, as the Front Desk Manager who had promised us a price match had just been transferred out and the staffer at the front desk had to spend some time figuring out how to honor the hotel’s promise. We were eventually assigned a two-bed suite on the 54th floor on Broadway, which offered the same lovely sunrise view as our first stay there. We did ask about the possibility of a suite with a different view, in particular the Central Park, but were told that two-bed suites are all on this side of the building with the same view. 

Our last experience had been that breakfast was below standard, in terms of food quality and service—by the standards of NYC hotels and Residence Inns elsewhere such as London. We thought we should give it another chance, but it turned out to be a mistake. Tough luck.

One small problem was that the coffee maker in our suite was broken. We requested to have it replaced not long after checking in and were told ‘sure, right away!’, but it never got taken taken of.

Being the highest hotel building in America Residence Inn NY Manhattan / Central Park certainly offers an unbeatable view. For some reason we felt the staff was not as friendly as what we had seen the last time we were there. The vibe has just changed. We being Marriott Bonvoy members may try another Marriott property when we’re in NYC again this fall.

title: Likely New York's most central location and the BEST STAFF!
text:
Our family of four were transitioning from an international ski trip enroute to the Caribbean. We had 3 nights in Manhattan and had a perfect stay.

Every staff interaction was great. From Mark at check in, to Megan managing a phenomenal team throughout our stay, to Eric assisting us making our flight during an early morning departure, I could not think of a better place to stay. Awesome breakfast that the kids loved, something hot and tasty for everybody. Lots of great coffee. 

Don't get excited about the size of the rooms. DO Get excited about being walking distance to many, many great spots in the city, including Times Square. 

New York City is an incredible place that must be enjoyed over and over again. The staff at this hotel are among the many reasons why New York is so great. Thank you Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park!

title: location is everything
text: Our room was adequate with a nice view.  Only one person at a time could get in the small bathroom.The second day, our towels or bathmat was not replaced nor the shampoo. Getting to the room, you had to go through a very dark, brown hallway. I felt like I was in a cave.  I've never seen such a dark hotel, especially in the hallways. It was a little creepy.  The hallways were not well lit.The complimentary breakfast was OK. We probably won't stay again.The location was good.

title: Découverte de New york
text: Hôtel très propre chambres impeccables et silencieuses ménage fait tous les jours petit déjeuner sucré salé chaud ou froid à 10 mn de Time square personnel très sympathique et à l’écoute je recommande vivement cet établissement bravo à toute l’équipe

title: Great Views
text: The rooms all have floor to ceiling windows and have several choices.  The location is the best for shows and shopping as well as being 2 blocks from Central Park.  The rooms are immaculate and the staff is great.

title: excelente ubicacion
text:
este hotel debe mejorar los ruidos de las habitaciones ya es la segunda vez que vamos y tenemos el mismo problema salvo las habitaciones que terminan en 05
otro problema para los que hablamos español es que no tienen a nadie que lo habla es increíble con la cantidad que visitan nueva york no tengan a nadie en la recepción que lo hable
nosotros tuvimos ese problema y nadie lo hablaba y eso requería de un mayor dominio del idioma para poder trasladar todo el inconveniente por suerte al segundo dia e intentando solucionar el inconveniente se nos acerco muy amablemente wanda que afortunadamente estaba por alli es la directora de recursos del hotel y que hablando nuestro idioma nos soluciono el problema y nos cambio de habitación y volvimos a una de las terminadas en 05. otra cosa que deberian mejorar es el desayuno ya que no tiene demasiadas opciones y no reponen lo que se termina

title: Meraviglioso!!
text:
E' la terza volta consecutiva che torno in questo hotel, ormai è come tornare a casa.
Le cose che mi piacciono di più sono in assoluto la vista, la cordialità e la disponibilità dello staff.
I letti sono molto comodi. Il piccolo angolo cottura è super attrezzato!
Ottima anche la colazione!
Ci sono state alcune cose che non mi sono piaciute e che le volte precedenti non erano presenti (ad esempio alcune macchie sulla moquette, la maniglia della finestra coperta dal nastro adesivo, macchie sulle tende, un bicchiere rotto tra le stoviglie..)
A parte le cose che non mi sono piaciute, tornerò sicuramente in questo hotel.

title: Breathtaking View, Tiny Room
text: Oh, what a view! I guess most views in the hotel are great, our view was facing southwest and it was fantastic. Unfortunately, the room itself is tiny, and only half of one wall had windows (floor to ceiling). The bed, linen, furniture were ok and of recent vintage. There was so little floor space, I was unable to perform some body stretches that I do each morning. The breakfast was ok, short on fresh fruit (two choices, one of which ran out), and the breakfast room had overwhelming sunshine, making half the room too hot to sit. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is really close to lots of attractions. Overall I would return, but wish the rooms were just somewhat larger.

title: Convenient
text:
The only reason we stay here is because of the location near my husbands office. 
It’s fairly basic no luxury bath sheet towels here... one miserable tube each of shower gel shampoo and conditioner - despite there being two adults in the room - (there is a Duane Reade close by) the water was only replenished once during our 7 night stay - despite me mentioning it to reception. 
The bedding wasn’t quite the right size for the bed - queen size fitted sheet stretched over a king mattress and the ‘duvet’ was miserable flimsy light weight over-washed  and just between 2 sheets - no duvet covers - so you had to be careful whilst sleeping as you wouldn’t really want it next to your skin. 
Generally the room was quiet and it’s close to several mart lines. 
There was one day when housekeeping called me mid afternoon to ask me if I needed anything. They said they couldn’t come in the room because the do not disturb sign was on.... I told them I was asleep and they had woken me to tell me that, - no apology, I’m not sure what they wanted since they had already serviced the room earlier and they had only replenished the water once during our 7 night stay.... 
There is a free breakfast but to be honest we only had it one day. I’d rather pay and go somewhere else. In the hotel it’s a fairly low quality food with people piling food on the plates like they haven’t eaten in a week..... then they either drop bits on the floor / chair or leave it  all over a table and leave without clearing away their mess. It’s pretty revolting. Though this isn’t the hotels fault... it’s just unpleasant.

title: Morar no céu
text:
O hotel mais alto de New York é realmente fabuloso.
Do meu quarto podia ver a cidade, à direita Times Square e à esquerda o Central Park. 
A Gigi, qu não tive o prazer de conhecer manteve o quarto imaculadamente limpo, com troca diária  de toalhas. Camas excelentes com boas almofadas. Kitchenette impecável e funcional. Elevadores rápidos e silenciosos até ao andar 56, quase sempre vazios. Pequeno almoço bom, dentro dos critérios exigidos a qualquer bom hotel. Podia ter sumo de laranja natural. Excelente espaço de lounge. Muito atenciosos com o aniversário do meu marido.
Salvo um pequeno incidente com o doorman e a bagagem no depósito, de 0 a 10, classificaria a minha experiência com um 11, na semana da Páscoa.
A todos os que se queixam que a sala do pequeno almoço é pequena e que se torna impossível comer lá, recomendo que vão cedo. Tomei pequeno almoço entre as 7 e as 7:30h todos os dias, sem qualquer complicação, usufruindo da vista panorâmica.  
Ninguém no seu perfeito juizo vai dormir para a cidade que nunca dorme, caramba!
Rise, shine and walk.
Stay at Residende Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park

title: Good stay
text: Hotel is nice and staff friendly. Room isn't the largest but think most hotels are the same. Location was great, could hear no noise at night. Would recommend this hotel. Kitchen facilities were good, only downside there weren't any cloths to wash and dry the dishes.

title: 部屋が広くて景色が良かった
text: 1階でチェックインを済ませると、部屋は35階以上にあるので景色が部屋からの景色が良く、部屋には小さいですがキッチンがあるので外食に疲れた時には使えそうです。シャワーの水量と温度調節がひとつになっているため調整が難したったのですが、セントラルパークもタイムズスクエアにも歩いて行ける場所柄含めて概ね満足でした。

title: Terrific view from high floor, very convenient location
text: The hotel is very close to the Broadway shows and Central Park. It is also within walking distance to most midtown attractions such as the Empire State Building. There are 3 subway routes nearby for further away trips. We stayed at the high floor Time Square grand view room. Indeed there are partial views to Central Park and Hudson River for this room. The front desk are very friendly and helpful. This is a busy hotel so sometimes the request on the mobile app may not be responded very soon. Many people come to breakfast after 8 am, better selections than other Residence Inn we have stayed. Highly recommend this place for my friends visiting NYC.

title: Wonderful hotel
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was inviting the minute you walk in and the lobby staff were great. I was recognized as a titanium member and was upgraded to a higher floor.

These rooms were amazing - whoever did the architecture of these spaces deserves some major props. The kitchen area was delightful. Everything was hidden away within the cabinets and cupboards of the counter area including the refrigerator, dishwasher and microwave. Very cool experience and I have never seen a built in fridge and freezer like that anywhere else. 

Rooms are on the small size for a Residence but views were amazing . The Central Park view is actually not as nice as the river out the other window. Room was quiet, and I wish I had more reasons to be in this part of town.

Negatives:
The bed was not the usual comfort level of a Marriott (a little too firm). But it worked out okay.

I did go to the free breakfast which was a little crazy. They ran out of yogurt both days before I got there at 7:30 and healthy options were hard to find. The layout made it hard to get food when there was a crowd, which there was both days. The small snack shop in the lobby needs more drink selections.

Overall, though, it still gets 5 stars for innovation, rooms and a Lovely stay!

title: Excellent!!
text:
Lets start with what attracted me to staying here minus the location... THE VIEWS!

We were fortunate to get a corner room with a glimpse of Central Park and the many surrounding beautiful buildings.The front desk staff are wonderful, we arrived on a red eye and were able to get an early check in. The room was perfect for 2 people, not as small as others have described. The location of the hotel is perfect as you are close to everything but can avoid chaotic Times Square. The hotel is close to subway stations and lots of restaurant choices. Breakfast in the morning was good, everything you need to get your day going and a great way to save some money. 

Overall I am so happy to have chosen to stay here and we will be returning on our next visit to the city!

title: Great place to stay
text: The hotel is close to a lot of the tourist hot spots (Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller, Central Park, Broadway) but it’s outside of the madness of Times Square so it’s a little quieter which was great! The room was set up for 3 of us and had a great view over the city which was particularly impressive at night. Breakfast in the hotel was good, they ran out of some items but these were replaced pretty regularly so you didn’t miss out. Great touch that tea/coffee was set up so it could be taken out, although as a Brit, there was a lack of breakfast tea available each morning (lots of herbal tea). Overall a really great hotel for first time visitors exploring New York and I would recommend

title: Great location, views, hospitality
text: We used Marriott Points and chose this hotel for its location and reviews. The hotel clerk was very accommodating and friendly. He gave us room 6402 which was SE corner room. I couldn’t take enough pictures from the room. Hudson River, Central Park, City Views from floor to ceiling. We Did not need to go to the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock because the views from our room were so breathtaking. The breakfast offered everything from eggs, bacon, Greek yogurt, croissants to waffles. Beds are very comfortable and clean rooms. This is the tallest hotel in the Western Hemisphere built in 2013. Would stay here again. Short walk to subway, Time square, St Patrick’s Cathedral, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Lots of Irish Pubs nearby

title: Great hotel for the NYC Marathon
text: I stayed here in November 2018 when I did the NYC Marathon. I walked from the finish line back to the hotel, which was great! If you're looking for something close to Central Park, this is a good hotel to look at. I also got a room on the 60th floor with a view of midtown Manhattan!

title: Buon Hotel...
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel due notti il mese di marzo 2019.molto buono ...il ristorante è freddo e poco accogliente.non dispongono di acqua di cortesia ma bottiglie a disposizione a pagamento.
Non dispongono inoltre di un servizio di cambio denaro alla reception.
Posizione ottima ,pulizia ottima ,servizio navetta aeroporto Ottimo.

title: Surprisingly good!!!
text: I am more of a snoot about hotels but hubby wanted to use points so I conceded and braced myself for an average stay. I must say, though, this hotel offered beautiful views (evidently they were even better before when the newest addition to the Central Park skyline was not there) , nice accommodations and amenities. Good new studio kitchen, comfy bed, nice linens, good desk space, all the right plugs and gadgets for electronics. The location is really great.... on broadway close to Central Park and close enough to Times Square without feeling that you’re in Times Square.  It’s right across the street from the Ed Sullivan theater where Colbert show is. We didn’t use workout room, but there is one. The bar/food area looks better than the food and drink tastes. Breakfast was, well, Residence Inn breakfast with poorly cooked eggs, clotchy oatmeal, dried bread products and that awfully sweet smelling waffle making station. But I wasn’t there for the food. A good New York Jewish deli bagel is the way to go in the morning. I really do recommend this hotel when you want a New York view, New York location and Chicago prices!

title: Returned after almost 5 years and still loved it
text: Tripadvisor just reminded me that I had already written a review about this hotel in 2014. I could not believe to my eyes as I felt it was like yesterday. This time we got a nice location corner room with a view on the park and the city. Unfortunately the view on the park is not really there any longer because some new buildings were erected in in the past couple of years and they block the full view, but still it can be called park view. The room itself is fine, typical New York size room with comfy bed and a nice size bathroom and all the amenities when would expect from a hotel at this location. We did not try the breakfast this time, so I can not report it has been improved since our last visit. The front desk people were very kind and super helpful and the whole stay was a pleasant want. Would return any time.

title: Amazing location and views
text: This hotels location is perfectly in walking distance to times square as well as central park and Rockefeller center. Breakfast is included and rooms have amazing views. My husband and I have stayed here multiple times and love this hotel

title: Perfect Visit
text:
My husand and I stayed at this hotel during my "60th Birthday Month" in December.  It was a last minute trip but we were still able to get a good rate.  I chose this hotel based on location, name and price, and it more than met our expectations.  We booked a park view room, but at check in my husband told them we were celebrating my birthday and a kind young woman upgraded us to a room with a better view. (I'm sorry I don't remember her name, Victoria??)  When we entered our room we actually laughed as it was so tiny, smaller than the pictures make it look.  That said it was full of small spaces, drawers, cupboards, shelves and we were able to manage quite well even finding spots to stash our suitcases. We've been in larger rooms that weren't this efficient!!  This tiny suite had a kitchen with dishwasher, microwave. and fridge and everything is faced so seamlessly we didn't  discover the freezer until the last day. The "kitchen" was handy for reheating leftovers, and chilling sodas and beer.  
The upgraded view was incredible!!! There were two windows and we had fabulous views of Times Square and the River, including beautiful sunsets. Thank you!!
We did not take advantage of breakfast but instead headed to Nosh for Lattes every morning to have with pastries we picked up at local bakeries. 
As others have mentioned the location is excellent for walking around the city, and a perfect base to come back and rest. The bed was quite comfortable, and we slept well!!  
The staff members were helpful and welcoming, and we appreciated their part in making this an excellent Birthday adventure. We highly recommend this hotel and hope to stay again in the future.

title: Vue époustouflante
text: Très bon accueil à la reception, un remerciement particulier à Rebecca. Personnel au petit déjeuner pas très sympa sauf le maître d’hotel. Petit déjeuner copieux mais irrégulier suivant les jours. Beaucoup de poussière dans les chambres. Particulièrement bien placé avec tous les services autour de la résidence et métro à proximité. Évaluation globale positive. Ne pas laisser traîner ces affaires, tee shirt embarqué par la femme de ménage jamais retrouvé malgré ma réclamation. Conciergerie très sympa, personne à votre écoute et très efficace et serviable.

title: Excellent location with good views
text: The hotel is located at Broadway and 54th.  It is in walking distance of the theater district, Lincoln Center, Central Park, Times Square, The Museum of Modern Art and loads of restaurants.  The studio rooms have a kitchenette and lots of plates, glasses, etc.  For a studio the rooms are not particularly large. The staff is friendly.

title: Amazing value for money
text: Stayed there for a week in March. Very nice spot for walks. close to major NY attractions as well as 5th Avenue. Polite staff. Decent breakfast. Very small rooms as expected for NYC. Subway stations very close.

title: Great Stay!  I will be back
text:
I was in town overnight for a nearby conference,  and chose this hotel due to its proximity and price.  

The hotel has a great location just North of Times Square, between 54th St. and 55th street on Broadway Although the addresses 1717 Broadway, the actual entrance to the hotel is on 54th St. West of Broadway.  

The hotel is modern, up-to-date, and in a great location.

The checking process was simple and convenient, and the front desk personnel was very friendly and helpful. I am a Marriott Bonvoy loyalty member and had utilized mobile check-in prior to my arrival.

My room was located on the 49th floor, and was a corner room with views of both the Eastside and Central Park, although the park was obscured by buildings.

The room was clean, up to date, echo friendly ( you have to insert your key card into a slot to get the wall lights to turn on) with great views and was very comfortable.  although the room wasn't overly large, it was quite comfortable.

Had a great night sleep.

Awoke the next morning and took advantage of the free breakfast on the third floor. Plenty of breakfast items from which to choose, and plenty of space to enjoy it.

I utilize mobile check out later in the morning.

I highly recommend this hotel for a reasonable price, great location, friendly staff, in all the right amenities.

title: The View (and location) - and the View
text:
This is now my absolute go to property in NYC.    I visit several times a year, but this was my first visit to the RI Central Park.   I was in town for the NYC Half-Marathon, and the new course puts you about 3 short blocks from the finish line (so this property is perfect for racers....you do not have to fight the runners on the subway after the 13.1 miles).    The property is extremely well maintained, for the amount of traffic it gets.    The staff was extremely professional and very accommodating....I had requested that if a room on 65 was available - that I would certainly appreciate that floor - and sure enough - 6503 was my room assignment.    And, the staff was aware thru some pre-visit conversations that I was running the race, and they left a very nice note - wishing me luck - and some extra bottles of water and some snacks.    Granted, I am a Gold level member——but that was above and beyond.....just kicked off the 2 day visit so favorably.     Everything in the room worked perfectly.   Elevators were very quick (even for being on the top floor—-never had to wait to long).       

The view though - that is the selling point - - I would sit at the window - looking out over the eastern part of the City and the tip of Times Square - and just watch the world go by...just an incredible opportunity to stay at such an incredible property.

If you are visiting NYC - and you want a room that is larger than normal NYC rooms - AND you want a view that will absolutely knock you off your feet - then stay here!!!     You will not be disappointed.

title: Fantastic Hotel, beautifully appointed and GREAT LOCATION
text: Our room was OUTSTANDING. Small but well done, where we had plently of space with closet/drawers, bathroom was gorgeous. Loved the shower and amenities. The free breakfast was over the top good. Eggs, waffles, everything you could want. Then there was a mini kitchen in our room complete with fridge, dishwasher, microwave. We had wine and cheese every night. It was more than i expected, i travel ALOT and was delightfully surprised by this hotel. Clean as can be, beautiful artwork, upscale presentation, GREAT breakfast lounge and the location was excellent. We walked everywhere. I will be coming back again next year.

title: Another fantastic stay
text:
This was my fifth stay and it has been fantastic. As an amateur photographer, I really appreciated the fantastic views from the 65th floor. I missed the drawers that I had in my previous rooms but I guess you can’t have it all! The location is perfect and allows you to walk not only to Times Square but also Central Park and Fifth Avenue. Plenty of restaurants around as well as subway stations and buses. Breakfast is good and lines can be avoided if you are an “early bird”, specially during the weekend.
Efficient staff make check-in a breeze. I would recommend this hotel and I look forward to my sixth stay.

title: good location
text: the residence  inn on 1717 Broadway is an ideal location fro Carnegie Hall and many other attractions. The room was a good size with a very comfortable oversized bed. Excellent views we were on 49th  floor and very quiet. Staff were very helpful and assisted with taxis when needed. I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past 2 years and the standard has remained constant

title: Excellent stay in NYC
text:
The corner room in this hotel was excellent, with panoramic views of NYC from the high floor are just breathtaking. 

Size of the room is a bit small but well equipped and has a small kitchenette which makes it convenient for long stays.

Very polite and professional front desk/house keeping employees.

Location is excellent, few minutes walk from Central Park and Times square.

Bathroom Amenities could be improved.

title: Perfect location and wonderful stay!
text: Perfect location if you fly into JFK.  E train subway station is one short block away.  Get off at 7th Ave and exit at the 8th and 53rd stairs.  Only drawback, no elevator and lots of stairs!  Very quick check in.  We asked for a corner room at check in and we got a semi corner room on the 49th floor.  Beautiful view of the Hudson River and Jersey.  Five minute walk to Times Square.  The room was small but very comfortable.  Bed was delightful.  The mini kitchen was great!  Coffee maker, fridge, freezer, micro wave, duel burners may be requested.  We used the gym everyday.  A variety of cardio machines and weight options.  A few of the machines were broken though.  The free breakfast was great!  Huge variety of hot and cold items.  The dining area is quite large and we never had to wait in line.  One of my favorite pros about this hotel is, NO RESORT FEES!!!  Found a super promotion on Travel Zoo.  Definitely our new favorite hotel in New York City!

title: Fantastic location but poorly maintained
text:
I have stayed at quite a few Residence Inns and unfortunately this was one of the most poorly maintained Residence Inns I have ever visited. The kitchen and bathroom drains were very slow, and the shower drain was completely blocked with hair. Rather than removing the hair, someone just pulled out the drain stopper and sat it on the side of the tub. Maintenance came and removed the hair but left the drain stopper on the side of the tub and poured chemicals down all the drains, but they continued to drain slowly the rest of my stay. Many of the light bulbs in the room were burnt out, and two lights over the kitchen counter were just hanging down by the wires and were inoperable until maintenance repaired them. The carpet in the rooms is in dire need of cleaning or replacement and was held down with duct tape in my coworker's room. The sheets on the beds had holes in them, and the white blanket at the end of the bed was yellowed and very, very worn out. 

The rooms are not suitable for extended stays or for work.  Some coworkers had rooms with no desks and some coworkers had no drawers or space to store their luggage.  The rooms that did have desks did not have an adjustable chair.  I was unable to reach the desk unless I sat on pillows, and a much taller coworker had to do the same.  

The location of this hotel was convenient to Central Park, Times Square, many train lines, and great food. The variety of options at breakfast was impressive, and the gym was the best hotel gym I have ever seen. It is a shame that a hotel in such a great location is not better maintained.

title: Great hotel
text:
The lobby area is a little small, but the staff are very friendly and welcoming. We were on the 40th floor, the room was on the small side but it had everything that you need, we had a view of the city. My mum stayed on 64th floor with a corner room, she could see Central Park and the Hudson River. This room was amazing, it was set up for a disabled person so had a walk in shower, which turned out great for her. 
The hotel is so close to everything, Times Square and Central Park are about 5-10 minutes walk and the subway is about 5 minutes away. We walked everywhere from here!
The breakfast that is on 3rd floor was great, my husband and mum loved the waffle making machines! We had coffee and sandwiches on 4th floor. It’s nice to have somewhere to sit that not in your room. I would definitely stay at this hotel again

title: Tallest Hotel with great views
text: Great location, fabulous views, good buffet breakfast. Friendly staff. Good value for location. Some rooms have central park partial view. Others, the Hudson. Lots on the doorstep. Spacious room! Only thing that irked me was the lower window pane that can open quite far out. I am assuming these are fully locked for families with small children who crawl.

title: Great with the right room
text: We are generally first class travelers but saw a deal on Travelzoo and booked this hotel for a long weekend. Got upgraded at check in and had a fabulous room overlooking Times Square on the 61st floor. Room was small but adequate and we could see the top of the World Trade Center and the sunsets. Maid service is spotty but bed was quiet and comfortable.  For $200 a night it was terrific!

title: Intéressant mais des bémols
text:
Pour commencer merci au check in d’avoir accéder à notre demande de chambre en étage élevé ( 65ème et dernier étage ).
La chambre est jolie et bien entendu la vue grandiose.
Le personnel est à l’écoute et patient malgré notre anglais très médiocre.
Merci aussi pour l’organisation de la réservation d’une voiture tout confort pour notre retour à l’aéroport.
Le petit-déjeuner est très bien et complet. Certains se plaignent du manque de changements mais personnellement chez moi je mange tous les jours la même chose et ici le choix est tout de même varié ( salé et sucré - super les gaufres à faire soit même).
Pour éviter l’attente au petit-déjeuner nous avons suivi les conseils des horaires ( donnés dans les ascenseurs par écrit) et n’avons eu aucun problème.
Le gros bémol c’est en effet le bruit dans la chambre : entre la soufflerie du chauffage, le moteur du frigo qui tente de démarrer et finalement n’y parvient pas pendant des heures ( y compris la nuit.... ) et enfin un bruit de tapement venant de la chambre voisine, cela a été terrible.
Nous avons réglé le problème : chauffage coupé ainsi que le frigo la nuit mais ce n’est pas une solution viable.
Je mets 4 points pour la situation, le personnel et l’emplacement mais pas garanti que j’y retourne malheureusement.

title: Bottom Line - Would Not Stay Here Again
text:
Pros: location, staff, room reasonably clean, nice view

Cons: tiny and not your typical residence inn, bedding is Motel 6 like, tiny bathroom, dark halls, not Marriott quality.  AC is so loud, breakfast was mediocre

title: Excelente opção! Recomendo!
text:
O hotel fica bem próximo de 4 estações de metrô, o que permite uma fácil locomoção. Meu apartamento era o standard e foi excelente. 
Uma cama queen, banheiro de bom tamanho, TV grande, guarda roupa é uma compacta e super pratica cozinha, com microondas, máquina de lavar louça, geladeira boa, louça e talheres, panelas (você precisa pedir o mini fogão). Foi excelente, pois varias noites chegamos no hotel cansados, e comprávamos na recepção pizza congelada, macarrão... e comíamos no apartamento. A geladeira vem vazia, vc pode fazer compras e deixar nela sem problemas. 
Meu apartamento era no 47 andar, uma vista maravilhosa. 
Se você pedir apartamento final 5 (o meu era 4705) você terá um apartamento de quina, ou seja, com 2 lados de vidro. Da minha janela eu via, de um lado, os prédios da cidade e do outro lado o Rio. Foi fantástico! 
Quarto silencioso, não ouvia barulho algum da rua.
Café da manhã excelente, com varias opções de pães, waffle, iogurte. Superior a outros hotéis de NY. Salão do café da manhã muito confortável, com poltronas e sofás. 
Tem Starbucks no hotel, e também lavanderia com fichas, auto serviço. Quebra um bom galho!
Super recomendo.

title: Best location
text:
Arriving at the hotel had an excellent service from O’neil at the reception, lovely young man with a very friendly attitude and a smiling face who makes you feel welcome straight away.
Moving on to my room on the 55th floor I felt like  will be having my own apartment in NYC for some days.  Amazing view from my bedroom windows.
Cleaning services everyday.
Best location, Time square and Central Park is a 5-10 minutes walk.

title: Great service and location
text:
We arrived very early from our red-eye flight, and failed to get any sleep.  We arrived at the hotel just looking to drop of our bags off, but we were able to check in early which SAVED THE DAY!  The service was great whenever we needed something or had a question.  

The breakfast was good, not great.  VERY crowded, so go early otherwise there wont be anywhere to sit and you'll be waiting for fresh food to come out.  They say there is a Starbucks on the 4th floor - but there isn't.  Just a small place that serves Starbucks coffee.  

The location is fantastic!  We were able to walk everywhere we wanted, which was convenient.  Rockefeller Center, Broadway shows, great restaurants, Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park, and more right there.  Our room was on the smaller side, but, we weren't really in there expect to sleep so it didn't matter.  Our room was immediately next to the elevator, which we thought would be annoying but really didn't bother us at all.  

Overall, definitely recommend this place.  Next time we are NYC this will definitely be an option for us!

title: great value
text:
Average service , not outstanding but decent enough. Hotel deco is dark and gloomy (not bright or fresh) , the pictures on the website dont show this- i wouldnt really choose a dark and gloomy place to stay in , thank god for the curtains in the room that can open to a great view and the white sofa. 
Location is good, close to everything , the room is small (but i guess that's how hotel rooms mostly are in NYC?) .
Breakfast selection is similar each day and limited tables if you come in as a family . most are just lounge sofas (again, what's up with the deco and interior of  this hotel?)
i would only choose this again simply for the location but there are other hotels around so maybe look around first?

title: First Class Everything
text: Travelled here for 15th anniversary. Booking was a breeze. When we arrived, or room want quite ready. We were offered a free upgrade and given access to 2 different room layouts to choose from. Pamela, the receptionist wad amazing and couldn't have been nicer. Although we tend not to stay anywhere twice, ou'd wee come back to New York, we will absolutely come back.

title: Nice hotel, close to everything
text:
We enjoyed our stay at Residence Inn. It is close to Times Square, Central Park and many other tourist draws in Manhattan. Staff was very friendly. 

The room was comfortable (but a little tight).  There is a sliding door to the bathroom (for space). It did have a nice kitchen (we mainly used the under-counter refrigerator and the glasses).  We were in Room #3 on our floor (of 9 rooms) in the 50+ floor level.  CITY VIEW (Not Central Park view that we preferred). We could hear the whirring of the four elevators all the time, but they were not distracting.

title: preocupacion
text: estoy viajando la semana de carnaval , lei las criticas y me preocupa que la habitación sea muy pequena como lei, somos dos personas y estoy con la rodilla mal. no me gustaría tener una mala experiencia . sobretodo si tiene tan chicas las habitaciones . que me recomiendan?

title: Ótima estadia com excelente localização
text:
O Hotel é muito bem localizado, possibilita ir a pé tanto ao Central Park quanto à Times Square, além disso pertinho do metrô. É super fácil de se locomover para todas as partes de Manhattan.

Super recomendo ;)

title: Happy with our stay
text: We stayed 5 nights at the hotel last week.  We arrived at 10:00am after a red-eye flight and the hotel was able to accomodate my early check-in request and they upgraded us to room on the highest floor with a terrific Times Square view.  We had a king room and it was efficiently laid out.  Not being a fan of tub/shower combos, the stall shower is a big plus.   The breakfast is pretty good, but be sure get there early!  Location is excellent.  Theater, restaurants, and subway options are very close by and Central Park is just a few blocks walk. I have to give a shout out to the front desk!  They were friendly and very helpful no matter the request! Winter is a good time to visit NYC.  It's still busy, but nowhere near as crowded as April-October.

title: Albergo mediocre, ma vista eccezionale.
text: L'albergo è abbastanza anonimo, diviso tra il residence e l'albergo vero e proprio. La sala del ricevimento è praticamente inesistente, anonima e spesso affollatissima, con commessi giovani che si alternano in turno e non sempre riescono a coordinarsi. Abbiamo avuto diverse problematiche con i servizi, primo fra tutti l'assegnazione della stanza. Avevamo prenotato una Grande Studio ad angolo con vista su piazza del Tempo, chiedendo il piano più alto possibile, ma il primo giorno ci danno una Studio normale a un piano alto, mentre il secondo giorno ci fanno spostare prima in una Grande Studio a un piano basso senza vista e poi, dopo le nostre rimostranze, finalmente in una Grande Studio al penultimo piano con vista, nonostante ci avessero detto che non c'era più nulla disponibile ai piani alti.La lavanderia in un'occasione ha dimenticato di ritirare i nostri abiti. Le camere sono abbastanza piccole, ma pulite e il servizio di riassetto è positivo. L'impianto di climatizzazione è rumorosissimo (sia per il caldo che per il freddo) ed è impossibile tenerlo acceso mentre si dorme. Nella Grande Studio ci sono due pareti interamente di vetro da terra al soffitto. Consiglio: fatevi dare una camera con vetrate ad angolo retto e non con l'angolo smussato, altrimenti lo spazio è ancora meno e la vista peggiore.

title: Cosas buenas y cosas a mejorar
text:
Hemos pasado unas buenas vacaciones en Nueva York , nada más llegar al hotel nos dieron una cálida bienvenida con un upgrade a una habitación con mejores vistas ya que era nuestra luna de miel.
La habitación era lo suficientemente amplia y todo estaba limpio.
Hacia frío estos días y el aire acondicionado funcionaba perfectamente, lo único que puedo decir que podría estar mejor es un humidificador para que el aire no estuviera tan seco, de todos modos con la tetera eléctrica hervíamos agua y al vapor humedecía el aire (trucos)

Las vistas era excelentes , la habitación tiene buenas cortinas que por la noche te dejan descansar ya que la mitad de la habitación es cristalera, igual en las dos esquinas de la habitación era difícil cubrir pequeños huecos donde por las mañanas entraba el sol, pero bueno, nada que sea gran problema para dormir.

El gimnasio está bien , tiene diferentes máquinas y pesas y una zona donde poder hacer ejercicios de suelo con esterillas de Yoga.

El desayuno no estaba más, tienes pan y bolleria , queso y algo de fiambre , para las dos semanas que hemos estado nosotros diría que han variado muy poco o más bien nada el desayuno, me esperaba más de un Marriott en cuanto al desayuno, la calidad de la bolleria debería ser mejor, los croissants parecían industriales (nunca los probé), la sala es grande y acogedora, 

La gente del hotel muy gentil y acogedora, nos han ayudado en todo momento para cualquier duda o la compra de tickets para actividades en la ciudad.

El hotel está muy bien localizado, muy cerca de Central Park y de Times Square , el metro está muy cerca .

title: Solid hotel in a great location
text: My husband and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary in NYC over New Years. We chose the hotel because of the location. Close enough to Times Square but not too close where it would be impossible to get in or out on NYE. Good choice that we were happy with. We could get around the city easily and walk to some of New York’s best highlights. The hotel itself was comfortable but a bit tight although our view was amazing which we paid top dollar for. service was very good and we were treated to a complementary dessert and sparking wine delivered our room because it was our anniversary. Much appreciated. The  king room was fine but it was literally all bed with very little walking space. Ok for one person but not ideal for two adults. Can’t imagine a family sharing a room with double beds if it is comparable to the king room. Overall, we were happy not overjoyed or overwhelmed. Super busy as to be expected for NYE. I got the feeling that we over paid by buying through the Marriott site. I checked out rates on Trip Advisor and they were much cheaper. Highlight of the hotel is the workout area. Big and has everything you need and more. It overlooks the city...breathtaking view. Do not bother with the cafe on the 3rd floor. It is only there for convenience but has no atmosphere. Maybe a good spot if you need to work and want to get out of your room. Regular coffee was good but anything more, best to go off property. Will stay again only if the price is right.

title: Très bon emplacement, vue époustouflante
text:
Pour notre deuxième séjour à NY nous avons choisi cet hôtel pour son emplacement central et ses bons avis. Los de la réservation j'avais demandé une chambre en étage élevé, à notre arrivée on nous a attribué la chambre 6305 (63eme sur 65) avec une sublime vue sur Time square. les chambres sont bien agencées et nous avions une grande douche à l'talienne. Le petit déjeuner est très garni et rechargé régulièrement. Les chambres étaient propres ainsi que les parties communes. Un grand merci au concierge à qui nous avons fait appel pour régler un problème. 
Je recommande fortement cet hôtel et n'hésiterai pas à y retourner lors d'un  futur séjour.

title: Fabuleux ❤
text: L'emplacement de l'hôtel est idéal, la vue de notre chambre était juste exceptionnelle, tout était parfait l'acceuil, le personnel sympathique et à l'écoute, le petit déjeuner, le bar, la propreté des chambres, la salle de bain ... Je recommande vivement cet hôtel qui a contribué à rendre notre sejour à NY inoubliable.

title: Very Dissappointing Stay!
text: I went back and forth on doing this review. But it's best to give my honest experience. Both good and bad. I was excited to be staying at the Residence Inn-Central Park for my Anniversary. I like staying Marriot because they have the mobile app. You can check in via the mobile app and the room will be ready upon arrival. That didn't go as planned. Our room was not ready and we had to wait about an hour. We checked in...went up to our room. View of "Central Park" that I expected was more of a peak between buildings. Still a nice view of the city as we were on the 60th floor. Just not the romantic central park view of invisioned. I noticed I had been charged an additional $60 for my stay. After calling the front desk.. I was told it was a $20 per night for incidentals. Nice to be notified in advance. We were expected "plush" bedding. Hotel beds are always the best part of vacation. Well we had a "pad" inbetween 2 sheets. It was cold in the room and couldn't regulate the temperature. We requested blankets and waited 2 hours for them. After using the app to explain the situation..we were sent up wine. Heat barely worked. They had to send someone to fix the heat. It was 1 thing after another. I tried to talk to the manager Kenny to possibly be moved. Since it was so cold in our room. No rooms available. I was just very unimpressed and dissapointed with my stay here. Room was as pictured... View was nice... Free Breakfast was good. But everything else was sub par. Would not stay here again.

title: Terrific place to stay
text:
Location, location, location.... Stayed over the Martin Luther King, Jr. weekend. The hotel is strategically placed between bucolic Central Park and frenetic Times Square, and you are close enough to walk conveniently to either. Subway entrances are also close by. 

The hotel is one of those hybrid Marriott properties that is half Residence Inn and half Marriott Courtyard. Staff handle this mix of brand identities and guests very well. Indeed, the staff were outstanding - welcoming, professional and helpful. 

Rooms are nicely designed, a bit compact but more space than many other rooms in New York City. A large overstuffed chair takes up way to much area but, otherwise, everything was fine. A wand shower head was a highlight in the bathroom, the lighting was good, and the Marriott bedding is always top notch. 

The hallways leading to the rooms, however, are very dark, almost scary - it was hard even to see the room numbers beside each door.  

Huge, pleasant common areas on the third and fourth floors for business and hanging out and for the complimentary breakfast are graced with tall windows that look out over Broadway. 

My only real complaint is that external calls to the hotel don't seem to be answered. On two different days I called to confirm my reservation that had been made through a third-party vendor, and no one answered the phone. On the second day, I tried (no kidding) 8-10 times before finally reaching a very pleasant person. Maybe this was just a glitch, but it is something that management might want to address. 

All in all, I had a wonderful stay, would stay there again, and recommend this property highly.

title: Second time here and still great
text: We stayed here a few years ago and I am happy to say the place is still great! Fantastic views, fast elevator, tastefully decorated room. The location rocks, too. Breakfast was good with plenty of seating.

title: Amazing View from the top and close to so much!
text: We enjoyed our stay here! It was such a beautiful view from our floor and the room was cozy! We were greeted by Mathura and she was amazing! She answered all of our questions, got to know us and made sure were happy. I love when I meet people who take pride in their job! The nice thing about this hotel is the distance to get to places! We were close to so much! It is a beautiful hotel and we look forward to coming back in the future!

title: Love This Hotel!
text: Our recent stay at the Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park was absolutely perfect!!  The location could not be any better!  We were within an easy walk of all of the sights we came to see--Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall, Radio City Music Hall, and more!  We were fortunate enough to be given a corner room and the view was absolutely spectacular!  We awoke each morning to the sun rising over the city skyline and it was amazing!  (Ask for room #4902!  It's perfect!) The footprint of our room was small but it was so conveniently designed that we never felt crowded.  There was ample drawer and closet space and the small, well appointed kitchenette was an unexpected bonus!  (Great for leftovers from all those delicious restaurant leftovers!)  The bathroom was spacious and also featured well-designed storage options.  Loved the thermostat on the tub/shower!  Very nice feature!  We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to NYC!!

title: Good stay
text: Some rooms have great views. The rooms are not large like you would expect for a Residence Inn. There seemed to be issues with cups, glasses, and utensils missing or appliances not functioning. Beds are super comfortable. Elevators can be tedious especially during breakfast hours.

title: Great Stay
text: We had a great experience at the Residence Inn. The location is perfect - convenient to so many things. The hotel is beautiful and clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and there are wonderful amenities. We will definitely stay here when we come back.

title: Just perfect in all respects
text:
We usually stay at the Courtyard Central Park, but this time I was traveling alone and  decided to have breakfast included to save time. Well, I was not disappointed - everything was great: early check-in, courteous and extremely helpful staff, excellent breakfast with plenty of healthy choices. My room on the 52 floor was very quiet and the view was stunning, modern, sparking clean, well appointed kitchen with everything you need, if you decide to eat in your room. 

I also got a late checkout which was so helpful. 

We will be back for sure.

title: AMAZING, ÉPOUSTOUFLANT.....
text:
Nous avous séjourné 1 semaine au résidence by Marriott, vraiment que du bien pour l'hôtel, les agents un grand merci aux personnels de chambre......
NS étions chambre 6205
Accueil plus que parfait à refaire sans hésitation à oui le petit-déjeuner très bien large choix sucré, sale, fruits...

title: Central Park?? I don’t think so
text: Let’s get to the actual location...Times Square!  Yeah, Broadway at 54th street. Still a great location for theatre, subway, bus, tours, etc. But Central Park...up several blocks.  Horribly misleading name.  And, maybe you can SEE Central Park from the 65th floor, but how many guests get those rooms?  Stay away from the rooms behind the elevator shaft - and I’m sure there are tons - because you’ll get to hear a clanging noise every five minutes. So about an hour into my room stay I requested a new room and was graciously acommodated. The staff was wonderful, especially Rebecca. Fast service and always a friendly smile. Lovely bed, full kitchen and walk-in show bathroom with an expansive window walls - nearly 1/2 of my room was windows! I did not eat at the restaurant.

title: Our ‘new’ New York hotel!
text: We recently stayed here for our 11th wedding anniversary.  We frequent the City and while we stayed at many hotels, we haven’t stayed anywhere that we’d like to return to.  We now have our hotel!  The staff arranged a beautiful room for our Anniversary.  When we went to check in the staff informed us that there would be a delay as another Platinum member had requested a late checkout.  While we contemplated whether to take another room, the staff was patient and suggested that we wait as the room was fabulous!  This was great advice as the room/view was beautiful!  Thank you to the front desk for the personal touch and the good advice!  Everything else from the valet, the breakfast staff, and housekeeping was wonderful.  Thank you for making our Anniversary special, we will be back!!

title: beautiful room with a beautiful view
text:
everything about this hotel is first rate.  from check in to the time we left.  will be back of course.

also the restaurant next door.  empire steak, I think is the name of it, great food and ambiance.  
Our favorite hotel in nyc.

title: First-rate hotel in excellent location
text:
The property is well-situated close to Central Park, Broadway shows, shopping, restaurants, and museums, and several metro stops are within walking distance with access to various subway lines.  The staff are top-notch professionals:  pleasant, responsive, efficient and helpful.  Check in was quick and easy.

The view from our room (54th floor) was spectacular, a big selling point! Our room was not large but was roomy by New York standards with a convenient layout. Two bedside tables, multiple lamps and lighting options, closet, bureaus, desk, two chairs, a safe, and a kitchenette, complete with fridge, microwave, cutlery, dishes, pots and pans, cabinets and drawers, and coffee maker.  The rainforest shower was delightful, and bathroom vanity space was generous.  The exhaust fan in the bath was whisper quiet - unusual in our experience and much appreciated.  The bath could use more towel racks (towels fell off the shiny hooks).  Linens were fresh and fluffy, and toiletries were good.  The bed was okay, not as comfortable as other hotels in the same mid-price range; that was a surprise considering the overall quality of our stay.  Heating unit worked well.

Noise separation among rooms was not great, and we could hear conversations of our neighbors; but everyone on our floor seemed to be mindful of not speaking loudly and keeping TV volumes to reasonable levels.  Free wifi worked well.  Elevators are fast, and come quickly at certain times, but long waits may occur during heavy traffic times.

The breakfast buffet, also free, was better than the customary free breakfast offerings at moderate hotels.  Cold meats, spinach salad and yogurts were added to the usual breads, muffins and cold items.  Hot choices included not just pork sausage but also turkey sausage, and almond milk was included as well as typical dairy-based milk.  A word to the wise:  go early to breakfast, as lines form by 8 am and the serving stations get very crowded, with diners bumping each other and creating a not entirely relaxing environment.  The breakfast room is large with high ceilings and excellent views, but, at peak times, it still feels crowded.

Overall, we could not have been more pleased.  Hope we will have a chance to return soon.  Highly recommended.

title: Hyvät näkymät
text: Siisti huone, ehkä vähän pieni kahdelle. Hinta ja laatu kohdillaan, ottaen huomioon, että ollaan New Yorkissa. Huone sijaitsi 56. kerroksessa. Manhattania pystyi hyvin ihailemaan huoneesta. Times Square lyhyen kävelymatkan etäisyydellä. Hyvä aamupala, etenkin pannukakkukone teki vaikutuksen.

title: Bustling and Busy
text:
My daughter and I stayed at this property together during Christmas week. She loved it, but grew frustrated every time we needed to use the elevator since it took 10-15 minutes for one to come. The hotel was over capacity at Christmas, which meant long waits for elevators.

If you take that out of the mix, the hotel is conveniently located and well decorated. My only true problem (each time) is with the shower. The entire bathroom floods every time in every room. While Housekeeping was happy to mop up and leave extra towels, I have to be honest, a plumber should really deal with this!

I recommend this property. But if you’re traveling with little ones during a holiday week, you might want to consider a hotel with more elevators and less floors.

title: Great service at a very busy hotel
text:
The location of this hotel is great, close to central park and mid-town for Times Square,etc. The staff is very accomodating and helpful. Being a lifetime Marriott platinum member, you don't get much here other than possibly a better room location (as with all Residence Inns). The rooms themselves are very tight compared to other Residence Inns, but they do have all the necessities (fridge, microwave, dishes, dishwasher, etc).

Overall, great for a Residence Inn and I'd stay here again.

title: Great Stay (but avoid rooms next to the elevators)
text:
We had a nice stay in this hotel at the end of November / start of December 2018. We were spread over 3 floors, 45, 53 and 55 so I got to see the views from different levels and each one was great. Of course the higher you go the better the view but it was nice not to look out at a brick wall or fire escape for a change. We had a view that captured a bit of Times Square and some of the Hudson. 

We did have to get one of our rooms changed as it was located directly next to the elevator shaft and the noise was bad. It sounded like a storm blowing through, especially at the busy breakfast times when all the elevators are being heavily used (this is also the time where you should expect to wait longer than usual for an elevator). As soon we we mentioned this problem to reception they were very helpful and moved the guests to a better room on floor 53 (from a lower floor) immediately. We got the impression that this was not an uncommon issue. However the change was swift and hassle free.

The in room kitchen was very useful and added a nice bit of extra space to the room that you don't usually get in New York hotels. It had a fridge, microwave, sink, kettle, coffee maker, slow cooker, cutlery, dishes, pans, some had toasters and a counter top stove could be requested from reception. There was also a dishwasher which would be loaded and turned on by housekeeping when there were enough dishes to warrant it (we didn't use this though). It is quite handy if you don't want to eat out or want to keep your costs down and make your own meals. There are a couple of Duane Reade's nearby where you could get a limited selection of groceries.

Breakfast is served on the lower floors and serves both hotels. It can get quite busy but the selection of food was good. Cereal, fruit, pastries, yoghurt, waffles, hot selection, toast, muffins etc and hot drinks and juice. It was a good way to get set up for the day ahead. The elevators do have useful guides in as to when they are at their busiest at breakfast time so that gives a good indication of when the breakfast room is busy. I went down around 8am and this seemed to be a good time. When waiting for an elevator at the breakfast room when you finish it may be wise to jump in one that is going down instead of waiting for one going up as you could be there a while. It is sometimes quicker to go down to go up and saves waiting in the queue as when we were there, the queue didn't go down because people at the front wouldn't get in the elevator unless it was already going up. If you are prepared to go down a few floors first, you can jump the queue this way. 

The location was great, really easy to get to everywhere.

One thing to note is the windows in our rooms had an opening at floor level and one of them did not close properly. Regardless, it would be something to be aware of if staying with children as it would be fairly easy for them to open. There is a heavy armchair in the room that could block access to it but just worth being aware of.

I would definitely stay here again.

title: Bela vista e bem localizado
text: O hotel fica muito bem localizado, entre o Central Park e a Times Square. Tem 65 andares, se não me engano, e lindas vistas da cidade. Fiquei no 40 e a vista do quarto era linda! O quarto era equipado com cozinha completa e as amenities são Paul Mitchell. O café da manhã é bem variado e está incluído. Único problema são os elevadores, que apesar de serem 4, não dão conta do número de hóspedes e nos horários de pico é preciso esperar muito tempo.

title: Convenient but not great
text: If you want the heart of Manhattan you’ll love it, but it’s really a three star feel with groans, creaks, wind noise and very, very slow elevators. Staying on the 57th floor with a view over the city sounds glamorous but it takes ages to get up and down the property, especially in busy footfall times. Breakfast at peak hours is packed, and lacks bacon, but is good value when included in the room rate. We were coming back - as we had rebooked a second stay upfront owing to our travel plans, as we were given a recommendation on the place before arriving - but after being told that we couldn’t leave two suitcases behind as there is ‘no storage’, we’ve cancelled that booking. The rooms are an average size for a Manhattan hotel (think small) and the bathroom is a tiny offshoot of the bedroom. There’s a good shower above a bath. Weirdly there’s a small kitchenette with a dishwasher, fridge and microwave. It’s not a bad place, but you May well find better!

title: Not Up To Expectations
text: Booked a stay with my family following the Christmas holiday.  Our initial room was located adjacent to the elevators, which provided us with the near constant sound of them traveling up and down.  Following that experience we were able to relocate to a different room.  This time it was much quieter.

title: Poor Service, needs improvements
