text: Check in experience horrible.  Platinum Elite member and treated like garbage when I tried to check in early.  Said they’d call when room ready but didn’t.  Rooms misleading, supposedly a Central Park view room but can barely catch a glimpse of the park through a building.  Borderline fraudulent marketing.  Room is ok, beds small - supposedly two queens but feel smaller.  No USB adapters or international adapters in the hotel.  No one answers the phone when you call for service so don’t bother.  Elevator painfully slow.

title: Inspiring view from room 6202
text:
My sister recommended this hotel for my girlfriend and I to stay at during our holiday vacation. Unfortunately, when we first began our research for hotels in New York, the Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park was fully booked. We did extensive research on countless hotels. Everywhere from the Upper West Side, Midtown, Financial District, Soho, Battery, and South Street Seaport. Nothing excited us in comparison to the jaw-dropping views that Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park offers. We booked several hotels with free cancelation policies and four days before our trip the Residence Inn became available. We immediately booked the King Studio Central Park View room and canceled all of our previous reservations. 

Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park is in a perfect location, walking distance to Times Square, two blocks from the 7th avenue Subway Station, and a very short walk to many broadway theaters. We saw King Kong and it was amazing. I highly recommend buying a seven day unlimited metro card to easily travel around Manhattan. We were in New York for only four days and took the subway about twenty times. The subway made it very easy to avoid walking in the cold. I also highly recommend going to TKTS at the Lincoln Center location instead of Times Square to avoid the long lines. TKTS offers broadway show tickets at a good discount. 

Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park is clean and very accommodating. They met every special request I had and provided excellent hospitality. I definitely recommend using the Marriott app to check-in and make requests for your stay. The front desk staff and concierge greeted us with a smile, our housekeeper was very nice and payed attention to detail when cleaning our room, we always had fresh towels.  Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park is tallest sole purpose hotel in North America. Our room was located on the 62nd floor and had a complete 180 degree view. We could see the Hudson River, Central Park, East River, Midtown, and part of Times Square. Awesome views of the One57 building and 432 Park Avenue building. I will recommend this hotel to my family and friends as well as anyone I speak to about traveling to New York. Our trip couldn’t have been any better. The view from the room was unlike anything I have ever experienced at a hotel. The photo I have attached will speak for itself.

title: Didn't Want to Leave
text: This hotel is well priced and comfortable. It has an excellent location with an easy walk to Times Square and views unlike any other hotel in NYC!  It was difficult to check out of the room because it was so relaxing and the view was so outrageous.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: A little sweet talking got me an upgrade to a high floor with spectacular view, despite the fact I had a great rate. Breakfast was good. Service at front desk was exceptional. Bed was wonderful. Perfect location for shoppers or theatre-goers. Enjoy!

title: Excellent hotel for Manhattan Theater District
text: My wife and I recently stayed in the Central Park/Manhattan Residence Inn for our visit to NYC.  It provided an excellent base for our Christmastime visit to such sites as the Theater District, Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum, Harlem, and Rockefeller Center.  The Residence Inn's studio room provide such a more comfortable setting than a traditional hotel room.

title: Excelente localização
text: Estive neste hotel com minha esposa em maio/2018. Ficamos muito satisfeitos com a estadia. O Hotel é muito bem localizado, possibilita ir a pé tanto ao Central Park quanto  à Times Square, além de contar com acesso fácil para o metrô. Ressalto ainda que conta com café incluso ( boa qualidade ) e quartos amplos ( não comum na região ), além de uma bela visão do local, tendo em vista a altura do hotel. Voltaremos sempre quando visitarmos Nova Iorque.

title: 위치 좋은 숙박
text: 위치는 정말 좋아요. 센트럴파크와 타임스퀘어 중간이죠. 다만 비싸요. 포인트숙박아니면 못 묵을거 같아요. 조식은 중간정도고 기타 부대시설 괜찮아요

title: Excelente Ubicación Increíbles Vistas Muy Buen Hotel
text: Habitaciones tipo departamentos con todo lo básico necesario para cocinar y pasar una excelente estadía en una ubicación EXCELENTE dentro de la ciudad de Nueva York. A pocas cuadras del Central Park y de Time Square. Increíbles vistas de la ciudad y muy buena atención por parte del personal. Desayuno adecuado en calidad y variedad con algunos problemas en la cantidad de gente/comodidades sobre todo los fines de semana. Una muy buena opción para alojarse en el centro de Manhattan y poder tener cierta autonomía en el manejo de los horarios y la comida sin depender siempre en comer en bares/restaurantes. Muy recomendable.

title: Far Above Expectations
text: From the onset, everything was excellent. Reception was always attentive and courteous, In particular, Meghan. The view from the room (Grand Times Square View) was 180 degrees of spectacular. Eating in the room at night with the lights of the city was something so special. Breakfast was plenty and good.

title: Customer service wins in the end!
text:
My husband and I recently visited New York and after extensive research decided on this hotel. The location is amazing! Within walking distance to many iconic landmarks, Time Square, Broadway shows, Central Park,  Museums and an abundance of restaurants. 

We were given a beautiful room on the 50th floor with an absolutely STUNNING 180 degree view. With the Hudson river, Time Square and Central Park all within view! Lovely during the day, mesmerising at night! 

During the first night of our stay a water pipe burst below us causing the hot water to the entire hotel to be shut off for repairs. This resulted in freezing cold showers and the uncomfortable exspirence of washing my hair in the shallow bathroom sink but understandably there was nothing that could be done by the hotel staff. The hot water remained off for the 2 days of our stay. 

The bigger problem was that the water damage caused 2 of the 4 elevators unusable. In such a large hotel with many higher levels unable to navigate coming and going any other way, this was extremely inconvenient and problematic. 30-45 minute waits for every elevator. Angry guests pushing and shoving into over crowded elevators. Again the unforseen event was not any fault of the hotel, these things sometimes happen, but I was disappointed that I did not see the hotel staff helping to maintain order better. 

After our trip I contacted corprate customer service to request part of my points refunded due to the difficulties during my stay. It was difficult to maintain communications but after the hotel manager made contact with me I was HIGHLY impressed with the excellent customer service. Not only did the manager validate my concerns and refund the points I had requested,  but went the extra mile and invited my husband and I back when we visit New York in the future, where we would be given VIP treatment. An unexpected and impressive offer!

Occationally things will happen that is out of the control of a business. The water pipe brake was such an event. The type of follow-up and attention a company extends after such an event says a lot about that companies customer service quality. Marriott continues to impress me as a company. 

This hotel displayed excellent customer service the entire time. From the friendly and accommodating front desk staff, breakfast staff, room attendants, and ending with the hotel manager addressing our situation. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

title: Terrible
text: One problem after another. First day, the room was not made up.  The haidryer broke down twice. A man opened the bedroom door without knocking when room had been made up. Very scary. Toiled clogged. No blankets on bed. Noisy room, fridge had to be disconnected. Breakast croissants and english muffins were always soggy. The price was very high and the hotel did not perform. A good option is the the New York Hudson Hotel.

title: We were actually there for 5 nights the good and bad ..
text:
I stay at a lot of hotels and consider myself someone who knows what to look for.  So my review is solely my perspective of a 5 night stay in Nov 2018 over Thanksgiving.  We actually were checked in to 2 different rooms.  There are specific things you should know about this hotel.
#1 - it has a very small lobby and shares the space with Courtyard.  Based on daily lobbies packed with luggage and waiting guests- it seems like early checkins may be problematic.  The same checkin desk handles both Residence inn And Courtyard.  The lobby in the winter cold had free hot chocolate and marshmallows.  That was awesome.  The first 30ish floors are Courtyard.  They have their own set of elevators.  The Residence Inn rooms start on floor 35 and they also have their own elevators.  About 5 elevators total for that side.  And the elevators are super tiny. While we were there at least one broke down daily.  So waiting for the elevator happened daily; but, it was maybe 5 minutes or less.  The harder part was if people were already with luggage as the elevator was super small.
There are only a few rooms per floor.  I want to say about 9 rooms.  I was told that rooms with 2 beds are not on the highest of floors - so something to keep in mind.
We were seeking a room with a spectacular view. The first room we got was a high floor ADA room that did not have the layout we were seeking.  The view had a small smidgen of Central Park but, was mostly buildings and construction.  But, that room did have a college sized separate refridgerator and a larger bathroom.  It did not have that plush white chair that you can see in some pictures on their website.  
The second room we moved to the next day had an amazing view on the 50th floor of Times Square, downtown and also the Hudson.  Ask for one of those rooms that has floor to ceiling windows- and also the plush white chair/table.  We thought the 50th floor was not high enough; but, we were actually able to see Macys balloons in the far distance from our room.  We also had an amazing view of times square.  There was a smaller tv- and not much else.  If you are thinking the room will be functional because of the kitchenette- it really is not.  The fridge is in a drawer and it is literally the size of a silverware drawer.  It is super small.  Completely not functional.  The freezer did not work right even after maintenance came.  There is a ice machine in the freezer; but, it did not work.  There is a hotel ice machine on a lower floor.  The microwave was fine.  But, we mainly wanted to use the fridge to store thanksgiving dinner.  Truthfully the drawer was just sad.  Do not think this is a typical Residence functional inn in that respect.  The fridge drawer never got cold enough.  Maintenance just couldn't get it cold enough.  We finally resorted to adding ice from the hotel ice machine in the freezer and fridge drawers.  Check online for videos that show you exactly what the kitchenette is.  If you are not needing a functional fridge to store things that really need to be cold - than it would be ok.  Other than the disappointment to no real fridge-  the room was amazing.  The bed was very comfortable.  The room was very clean.  The shower was walkin glass and very large.  The bathroom was smaller and the toilet was stuffed in between the wall and a counter; but, it worked.  The room had an amazing view and we never closed the curtains.  The city lights were spectacular from the bed.  One night it snowed and these Floridians cheered like kids on xmc morning.  Be aware though that the room is really small.  As most NYC rooms are.  We were lucky to get that comfy plush small white chair and table in the corner of the windows.  I can not stress this enough.  If you want to just sit and admire the view that chair is crucial.  So ask for a room with it.  The linens were upgraded.  The internet had a strong signal.   The best part of the hotel is the staff.  There is absolutely nothing they will not to do to make your stay amazing.  We interacted with many different staff members from maintenance, breakfast attendants, porters and front desk.  There was a complimentary breakfast every morning.  Standard fare.  No evening reception.  There was not one staff member that took away from our stay.  They each took a "can do" attitude to a new level.  They greeted us enthusiastically and just really made us feel as though our business was so appreciated.  The hotel was sold out several nights yet they handled the volume perfectly.  We were there over Thanksgiving and could not have had more memorable stay between the view and the staff.  If you are considering this location know that there are many restaurants and fast food within close walking distance.  A nice Italian and steak restaurant almost inside the hotel.  You are right down the street from where Stephen Colbert tapes.  Times Square is about 5 blocks away.  You are close to Central Park.  You are close to so much.  The area was good and we felt safe walking around.  I travel a lot for work and have a lot of experience with hotels and staff. This location is high on the list of my favorites.  We struggled whether to stay at this particular hotel and I am so glad we did.  Thankyou to the amazing staff for making our stay so memorable and special.  I highly recommend giving this hotel a try.
If you are cruising the taxi ride was about $5. to the port.

title: Good value for money in Manhattan
text:
I visited for 10 nights with my husband last february. We chose the hotel because of the great views and the excellent location, the rooms are situated in the top of a skyscaper. We payed extra for a grand times square view and thats what we got. To think back I would have chosen a central park view now. The room is spacious and clean, the maintenance even washed our dishes and helped with a missing glove.
Breakfast is included and it was okay. Lots of unhealthy food if you are in to it, but not much choise for fruits or greens.
I would definedly recommend this hotel for the price and the view. Nothing to complain.

title: Meh
text:
I was hoping for another good choice in that area so picked this Marriott for the night before the parade. The view from the room was spectacular and the front desk agent was friendly at check in.

Valet was awful, if you aren’t oversized try to find a local garage to park instead. 

When we checked into our room there were hairs visible on the pillows. We told the desk agent at checkout but they seemed unconcerned. 

The restaurant was absolutely useless with food allergies and had no ingredient list when we were starving after coming back from an event. Yes it’s nyc and we could just run out but we were exhausted and Marriotts have always been great with our food allergies. This staff was absolutely useless.

There are a lot of good hotels in this area. I wont recommend this one to my friends and colleagues. I am upset that I wasted 35,000 points on this room when I could have had a much better experience for that price.

title: Good location for NYC Marathon
text:
We stayed for 4 nights for the TCS NYC Marathon. I believe that most of the guests (if not all) were also runners. It is very convenient for runners as it located very near to central park (marathon finish area). It also served by multiple subway station nearby for an easy transportation around the city. There are plenty restaurant options in walking distance.

The room itself is on the small side, but we somehow managed to open our 2 big luggages with no problem. The bed and pillow is very comfortable. Bathroom size is enough with good water pressure. They did not provide any free bottled water (they sell one with price $9).

title: My home away from home in NY
text: I am very much looking forward to my fifth stay at the Residence Inn. As an amateur photographer, I am always impressed by the magnificent views from the room. The hotel is within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center.

title: Good location, ok hotel, not worthy of 4 stars though
text:
We had a Times Square view on the 54th floor and had a lovely skyline view. The room was a good size and had lots of drawer space. Everything was kept clean and the bed was very comfortable. However It took 2 notes two days running to housekeeping, 2 messages via the Marriott app a call to reception and a actual visit to reception before I finally got a shower cap in the third day - by which time I’d bought one from Duane Reade. (A small problem - unless you have long curly hair and the hotel has hairdryers but no diffuser and mine doesn’t fit theirs so I was trying to reduce the amount of mornings I had wet hair. )

Breakfast is in an enormous room and is adequate. we had no problem finding space but the food area is a little cramped. I generally grabbed a piece of fruit and a coffee but there was a ‘hot’ buffet, a cold section with cheese and yoghurts, cereals, a waffle maker and a selection of bread stuff. 

The ‘bar’ is just miserable. The only reason to go here is to continue using the hotels WiFi. It’s just a big open room with TVs. And the bar selections are quite limited which is probably why no one goes here. This is a monster space and could be a money generator for the hotel.... but sadly not. There is s nice bar next door though ! 

On a rainy day we were told by the duty manager ‘we don’t have umbrellas - you can go outside and buy one’. I was completely shocked. I expect this lack of amenity in a lower category hotel but not this one. It’s ‘supposed’ to be 4* I certainly wasn’t shocked with the attitude as sadly this has become the norm of n NYC. 

So all in all an average hotel. Paying 4 star prices for the level of service we had had in 2 or 3 star hotels. Oh and we have stayed over 120 days in SPG properties this year, 730 days in 10 years, and still don’t get any kind of preferred treatment. Location is the only reason to go back for us.

title: Correcto, limpio, bien ubicado, tiene pequeña cocina
text: El hotel comienza en el piso 35, los pisos de abajo corresponden a otro hotel, no todas las habitaciones tienen ventana grande, a mi me toco una con ventana chica, así que te conviene pedir esquineros.

title: Great location and service
text: Couldn't ask for a better location to spend time in NYC. Easy access to subways and taxis, this B'way spot is where you want to be. Rooms are updated and somewhat large than typical city hotel rooms. Lounge on 3 is a great spot to begin the day.

title: Never again what a disappointment
text:
Currently staying at this hotel for 6 nights. Checking in was an issue but all credit to staff they eventually sorted the problem. Unfortunately for my family travelling with me their room was not ready at 9pm. Why state check in is from 3pm if you cannot get a room until 9pm. Getting the rooms ready could not take that long because they certainly are not spending that much time cleaning them. Bathroom is old, you would not dare take a bath it is disgusting, couldn’t anyway no plug to push in, can not turn the cold water tap on over the sink it just won’t budge. The floors tiles are dirty in general it’s the worst bathroom I’ve ever had to use.  
The room is definitely not like the room picture used on the room key tag, hotel website gives a very false impression of this hotel. Unfortunately not much I can do now more family arriving today to celebrate my 60th Birthday, a big disappointment for us traveling all the way from Australia for such a special occasion. 
Only thing going for this hotel is it location.

title: On top of the World
text: Location is fantastic!!! I have to say that the breakfast should be better, it's a shame really that a nice hotel like this one doesn't offer guests a proper food variety for breakfast in the heart of NYC? Go for it Hilton you can do much, much better!! Another area that improvement should be "invested" is at the main reception, hiring much better well trained staff, a smile makes a huge difference ande be professional please, those Chinese, Brazilians and Italian(don't talk behind their backs just because some don't speak English fluently) they are paying your wages, just a little reminder PLEASE!!

title: Staff is so friendly!!
text: First time at this location and I was very pleased. Front desk staff was so friendly and welcoming (thank you Megan). Rooms in New York are always tight, but this Residence Inn has figured out how to comfortable put a lot in to a very small space. Great views, great bars and restaurants, only a short walk to theaters and Times Square.

title: Return visit not as nice
text: I recently stayed at the Residence Inn, mainly because I enjoyed my stay there last year.  This year my stay was not as nice.  The location, the view. and the furnishings are all still positives.  However, the service seems to have declined.  One day my room was serviced, but only partially (i.e. wastebaskets not emptied).  Another day my room was not serviced at all.  When I called the front desk about the second situation, an apology was offered but no explanation given.  On more than one morning, the breakfast buffet was not completely set up (no fruit set out yet, batter for the waffle maker not replenished) despite arriving 45 minutes after the start time.  Perhaps this was just a temporary blip, but I expect more for the prices charged.

title: Bien placé
text:
Hôtel très bien placé dans Manhattan entre Times Square et Central Park. 10 nuits en octobre, un personnel à l'écoute même si notre anglais est très moyen. Une très belle vue de la chambre depuis le 42ième étage entre Hudson et Central Park. Une bonne literie, une chambre et une salle de bain propre. Le coin cuisine est pratique mis à part un congélateur pouvant être bruyant. La chambre quant à elle est petite, surtout rien pour ranger les bagages et le placard unique est trop petit pour un séjour de 11 jours, mais on s'adapte et on n'y passe que la nuit dans la chambre.
A noter un Wi-fi excellent.
Le gros point noir de cet hôtel est le petit déjeuner qui n'est pas digne d'un 4*. Que ce soit le salé (œufs brouillés, saucisse, ...) ou le sucré (pain de mie, croissant ??, confiture, ...) aucune saveur pour l'ensemble des produits qui sont vraiment des produits premier prix de base. Prenez plutôt votre petit déjeuner dans votre chambre avec des produits acheter dans les "market".
Pour finir, si vous réservez cet hôtel, faites le avec un site type de résa sur Internet et pas celui de Marriot qui est plus cher le plus souvent et qui ne satisfait aucune de vos demandes faites sur le site de l'hôtel lors de la résa.

title: The tallest hotel as my home away from home!
text:
Residence Inn by Marriott NY Manhattan/Central Park is an awesome hotel not to be missed. With our positive experience with the Residence Inn London Bridge, we had high hopes for this NYC stay in late September. It didn’t disappoint. The tallest hotel in the Western Hemisphere, it offers the best views of Manhattan imaginable. Thanks to the friendly Front Desk Manager, Melissa, our suite is on the very high 56th floor (highest is 65th) on the Broadway side. Before arrival we had hoped for a corner suite with also the Central Park view, but it seemed that none of the corner suites was in our preferred twin-bed setting. Anyway, the view of sunrise through the floor to ceiling window impressed us enough and made up for everything. An added bonus was that we could check the temperature and weather by taking a quick look at the Weather Star on the roof of 1740 Broadway before going out!

There was nothing we didn’t like about our suite. It was very spacious, with one queen and one twin beds (both very comfortable) and, good news for those who had work to deal with, also a huge (I mean huge) desk. The bathroom, also spacious, was clean and offered good-quality toiletries and plenty of towels. If we had to make a suggestion for improvement, it would be a replacement of the towels that were too tired and rough (one of my biggest pet peeves). 

Like other Residence Inns, there is a fully-equipped kitchen in every suite. Since we were in The Big Apple, we thought we might skip cooking altogether and instead try out different highly-rated restaurants. Free breakfast was offered on the 4th floor (shared with guests of the Courtyard by Marriott which occupies the lower floors), again as with Residence Inns elsewhere. Unfortunately, the breakfast was rather disappointing, with limited choices and slow refill of food and coffee—quite unlike what we had experienced in other Marriott’s and Residence Inns. On the second morning, we decided to try somewhere else, and chanced upon Astro. We were happy we did! Their pancakes and omelette were delicious and served quickly.

Will we be back to Residence Inn by Marriott NY Manhattan/Central Park? Certainly, because of the view, the home-away-from-home convenience, the location and, of course, Melissa.

title: Perfekte Lage und Aussicht
text:
Wir waren im September 7 Nächte in einem Grand Times Square View Room im 57. Stock. Das Zimmer war für die Lage und den Preis recht geräumig und gut eingerichtet, die Aussicht ist umwerfend, die Betten bequem. Dank der Höhe ist das Zimmer auch - trotz der Lage mitten in Midtown - sehr ruhig.
Die Lage ist für einen ersten Aufenthalt in New York sehr gut: Central Park, MoMa, die Museen von Upper East Side, die Sehenswürdigkeiten von Midtown, die High Line und Chelsea, selbst Soho und Lower East Side sind für passionierte Fussgänger zu Fuss erreichbar; U-Bahn-Stationen sind direkt beim Hotel. 
Das Frühstück ist zwar im Zimmerpreis inbegriffen, war aber für unsere europäischen Gaumen leider schlicht ungeniessbar. Wir haben nach einigen Tagen in Restaurants der Umgebung gefrühstückt. Das Hotel hat im 35. Stock Waschmaschinen für die Hotelgäste, die mit Kreditkarte funktionieren, aber auch einen Laundry-Service.

title: Nice Stay, Great Location
text:
We had a really nice stay at the Residence Inn. We had a clean modern room right in the middle of Times Square. Perfect location after a Broadway show. 

There wasn’t much of a lobby, pretty much just an area with the front desk.  All was good though. The hotel was just what we needed. Room was quiet and the bed was comfy. The bathroom was very modern and clean too. I’d stay here again.  Below is a view from our room.

title: Bueno
text:
Las habitaciones son bonitas, las camas cómodas, tienen una pequeña área de cocina
El desayuno está bien, pero no es muy variado 
No se si es porque estaba cerca del cuarto eléctrico pero cada vez que se activaba la calefacción sonaba un golpe que me despertaba cada vez

title: Downtown NYC Stay
text: This hotel is very clean and crisp.  It has furnishing and a setup on the very sleek side.  The bathroom is small with a tiny sink.  Given its location it is a very lovely clean place and we forgave the smallish stylish rooms.  We were on the 45th floor corner room with a wonderful view of the city.  We used our points to stay here so in a way the price was right at 35,000 points.  So, if you are downtown NYC to see the Book of Mormon as we did this is the perfect place..The bad of this trip was not the hotels.  I decided not to go back to the airport to get a car for our trip to Maine, so I drove into town.  In short, this is a nightmare of a city and I would recommend not ever driving in it.  Traffic laws and civility are ignored.

title: Vue époustouflante !
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel pendant 9 nuits au mois de septembre. L’accueil était un peu expéditif mais professionnel.  
Notre chambre se situait au 51e étage avec vue sur Times Square. 
La vue était magique, de jour comme de nuit. Notre chambre était très propre, et très bien équipée avec un coin kitchenette (Lave-vaisselle, frigo, bouilloire..). 
La literie était très confortable avec un lit king size. 
La salle de bain était moderne avec une douche à l’italienne. 
Le petit déjeuner était très copieux, avec un choix de pain, de fruits, de fromages, de gaufres ou encore des produits salés. (Seul point négatif , la clim était froide, il faut penser à prendre un petit pull ;) )
Quant à l’emplacement de l’hôtel, il est juste parfait à deux pas de Times Square et de Central Park.
Si je retourne à New York, je n’hésiterai pas à retourner dans cet hôtel.

title: Excellent Choice in Good Location
text:
My husband and I stayed here for five nights in mid September. I had purchased Hamilton tickets in January, 2018 and was very excited about our trip to New York. I chose the Residence Inn at Central Park for several reasons. It was in a good location, had a refrigerator and microwave, and all the rooms have floor to ceiling windows. The hotel is located on floors 34 to 65 of the building located on 53rd St and 8th Avenue. The Courtyard is located on the lower floors. They share the dining room where a free breakfast is served. 
We were able to check in early and got a beautiful corner room on the 64th floor.
The room was large by New York standards . It had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The bed was nice and towels were soft. Everyone was nice and helpful. You won’t be disappointed if you decide to stay here.

title: Fantastic views, fantastic service
text:
One thing that really impressed me about my stay is the front-desk service. They were very friendly and professional and let us check in early and check out late (I am a rewards member). The rooms were clean, beds were comfy, and the views were incredible. 

I do want to leave one piece of feedback for the hotel to improve. It's fairly minor which is why I still gave 5 stars. The little restaurant on the fourth floor has a lot of issues. I ordered an $18 personal pepperoni pizza for dinner since we were running low on time before our Broadway show. It was one of the worst pizzas I have ever eaten, and it wasn't cheap. I could go to the grocery store, buy a $3.00 Red Baron frozen pepperoni pizza, heat it up in the oven for 15 minutes, and it would be significantly better than the pizza this restaurant is serving. The restaurant/cafe also sells individual bananas, which cost about 10 cents each, for $3.00. I think you need to have a conversation with the person who manages this restaurant/cafe on the fourth floor. They are not doing a good job.

title: Manager needs customer service training
text:
I recently stayed in the Residence Inn and Courtyard. My first few weeks were in Courtyard and I then moved to the Residence Inn floor.
The Residence Inn rooms as depicted in other reviews are in need of minor repairs as stated in other reviews.
Generally speaking most of the staff at the front desk was very helpful.
The location was great and the view from the room very nice.
My problem came the day of checkout and it all went down hill from there.
I asked for a late check out so that I could move to a different hotel due to meetings for the UN events.
I took my luggage to my new hotel and realized I was missing a belt.
I went back to the hotel and was told I could not return to the room without security.
I explained that I had not yet checked out of the hotel.
I eventually went back to the rooma nd could not locate the belt.
I was not sure if perhaps someone had already done a sweep of the room.
I left and called back to the hotel and asked that someone please ask the housekeeper if he or she had found a belt.
I was told that I had to speak to lost and found.
Let me explain that on the Courtyard side I had left a phone charger in my room when I moved from Courtyard to Residence Inn and no one could locate my phone charger.
With that in mind I did not have much faith in the lost and found system in the hotel.
I eventually spoke to a manager and it was one of the more bizarre conversations I have ever had, bar none.
She was beyond rude.
During my stay I had told the nousekeepers they did not have to clean the room every day only every other day. I had noticed that the vanity area around the sink was sticky and that the floor did not appear to have been mopped and I did call and complain.
When trying to explain that I wanted someone to check that my belt had not been perhaps thrown out the manager said that I had a problem with housekeeping because I asked that the vanity be cleaned and the floor mopped.
I was really taken aback given that the total of my bill upon departure was 13,401.00.
I was there for medical treatments for a client and UN meetings and originally found the hotel to be a very good location. Never again.

title: Highs and Lows
text:
We stayed for 6 nights in October.  The hotel is well located (within a few blocks of Times Square, theaters, and a number of subway lines), clean, comfortable, well maintained (caveat as to elevators), and (for NYC) reasonably priced. We had a room on the 50th floor with a nice view, and a kitchenette (microwave, refrigerator, sink, and dishwasher).  I would think twice about staying here again, however,  as opposed to the many other properties in the neighborhood based on:

Really small room.  Gracious, there was literally no place to put our suitcases down!  The closet is quite small, too.  Mind you, we've been to NYC at least 10 times, and we know the rooms are small, but this seemed particularly so.  Its an odd shaped building on the upper floors, so some rooms are likely to be better in this respect than others.

Elevator service.  The Residence Inn portion of this property (the top half, the bottom is a Courtyard with its own elevators) has 4 elevators.  Obviously if you're on the 50th floor, you need to use them.  Suffice it to say each elevator has posted in it a sign warning of the times of the day when traffic is such that you may need to wait for an elevator for some time.  When we tried to check out on Sat. (and hence had our suitcases with us) we actually had 2 different groups give up and WALK DOWN rather than continuing to wait. (Two of the 4 elevators were out of service.)

Breakfast.  Yup its included, and the room (shared with the Courtyard people) is actually nice.  I wouldn't bother with it though, because apparently the staff doesn't bother either. When we came down they were out of scrambled eggs and meat and it didn't get refilled until after we had already had a hard boiled egg and yogurt instead.  The croissants were just bread shaped like a croissant. Ugh.  We did not go back after that first morning. You can do better for a reasonable price elsewhere. 

Concierge.  We have been to NYC enough that we don't often use this service, but if its important to you, it seems to be an afterthought for the hotel. It is stuck in the back of a hall where the elevator bank is, in a dark corner.  It didn't even have the current week's "Time Out" magazine when we asked for a copy, nor were we impressed by the staff's attitude about it.

We thought that there had been little thought given to how the kitchen was stocked.  For one thing, there was a full panoply of metal cooking pans in the drawer, but no stove to use them on- just a microwave.  So they are wasted. There is a dishwasher, but frankly it seems easier to just hand wash and rinse the few dishes we used.  Too bad there is no dish soap (when we asked, we got additional dishwasher soap) or a sponge or something to wash them with. (Just a query:  what happens when a guest fails to wash the dishes in the dishwasher?  Does the staff actually run the dishwasher to clean them before the next guest?  That would take quite some time!  As in any place where you don't know, I would wash the dishes and silverware myself before using them.)

Finally, housekeeping on one day managed not to get to our room at all by the time we had returned at about 4:30 pm.  By that time, we just wanted to lie down for a bit, so we missed out on the housekeeping that day.

So, the hotel is ok, but but they have issues to work on!

title: great location, great price for mid town
text:
Finding a hotel is NYC is daunting.  You can spend tons of money and be looking at a brick wall in a noisy area.  This Marriott Residence Inn was beyond our expectations.  The room was small, but very chic and well appointed.  Because we were in the Residence Inn section, we had a small fridge, dishwasher, sink and cabinets full of kitchen items.  Our room on he 48th floor had a nice view of the Hudson River, very comfortable bed with 2 side chairs and a small table.  Lighting was great.  Power outlets were voluminous and it was super clean.  The shower and bathroom area were also well appointed with excellent water pressure and cleanliness as well.

This hotel is actually a combination of a Residence Inn and Courtyard and has 2 sets of elevators for the respective hotels,  There are 65 floors and a very elaborate breakfast for American standards.  The front desk staff was very friendly and there is a concierge on site, though we did not need one.  The location is near the theatre district, but also a short walk to the park, great shopping and citi-bikes.  I felt the location was perfect for our tourist visit and night at Broadway.  It is not a boutique hotel, nor the Plaze, but the prices were very NY-reasonable.  We were pleased by the value and quality.  Will recommend to other tourists.

title: Hotel muy deficiente
text:
El cuarto es muy pequeño para dos personas, con cortinas rotas y manchadas, el sillón rayado con lapicero. Sábanas rotas, toallas manchadas.
Muy poco espacio para guardar ropa, la dotación de la cocina incompleta.
La limpieza deja mucho que desear, no desocupan los basureros todos los días.
El filtro del aire acondicionado no lo han cambiado desde que estrenaron el hotel!
Cuando llegamos no había jabón ni shampoo y aunque pedimos, trajeron solo shampoo.
El desayuno es caótico y si algo se acaba no lo reponen de inmediato o del todo no lo hacen.
Nos llegó un paquete y no nos avisaron.

title: Fabulous
text:
We stayed here for two nights in September 2018 and really enjoyed the hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff were great. Always professional and smiling. We requested an early check in as we had arrived from a cruise ship. This request was granted with a smile and courtesy by the front desk agent ( I think her name was Alla). As noted by others the location is perfect. The breakfast was more than adequate with fruits, yogurt, eggs, bacon etc.
We reserved a high floor corner room. Recommend room 6205 for the most fantastic views exactly as seen on the hotel website. We did not want to leave the room. Our check out was a breeze and the staff once again excelled with their kindness in looking after our needs. Special thanks to Eric for helping us get a taxi during a very busy time in NYC.

title: Great stay!
text: We chose this hotel for our long weekend in NYC. The service was helpful, the room was clean and well appointed, the view fabulous, the location so convenient to Central Park, Times Square, multiple subway lines, and good walking to several sites, and the hot breakfast was such an added bonus. We would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. The elevators were fast and convenient and I really have no complaints about our stay at all!

title: Complimentary breakfast needs improvment
text: RIs are our favorite Marriott property. Many RIs vary their egg offering from scrambled (with and without yoke) to fried to omelette. Not this place. Many RIs vary their meat offering. Not this place. Many RIs keep the food refreshed. Not this place. On Friday, I reported they were out of 2% milk. It was not replaced until Sunday. Although you pay for this breakfast, there are made nearby restaurants where you can eat much better. We stay here because of its location. Central Park is four blocks away. The theater district is five blocks away. Numerous restaurants are nearby. Our small corner room had a view of Central Park (obstructed somewhat by nearby skyscrapers) and the east side of Manhattan. Our floor was quiet. Staff were friendly.

title: Excellent Staff, great stay, average breakfast, great location
text:
This hotel is located conveniently between Times Square and Central Park. From here it's only two blocks to the subway and a few more to Rockefeller plaza and fifth avenue.
Really great location. The Residence Inn is the upper part of the tower and the views are great. This was a Marriott Reward stay and upon arrival, the friendly staff, Wioleta, welcomed us to the hotel. Great service as we were allowed to check in several hours early and received a great room with a view of times square from the sky! (5707).

The breakfast is also in a great high ceiling room, but the freshness of bagels and croissants is nothing to write home about, but it was free and included.
The hotel also has a beautiful 35th floor fitness area with city views from the sky while working out. Overall a great place. Would recommend.

title: GREAT stay here!!!
text: I go to NYC quite often but had never stayed here. It is GREAT! We were on the 59th floor with GORGEOUS city views. And, the breakfast, which we figured would not be much, was a FULL breakfast & very good. The only improvement with breakfast would be to have options for flavoring your coffee. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly & helpful. My niece who was with me wanted the room cooler but I'm cold natured. I called downstairs and within a few minutes I had an extra blanket for my bed. I will definitely stay here again!!!

title: Perfect location & a great hotel
text: Great location, great hotel, very friendly and helpful staff! We got a room on the 63rd floor and the view was amazing! I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. We stayed for 7 days and nights and we were really happy all the time we were there. We had breakfast included on our stay and they had pretty good choices on the breakfast buffet and also a Starbucks on the floor above! We really want to stay here again someday when we come back to NYC!

title: Stellar place to stay
text: This was our first stay here and I will definitely be back. The entire staff is friendly,  professional,  and helpful.  Melissa and Abel were our initial contact and they set us up in an amazing room with everything we needed. They were so genuinely caring and made us feel so welcome, like family. Breakfast was good , the location was central to everything, the rooms had all the amenities, house keeping was fast and thorough,and our stay was fabulous. We come to NY 2 or 3 times a year and really were impressed with this property. Cudos to EVERYONE that works there.

title: Genial
text: Quelle bonne surprise! Hôtel superbe, personnel aimable, souriant et agréable. Le ménage de la chambre était parfait. Étant allergique aux plumes nous avons demandé d'autres oreillers que nous avons eu aussitôt. Nous avions un studio lit king size vu sur ville au 43e étage et nous n'avons pas était déçu!! Coin cuisine impeccable avec frigo, lave vaisselle, bouilloire et cafetière. La wifi gratuite passe parfaitement. Le buffet du petit déjeuner est très varié : viennoiserie, gaufres, charcuterie, omelette, pomme de terre,yaourt, céréales, fruits... café, thé, chocolat... notre séjour à été très agréable. A 10 minutes de time square et central park. On recommande à 100%

title: Ужасный завтрак и супер маленький номер
text:
Выбрали этот отель из за красивого вида. Собственно это все плюсы отеля. Все остальное ужасно!

1) Завтрак - просто супер отвратительный 🤮 , маленький выбор, а что есть невкусное! 

2) Номер хоть и 20м, на самом деле супер маленький- чемоданы поставить некуда, покупки из магазинов поставить некуда, а почему? Потому что половина номера занимает кухня! Кухня?? 😱 зачем? Это же отель, а не дача! 

3) Плюс ко всему холодильник ОЧЕНЬ сильно шумит, почти каждую ночь просыпались от его тарахтения.

title: Celebrating a Special Occassion
text:
The hotel is in a great location, a couple blocks south of Central Park and a few blocks north of Times Square. Easy access to the subway as well.It's very clean and the rooms are fantastic.
 We stayed in a top floor (65) corner room and it was breathtaking! The service and the staff were very professional,helpful and courteous.
From the moment we checked in, O'Neal J. was terrific in getting us squared away. And a very special thanks to Jamie B who surprised us on our visit. It was terrific !
We will definitely stay there again next visit to NYC.

title: Extremely Disappointed/will not be returning
text: We had been looking forward to this trip for months since it was the first part of our honeymoon. Upon arrival front desk notified me that I checked in already and my room was ready. Someone on the hotels end checked in for me which I don’t know how. I wanted a Central Park View room. The woman who was helping us told me they were sold out but that she’s making a note for us to be moved the next day which was fine. No one ever called the next day to move us or to follow up with the request AT ALL. No one ever called throughout our entire stay.The second night we had plumbing issues. We couldn’t use the bathroom all night because water kept randomly filling up and wouldn’t flush. We forced ourselves to sleep and the next morning it still didn’t work. I called and explained to them that my husband and I are germaphobes and if they had another room my husband could use the bathroom in that would be great. The man went on to tell me how my husband and I can use the bathroom on the third or fourth floor. This was the bathroom all of the guests were using during breakfast.I told him that’s not an option for us and I would appreciate it if he could us a bathroom in a clean room.He told me all the rooms are sold out. I don’t know how Check in promised us another room to move into the next day if they are ALL SOLD OUT. Not sure who was lying and who was just plain lazy to move us to the room that was promised to us. The conversation went nowhere and he abruptly ends the call with me. He hung up on me while I was still talking to him. Twenty minutes later the engineer comes to our room with a plastic bag and a huge plunger. Water is spilling out everywhere and he puts the plunger in a plastic bag over the towels, our shoes etc and leaves. I called front desk immediately and asked for them to send housekeeping to disinfect our room (toilet, bathroom floor and door handles). I also called them back two minutes later and asked if housekeeping could bring us more towels and those were never brought to us either. The guy I was speaking too could care less and the staff members were promising things that were clearly out of their control.For someone who is staying at the hotel and using their points during their honeymoon they could’ve handled both situations much better and with less of an attitude towards silver elite Marriott rewards members. I want my points back! I will not be recommending this hotel or ever returning.What was suppose to be a memorable trip was not because staff could care less about their guests!

title: Amazing!
text: Wow, check in smooth. We were allocated room 6205, three floors down from the top, corner king suite Times Square view. I was actually speechless when entering the room, the views were absolutely stunning. You had everything you needed in your room, dishwasher, fridge, freezer, microwave, iron and board, hairdryer. I was amazed at how well it all fitted in. The shower was incredible. Ice machine on the 35th floor. Lifts were great no wait time at any time when we were there. Bed was super comfy. We left the curtains open all the time during our week stay. Breakfast was delicious great variety to choose from, set us up for the busy days ahead. This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. All staff friendly and courteous. Thank you for making our holiday to New York so special we won’t forget.

title: Above and Beyond
text: My wife and I stayed there for four nights and the people could not have been nicer and helpful. The room was clean, well-appointed with nice amenities, and the people were very responsive to our needs. Furthermore, they were always friendly, despite the busy nature of the hotel. They quickly took care of an issue with the room, which was our doing, and they also found some items of clothing I inadvertently left behind and are shipping them back to me. Any time we return to New York, we will stay there.

title: VIVEZ DANS UNE CARTE POSTALE  !!!!
text:
Nous étions au 42 ème étage dans un studio avec lit king size (très confortable) kitchenette (frigo-lave-vaisselle-plaque de cuisson-congélateur-couverts- cafetière et bouilloire).et salle d'eau douche américaine.
Nous avions d'un côté la vue sur centrale Park et de l'autre le Hudson.
l'hôtel est tout prêt de time square et donne sur broadway. c'est un vrai bonheur
l'accueil est de qualité et le personnel très serviable et à l'écoute.
Le point noir c'est le petit déjeuner. la climatisation est poussée à l'extrême et croyez moi ca réveille !!!! Il faut donc se couvrir comme en hiver pour prendre son petit déjeuner.la salle est belle mais le  mobilier n'est pas confortable et inapproprié pour petit déjeuner. Les produits ne sont pas de qualité en salade de fruit il n'y a rien d'autre que du melon et de la pastèque quant aux viennoiseries c'est très bas de gamme. C'est une salle commune donc l'ambiance bruit et propreté est discutable mais le comportement de client indélicat est plus préjudiciable.
C'est un hôtel que je recommande et où j'aurais plaisir à revenir et surtout merci au personnel pour leur courtoisie.

title: Great stay
text: We had some difficulties to find the hotel as we came to New York for the first time and we traveled by car. Neither gps or the phone could find the address, however, we managed to do so after few circles around. Valet parking was great and the guy very friendly, check in went smoothly and we got a room on the 42 floor. It had amazing view of the skyline. Bed was very comfortable to sleep in, close to all the main attractions (Times Square, central park, etc). Complimentary breakfast was very nice, a lot of choice, quality food. Really enjoyed the stay. Marriott never disappoints. Definately recommend

title: hotel bellissimo in posizione ottima
text:
abbiamo soggiornato 9 notti in questo hotel ad agosto. camera al 49mo piano con vista stupenda (camera standard).
bagno pulito e pulizia giornaliera con cambio asciugamani sempre impeccabile.
hotel in posizione perfetta. 5 minuti a piedi da central park e 10 da times square .
sala colazione bellissima con tantissima varietà di cibo (colazione europea e americana)
palestra e lavanderia al 35mo piano.
CONSIGLIATISSIMO

title: Perfect!
text: This hotel was beautiful and a nice view, we loved it!  It’s’ central location, near the theater district, Times Square and Central Park makes it an almost perfect place to stay.  On 54th Street, near Broadway, you can also walk to the far end of the West side to take The Beast or take the subway to South Ferry and the Wall Street area (Bull and Little Girl) as well as the boat to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.

title: IMPRESSIONANTE
text: Posso solo dire che il soggiorno in questo hotel vale il viaggio a NewYork. Non ho parole per descrivere l'incredibile vista dalla camera. Posto una foto e lascio a voi trovare le parole giuste. Altri servizi perfetti, tra cui ottima ed abbondante colazione, palestra al 35°piano e posizione centralissima su TimeSquare.

title: Business overnight stay, good choice
text: Centrally located, modern amenities and decor.  We booked a conference room during the day for our meeting.  The meeting room was quiet and well equipped.  Check in to our hotel rooms was quick though the rooms weren't available until almost 4pm.  Room (suites) were clean and comfortable with great views of the city skyline.  Plenty of hot water and comfortable AC.  Breakfast buffet was adequate.  Hotel was quiet during our mid week stay but fully booked.

title: Mahtava
text:
Erinomaisella paikalla, kävely matka joka paikkaan lyhyt. Hieno hotelli, todella siisti, Vastasi täydellisesti kuvausta. Suosittelen 5/5. Ystävällinen henkilökunta. Siivous erinomainen. Kätevä pieni keittiö. Upeat näkymät huoneesta. Hyvä ilmastointi. Erinomaiset sängyt. Hieno ja toimiva kylpyhuone. Wifi hyvä. Tulisin uudestaan. 

Aamupala kohtalainen, yksitoikkoinen, hedelmiä/vihanneksia/kasviksia parina aamuna viikosta.

title: Good choice
text:
Modern hotel. Perfect location. Really nice view from higher floors. Staff is very kind.

The aircondition is killing. It is totally exaggerated like everywhere in the US. The breakfast is quite poor. Much under european standards.

All in al good choice if you wanna stay in central Manhattan.

title: perfectly good residence inn
text:
Check in was fast but there was no upgrade for Platinum status nor was there a platinum welcome gift.

The room was VERY small by residence inn standards and didn't even have a chair or sofa to sit.

Gym was OK with nice modern cardio equipment but not much in the way of weights.

Laundry room was very convenient with credit card payment which saves having to get quarters.  

Location is excellent for central park and several metro stations.  

Breakfast was nice but things were not replenished very quickly and picking up garbage was slow, so the room gets very messy later in the breakfast period.

Elevators are quite slow... maybe low floors are better but I'm not sure.  

Nothing wrong with this place but nothing special about it either.  I'll try something different next time just to see what might be better.

title: Eccellente Posizione 📍
text:
Questo Hotel di eccellente ha solo la posizione! A due passi dal Time Square, e a pochi minuti da Central park, dal Top of the Rock e dalla 5 Av. Ci sono varie fermate della Metro. Market e farmacie. E qualsiasi cosa vi serva! 
Per il resto darei a questo Hotel non più di 3 stelle. La colazione non è sempre ben assortita. Noi non abbiamo mai trovato il bacon per esempio! O i pan cake tipici nelle colazioni americane.. né altri dolci. Solo waffel da fare al momento e pane, affettati, cheddar e Philadelphia, uova strapazzate e odiosi wurstel. Potrebbero arricchirla un pochino, almeno chi non può mangiare niente come me.. Può avere più scelta. Camere pulite, ma attenzione alla tata perché potrebbe entrare mentre siete ancora in stanza alle 9 del mattino. Al 4 piano c'è l'ennesimo Starbucks. Al 35 una palestra per i più fissati, anche se una corsetta a Central park è decisamente meglio! L'hotel non dispone di Spa Wellness e di un Rooftop (grande mancanza!) Altrimenti sarebbe perfetto. Il personale è gentile.. piccolo consiglio: al momento del check in chiedete la camera al piano più alto possibile. La veduta sarà mozzafiato! Noi eravamo al 55° piano. 
Ci tornerei solo per la posizione davvero strategica. Lo consiglio.

title: Parfait
text:
C'était parfait, notre chambre était magnifique, une chambre en angle au 57ème étage, chambre 5705 une tuerie............

Ménage impeccable, très sympa, le seul hic, ils ne parlent pas un mot de français.
Petit déj, rien à dire, parfait 
Ascenseurs, nous n'avons jamais eu d'attente, nous étions souvent seuls même le petit déjeurner au 3ème étage, jamais trop de monde.
Par contre, si vous souhaitez une plaque pour faire cuire, il faut la réserver à l'avance.

Séjour magnifique

title: perfect location, great breakfast buffet, modern bathroom
text: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel last weekend. The location is perfect! We were close enough to Central Park to work out there before our jam-packed days exploring the city. Our room was the typical NYC hotel room size (small), but very nice. Our bed was especially comfortable and we both slept like bricks. The bathroom was really nice, with a modern look and sleep fixtures. The breakfast buffet offered much more than I had expected: waffles, eggs, potatoes, breakfast meats, Greek yogurt, tons of breads and bagels and pastries, cheeses, fresh whole fruit, and cold and hot cereals. We had a Cuisinart coffee maker in the room as well, which was really nice because we could have our coffee in the room before our run. The staff was kind and helpful, especially Oneil, who checked us in. I would return here in a heartbeat.

title: hotel fantastico
text: abbiamo soggiornato una settimana in questo hotel, beh che dire personale tutto molto cordiale e carino,camere sempre ben pulite,colazione ottima, una fortuna calcolando la difficoltà di trovarla non a pagamento a New york, ogni giorno frutta e piatti caldi diversi, posizione ottima si può arrivare praticamente ovunque, le camere iniziano dal 35 piano dunque la vista è assicurata a tutti io era al 63 piano quasi in cima praticamente e che dire una vista fantastica!! hotel perfetto consigliato veramente.

title: Worst experience!!!
text: I booked two rooms at this hotel I arrived at 3 am and before my arrival I made a request for two beds in one of the rooms but when I got there they had not reserved a room with two beds for us, so one of us had to sleep on the floor. We got to the room and the air conditioner was not working we complained they offered us fans unbelievable!!!the staff was rude we actually fell asleep waiting for the fans they never brought them, in morning we told manager what happened she blamed us for the air conditioning not working. I will never stay here after the way we were treated I just couldn’t believe they would have the ordacity to blame us and treat us so badly by far worst experience ever!!!!!!

title: One of the staff at the front desk could ruin your expectation of NY trip.
text:
!. If you are planning to trip to NY for the first time for just 3 days, this would be a good choice because of its location, and you may have little chance of meeting one of the staffs who has quite different attitudes towards guests. 
2. If you are traveling to NY more than 5 days, you wouldn't be satisfied due to its location- dirty street, croweded all the time, angry taxies' horning, and dirty garbages waiting to be picked up which takes up half of the street at night. 
3. If you are non-white, I suggest you consider this hotel one more time, because you may ruin your trip due to one of the staffs at the front desk.( Only one I got very upset, other staff members were fine. However, I happened to speak to her more than three times. That was the problem.)Her language was very rude, and sullen face and arrogant attitude always displeased us.) And I realized that when she talks to whites, her attitude changes drastically. Don't argue. Since I was there over 15 days, it was not a difficult thing to catch, and I regret choosing this residence Inn by Marriot for my trip to NY. 
4. If you are not lucky, you may be have a room with broken freezer, battery-out safe, and not- closing-well drawer. Freezer and safe, we called for reparing right away, but what about drawer? We noticed that after a night, and did not want to move to another room due to heavy luggage. And what about there were other problems even though we moved to another room? 
5. If you open the window due to the dust, you could have a good sleep with mosquitoes. We also found one big fly.
6. If you want to get some mail, well, they never notice you. You have to check all the time. Once I checked up whether I had a package for me, they said there wasn't a package for me. However, I logged in to UPS to track and found the name of the person who recevied my package! I went down there again to tell his name to get my package. If you meet the one staff I mentioned above, you may feel very bad due to her annoyed look and rude behavior.
7. Never expect to have a late-check out for an hour. Even though we have stayed there for more than 15 days, she(unfortunately I had to speak to her as there were no other staff at that time.) said, "Well, only 30 minutes. not 13. 30." How grateful!

I hope that you have a good sense of chooosing a nice hotel in NY.

title: Bellissimo hotel con posizione ottima!
text:
Io e mio marito abbiamo soggiornato qua una settimana alla fine di maggio. La posizione dell’hotel è ottimale! A due passi dalla fermata di Columbus Circle (da cui passano diverse linee), a 5 min a piedi da Time Square o da Central Park e dalla 5 av. La stanza era molto bella, pulita, spaziosa e con una piccola cucina attrezzata con tutto(mai usata però!)...eravamo al 56 piano e la vista su Manhattan era davvero spettacolare! La prima colazione buona e ben fornita di tutto, dal salato al dolce, dalla frutta fresca alle uova e pancetta. Si consuma in un bell’ambiente con poltrone e banconi attaccati alle vetrate che danno sulla Broadway. A disposizione degli ospiti ci sono anche due pc con stampante. Al 35 piano c’è la palestra ben fornita con vista su Time Square. Allo stesso piano c’è la lavanderia con le macchine a gettone.
Il personale è gentile, sorridente e disponibile. Siamo molto soddisfatti della nostra scelta e sicuramente quanto torneremo a NY riprenoteremo qua!

title: LOVE this hotel & staff
text: This hotel and staff are amazing.  These other reviews that fault them- are blaming them for things out of their control. NYC hotel is efficient- energy conserving- and spacious -compared to any other hotel room of any friend's at at any place have seen... the staff are helpful and kind, just ask!  and be grateful in return.  Rodney, all the gentleman downstairs at night were kind & thoughtful, professional even at 3-4 am checkin Sat morning- Pamela- kind, gentle, helpful-- we had nightmare travel issues (NOT the staff's fault)- the hotel- down to housekeeping and elevator technicians were so kind.  I am from SC & these are hospitable kind people- and I never want to stay anywhere else. Perfect location- walk to Central Park or Times Square & Ed Sullivan Theatre and Hello Deli right around corner- go see Rupert! (Love)  and my family LOVED this hotel! I just pray I get to go back one day soon -- shout out to everyone who helped us!!

title: Very problematic service
text:
The hotel has lots of good things:
Nice room, comfortable bed, nice views, nice location, nice gym. But there is a problem with service there.

We had to ask EVERY SINGLE SMALL REQUEST at least 4 times:

Out of 6 nights our room was cleaned twice. We had to beg them to clean our room basically. 

After cleaning still no fresh towels or soaps.

Our fridge made horrible sounds--had to call 10 times in order to get someone to fix it. It was cleaned on the 5th night.. 

The maid left our door open after cleaning. 

Staff was never nice or welcoming at all. 

We did get a lot of compensations eventually and this is the only reason I gave this hotel an average review and not less. 
It's not the compensation that will make someone come back to your hotel.. FIX YOUR SERVICE! IT'S BAD!
I travel a lot for business and never had such a bad hotel services...

title: Well lit bathrooms needed badly!
text:
Residence Inns can be counted on for comfortable beds and free breakfasts, and this hotel also has kitchenettes.  But this hotel has specific pluses and minuses that some visitors might need to consider before booking.  On the plus side - the breakfast buffet includes hot cooked oatmeal and has plenty of protein offerings including rarely offered cheese to put on bread.  But the popular banana was in short supply, unfortunately.  On the minus side, there are two.  The first is the bathroom lighting.  The designers aimed to create a sophisticated NY city feel to the rooms but forgot to consider that dimly lit bathrooms create shadows that flatter no one but the twenty somethings and don't create good feelings about ourselves - not how you want to feel when away!  The second is the reservation mishaps.  Twice, I reserved a room and twice, the room I reserved was taken by the time I got to the hotel.  Each time, I had to settle for a temporary downgrade and the inconvenience of having to move from room to room during my stay.  The second time, I had to insist that the hotel offer me some freebies to make up for the extra money I had already paid for the better room.    
     Finally, there are two things to note.  First, the peculiarity of having pots and pans in the kitchenette but no stove to use them on!  Second, there is no longer any advantage to a room overlooking Central Park.  Three new skyscrapers plus more coming are blocking the view so wall to wall windows are great but now even those rooms just have a "city" view.  That eliminated this hotel's plus for me.  Next time, all things being equal, I'll pick the hotel with the well lit bathroom!

title: Boutique in style, Great location for Broadway lovers!
text: Nice lobby but not huge. Staff are courteous, polite and helpful. The elevators are fast so no need to waste your time waiting in the lobby. Our room in the 54th floor is quite and has enough space for a couple staying overnight. Modern amenities like flat screen TV, dual door fridge, functional small kitchen in lieu of receiving area are added conveniences. Programmable HVAC is a plus. Bathroom has no bathtub but instead a glass doored shower with white and black tiles that is european in style and fixtures. The bedroom has one queen bed that is soft, clean and comfortable. Drawers and cabinets are small but functional for overnight or a few days stay. Overall, the hotel amenities and its location in upper Manhattan at the heart of Broadway is a winner.

title: Great stay at Residence Inn
text: I love this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and couldn't be happier. The room is small which is expected but it's very comfy. I want to give kudos to hotel front desk O'Neal for being super friendly, nice, extremely patient with my kids who couldn't stop running around the front lobby area all the time. Thank you O'Neal for 5 star customer service during our stay. Breakfast is packed every day which is a little bit frustrating but that does not stop us from having a great time. Overall, love this hotel and the hotel staff!

title: PERFECT from beginning to end
text: Nicole, the beautiful front desk agent made this 4 day New York trip a memorable one for my daughter and me. She rushed our room to be ready knowing we caught a red-eye to the city and were super tired. I mentioned to Nicole it was my daughters first time in NYC so she put us in a wonderful corner room on the 58th floor where the views were absolutely breathtaking. Nicole situated our stay from beginning to end and would ask how we're enjoying our stay as we would walk through the lobby. Nicole made us feel at home and very comfortable in a city where that's almost impossible to find in a hotel. Marriott should recognize employees such as Nicole for how well she represents the company and herself as well. I will continue my traveling stays with Marriott thanks to her.

title: Bad experience on Broadway
text: This hotel was the first stop for my wife and I 25th Marriage Anniversary. This hotel was very disappointing. The rooms are small, but I sort of expected to be because of the local and hotels usually try to get as much as they can. The real issue was again with Marriott, the cleanliness of the room. The room was feelty. We has human body fluid on several spots on the bed after my wife pull back the sheet to inspect the bed as she always do. After a long day of viewing time square and other things, this happened. So we had to endure someone stripping the bed and remaking it after we showered and was ready to end the day. I talked to manager who did look the part of a hotels manager. I was ask by him " What do you want us to do for you" managerial skills of zero with that statement. He then said "I can give you 10K of points". Really dude... he had no clue.. As a Platinum member & Marriott biz card holder that was a Total insult. This maybe the last straw dealing with Marriott.

title: Thank You!
text:
Hey big shout out to all of the staff for making my daughter's multi-day visit there an excellent one!  She had a great time and raved about the room, the views and most of all the services.  My daughter is hard to please and this says a lot about your hotel and it staff.
Best,
Ralph W.
Platinum Elite

title: Viihtyisä hotelli keskeisellä paikalla
text: Uudehko hotelli, erittäin siisti ja toimiva kokonaisuus, avulias ja ystävällinen henkilökunta. Huoneemme oli normaali 2 hengen huone 57.kerroksen kulmassa, josta näki osittain Keskuspuistoon (edessä oli yksi monista Manhattanilla rakenteilla olevista pilvenpiirtäjistä) sekä Times Squaren valot toisesta suunnasta. Ikkunat olivat lattiasta kattoon (heikompaa saattaa huimata!). Kaikenkaikkiaan suurkaupunki levittäytyi eteen huoneemme ikkunoista ja maisema oli upea jokaisena vuorokauden aikana! Huone oli muutenkin sopivan tilava kahdelle. Ilmastointi piti hieman ääntä, mutta nukuttua saimme silti hyvin. Aamiainen oli melko amerikkalaistyylinen; munakasta, paistinperunoita, puuroa, mysliä, vohveleita (joita sai itse tehdä), bageleita yms. hiilihydraattia. Itse jäin kaipaamaan jotain vihreää, mikä puuttui täysin. Hedelmiä oli. Kahvit ja tuoremehut ok. Kattoterassi olisi ollut mukava, mutta ainakaan me emme sellaista tästä hotellista löytäneet. Pimeällä hotellin löysi helposti seuraamalla sinisiä valoja, jotka loistivat hotellin kattokerroksissa. Vastaa mielestäni tasoltaan Suomen Sokos-hotelleja. Perusvarma valinta.

title: Great staff and excellent hotel
text:
Fantastic property staffed by people who go out of their way to be helpful.

Extremely well organized from micro popcorn in the room to loaner umbrella at front desk.  Amazing views.

Pamela at check in was wonderful.

title: Modern hotel in great location
text: The Residence Inn is the upper floors of the combined building with Courtyard. They share the same amenities I believe. The hotel is very modern and that shows in the rooms. Views from the Residence Inn can be spectacular. I had an amazing 57th floor view of Times Square and the Hudson River. The gym is far better than most hotel gyms and had a ton of space. Free breakfast was also solid though not spectacular. Check-in was quick and easy for me, which seems rare in NYC hotels. The room was much smaller than a normal Residence Inn room but that's common anywhere in NYC. Layout was practical, and the room had the normal Residence Inn features like a kitchenette. I also liked that there was lots of common space on the 3rd and 4th floors (and a sky terrace on the 35th) to get out of the room and do work or relax.

title: Una pesadilla
text: Llevamos tres noches aquí y todo está siendo horrible, pedimos una habitación con bañera (incluida en en nuestra reserva, y nos dan una con ducha). El desayuno es el peor en el que he estado, cuando la comida se acaba no sacan más, y ponen súper poca cantidad, no me ofrecen pan sin gluten, ni cereales, ni bollos nada (y me estoy teniendo que traer los míos), pido si me pueden sacar de cocina un huevo, ya que no puedo comer nada de lo de fuera porque todo tiene gluten, y me mandan al bar de pago; la poca fruta que tienen es incomible, sin sabor. Para colmo ayer no nos limpiaron la habitación, a pesar de que después de comer les avisamos de que la habitación no había sido limpiada, y se excusan diciendo que teníamos puesto el cartel de no limpiar, les decimos que eso no es así, que no estaba puesto, y nos dijeron que ellos tenían apuntado que si, vamos nos llamaron mentiroso en toda la cara; les pido una solución, y solo me ofrecen toallas limpias... esto está siendo una pesadilla. El peor hotel sin duda, y es una pena porque está bien ubicado.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text: We stayed here for four nights over the 4th of July this year. I had stayed here last summer and had a great experience but the friend who came with me hadn't stayed here before. We both thought the hotel was all around a great hotel- the room was small but big enough for two people and our combined 4 suitcases. We had the Grand Times Square view (room 6108) which was amazing- our view was of the Hudson River and dock where cruise ships come in, along with great city views and of course times square. We had a king bed, which was nice because we had a nice chair to sit in by the window along with the chair at the desk area. Even though we didn't have a totally panoramic view, it was totally worth it because we were so high- we even got to see fireworks from 3+ shows that were happening all over New Jersey right from our hotel room! Breakfast was fine, decent variety and not too crowded, especially on weekdays. Both times I've been here I noticed that it sometimes takes a little while to get an elevator, especially if you are coming down from one of the top floors, but it never was an unreasonable amount of time, especially given how many floors you are moving and the views you get because of this. Check-in and check out were fine, at check out the bellman was actually able to reserve us the hotel car so we could get a ride to LGA for a flat fee- it was around $50 plus tip I think. Great location too- we could walk to so many things! (Oh, and the A/C was great with the hot weather we had when we were there.)

title: A perfect hotel we found for a long stay
text:
We stayed for around 17 days at the inn and no doubts that the inn was a great choice. Location wise it was perfect where as central park at one side and Times Square on  the other. 
We were at the 40th floor and 2 sides view of a corner room was amazing. The photos mentioned do full justice to what the property iss. Theres an extra charge to have a double bed room.
The housekeeping is only till 3pm on weekends and definitely need to put the door card to advise to not wake up early if require service at a later time. The staff must take care to clean the blinds and curtains as they were dirty from the hooks.
We choose the property as it has a kitchenette equipped with all you need. Easy cooking and easy serving. The only thing lacking was the fridge door handle and instructions to use the coffee machine and dish washer. But that you can call at front desk and person would come to help.
Dish washer powder is also provided.
At front desk ONeil helped us through with smooth check in and providing us with any additional information needed. 
35th floor has the laundry room and takes USD 2.75 each for washing and drying. They have in room laundry as well. tide detergents for washing is available in the room for guests. Ice machine and gym is on the same floor as well. 
Floor 3rd has The breakfast and timings were a bit harsh as on weekdays it shuts at 9.30 am and weekends 10am. It will be nice if its moved a bit late like till 11 am.
4th floor is called nosh area with starbucks ,business center and waiting area. 
Beds are comfortable and over all I believe our stay was very satisfying. 
Would totally recommend to all looking to stay central of manhattan.
I like this location better than residence inn by times square.

title: The Best In Town
text: Perfect place to stay. From the moment we checked in, we knew we had found a great hotel. We stayed as a family for 2 nights, during 3 of the hottest days so far this summer. Not easy to walk around in outside, but the A/C in our room saved us, as well as a full kitchen to put extra water, food and ice in. The beds were super comfortable, and our view on the 50th floor was amazing! There was lots of counter space in the bathroom--which for 2 women is "a plus". And our housekeeper was very gracious and helpful making sure we had everything we needed.

title: Best location for exploring the City!
text: My husband and I booked this hotel for a 5 day stay in NYC.  We selected Residence Inn due to the amenities such as a full size Fridge/Freezer and kitchenette.  We were checked into a high floor (52nd) and enjoyed the view of Midtown, Times Square and Central Park. Our room was a King Studio and it came with a panoramic window that allowed us to the see the city from up high. So very cool. Staff was exceptional and there is even free breakfast! Don't expect much other than waffles, eggs and fruit but hey...it's free. Grab your coffee and breakfast before you hit the streets every day and then stop later in the city for something that suites your tastes.  Great location and easy access to CitiBike share and many subway and bus stops.  We will definitely be back!

title: Clean, modern and great staff
text: Five days in the city and a spectacular room upgrade made this trip a real pleasure. Efficient and courteous staff was a big plus, free breakfast and great location make this hotel a superior choice in NYC

title: Ideale Lage
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist ideal. Einen Block entfernt ist u.a. die Express Station JFK und 5 Blocks  die Station Columbus Circle mit weiteren U-Bahn Linien. 
Ein Bio Supermarkt  ist direkt Ecke 8th/54 sowie ein sehr großer, gut sortierter Supermarkt am Columbus Circle. 
Sowohl an der Rezeption als auch beim Frühstück war das Personal stets sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend.
Die Zimmer sind klein, aber das ist einfach so in NYC. Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 59. Stock mit Blick auf den Times Square und ein bisschen auf dem Hudson - also traumhafter Blick. 
Es war bereits unser zweiter Aufenthalt im Residence Inn und sicher nicht unser letzter.

title: Great hotel, best deal in NYC!
text: My husband and I stayed here for an overnight getaway recently and were thrilled with the hotel! Our room was on a high floor (40 something) and had an amazing view of the surrounding area. We were treated to an amazing sunrise reflected in the neighboring skyscrapers. The room was small but had everything you could need, including a fully equipped kitchen. The staff was friendly and efficient, and the location was perfect! Close to Central Park, 5th Avenue, and not far from Times Square. We will definitely stay here again! Best deal in the city!

title: Front desk needs more training!!
text: So we traveled with a group of 56. Arrangements were made almost 7 months before our arrival. Rooms we were told would have 3 beds and so we set our group up in rooms of three... arrive and not the case ... some rooms took 3 tries to even get a room with 2 beds for the 3 girls to share ... NOT WHAT WE PAID FOR!!!!   Another room got checked into a USED/DIRTY room, housekeeping totally failed on that one! Not impressed at all.

title: Antidepressiva out or not
text: Prima locatie om een dergelijke bijeenkomst te organiseren in De Verenigde Staten.Het bezoek was de moeite waard Het hotel.herkende ik  an Radisson blue France Dakterras is uniek evenals de locatie voor ontbijt en ....

title: Fantastic
text:
We had a fantastic 2 nights in this beautiful, centrally located hotel. Staying on the 52nd floor, we had a corner suite with two double beds for the four of us (2 adults & 2 children). It also had a small kitchen with microwave, dishwasher etc. Lovely. The room was small but perfectly adequate for our needs and typical of NYC rooms.
