The concerierge was great, she suggested some fun ideas for things to see. We walked the high line, visited Chelsea market, enjoyed an evening sunset cruise around Manhattan island and strolled around Central Park. We have visited New York City many times and we never get tired of it. 

Breakfast was buffet style with plenty of choice and a lovely quality. Would definitely return again. Thank you Residence Inn.

title: Encomiendas eBay amazon
text:
Voy a visitar el hotel la semana próxima, y quisiera saber si Te cobran por enviar paquetes al hotel? Estuve leyendo y dice que es gratis pero quiero asegurarme de que sea realmente así. 
Muchas gracias!

title: ottima scelta
text: camere con vista spettacolare e dimensioni più che accettabili per lo standard newyorkese; personale attento, educato e gentile; colazione da migliorare sul versante "dolce": mancano biscotti, fette biscottate, dolci vari; servizio efficiente, dalla reception al servizio bagagli; pulizia non perfetta, ma accettabile; comoda la minicucina per prepararsi tisane e riporre in frigo la frutta; posizione eccellente per raggiungere i vari punti di interesse della città a piedi o con fermate metro vicine. molto apprezzata la scelta di rispondere alle recensioni che dimostra interesse per il cliente.

title: Stolen Clothing!
text:
Unacceptable for a seemingly high end property! I had 2 pairs of designer jeans and Lululemon yoga pants stolen from my room during my stay. First hotel management did not seem interested in hearing my story.. and several weeks later they let me know that they did an "investigation" of their housekeeping staff and found no evidence of foul play. Case closed. I'm sure the housekeepers were eager to admit to thievery. 
As a Marriott Rewards member, I am highly disappointed with the customer service and lack of concern. I am always careful with my jewelry in hotel rooms as I don't ever want to tempt anyone. But the last thing you think will get stolen are your actual clothes. There is no safe big enough for your suitcase.
I have been a loyal customer of Marriott in the past and will think twice before staying in a Marriott again. Be careful! 
.residenceinn

title: Great hotel
text:
The room was exactly as was on the website. Were on the 57th floor and had a view of Central Park. It is conveniently located as it is a short walk to Times Square and to Central Park. Close to subway lines. Plenty of places to eat nearby whether you want something casual or more fancy.
The room we had, included fridge, coffee machine, kettle, toaster, microwave and even a dishwasher. 
The only downside to the room was that the air conditioner (though efficient) was quite noisy and you couldn't change the fan setting. Also the fridge made load clicking noises for a few minutes several times a day. Sadly this included in the middle of the night so if you are a light sleeper then it could be an issue.

title: BBB
text:
Un hotel Nuevo en Manhattan y mi primera experiencia a sido positiva.
Habitación pequeñas para una persona que viaja por trabajo. Se complica si son 2.
Tiene todo para unos días de trabajo en la gran manzana. 
Buena ubicación y lugares de interés cercanos..

title: My first visit
text:
Stayed here for two nights
Rooms great, clean and modern. 
Grear breakfast
Service is amazing. Would like to commend Ramone from security for his impeccable service
Good location
Hotel is highly recommended

title: Wonderful hotel, friendly staff, conveniently located, great views.
text:
This review is for room 5704/1 twin+1 double for a weekend stay.

A fabulous Marriott in a location very convenient to Central Park, Times Square, great restaurants, Starbucks, MoMA, 5th Ave, Madison Ave and Rockefeller Center. I would definitely choose to stay at this hotel again when I return to NYC. 

Service: wonderful and friendly. We checked in around 9pm, and were greeted warmly then and throughout our stay. Our customer care specialist helpfully recommended several restaurants in the area, another helped us get a cab.

Rooms: as pictured. Modern, clean. We requested and received a high floor (57th) with spectacular views of the city...a glimpse of Central Park between buildings when we looked left out of the floor-to-ceiling windows, and a glimpse of Times Square looking right. The floor at this height is small...I think there were perhaps 10 or so rooms on this floor. The room is smaller but definitely adequate with a small kitchenette that is well-stocked. Key operates lights. Beds very comfy (typical for a Marriott IMHO), but with surprisingly noisy sheets (super crisp?) A little getting used to: the toilet is about 3-4 feet from the bed on the other side of a sliding door (definitely not much auditory or olfactory privacy). Bathroom wall likely shares a wall with the elevators, which were not noisy but a slight whooshing noise can occasionally be heard. Pillows on the double bed were along a wall where the HVAC unit was installed, which also was (thankfully) not noisy. Very effective A/C and heating. Overall, a quiet location...rarely heard doors closing from other rooms, never heard other guests.

Bathroom: modern. Paul Mitchell products, and more offered in the room than other Marriotts (plus lotion and bath gel). Bath tub with hand-held shower head. Shower head mount definitely will fit taller people (I am nearly 6'). Water pressure effective, especially for being 57 floors up.

Elevators: FAST. Ears routinely popped near the 42nd floor. Key is required to get to guest room floors. 

Housekeeping: so helpful and nice! Requested extra shampoo. Toothbrushes are complimentary (ask a customer care specialist in the lobby). I'm not sure how they knew we were not in our room in the morning, but every time we came back from breakfast our room was clean. Thanks, Gigi!

Breakfast: very good, large selection, wonderful dining room. Get there early. We arrived about 30 minutes before closing; food selection was still good, seating was tight but clearing (we sat along the bar near the windows), coffee was out. 

Thank you, Marriott!

title: Did not honor reservation!!
text:
On our arrival in nyc after a 4hr train ride, we were greeted by this hotel’s staff with the news that our reservation through booking.com had been cancelled due to an “invalid payment.” The staff member called over his manager, a woman named Melissa, who told us that the credit card we used had been rejected. She blamed booking.com for the error with the credit card even though we had a confirmation from booking.com. This is odd given that we had used the same credit card to make several hundred dollars in charges both locally at home as well as in nyc within the past 24-48 hours without difficulty. 

As the hotel was overbooked, the manager told us to go to the sister hotel residence inn in Times Square. She did not offer any further assistance, and told us she was very busy and had other customers to assist. We found this preposterous; this is a terrible establishment. 

We arrived after a 4hr train ride to be told by staff here that our reservation had been cancelled. That our credit card had not gone through. Because the hotel was overbooked they could not reinstate the reservation! So we had nowhere to go. The mgr suggested we go to their sister residence inn in times square. She then said she had a lot of customers to assist so could we please step aside. Generally,when a hotel is overbooked, the courteous thing to do is help arrange for accommodations elsewhere. She told us to straighten out our finances!!!  We were obviously irate. We insisted that she contact this other hotel and help us make reservations. She fled the desk at this point claiming that she could not reach the hotel and would try to email them from the office. 

While she was nowhere to be found for the next 30 minutes, we contacted our credit card company who confirmed that no recent charges were denied and they in fact had record of a successful test charge of $1 from this hotel. I finally caught the manager out in the lobby again, and she said we “had a room” at the residence inn Times Square. She wrote the address on a post-it and that was it. She expected us to leave. When I turned my back to her to get my card from my wallet, she again disappeared. 

After this her staff could not get her to leave her office to talk to me again. We had a crying baby in the lobby, we were exhausted, and we weren’t sure we had a room anywhere in the city. We were highly suspicious that the hotel had overbooked and punted our reservation, while dishonestly blaming booking.com.

Another staff member made like he called the other residence inn and found out the mgr had never made any reservation for us. He then told us he made a reservation for us and that this other hotel was $100 cheaper than the rate we would have paid. 

We finally headed over to the other residence inn in Times Square, and surprise surprise, they knew nothing about any reservation. They also explained that residence inns usually compensate customers in overbooked situations by arranging alternative accommodations and giving the first night free. They also make sure you arrive at the alternate hotel safely.  We got none of that. We were insulted and told our credit card was no good, lied to several times, and basically ignored until we left. The managers behavior was absolutely abominable given the situation where the mistake was theirs and we were left basically homeless.

This hotel cannot be expected to honor online reservations. Don’t expect to be treated well when things go wrong

title: Wedding Anniversary Trip
text: The hotel was great. The staff was wonderful.  Kimberly at the front desk is amazing and made our stay fantastic.  The hotel location is close to times square and central park, but also close to the subway.

title: Great view, quiet room and good location
text:
I picked this hotel because of it's good reviews, the free breakfast , the great value and its close proximity to Central Park. On arrival we were checked in quickly and efficiently and contrary to some reviews we found reception staff to be friendly and helpful, with time to say hello to us most mornings of our 5 night stay. The breakfast was good but go early to avoid congestion. The kitchenette in the room was very handy and the onsite DIY laundry was a godsend to us having been on the road 10 days. We also used the gym equipment. Things that could be improved : 
-after 20 frustrating minutes the concierge was unable to process our credit card for a museum pass due to technical issues
- the bar area on the 5th(?) floor is poorly run, expensive and has the worst service in the whole hotel.Which is a pity as it could be good with minimal effort.

title: Great view, nice staffs, need some fixings
text: I am a New Yorker.  I decided to treat myself for my birthday and stay in the city and planned out a few days of activities.  I wanted picked a hotel that is close to central park and shopping area.  I narrowed down to this location.  It is not the most expensive but not cheap.  I like the location and I like the modern feel to it.  I got a quiet corner room with Hudson river view and happened to see firework displayed one night.  The room is s and small but the view was great and I was on 49th Floor.  The room overall feel fresh and modern.  There is a kitchen area which is nice.  However, first thing I saw after checking in was a paper towel on the cabinet door.  I took it out and saw some old spill and the door will not close without that paper towel being stuck there.  I guess that's their remedy of "fixing"?  It was shocked but I was too tired to change room at that point.  The corners of drawers were all busted. The bathtub is small and I can see the dusts behind bathroom mirror.  Not a pretty sight.  Breakfast is free and it is located on 3rd floor.  The selections are the typical Marriot breakfast with pastries, waffle, pancake, yogurt, oak meal, fresh fruits, etc....It was decent and the breakfast area is nice with big columns, large windows with natural lighting, pretty seating and sculpture.  Overall, I like this hotel but they need to fix up the place for the price we pay.

title: Breathtaking view on timesquare! Good price/quality/location
text:
Been here for a week in april. No shocking comments. everything was like it suppose to be as expected when you book this hotel. Minor problem with the fridge, kept making noise. Unfixable so maintenance put it off and couldn't use it.
Breakfast bit small in variety but oke to start the day!

title: Gorgeous view, decent size/functionality of rooms
text:
I spent a lot of time researching the 'perfect' hotel as we were going to be making a quick trip to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday.  We're both first-timers to NYC and wanted to be in a very central location while sticking to a reasonable budget.  This hotel checked all the boxes for us. 

Our hotel flew into JFK so in order to get to the hotel, we took the air train and 1 subway line.  Once we got off the subway, we had to walk about 2 blocks (and passed by Stephen Colbert's studio while doing so!).  We arrived early in the morning so we knew our room wasn't going to be ready so we were able to leave our bags at the hotel and do some sight seeing of the city while we waited for our room. 

Here's where it got a little tricky - I used the Marriott iPhone app to check the status of our room.  We didn't want to end up walking any further than we had to if our room was available since we had to make it back in time to change and go up to the Bronx for a Yankees game.  The chat feature on the app said our room was ready so we headed on back to the hotel.  

When we go to the desk, they said the room wasn't actually ready.  Now I was miffed because we had just marched from the other side of town in hopes of taking a quick shower and heading up to the Bronx.  To rectify this, they said they could "upgrade us" to a room with a Time Square view but it was on a lower floor than we had hoped.  We went up and took a look at the room to notice the lamp shade and chair were dirty and the floor height and view were NOT what we were expecting (I had called back in February 2018 when I made the reservation to see what "side" of the building to reserve a room on for a view of the Hudson river).  We went back down to the front desk and requested a different room.  This time, we were given a king size corner room on the 56th floor (5607) with a view of Time Square and the Hudson.  We went back up and the room was laid out MUCH better. 

The hotel room was clean and the layout was very functional for a small space.  There was plenty of room for the king bed as well as a desk and a chair to sit in front of the window to take in the views.  The bed itself was EXTREMELY comfortable and the staff brought up extra pillows for us. The bathroom was very modern and clean as well.  The kitchenette area included a microwave, fridge, freezer, and various cooking utensils (we didn't stay long enough to use any of these, but it was nice to have them available). 

I'm not sure what other reviewers are talking about with the elevator rides taking a long time.  There are several elevators and we never had to wait long for one to take us up or down (and we were there on a holiday weekend).  The actual elevator ride itself is VERY quick. 

As far as complimentary breakfast - GET THERE EARLY.  I read reviews ahead of time that breakfast gets very crowded and/or runs out quick.  Knowing this, we set our alarm to get down to the third floor breakfast area as soon as it opened each morning.  We never had any issue getting food and there were PLENTY of options available.  There was also plenty of seating.  Also, the coffee is fine.  If you want fancy coffee, step outside the hotel and walk 5 feet to a dedicated coffee shop.  On our last day, we did take trays and brought our breakfast back up to our room so we could enjoy our last day overlooking the Hudson.  We had no issues whatsoever with breakfast. 

Checking out was easy as it was done all on the Marriott iPhone app.  Our flight wasn't until later in the day so once again we left our bags with the hotel and then spent the day exploring Central Park.  

As far as service/staff goes, everyone we encountered was super friendly.  Even though we had a minor hiccup with our check-in process, the employees were all very willing to work with us to make sure we were happy.  

All in all, it was a wonderful stay and this hotel is on my list of favorites in the NYC area.

title: Gorgeous view; small room, but well-planned layout and functionality
text: We came to NYC with friends who visit often, and this is their favorite hotel based upon its location/convenience and amenities--we understand why after a 4-night stay over Spring Break. First, the location is just wonderful for accessibility to Times Square, the theatre district, Central Park, etc. The included breakfast was helpful as a time saver, and had a reasonable variety of items for a "hotel breakfast." Seating could be a bit problematic depending upon what time we visited. Staff was pleasant and helpful, particularly Samantha and Kimberly. My daughter used the fitness room twice and said it was great. We had a corner room on the 49th floor, and the view of Central Park was just spectacular.

title: Excelente hotel. Se destaca su estratégica ubicación, su personal y sus facilidades (cocina)
text:
La ubicación es su principal patrimonio. Está al alcance de los principales atractivos de NYC (Central Park, 5ta Ave, restaurantes, Square Center). Se puede andar con seguridad a cualquier hora. En su barrio se puede conseguir de todo al alcance de la mano.
También se destaca su personal, del front desk (Oneal), de seguridad y camareras. Excelente atención y buena disposición.
Dispone de un bar muy bueno que opera todo el día, con happy hour y con lugar para que los huéspedes puedan comer su propia comida o encargarla en el lugar. Muy práctico y muy agradable lugar !!!

title: Bien trop cher pour la prestation
text:
Nous avons réservé un "studio majestueux avec vue sur Time Square" avec salle de bain ensemble douche et baignoire, kitchenette...
Une belle arnaque !!! Tout d'abord la chambre : minuscule, même pas de place pour ranger ses valises, kitchenette sans plaque de cuisson mais on vous donne casseroles, poêles et autres accessoires pourquoi faire du coup ??? Des câbles qui pendouillent dans le placard.
Seulement une douche, je me demande encore ou est la baignoire...
Et la vue... nous n'avons pas vu grand chose de Times Square... 
Tout ça pour le modeste prix de 1200 euros pour 2 nuits sans les taxes !!!!

title: Excellent hotel
text: We were surprised at the standard and the size of room as We had been advised hotel rooms in New York were  small .We had a corner room on the 63rd floor with stunning views down to times square.From check-in to check out it was a very pleasurable experience. Breakfast was varied and plentiful although sometimes a little crowded at the food area but plenty of room to sit and eat .The kitchen area provided in the rooms were of a high standard and offered all you needed . The hotel lauderette had plenty of washers and dryers and very reasonably priced. The housekeeping staff kept our room  spotless.We would stay here again and have already recommended to friends.We would like to compliment the manager and his team for their efficient and courteous service it was a pleasure to be greeted each time you entered and left the hotel with a warm words and a smile.

title: Superbe Hotel
text:
Avril 2018, 2 semaines, 57 eme etage vue time square
Du bonheur, vue superbe, petit déjeuné top.
Situé pile entre time square et columbus circle avec beaucoup de ligne de métro disponible

Reste juste à revoir l'accueil et le ménage dans les chambres qui auraient besoin de régularité !

title: Excellent value and location in NYC
text: Great rooms with fabulous views, great service and great location.  Just far enough North from Times Square that it's not too crazy, but close enough to easily walk to shows/restaurants.  And close enough to Central Park that it makes an early morning walk super easy.  Nice (free!) breakfast and chic room design.  My favorite Marriott in NYC so far.

title: Disappointing for a Marriott
text:
Stayed here on our honeymoon last week. Checked in and found the room to be nothing like the photos of big open windows, with only 1 small window. Also disappointed with the condition of the room with severely torn lace curtains and burnt/stained light shades and the room generally in a poor condition. I reported this to reception, but it was never fixed and never even contacted about again. 
My other issue was I needed to return home a day early due to an unexpected family issue, the reception staff didn’t care at all - saying it was a guaranteed booking and you can’t get any refund. I understood that is their prerogative but I’d hoped for a small amount of compassion, even a slight discount on my next booking (I was going to be back in 2 weeks) would have been nice, but instead they couldn’t care less.
Overall very disappointing and my worst experience at a Marriott branded hotel anywhere in the world. 
Stay elsewhere!

title: Disappointing, rude staff, better choices elsewhere
text:
I was really looking forward to staying here for a week with my husband after seeing the photos of the hotel and reading positive reviews but we were so disappointed with this hotel. The biggest advantage is location, especially if you're in NY for the first time, because it's very central and close to several sights and subway stations. The rooms themselves are pretty standard but nicely decorated and clean. They are very small but we were expecting that. Each room also includes a kitchenette which turned out to be really useful to store food in the fridge or reheat some takeout. 
The biggest drawback of this hotel was the service and the staff and a few small things that just shouldn't be happening in a hotel of this standard and ruined the experience for us. After booking I sent the hotel a few messages to let them know we were coming for our honeymoon and asked if we could have a room on a higher floor. Never got an acknowledgment of receipt. When we arrived we were given a room on one of the lowest floors. That's fine, I understand not every request can be accommodated but the hotel didn't acknowledge in any way we were there for a special occasion which I'd expect from a hotel of this standard (a simple fruit basket or prosecco bottle comes at no extra cost and would have been a nice touch). When we asked if we could potentially move to a room higher up later in the week as we were there for a long time the people in reception looked at us almost with disdain. We were told to come back the next day and ask when the manager was there which we did but again were treated with a look of disdain, a comment that they were full and the manager was standing right behind the desk and also just looked at us with pity and like he just wanted to get rid of us.
We had a few small requests/ questions like whether they had a plug adapter or could tell us where to buy one, what the latest we can check out is etc. Each time we felt like we were just disturbing them  or like we were second rate guests. Wioleta in reception was particularly unpleasant. I guess they know the hotel is fully booked anyway so they don't need to try hard (or at all)
The other thing that was just unacceptable was the behaviour of the cleaner. She was incredibly rude and behaving like she was doing us a favour. She knocked on the door a few times ready to clean but we were in the room and asked if she could come back in half an hour as we will be leaving then and each time this was met with a sigh and her mumbling something to herself unhappily under her nose. One day she then said "ok, I won't come today then". My husband said no, we still want the room made up today and she just left without a word clearly upset. We used up the one bottle of shower gel we had in the room within two days and this was not replenished for the next 3 days. In the end we asked her if she could please bring us some shower gel so when we left for the day she brought us 10 bottles of shower gel and like 10 towels (which by the way had stains on them). Very passive aggressive. She then didn't turn up the following day clearly thinking we don't deserve her attention. Totally unacceptable. Seeing as the manager tolerated rude behaviour from staff downstairs we didn't even bother complaining.

There's not much more to say about breakfast as all has already been said in other reviews. It is great to have breakfast included in a hotel in NY as it saves you time and money. Overall we found it to be sufficient but it is very limited and is not replenished regularly which can make for a frustrating experience. Be warned- the coffee is disgusting. It does also get busy and the use of space isn't very smart so you might have to wait for a table.
Two other things- one day of our stay two out of the four elevators were out of order which resulted in ridiculous queues to get to breakfast or back to your room. We waited for over 10 minutes on our floor to be able to get down. When you're on the 35th floor or higher it's not really reasonable to expect people to take the stairs. Again, I understand things like that happen but I have stayed in many hotels and have never seen anything like that. One evening we also turned the aircon on in our room and after a few minutes a terrible smell of old frying oil came out of the unit. Probably from the bar which serves snacks until late. It was absolutely disgusting and left me gagging. It took us an hour to air the room out so we could actually go to sleep. These might be small things to some people but they ruined the experience of staying in this hotel for us.
And actually this stay has put me off staying in any Marriott hotel in the future, it's just ruined the brand for me.
Considering the really high price we paid for our stay and that we were staying there for a whole week (you'd think they'd treat guests like that with respect) it was not worth it, I wouldn't go back and I wouldn't recommend this hotel. There are far better options in New York for that same or lower price

title: High up...
text:
...In the sky or similar. I know I am a bit late, but we really enjoyed our stay there.

Rooms are average sized, clean and neat. Bed is excellent and the view astonishing. Situated very close to the typical sightseeing Hotspots.
Bathroom is kinda small and only thing I would point out is that the sliding door must have seen some better days. There is a safe available, and a small kitchenette at your disposal.
Breakfast is very basic and I did not appreciate the plastic plates, as well.for the seating which would be more suitable in a lounge for afternoon tea. 
Staff is friendly and helpfull.

title: A medium priced gem in a great location.
text:
I almost hate writing about this hotel.  I don't want it to be more popular than it is, but since it's already almost always sold out, apparently word is out.
Rooms are great, especially on an upper floor with views of the Hudson River, the Park or Times Square.  Comfortable beds, great shower, wonderful microwave, refrigerator and freezer.
Included breakfast is certainly serviceable for a good start to the day.  Good coffee.  Breakfast location is more like having breakfast in the living room, but it's kind of funky.
Best of all, is the service.  The staff is extremely friendly, attentive and responsive.  If something was missing from the room, it would be brought within a couple of minutes.  The cupboard door, covering where our microwave was was broken.  A worker came up within minutes of our calling to take a look at it, he determined when we were going to be out, because it would be a messy, noisy repair, and by golly it was totally fixed when we got back.
Our AC was keeping us awake at night with an overly noisy fan.  Again a worker was up in a matter of minutes, who diagnosed and then fixed the problem. You just can't beat service like that!

title: Non male..!
text:
Hotel il cui punto di forza è sicuramente la posizione, nel centro di Manhattan a metà tra Times Square e Central Park (nonché vicino alle linee principali di metro).
Altra caratteristica è che le stanze sono posizionate su piani alti, precisamente dal 35 al 65, permettendo pertanto di godere di una vista spettacolare. Tuttavia, qualora possibile, è consigliabile, pagando un po’ di più, richiedere una camera corner (cioè ad angolo) o comunque con tutta la parete a vetrata, in quanto prendendo la camera King normale con una sola finestra/vetrata la vista è più che normale. 
Molto buona la pulizia.
Mediocre la colazione; poco ricca per un quattro stelle, soprattutto la parte dolce ( no cornetti, no brioche, no fette biscottate..ecc.).
Staff discreto, ma poco dedito a comprendere chi non parla perfettamente inglese.
! Attenzione, aspetto molto importante, al check in chiedono la carta di credito bloccando la cifra necessaria al pagamento della camera, nonché una cauzione consistente nel prezzo di una notte (considerate quindi il plafond della carta!). 
....insomma, per quanto nel complesso siamo stati bene, da un albergo così ci si aspetta di più, considerato il prezzo.

title: AMAZING !!!
text: Nous étions dans la partie Residence Inn, au 59eme étage, dans un studio avec baie vitrée d’angle, vue sur Central Park ... De quoi transformer un voyage à New York déjà exceptionnel en un rêve éveillé. Une équipe d’accueil très agréable, un petit dej compris extra, une situation dans la ville parfaite ... Aucune fausse note. Merci à ce lieu de résidence d’avoir participé au caractère complètement fabuleux de ce voyage magique !!!

title: Panorama!
text: Dalla nostra camera al 49° piano potevamo vedere Time Square e ammirare NY fino al fiume Hudson...incomparabile! La posizione è, infatti, centrale tra Central Park con i suoi alberi fioriti a primavera e Time Square sempre viva, fulcro della città. Camera con letto comodo e bagno abbastanza grande per la media di NY. Poco spazio in armadio.  Presente anche  una piccola cucina completa ma con frigorifero molto rumoroso che abbiamo dovuto fare staccare. Colazione al terzo piano abbondante, all'americana, anche se non sempre di grande qualità. Personale molto gentile e pronto ad ascoltare ogni richiesta. Wi-Fi gratuito in tutta la struttura.

title: Wrong choice!
text: If it is your taste, the only thing you may like is the modern design. Other than that, the breakfast is disappointing: at 9:00 there is not much available, at 9:15 there is noting left and at 9:29 sharp, they will close the doors! Housekeeping is a catastrophe as well. 1st night have to call the front desk at 6:00 p.m. because room was not cleaned. 2nd night you arrive at 11:00 p.m. and guess what ...beds are not made either! Of course, no towels, no body wash or shampoo. Absolutely unacceptable for US$ 500,- per night. Since there are plenty of other hotels at walking distance, I do highly recommend to pick another one!

title: Great location, and clever and clean rooms
text:
My husband and I stayed at this Residence Inn during a weekend trip away. We loved the location... just steps to MoMA, Times Square, and Central Park... and the room was cleverly laid out to include a full modern kitchen. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable.
The breakfast was crowded, but it was a weekend. We had trouble finding a table both mornings, but that wouldn't have been a problem if we had gone earlier, I believe. The staff did their best to keep things stock in the breakfast buffet, but they fell behind from time to time.... there were just too many guests.
It was a great hotel for the price we paid and we would stay here again.

title: Vista spettacolare
text: Residence sulla Broadway a 5 isolati da times square e 4 da central park. Posizione ideale per girare la città e considerato che le camere sono tutte ai piani alti si gode di una vista mozzafiato. Le camere sono piccole e l'angolo cottura può essere usato per uno spuntino veloce non di più. La pulizia non è proprio impeccabile ma la biancheria viene cambiata ogni giorno. La colazione è poco varia e il buffet affollatissimo. C'è qualcosa da migliorare.

title: Excellent all the way!!!!!
text: An amazing place to stay. Fantastic service. The people that worked there are incredible. The water bottle in the room is 7$ which is pricey but the girl offered me in two different instances free bottles of water. Very helpful all around. The view is to die for I was in the Grand Times Square room. The pictures speak for themselves. The hotel is quiet and the toiletries are amazing. The breakfast was included and it was delicious many many choices. I will be staying therein the future for sure. The subway is close by and everything is close restaurants pharmacies etc. Amazing stay recommended.

title: Fab stay in NY
text:
Booked the Residence Inn based on the many reviews it had received on Tripadvisor. The check In was super efficient and during our stay any of the people at the check in desk were very helpful.
I was looking for a room with a great view of the city and I certainly got that. They put my wife and myself on the 65th floor and we had magnificent views of Times square and the riverside. And even though we were on the top floor, I don't we ever waited more than a minute for the lift to arrive, which was amazing.
The hotel is very central to Broadway, Times square and central park and as the weather was great when we were there, we were able to walk to most places.
I would recommend this hotel highly.

title: good location
text: After a rocky start (the hotel had cancelled our reservation, which we had made 4 months in advance and confirmed a few days earlier by phone calling from  France,  12 hours (!) before our arrival. Finally a solution was “found”. The location is excellent (for museums, Lincoln center and Metro). The room was ok, the view from the 47th floor almost stunning – but the (fast and very frequent) elevators rattled by the room like a subway train a-d kept us sleeping or interrupted it. When asked to have the room changed we were told “no point, all rooms hear the elevators!). At that noise level the hotel is vastly overpriced!

title: Chic modern hotel but very good.
text: Booked 4 nights at this hotel. To our surprise Lobby was not impressive as it had access to 2 hotels. High Speed elevators. We got a Corner room on the 8th floor. We had the city view. The room was very nice. the layout and ambiance was just perfect. Functionality of the room was well thought of. Bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom had shower and a separate tub.  The shower had a temperature Gauge that one can monitor the required temperature of water. It was too good and well thought of. Hotel is situated just a couple of blocks from Central Park and Times Square. Very good location. Will definitely return to this hotel again.

title: Ubicación perfecta para primera visita a la cuidad de N Y.
text:
El Hotel está muy bien ubicado, los Subway cercas, habitaciones vidriadas que permiten ver el paisaje en distintos horarios y como cambia de colores la ciudad.                            Las habitaciones Son amplias, limpias y su personal en general es muy atento. 
El desayuno es muy abundante y surtido aunque para nuestra costumbre faltaría agregar en lo diario jamón cocido.(es solo un detalle a tener en cuenta )
La recepción y asesoramiento excelente!
Regresaríamos si volvemos a N Y.

title: Best view ever
text:
We’ve been in NYC for 6 days in Aprile and we stayed here in this amazing hotel and residence. Our room was at 64th floor and we had an amazing view over Central Park and time square. Out apartment was not so big but it has everything you need to feel home: good bed, kitchen, big bathroom and all the necessities. 
Plus in New York, in this hotel you have complementary breakfast!
Very recommended, wanna come back asap.

title: Wonderful Anniversary Weekend
text: We booked a long weekend at the Residence Inn for our 30th Anniversary.  While booking we requested a corner room. Upon arriving we were greeted by Wioleta Kozacki at the front desk.  She informed us that we did in fact have a corner room and asked if we were in the city for anything special. We told her it was our 30th. After we settled into our room (with a wonderful view) we heard a knock at the door. To our surprise Wioleta was there with an Anniversary card, bottle of wine and a cheese cake desert. It was a lovely gesture and beyond our expectations. Everyone at the Residence Inn was pleasent and accomadating. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay again when visiting the city.

title: Excelente localização!
text: Localizado entre o Central Park e a Time Square, fica fácil de se locomover para todas as partes de Manhattan! Estações de metrô perto! Bons restaurantes! Quarto com vista linda, limpo e funcional! Tem uma mini cozinha!

title: Great value
text: Stayed here on business and was very pleasantly surprised.   High floors have amazing full floor to curling glass views of Central Park.  Surrounded by good places to eat for any budget...quick eats or more involved sit downs

title: Une vue sur le skyline qui vous ferra rêver
text:
Je ne dis qu’un mot “la vue”... a couper le souffle. Au point de trouver la vue depuis le Top of the Rock limite banale/habituelle. On a eu la chance d’être au 62ieme étage, l’hôtel fait 65 étages. 
Petit déjeuner pas exceptionnel, ce qu’il faut sans plus. Mais la vue vous ferra vite oublier ce point. J’y retournerais sans hésiter.

title: College trip
text:
Our son wanted to visit Fordham University in the Bronx.  We decided to stay here since it was within walking distance to the Fordham Lincoln Center campus, and a 1/2 hr drive to the Bronx campus.  (45 min with Friday AM traffic) 
This hotel was right in the middle of everything.  You can walk to Times Square, you are right on Broadway, there is a parking garage across the street.  You can valet at the hotel but are unable to get your car until you leave, so we opted for the garage.  The hotel is lovely, the rooms were spacious and every room had a wonderful view of the city. It was very quiet too.  You could not hear any noise.  They have a breakfast that is included and is more than the usual buffet.  Plenty of options.  There is plenty of seating at the buffet area, but on weekends, it gets really crowded so go early.
Staff is very accommodating and friendly.

title: Ottima posizione! Ottima vista!
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato per una settimana (quella di capodanno) e ci siamo trovati bene.
Pagando di più si può avere una spettacolare vista su time square. 
Unica cosa un pò negativa è la scarsa colazione, nel senso che quando finiscono le cose non le rimpiazzano...quindi sveglia presto!!! E poi non si viene a NY per dormire...
Se torno a NY penso di ritornare qui.

title: All round enjoyable stay
text:
Booked this hotel due to an Air BNB cancellation 3 days before we were about to fly to NYC. Was not happy but the ladies on the Marriott call centre were excellent.
We were on the 48th floor of the residence inn. We were greeted by Kimberley at the front desk who was so nice and bubbly it was infectious. What a credit to the organisation she is. Anyways the room while not big was Ok in size and had a fridge (which didn't keep things real cold), but the ice machine on L35 was there to cool things down without issue if required.We had a view of the Hudson and were lucky enough for the clouds to break up and had 2 excellent sunsets. One thing was the the aircon was loud, but we didn't have it on at night so it wasn't a big deal. Also consider the hotels transfer deals. As an example they quoted $95 for transfer to Newark airport. We booked with another transfer company and the cost ended up being $90 with tolls and tips thrown in, so it wasn't worth all the hassle.
Cannot comment on breakfast as for me a piece of fruit will suffice. I looked at the fitness centre and it looked nice, but a peek is as close to a fitness centre I would like to come.

title: Non lo consiglio
text: Abbiamo soggiornato una settimana in questo albergo, le camere sono molto piccole, un letto ad una piazza e mezza (per due persone) e un letto singolo, un piccolissimo armadio, un microscopico comodino da dividere in tre e due cassetti, quindi poco posto per tutto. Per due giorni di seguito non hanno pulito la stanza e portato asciugamani, dopo numerose lamentele finalmente l'hanno fatto, comunque non soddisfacente, asciugamani e prodotti per la doccia non corrispondevano mai ai 3 ospiti che eravamo. Per fare colazione e trovare tutti i prodotti dovevi arrivare prestissimo, se arrivavi alle 9 non trovavi più niente e il servizio per coprire le mancanze era veramente lentissimo (nonostante l'orario per la colazione finisse alle 9-30). Sconsigliato vivamente

title: Che panorama!!
text:
La prima sera quando siamo arrivati in camera abbiamo "dovuto" spegnere la luce per sederci sul letto e guardare il panorama dal 63° piano....
Mozzafiato, come nei film; ovviamente, forse data l'altezza, camera silenziosissima.
Questo hotel faceva parte del ns pacchetto del viaggio di nozze (comprato dalla mitica Simona di A Tutta Randa di Rimini che non ho ancora avuto modo di ringraziare..) ed è con questo hotel a NY che abbiamo inaugurato il viaggio.
Camera piccola ed essenziale ma funzionale, servizio ok, colazione a buffet abbondante (ahimè senza croissant, direi fondamentali, ma va bene lo stesso), laundry service molto utile e con detersivo offerto dall'hotel.
Posizione ottima, vicinissima a Time Square (per chi vuole stare nella bolgia) quindi molto comoda per gli spostamenti, con la metro a 5 min.
Nel complesso, ottimo!!

title: My second review after 1* rating
text:
I reviewed this hotel couples months ago criticizing their poor customer service "prior to my stay". However, I still decided to stay here as I would like to experience the view from "the tallest hotel in North America" 

Below I would write about what I did experience from this place starting with the plus side:

I stayed here for two period: the first period for two night while the latter is just for a night (being upgraded from the Courtyard). I got the room on high floor -- 63rd and 62nd respectively. Unbeatable view of Manhattan. Really impressive. The location is at the heart of midtown. 5 minutes away to both Central Park, TOTR, and Time Square. The fist period I stayed in Grand Time Square View Room. The room is pretty small. However, for the latter period, I got bigger room with one-king size bed and one single bed that comes with bathtub. Somewhat enjoyable.

However, it seems like there are many negative issues I have to share. All are related to their service. Similar to other "hotels", the service provided by "hotels" are really drain and dry. It is like you are having a frozen food. Just unpack and put in the microwave. All guests received the same standard taste (a bit poor tho).  There is no spiritual. Staffs work as if they are robot. Working for money and forget their passions somewhere between homes and their workplace. (I would like to give a special credit to Rebecca -- the front desk staff who took care me when I checked out in the morning of 18/3/18. She is the only one I feel "wow" by her energetic hospitality.) Everyone is trained to focus on one job. Do not have ability of multi-tasking. Front desk staffs will know only check in and check out process. They dont even inform me about St.Patrick's parade. Dont know even when and where did it start. For this sort of information, you have to go to concierge counter which located in a small corner in front of Residence Inn's elevators. You may think that, you know, this is true. Front desk is for check in not for information. But this is what I regard as "robotic service." It would be more "cool" if you just let the machines do the job (self-check in/out) and provide 5 (or more ) laptops for customers' self service. At least the customers do not require to pay for tip. lol They also responded annoyingly slow for my emails. Prior to my arrival, I had to make an international call from Bangkok to the hotel as they did not reply my email for over 3 days. Once I called they let me wait for over 5 minutes for answering my simple question. (I asked whether they allowed me to store luggage during both periods of my stay or not). You may read my previous review about this. The peak story was, due to the snow storm, all flights cancelled. I cannot make it to the hotel for my second period. I sent them a message telling them my difficult circumstance asking whether I could be able to cancel my first night of the second period or not. Believe it or not, they replied after I checked out and on my flight back to Bangkok! Ridiculously true story.      

The facilities in the room is somewhat not useful. My first impression I admitted I was pretty excited seeing kitchen amenities. However, once my feeling was "cool down" I asked myself whether I need all those stuffs or not. As a tourist, nobody want to cook when they stay are surrounded by millions of restaurants. What I want is a bathrobe, slippers, "good quality" breakfast in which they did not provide. Bathroom amenities was also lacking. I did ask twice for more soap and shampoo.

All in all, If you would like to experience the view, book here with the high floor. Stay here for a night not more than two. And move to any other better service (or reviews) hotels.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Beautiful newer hotel with a kitchenette. Love the feel, and the cleanliness. Would recommend to anyone. The staff is attentive. The rooms are spotless. Getting a cab is easy.. Delicious restaurants surround it. Free breakfast included.

title: Great stay, but absurdly expensive call charges
text:
Overall a great stay, warm welcome (a very special Thank you to Wioleta in the reception and manager Jamie Bond for a great surprise in the room, highly appreciated), fantastic views and attentive staff. Breakfast so-and-so but this is smack in the middle of NYC so you can get whatever you like in 5min. 
Only downside was to pay $20 for a phone call to voicemail! Tried to reach a transfer agent 3 times and got to voicemail (US number) every time and was charged over $60 for this :( Which is just absurd.. Lesson learned - never had to check phone rates in hotels before, but will surely do so now. The hotel should inform the guests beforehand if they charge such steep prices to use the phone though (in hindsight I should have used my cell as calling through Sweden back to USA would have been several times cheaper).
Overall a great stay, would definitely recommend others (and already have), just be aware of the call charges which can leave a bitter taste at the end (hence not a perfect rating).

title: Super stay
text: I have just returned to Madrid after concluding my fourth stay at this fantastic hotel. I need not mention that this property has become “my home away from home” whenever I travel to New York. I was given a wonderful corner room in the 49th floor that was fantastic for my shots as amateur photographer. The check-in was quick although I arrived before 4 pm. The room was spotlessly clean and the bed is super comfy. If you are an early bird you will be able to enjoy the delicious waffles. The staff members are courteous, friendly and professional. I cannot wait to enjoy another stay!

title: Friendly staff nice room
text: Very friendly and accommodating staff, room was nice size and a kitchen that can be used to make some coffee and food. Comfortable bed and nice view if you get a high floor. Did not try the breakfast since most reviews indicated it was very busy and I wanted the quite AM. Would stay again if in NYC

title: Great staff, Spectacular views
text: We had a lovely one night stay at the Residence Inn. The staff were all excellent - friendly, courteous, welcoming, professional. A special shout-out of appreciation to the front desk staff and to Antonio - one of the bellhop staff. Our room was on the 64th floor and had, obviously, spectacular views. Although the room was quite small, the great views more than made up for this; as did the especially comfortable bed (one of the most comfortable hotel beds we have slept on!) and the super clean bathroom and great shower. Overall - a great stay and a really good choice when staying in midtown Manhattan.

title: what a view
text: I travel for business to NYC a few times a month.  I ended up staying by central park because of the location to the customer i was visiting.  I found this hotel on my Marriott rewards app a few days before my arrival and was pleasantly surprised as as to how nice it was! The view was amazing, the room was clean and the service was great!

title: 大雪の日
text:
大雪の日から４泊しました。
予約が自分ではなかったので、ロビーで待ち合わせ予定だったのですが、大雪で彼のフライト到着時間が大幅に遅れることに。

電話で事前に問い合わせてもらったら、荷物は預かれるが、チェックインはできないとのこと。
でも行って聞いてみたら、今日彼が来るならいいとのことでかなり早い時間でしたが、チェックインさせてくれました。
時と場合によって対応してくれてありがたかったです。

部屋は口コミにあった、エレベーターの音がかなりする場所でした。
高層なのでビル風の音も聞こえます。
毎日観光して歩き回り、疲れてたのでよく眠れましたが、音に敏感な方は静かな部屋をリクエストした方が良さそうです。
バスタブのあるお部屋でそこも良かったです。
出かけてちょっとランチに戻って休憩、また午後お出かけ...と便利な立地と清潔な建物に満足です。

title: A New Experience
text: Spent 4 days at this property and was duly impressed with the room, the high floor views and the lounges. Recommended, but the complimentary breakfast was disappointing. Not much variety and few healthy choices. Staff service was excellent and hospitable.

title: 5 night trip
text: My husband and I travelled from Ireland and stayed here for 5 nights from March 13th to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. Was apprehensive having read some reviews particularly regarding room size and breakfast. I needn't have worried. We were met by a very friendly receptionist and despite arriving at midday, our room was ready. We found the room size and layout  just perfect. Space has been used really well with lots of storage. We had a wonderful corner room with views of Times Square. We were on the 40th floor (room 4005) which was high enough to avoid most of the street noise. We went for breakfast each morning. We are early risers so maybe avoided some of the complaints other visitors mentioned regarding lack of space and choice. We found a good selection of hot and cold food (hot maybe a bit limited) but overall perfect for setting us up for the day. The breakfast room was very clean and staff were helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent for discovering New York on foot. For those not wishing to walk there is a subway station nearby. Times Square is approx 5 minute walk and the hotel is located close to all theatres. We arrived in New York a night early and unfortunately this hotel was fully booked. We instead stayed in Row NYC. Suffice to say we will not be staying there again. We were just so relieved to check in to Residence Inn and would recommend it to anyone visiting New York. We also requested a late check out of 1pm which was accommodated without any problems. Overall a wonderful stay.

title: Trevligt bemötande
text: Positivt bemötande, bra rum med pentry och rent och snyggt. Frukostbuffén  var av bästa slag med väldigt bra och trevlig service. Hotellets läge vid Broadway, nära Ground zero och finanskvarteren var också positivt.

title: Vista excelente.
text:
Visité este hotel para celebrar nuestro aniversario de bodas #24. El proceso de check in fue bastante rápido y eficiente. Solicité check in temprano e hicieron la opción de dejar las maletas, para las tarde hacer el check in una hora antes de lo anticipado. Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero bastante cómodas para una pareja. La limpieza estuvo excelente. Los baños son cómodos y cuentan con aguan caliente. Se necesita la tarjeta de acceso para encender las luces.

El recibimiento con una botella de champagne, y dos cheese cakes fue un lindo detalle de la gerencia. 

El desayuno debe ser más variado, pero estuvimos complacidos con lo ofrecido.  El area de desayuno era cómoda y con vista a la calle.

Lo mejor del hotel son las vistas. Nuestro cuarto fue en el piso 46, esquina. Podía ver el Central Park y Times Square, más varios edificios que hacían la vista completamente impresionante. Además, la localización céntrica lo hacen muy atractivo cerca de varias estaciones de Subway, que permiten el acceso desde cualquier punto.

En fin, creo que es un excelente hotel el cual recomendaría como una excelente alternativa céntrica y con maravillosas vistas de Manhattan.

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
Muy buen hotel en excelente ubicación. Muy cerca de varias de las cosas imperdibles de new york (times square, central park, etc.) y en un lugar seguro.
Sirven un buen desayuno. Estuve en una habitación, para 3 personas. Obviamente estábamos medio apretados, pero no deja de ser un departamento en nueva york, lo cual es lógico que así sea.

title: De 15 años con mi hijo no tiene casi vista a Central Park
text:
Este  hotel esta muy bien ubicado en Broadway y la 54, a unas cuadras de Times Square.
Tiene desayuno incluido pero el lugar es para los 2 hoteles q tiene el edificio y el domingo 8am casi se había sacado los alimentos.
El personal es amable!!
Las habitaciones son de buen tamaño para ser NY, modernas y limpias, tiene cocineta sin estufa solo con horno de microondas, refrigerador y utensilios.
Mi habitación tenía 2 camas matrimoniales, solo el bote de basura del baño un poco viejo.
CONTRA: la habitación la pague con vista a Central Park y para mi desilusión solo se alcanzaba a ver una esquina del parque.
Y eso que mi piso era el 48 de 68 pisos, pero en frente había un edificio muy alto que tapa la vista!!! No deberían de cobrar mas caro la habitación si apenas se ve un pedazo.

title: Voyage à New York
text:
C'est un hôtel qui est très bien placé à mi-chemin entre Times Square et Columbus Circle, entré de Central Park. 
Lors de notre arrivée on nous a dit que nous avions réservé qu'une chambre, mais lors de notre réservation nous avions bien demandé deux chambres, mais l'hôtesse d'accueil à fait de son maximum et le problème a été résolue. Nous avons donc eu deux chambres à deux étages différents et avec deux vues différentes. 
Les chambres sont suffisamment spacieuse, propre, la vue est magnifique et le fait de disposer d'une cuisine permet de manger dans notre chambre le soir. Par contre l'une des chambres était en moins bonne état que l'autre et ne disposait pas de tables. 
Le petit déjeuner est un peu déstabilisant pour des Français, avec beaucoup de salé, et peu de sucré et viennoiseries. Même si le fait de se faire des gaufres est très appréciable, deux appareils sont limites pour satisfaire la demande. Et certains jours il vaut mieux arriver tôt, avant 8 heures du matin car il risque de ne plus avoir autant de choix, même au niveau des boissons. Et je trouve qu'il manquait de fruit. 
Pour finir j'ai trouvé le personnel très à écoute et sympathique, comme la plupart des New-Yorkais à qui nous avons parlé durant ce séjour.

title: Midt på Broadway
text:
Absolut den bedste beliggenheden midt på Broadway. Gåafstand fra Central Park og Times Square. Godt og rummelig værelse med udsigt og lille køkkenhjørne. Aircondition larmer en del, men den kan slukkes. Der er også et lille vindue, som kan åbnes i stedet for. 
Eneste jeg vil ønske var bedre, er rengøring. 
Morgenmaden var god. Der var muligt at lave vafler, vælge mellem forskellige bagværk og havregrød. 
Alt i alt var jeg tilfreds med opholdet (10 dage) og kan varmt anbefale hotellet.

title: Great Location, smallish rooms, helpful staff
text:
Chosen as part of a Virgin Holidays package based on location, views from rooms, and modern looking amenities. Overall reasonable value. Floor 47 gave good views of central park / times square. Modern but smallish room with bath / shower and large double, free and fast internet, small kitchenette with fridge, dishwasher, crockery and cutlery etc, small hob avail on request. I'd stay again if the price was right. Breakfast a bit of a scrum, plenty of room to sit, but buffet area too small, and food not restocked often enough.
Staff were really helpful on front desk.

title: Hotel maravilhoso, localização ótima!!
text:
A localização do hotel é maravilhosa, fica entre a Times Square e o Central Park e próximo à várias estações de metrô! 
Os quartos, apesar de não serem muito grandes  são muito confortáveis e bem equipados! A cama é deliciosa! Como os quartos estão localizados a partir do 35 andar, a vista deles é linda! 
A mini cozinha é extremamente útil! Conta com um microondas, máquina de lavar louça, refrigerador, freezer e utensílios de cozinha! 
Quartos sempre limpos! 
O café da manhã é bom, apesar de não muito variado.

title: Excelente localização
text:
Excelente localização na Broadway junto aos teatros e próximo ao Central Park.
Ficamos no 54o andar onde a vista é incrível. Café da manhã bom e em ambiente confortável, desde que não seja no horário de pico.
Quarto confortável, limpo e completo.

title: Tiny Rooms, however magnificant views
text:
We recently stayed at this hotel for two periods of three and two nights, and were happy with our choice.   The hotel is in a great location, a few blocks from central park and Times square, with supermarkets, restaurants, bars shopping centres, subways within easy walking distance.

The checkin staff are friendly and professional, and as we arrived early, we were offered an early checkin in the courtyard part of the hotel.  That was fine, and we were to move the next day, and we still had access to the breakfast floor.  The hotel was heavily booked the next day, so we were offered a discount to stay in our current room, which we accepted.

The breakfast is excellent – plenty of choices, and space on the third level with suitable healthy options available for someone like me.  

Wifi in the hotel was good, the free version is all that is required, although you can upgrade if you want for 7 usd approx. a day (not needed). 

Rooms.  The views from the rooms are excellent, especially on the Residence in levels where we were on floor 63.  The addition of a kitchenette is nice, however the actual room was so small that we would have preferred to move back to the courtyard ones.  It was really pokey, with very little space to put a bag and just enough to move around the bed.  The bathrooms in both were great though.

All in all, we had a great stay, and we will recommend it to others – it is disappointing that they do not have a bar etc on one of the higher levels, although the 4 level bar was a great place to hang out and the staff were brilliant.  They have a microwave that can be used to heat food if required.

Disappointing – one area that was quite annoying is the access.  We have a baby in a stroller, and you cannot enter the hotel from the double doors; they are locked and the access button does not work.  Even though the staff could clearly see us trying to enter (a couple of times) with a sleeping baby in a stroller, no one made any effort to open the doors for us.  We had to back out and go through the turnstile entrance, lifting the stroller onto two wheels to try and fit the stroller in.  Totally unacceptable and even though we mentioned the issue to the reception, it remained the same for both visits.

title: Um pouco decepcionada
text: Foi a minha segunda vez no Residence Inn Central Park e volta a afirmar: será sempre meu hotel escolhido em Nova York. E porquê? Quartos confortáveis, café da manhã muito gostoso, computador disponível, vista incrível, localização maravilhosa. Porém este ano tive algumas decepções. Em primeiro lugar, algumas semanas antes mandei mensagem pelo Facebook pedindo um quarto com final 02 ( o mesmo que havia ficado 2 anos antes? Não obtive resposta alguma. Em segundo lugar, cheguei no hotel em torno das 7:00 am e, como o check in era só a partir das 16:00, pedi novamente na recepção se seria possível o quarto com final 02. Nada feito. Em terceiro lugar, o check só foi feito às 17:00 hs. Em quarto lugar, o quarto que me deram foi justamente aquele que eu menos queria. Mesmo sendo o Park View, tinha uma parede enorme em frente à cama  (quarto final 01). A diferença de um quarto para o outro é gritante. O quarto final 02 não tem parede alguma, só a janela com vista incrível. O quarto final 01 tem uma parede considerável. O que mais me decepcionou foi a falta da resposta do Facebook e uma certa preguiça de atender um pedido simples, visto que fiz a reserva com 4 meses de antecedência. Em quinto lugar, um dia depois do Reveillon, foi dito que o café da manhã seria restrito. E, realmente foi, com pouquíssimas opções. Em quinto lugar, não há nenhum controle com relação ao café da manhã. Quem não tem direito ao café da manhã pode tranquilamente ir tomar café sem serem questionados. Em sexto lugar, dois dias antes do meu check out não conseguia abrir o quarto. Desci para a recepção e falaram que havia um problema com o meu cartão de crédito. Resolvido o problema, tive que subir com um segurança para abrir o carto. Achei estranho, pois geralmente a chave pode ser destravada na recepção. Em sétimo lugar, o box do banheiro vazava e tinha que ficar enxugando.

title: Small Rooms
text:
Rooms are too small for more than two people but are nicely appointed.  Felt as if the chair and table were crammed into the room.  We booked for three people but had to remind constantly the housekeeping staff that we needed amenities for three people.  Not clear whether the items in the kitchenette were complimentary.  Since the bellboy told us that the bottled water was complimentary, we consumed several bottles before we were told that the water costs $6 per bottle.  Thankfully the hotel reversed the charges.
Breakfast was average.  Eggs were consistently dry; I suspect the hotel served powdered eggs.  Because there were only two waffle irons, making waffles was usually a chore.  Some food items were not replenished during the last 30 minutes.

title: Great room - not so great elsewhere!
text:
We stayed for three nights and our room, a king suite on the 41st floor, was great. 
Despite being close to the elevators, the room was quiet at night. 
I have no complaints about check in. 
Breakfast was a different story. Unless you were there early, the choice was diminished extensively with food bit really being proactively replenished. Anything from scrambled egg to tomato ketchup ran out 2/3 mornings. 
First morning we were down early so weren’t impacted!
Upon checkout, I questioned why I’d been charged one rate for two nights and a different rate for the other - as this was not what I’d booked. 
Girl stated ‘it’s to do with occupancy and it’s right’. 
No further discussion would be entered into so I paid and left.

title: New york
text: Muy comodo apart  hotel muy bien ubicado cerca  de todas las atracciones metro a una cuadra tenemos una habitacion en el piso 52 con una espectacular vista tanto de dia como de noche solicita pisos alto

title: 4th Stay At Property....
text:
This was our fourth stay at this property. Twice in the Courtyard and now twice at the Residence Inn.  We love the location, the staff, cleanliness and the bed is comfortable.

A few minor issues from the last two stays. In general, the rooms are quite drafty (at both properties) this could be from the floor to ceiling windows..the glazing..who knows..and this had us jacking the heat way up in the room.   Wind noise was an issue this stay as the gusts were pretty loud. Thought it was the room above me, but it was the wind.  Had never experienced this before.

Second issue was the breakfast area.  You guys HAVE to do something about this.  Their are a ton of complaints in the reviews here about this, but it was pretty bad.   Need to really improve the entire "flow" in this area as it's just not a good setup.  Please think about putting the plates/silverware in a different location as the lines for the waffle maker blocked access to them. Maybe move the waffle station to a different part of the seating area (side wall next to the food area)? Eggs were very cold.  Fruit was empty (eventually refilled).  Tea selection was empty.  Maybe it was a staffing issue?  The staff was friendly, however.  Just seemed over-worked.   It's a HUGE area for people to sit and such a small area for the breakfast food area.  

After the first morning (of three), we chose to actually go to the diner around the corner and pay for breakfast since we knew it would be better.  Kind of a shame since it's one of the reasons we chose this hotel again.

title: Perfect location and very comfortable rooms
text: The rooms are great, with king size bed, kitchenette and great views.  We were in New York for New Year's Eve and had a fantastic view of Time Square from our room.  Beds are comfortable, showers are hot and interesting temperature control.  Cleaning was done every day and staff are friendly.  Location is amazing, you can walk everywhere from here.

title: Rare Bad Experience with Marriott
text: Had booked a room and upon arriving found the room could not accommodate 3 people as I had requested. This lead to me emergently having to find another hotel. The staff made some attempts however do not feel they engaged to really solve the issue.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: As it was my husband's 65th birthday during our stay I emailed the hotel prior to our arrival to ask for a studio with a great view.  Jamie Bond from Guest Services ensured we had a lovely corner studio with view of Times Square, also a birthday cake, card and champagne were in our room when we arrived... a great surprise for my husband!  The gentleman on reception also wished my husband happy birthday on check in.  The studio was extremely comfortable.  Breakfasts were very enjoyable.  Housekeeping and reception staff were great - very friendly and helpful.  Wonderful hotel in a great location for Walter Kerr Theatre, where we went to see fantastic Springsteen on Broadway ... we will definitely be staying here again on our return to New York.

title: Great Hotel/Great Location
text:
This hotel was an excellent location and location for our weekend visit to NYC for my daughters college audition. I checked in via mobile, but had to wait a few minutes to pick up my key. At the reception, we were told about 3rd floor breakfast and 4th floor coffee in lounge. our room was 4003 and the room was sufficient for our needs.
I had cooked food, but there was a card that stated to call the front desk for a cooktop.
The room was very clean, modern and again served the purpose of why I was in the city.  I like small spaces.  There were minor things(reading light didn't work), too busy to report, otherwise I had no  major complaints. I would stay here again. I called for a late checkout and got it.  Minor issue: my room was cleaned on Saturday and I had to call the desk for washcloths(minor attention detail).  Also there was nothing in the room that mentioned the time for breakfast, so I had to call for the time. in this room if you are a light sleeper, then you will hear the elevator. The sound did not wake me up, but at first I could not figure out what the sound was.  I had a rate that included a dinner discount that I never used.  Staff was very friendly and helpful if I asked a question.  Shout out to the bartender at the lounge on Saturday night, he was amazing.  He recognized my guest badge from my daughter audition and just commended her on her success, so far.  This was amazing, sorry I did not catch his name.

title: Fabulous Hotel!
text: This was our second time staying at this wonderful hotel and won't be our last.  It's a fabulous hotel in a wonderful location.  Located one block from the subway and within easy walking distance of all the sites, including Central Park and Fifth Avenue.  The room was very modern, with an extremely comfortable bed - possibly the most comfortable bed in a hotel we have ever encountered.  The shower was roomy and well appointed and the kitchen well laid out.  The staff at the hotel were very accommodating and helpful. Breakfast was vast with a great selection of fresh fruit, bagels, eggs, bacon etc.The gym is an added bonus, located on the 35th floor with great views.  Our room was on the 51st floor with views over the Hudson River.  We will definitely stay here again when we return to New York. Highly recommend!

title: Hôtel magnifique avec vue panoramique
text: Hôtel très bien situé au cœur de Manhattan, à proximité immédiate de Central Park et Times Square. Chambre très confortable avec une vue panoramique époustouflante sur la ville. Petit déjeuné complet servis sous forme de buffet dans une grande salle lumineuse. Je recommande cet hôtel.

title: Romantic new year in New York
text:
This is a brilliant hotel! 
Very close to Times Square (could even see it from our window) walking distance to the nearest subway. I found on check in we had a grumpy woman who checked us in who needs to learn how to smile to guests but the others each day when we wanted little things if we didn’t get her the rest were nice. 

The big issue was breakfast, because we arrived on New Year’s Eve I presume the hotel was just full but at breakfast it was like people fighting over the last croissant and juice cup, there was no system whatsoever, the other 5 mornings we were there were still the same but with less people and nowhere to sit once we had our plate of food, the only one morning where we actually enjoyed the breakfast was when they had a receptionist on the door checking names and rooms which made it have a little bit more of a system to it, so I’d highly recommend them to do that in the future as it can get like a zoo in there!! Animals fighting for food lol. 

Other than this, be patient with the lifts - they do have a lot of floors to go through and you may have to stop on every one at some point on your holiday. Would go back when on another trip to Visit New York City.

title: Anniversary trip was great
text: Room was small but nice. Lots of light with all the windows. Stayed on 59th floor, corner room with park view. It's not so much a park view with the construction of buildings that block it so I would not pay extra for that view again. But otherwise we enjoyed it. Elevators were fast. Never ventured down to the breakfast and really the lobby isn't anything special, but that's not why we were there. The room was clean and comfortable like it should be. :)

title: Great hotel experience
text: We struggled to pick a hotel for our one night stay in the city. We were thrilled with our choice.  The gentlemen who kept our bags were very friendly. The woman who checked us in was fabulous. We never waited long for an elevator. Many reviews complained about the breakfast buffet, but we found it to be just fine. Everyone we encountered on the staff were friendly and helpful. And the best part was our room. It was a good size and came with a kitchenette. I checked it out and was very impressed with what was included. There was even a crockpot. There was a good sized fridge that was actually really cold and even a good sized freezer. Would be great for a long stay. But I saved the best for last and that was the view. We booked a city view room and were put on the 54th floor. We had a great view of the NYE ball and could see the river when we turned to the side. It was spectacular!  For the first time ever we slept with the shades open in a hotel room. Wished we could have stayed longer. Clean and comfortable.  Well done Marriott. Very happy with the location as well.

title: Fabulous Stay, the rooms was incredible, Front Desk Excellent.
text:
We live in the city, but sold our apt. in Dec., and we have been staying at hotels off and on till we can move into our new place 1/24. We have stuck with Hilton and Marriott using points or cheap rates. A total of 4 different hotels.
Of the 4, this was the best room, and frankly, the best room we've ever had in NYC, even when we lived in Texas and stayed in NYC on business. My husband was with a Dallas oil company before retirement, and they stayed at places like the Peninsula, Waldorf, Lowell, Plaza Athenee and the Caryle and St. Regis. We are no stranger to $700 plus hotel rooms, in our other life.
Our room, 4802 at the Residence, was the most beautiful room we have ever had in the city. We were stunned. Forget the fact that I used points. Even the going price wasn't horrible. A corner room with a billion dollar view. If only I could afford an apt. with that view!. Nice kitchen in the room in case you do want to cook, large beautiful bathroom. Wasn't a fan of the huge white chair in the room, which was awkward and too large, but other than that it was perfect.
The reception at the desk was friendly and kind, I checked in early with no problem. The location is good for business or touring the city, slightly out of the Times Sq. area,  but still close to good transport, and less people.
All I can add is try it, you'll love it.

title: Our favorite place to stay when visiting Manhattan
text:
This is the second time we have stayed at the Residence Inn New York Manhattan / Central Park.  Both stays have been fabulous.  The staff is incredibly warm and friendly.  

Diane was able to provide us with a great room with amazing views.  She was cheerful and willing to take the time to make sure our visit was memorable.  

The room was updated, clean and had an incredibly comfortable bed.  You cant beat the fantastic complementary breakfast.  If you are heading to New York and want to be close to Time Square, this is the place to stay!

title: Not Residence Inn Standard..
text: We were here 9 days and it was a very expensive stay. From the start of our stay we were disappointed in the service provided and the cleanliness of the room.  When we first arrived from the airport we stopped at the front desk and the first young lady we spoke with was very rude and told us to come back at 3:30.  We left and came back at 3 and spoke with another young lady who was extremely polite and helpful.  She told us our room was ready and had been ready.  She got us checked in, took are Marriott gift cards off the bill (which the first lady said couldn't be done til the end of the stay).  We got to the room, the 64th floor, we will say the view was breathtaking.  Hudson River on one side and Central Park on the other.  The room was not clean, we found other guests dirty socks on the floor, food crumbs all over the floor, the sheets did not look clean.  We were too tired to call downstairs so I got clean sheets from housekeeping and changed the sheets myself.  Yes changed the sheets myself as I did not want to deal with anymore rudeness from the staff.  The room needed some freshing up.  Lamp shades were stained, furnishings were very worn. Just not Residence Inn standards.  One day they had only 1 elevator working but none of the staff could tell you that.  Overall staff were rude except for the bellmen and the second lady who checked us in.  Also make sure you check your bill really good.  They like to slip charges in there for $6.00 bottles of water you never drank. Free breakfast became old after the second day as they serve the same thing every day.  Just disappointed that they call this a Residence Inn.

title: If you get a good rate, a great NYC choice
text:
I was was there for a two-day stay on a VERY cold Martin Luther King weekend in January 2018.  Great location and interesting hybrid hotel, one half Residence Inn and one half Marriott Courtyard.  Check-in was cordial and quick.  The staff was nice throughout my visit.

On occupying the room, I found that the desk lamp needed a bulb. After I called for assistance, a cheerful maintenance guy arrived within 30 minutes with a replacement. Very impressive! 

My 49th-floor room was compact by Residence Inn standards though not, necessarily, NYC spaces. The comfortable king-sized bed pretty much filled the living space with the remainder taken by a desk and an over-sized chair and ottoman. The view down Broadway was spectacular.  In the entrance corridor, a long counter with cabinets contained all the typical Residence Inn equipment. 

The highlight of the bathroom was a large spacious shower. The sink area was compact - not really room for two people to lay out toiletries. The commode was 3/4-sized - it almost looked like a child’s toilet, but It it worked ok. 

The breakfast area is gorgeous, highlighted by tall windows that offer sweeping views of the streets below. Unfortunately, when I arrived 25-minutes before closing time, the coffee and milk were out and no one was around to replenish them. Not very cool at all.  

All-in-all, it was a fine visit.  I would stay there again.

title: Clean, OK Breakfast, Good Staff
text: We had two rooms for a family of 5 for 3 nights.  Front desk gave us rooms directly across the hall from each other (no adjoining rooms in hotel). King was tighter than double/single combo, but it worked well as there was only one other room nearby.  Views weren't great on 39th floor, but did not request or care. Minor issue with noisy refrigerator was resolved quickly. Temporarily ran out of coffee at breakfast on two days (hate to wait). Car valet was quick (20 mins). Staff friendly and helpful. Not a good lobby for hanging out, and bar on 4th floor was closed after shows on Friday night.  Sheets not as good as regular Marriott, but good pillows.  Elevators can be a wait. Easy walks to Frick, Rockefeller Center, Lincoln Center, and Times Square. Overall, a clean, efficient hotel.  Would stay again.

title: Not your normal Residence Inn, in many ways
text:
I've stayed at a lot of Residence Inn hotels and this is by far the most unique.  Here's what I found good and bad about it. 

This is a VERY high rise hotel, and the Residence Inn occupies the top half of the building so views are amazing.  I was on the 50th floor looking north and could see the Hudson River, Central Park and lots of New York.  The windows in the room are floor to ceiling so you really get to enjoy the views.   Apparently rooms on the south side look over Times Square and most of Manhattan.  If you've never been to New York, or just enjoy skyline views, it would be worth booking this hotel just for that. 

The decor looks like it was lifted directly from the Mondrian Hotel in SoHo (now the NoMo Hotel).  Lots of clean blue, white, black and hip furnishings.  Not at all like many Residence Inns that appear to have been furnished from the generic furniture department at Home Depot.   Might not be everyone's taste, but I appreciated it. 

The shower is amazing.  Great shower head, lots of water pressure, a real shower so you're not just standing in a bathtub, and a floor to ceiling window in the bathroom so you can look out over Manhattan while showering.  Very cool!  (There is a window blind if you're particularly modest, but when you're on the 50th floor I wasn't worried about people peeking in the window). 

The bed is very comfortable, the heating / AC works well, WiFi is reliable if not particularly fast and I never had to wait long for elevators which is a good thing in a big hotel that goes up to 65 floors high. 

For the downside, I was on a business trip and Residence Inn's almost always have a useful (often very large) work desk and work style chair.  My room had a small round table and dining chair.
