I made it work, but it was a serious flaw in what should be a room you can work in.  There was one section of the room with a white leather chair and another round table in a corner.  A desk would have been great there. 

The only place you can see the TV is from the bed.  There are two chairs in the room,
but their placement and the floorplan mean you can't use them to watch TV.  I was thinking the TV might be on a swivel mount so you could adjust it a bit - but it wasn't.  

A key element of a Residence Inn is a kitchen which I always enjoy to be able to keep a snack or light meal.  The one here is small, which isn't bad considering it's in the heart of New York, but it didn't have any cooktop - only a microwave.  However somebody managed to stock it with pots and pans (probably Marriott standard issue for a Residence Inn) even though you have no way to use them.  Seems like nobody thought that one through. 

One evening I went down to the bar area on the 4th floor.  It's large and nicely done and has huge windows to look out at the street scenes.  It wasn't crowded but at least 50% of the empty tables had dirty glasses and dishes on them.  Not sure if a big party just left but it was a mess.  Then a few minutes after I got my drink the lights got much brighter and they started a painting class in a section of the lounge.   It's a really nice space, but didn't end up being welcoming or relaxing. 

Overall I would recommend this hotel for visitors to New York.  The views from the rooms are incredible.  The rooms are comfortable, showers are great, and staff are friendly.   If you're going to need to do much work in your room - or thinking you might actually prepare a light meal or relax and watch some TV it's not going to be your best choice.

title: High quality employees
text: First off I apologize for not quite remembering his name, but Miranez(I believe) from engineering responded quick to our tv not working in our room. The television was fixed in a matter of moments.  he made sure to tell us that they are here 24/7 and asked if we were in need of anything else before leaving. The entire staff was of high quality with everyone greeting us and making us feel welcomed.  Overall it's a good location and the rooms are not the biggest but the veiws and staff make up for it big time.will definitely recommend and return.

title: I loved this hotel
text: We were there during the frigid weather just before New Years.  The view from our room of Times Square and the Hudson River was so beautiful that I spent a lot of time watching the world go by and let the younger ones go out and about. Great location,  ambiance, furnishings sleek and cozy.  Service and cleanliness great.  The breakfast area was overwhelmed however.  Hotel fully booked.  Hard for them to keep up with utensils, food, seating.  House keeping needs a heads up about the dishwasher.  They run it when they come in to clean.  The second day it was running for ever.  I finally called maintenance.  It turned out it was on "heavy duty " for 3 glasses and a coffee pot.  The first day was fine, on a short wash.  Couldn't be opened during the cycle to find out what was going.  Looking forward to returning in warmer weather.

title: Great hotel option
text:
This is our go-to hotel in NYC.  Fabulous location within 3 blocks of Central Park, 5 or 6 from Times Square.  A couple of subway lines within 2 blocks.

The lobby is a bit bland but the staff does a nice job.  We ask and have received a corner room with a King bed.  The corner gives you a better view.  It's a typical small NYC room, but nicely decorated with good housekeeping.

Improvements?
Elevators.  Four but generally Slowwwwwww
Breakfast is included and decent.  Nothing "special" but works as fuel for the day.

Again, our go-to place.  Think this is our 3 or 4th stay.  We will be back.

title: 재방문한 곳
text: 예전에 방문하고 이번에 또 방문했습니다. 저번에도 그랬는데 이번에도 룸은 상당히 만족했던 곳입니다. 근데 직원분들이 상당히 불친절. 4시에 체크인 시간이었는데 얼리체크인은 바라지도 않았는데 4시가 훨~ 씬 넘은 시간이었음에도 불구하고 체크인이 안되어가지고 체크인 시간이 지나지 않았냐고 했음에도 불구하고 직원은 하나도 미안해 하지 않고 지금 해당 룸이 청소가 안되었기 때문에 이따가 다시 오라고... 체크인시간을 호텔측에서 어겼음에도 불구하고 이렇게 미안해하지도 않다니... 아.. 그리고 체크인을 하고 나서 키고장으로 인해 불편불편..모든 직원이 그렇게 불친절한건 아니었지만 유독 한 직원이 불친절함. 그리고 냉장고는 없었어요. 날이 추워서 냉장고를 뭐 쓸일은 없었지만 창가에다 음료수를 놓아두면 차가워졌습니다. 직원이 약간 불친절한것만 빼면 재방문의사 있습니다.

title: Very nice !
text: Nice clean rooms with a view,(small, but that;s normal in NYC) breakfast was ok, good service, especially for transportation (private SUV to JFK for 75$) and location is the best !! In the middle of everything and a lots of restaurants around. 5 min walk to Times Square, 10 min walk to Radio City.

title: Fantastic place
text:
Stayed here for our 15th wedding anniversary treat for 4 nights.  Unfortunately though we were on an unlucky flight to JFK from Heathrow which got turned back after at least 4 hours travel as JFK closed due to snow, hotel staff were fantastic though and moved our booking to a day later and added a day the other end when we rearranged our flight for a day later.

Jamie Bond guest relations manager had exchanged emails with me pre trip and blocked me an amazing room, we had paid for Times Square view but he ensured we were on the top floor (65th)on a corner (room 6507) so also had a view of the Hudson River and put cake and a bottle of fizz in the room, which after nearly 48 hours travel was a very welcome treat, thank you.

Location wise you can't get better, just a couple of steps to all the broadway theatres and Times Square, with Central Park being approx 5-10 mins the other way.

Staff were really helpful throughout, letting us check out later at 1pm.  Room amenities good, really like having the fridge and mini kitchen.  Would definitely stay here again when we are next in New York.

title: Second Time - Not a Charm
text: This was my second stay at this location, but my worst experience, in 28 yrs, as a Marriott Rewards member. I was upgraded to a corner room on the 39th floor w/city view. The rooms are contemporary & "cozy" with floor-to-ceiling glass on two sides. This is not an asset in winter, as the heating system cannot keep up with (and blows air directly on) the cold, drafty windows. After you set thermostat to desired temp, the system shuts off & will not go on again until temp. is 68 degrees or less. (I don't know if this was a flaw or hotel "energy-conservation.") Overnight, I woke up chilled 3x & had to turn the temp setting higher for warmth. Also, as guests from London & Boston reported, the b'fast experience was a disaster. Even though the lounge area is large w/many seating options, the architect failed w/a service area that is too small for the volume of guests. I saw only two (2) staff on duty. One could not keep up w/outages of food, silverware & beverages. The other was fighting a loosing battle against dirty dishes left on tables & drop-off station. (Note: I did not experience this chaos at b'fast on my last visit.) I'm still a loyal customer, but will look for another property on my next trip to NYC.

title: Spettacolare
text:
Sono stata a novembre con mia sorella è abbiamo soggiornato 10 giorni.
La posizione è ottima! In 5 minuti a piedi sei a time square, centrale Park dalla 5th avenue.
Il servizio è ottimo in reception, abbiamo avuto difficoltà nello stampare dei biglietti per la partita di basket e ci hanno aiutato, sono stati gentilissimi.
La stanza è bellissima avevamo una vista stupenda, ogni giorno ci cambiavano le lenzuola asciugamani e ci fornivano il kit per la doccia. Nella stanza avevamo anche l’angolo cottura, il frigo, lavastoviglie, il ferro e l’asse da stiro.
La colazione abbondante e trovavi di tutto e di più da mangiare. A disposizione se volevi potevi trovare i giornali gratuitamente.
Al 4 piano era disponibile anche uno starbucks senza uscire dall’hotel.
Noi ci siamo trovati benissimo e sicuramente lo consigliamo.

title: Ottlma sistemazione vicino a tutto
text:
Terza volta che torniamo in questo hotel, stavolta per capodanno con le nostre nipoti, posso solo confermare i giudizi precedenti, posizione eccellente a due passi da Central Park e dalla 5th, proprio sulla Broadway. Un must a NY la colazione inclusa. Unica pecca rilevata la costruzione di due nuovi grattacieli che hanno parzialmente tolto la visuale su Central Park, ma a NY, la città che non dorme mai, c'era da  aspettarselo...
Staff eccellente e cordiale, quando torneremo a NY sarà sempre il nostro riferimento!

title: Bien
text:
Fuimos en familia y nos asignaron una cuádruple en esquina con hermosa vista, muy conforme con la comodidad,  excelentes los productos de aseo personal. Los empleados de recepción,  limpieza, conserjería y hasta mantenimiento siempre muy predispuestos a ayudar.   A mi nena se le quedó el dedo atrapado en un anillo y todas las chicas de recepción y mantenimiento fueron superior amables trataron por todas las formas de salvar el dedo y el anillo. Mi agradecimiento a todos!
El desayuno un tema aparte, la gente se desespera por la comida y se llenan los platos d una forma q cuando podes acceder a las frutas te dejaron 3,  por ejemplo yo solo consumo café frutas y algún pedazo de queso y en 10 días solo tres conseguí algo. Hay mucha variedad pero no para nuestro gusto, por ej alguna mermelada o queso light, imposible conseguir.  Los que gustan del desayuno americano huevos,  panceta,  papas, avena, salchichas, hasta hamburguesas hay, y mucha variedad. La ubicación es excelente y sin dudas volveria!!

title: Deveria ser mais barato
text: Em termos gerais, é um bom hotel. Bem localizado, entre o Central Park e a Times Square, a uma quadra do metrô. Os funcionários são bem educados. Consegui um early check in, antecipando minha entrada das 4pm para o meio-dia. A existência de lavanderia no hotel ajuda bastante. O quarto não é ruim, mas tive um problema com a calefação. Apesar de ser inverno, o aquecimento do quarto não era bom, passei frio. Reclamei, mas não resolveram de modo satisfatório. Além disso, tive problemas com o chuveiro, que não esquentou algumas vezes. Alguns detalhes causam a impressão de um certo descuido com a manutenção, como abajures sujos e manchados. Além disso, por duas vezes passei o dia fora e quando retornei a camareira havia deixado a porta do quarto apenas encostada, sem trancar, colocando em risco meus pertences. O café da manhã precisa melhorar, pois o espaço para esse fim é pequeno, tendo em vista o tamanho do hotel. Além disso, a quantidade de comida era pequena, vários itens logo faltavam e não havia reposição suficiente. O ambiente é bem decorado, mas as mesas não são suficientes, os hóspedes precisam esperar que outros terminem o café da manhã para que possam se sentar. Em geral, as cadeiras são baixas, causando desconforto. E, finalmente, é preciso melhorar os elevadores, pois ficava muito tempo esperando por sua chegada. Como disse, no geral o hotel é bom. Mas o preço está acima do que ele oferece.

title: Could be so much better!
text:
The Residence Inn New York

My wife and I visited New York and stayed in the Marriott Residence Inn.
We checked into our Studio apartment on the 56th floor. The room was very compact but comfortable with an on suite shower room and a small well equipped kitchen.  The views of Times square and the river were astounding both by day and night.

The public areas of the hotel are generally of modern, but dated, design and produce a cold ambience .  

The service in the hotel was not good. On returning to the hotel at eleven, after a lovely evening at the Metropolitan Opera we visited the bar intent on having a relaxing drink before bed only to be told that the bar was closing. I was very surprised as there were still people in the bar drinking and for a bar in the middle of New York to close so early seemed ridiculous.   Breakfast can only be described as a shambles. The service area was far too small to cope with the amount of residents and there were very few staff on hand to top up the platters of food that were running low or out.   In the dining area tables were not cleared and there was an alcove stacked high with dirty plates and crockery. Staffing seemed to be a problem here.  On our third day our room was not serviced. 

Would we stay here again? Probably not.

title: Bel hôtel bien situé mais service à revoir.
text:
Hôtel très bien situé proche de central park, broadway et non loin de la fifth avenue et tous ses magasins. Hotel moderne avec une très jolie salle pour le pdj. 
Dommage que lorsque l’hotel est plein, il faut faire la queue aux ascenseurs, au buffet et il faut arriver au pdj 1h avant la fermeture pour avoir le choix.
La chambre pour 4 est peu spacieuse, même superficie que les chambres pour 2, pas assez de rangement pour les vêtements pour 5 jours. Lits confortables. En revanche pas de table ni de chaises pour manger à 4!
La city view est plus jolie que celle sur central park. Pas de vue sur central park au 45eme etage.

title: Vista spettacolare!
text: Abbiamo prenotato 6 mesi prima una camera presso questo hotel per assicurarci una camera angolare al 57esimo piano con vista su Times Square per il periodo di Natale 2017. Che dire?! La camera e la vista valevano tutti i soldi che abbiamo speso! procedure di check in/out veloci, operatori cortesi che ci hanno tenuto le valige anche dopo il check out e ci hanno fatto trovare un taxi pronto alla nostra partenza. Letto alto e abbastanza comodo, tantissimi cuscini disponibili. Camera leggeremente fredda, ma penso sia dovuto al fatto che la nostra era circondata da vetrate.

title: Ótimo
text:
A localização é com certeza o ponto alto desse hotel.
Fica a poucas quadras do Central Park, próximo à Times Square e vários pontos turisticamente interessantes de NY.
O hotel se divide em dois: ate andar 35 é o Courtyard; e do andar 36 até 65 é o Residence inn.
Gostamos do quarto, pequeno mas funcional.
Cama confortável, bom chuveiro.
Amenities compatíveis com um hotel de rede.
Bom preço para um hotel desse padrão em NY.
Café da manhã um pouco fora dos nossos padrões, mais simples, mas satisfatório. Estranhamos o fato de não haverem mesas mais altas, apenas mesinhas (parecidas com mesas de centro), o que tornava tomar o café um tanto desconfortável.
Recomendamos.

title: Good, but breakfast needs attention
text: This is our fourth stay at this hotel. It's a good choice in Midtown with clean, comfortable rooms, a mini kitchen, and great location near subways and attractions. I took a star off the rating, and considered taking two stars off, because of the consistent disorganization at breakfast. We arrived at 8am each morning to face food shortages, no silverware, no bowls, frozen bread, and tons of people jostling for position. It seems that the breakfast room is consistently understaffed. The employees do their best, and were as polite as they could be, but they just can't keep up with the flow of people. We stay at this property in part because of the complimentary breakfast, but during this stay breakfast was a complete letdown.

title: CENTRALE CONFORTEVOLE
text:
Ho soggiornato a fine Ottobre presso questo centralissimo residence.
Accoglienza calorosa concessami una camera al sessantesimo piano grandiosa con parete a vetro che dava  su T. Square  e sul fiume . Strepitosi tramonti - ! Di notte uno spettacolo . Camera non grandissima ma c'era tutto pure una  piccola cucina fornita di micronde e ben fornita di accessori vari - Letto comodissimo e grande - bagno piccolo ma con doccia impagabile !  Bastavano pochi metri per MM e BUS - 4 minuti a piedi per T S.  - Locali a portata di "inciampo" - Lo consiglio .!!!

title: Excellent Location and Price
text: I was very impressed with this hotel for the price! We booked two rooms (a king corner view and a double room) at the Courtyard Marriott which is the lower level floors. Upon arrival, we were given a free upgrade to the Residence Inn which is the high level floors. We were on floors 43 and 58 both of which offered incredible views. The rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. You couldn’t pick a better location as it is within blocks of many iconic NYC sites. The elevators were super fast which is important. Breakfast was good but very busy. Overall, I would stay here again.

title: Everything I wished for
text: The moment we arrived after a long trip the staff were so friendly & helpful. The room was spacious and was luckily to be given an upgrade to the 65th floor with amazing views. It was excellent have a kitchen and it was modern and just perfect. The hotel is in a great position close to time square, Central Park, subways & pretty well everything. The beds very comfortable & very quiet. Fantastic having breakfast include which is in a fabulous room. Look forward to coming and staying there again. It made our holiday even more special

title: Few days in  NYC
text: This place gets five stars alone for location. Being close enough to walk to most attractions was great, and if not the metro stop is just a couple blocks away! The room was cozy and had a beautiful view of the city. There was also a half kitchen which is great if you want to make a quick bite for yourself. The breakfast on the 3rd floor is included and very very good! Sausage, eggs, bagels, coffee, and hot Chocolate...what more do you need?

title: Business trip
text: this hotel is in a very convenient location - I  have stayed here several times.  Staff - overnight room and having breakfast included have been the big selling points for me to return again and again.  I don't know what was going on at the hotel for this stay....my overnight accommodations were just not up to par - the coffee maker did not work properly - the microwave oven was dirty - and the room did not even have any "wash cloths".  Breakfast on the 3rd floor was substandard.  no signage on the buffet - dirty coffee cups.  the 4th floor reception area that I usually like to enjoy a glass of wine in the evening was unkempt - dirty glasses and dishes every where.  Even the carpet needed a good vacuuming.  I walked in - and out.  I don't know if the hotel is under staffed?   The staff I came into contact with were professional and polite....Hoping my next stay is better....this must have been a one off.

title: Best views of central park in tallest hotel in city
text: Luxurious views from tiny rooms.  I stayed up high on the 64th floor and looked north over Central Park.  It was like living on a cloud.  Very impressed with the breakfast each day as well the breakfast area - it was very large and comfortable with views from just above street level with lots of light.  I am not necessarily a fan of Residence Inn's, but this is one to try out.  Easy access to Columbus Circle subway to take the A train up to Columbia Presby Med Ctr.  Walked to Whole Foods at Columbus Circle  one night for salad.  And, it is just far enough north of the touristy times square to have some piece of serenity.

title: Not your average residence inn
text: As a Marriott loyalist I have stayed at many locations over the years and this residence inn is at the top of my list for NYC. The location is great with access to multiple subway stops and nearby Times Square and Central Park. I booked a room with a view of Times Square and it did not disappoint. Not only could i see Central Park but the Hudson River as well. The morning breakfast was well laid out and there was plenty of seating which is not always the case at residence inns. I enjoyed the use of space where the fridge and freezer look like cabinets and were pull outs. The staff was friendly and attentive as well. This location will be on my list when I am in much for work or personal moving forward.

title: Costoso para lo que ofrece
text: Hermosa vista. Habitación confortable, pero las facilidades del hotel no justifican su precio. Desayuno deficiente. Area del bar poco confortable. Personal poco servicial. Solo volvería por las vistas de las habitaciones.

title: Macy Day Thanksgiving Parade
text: Very Upset... We waited a very Long time to do this trip... To see the Macy's Day Parade and New York City.. The only request I had was to be on the Parade Route, since I am a diabetic need to be able to go back to the room if needed.. When I book this through the travel agency she said I was, But to make sure I call the Hotel weeks prior to are arrival and talk to a Lady at the Hotel.. Told her my issues and she assured me that was no problem and they would put me on the corner room and I would have no problem seeing the Parade.. Didn't get the girls name. bad luck on my part.. so when we arrive at the hotel I ask the Lady that check us in and she laugh at me.. we are not on the Parade route.. Only to be 3 blocks from it.. she was not helpful at all, Just rush through check in and that was IT.. You can go talk with the concierge No Help there..  So to wait 40 years to do to this trip and only to have People not be truthful with you.. Very Disappointed that they couldn't have told me that in the beginning and we would have had time to do something different.. OH WELL.. I have learn from this trip...

title: Unbelievably Poor Service  for 4*
text:
I plan to stay at this hotel in the coming March by splitting into 2 periods. First, I will stay on 17th March for one night and come back again on 21st March for the other 2 nights. 

I would like to ask them whether they allow me to leave my suitcase there (between the 2 periods) or not. and also any charge for this service.

I tried all means to contact with them including 
1) sent them and inquiry email BUT NO ANSWER 
2) sent them a personal message on Facebook page, they READ BUT NO ANSWER.
3) sent an inquiry through agoda.com, NO REPLY
Finally
4) I decided to make an international call to the hotel number +1-212-324-3774. I have to wait approximately 3 minutes before I can talk to the "real staff" then he took about 4 minutes before "understanding my question". I do not think my English skills is not that bad for explaining such a simple question. And then, he let me wait "FOREVER" for getting the answer. As you know, the cost of making an international call is not cheap. I could even buy BigMac with up-size fries and Coke for my whole family, honestly! I totally give up, can't bear holding on the line any longer. 

Many reviews honored their mesmerizing and breathtaking views. I also would like to stay here as they claim that this place is the tallest hotel in North America. But, you know, if your hotel is the tallest, your service is at the rock bottom.

title: Ubicación excelente
text:
Está muy bien situado pero a la vez es un hotel tranquilo.

La habitación muy correcta y la mini cocina muy práctica si no tienes ganas de salir a cenar. Hay una nevera, lavavajillas, un microondas, y tetera/cafetera. Suficiente. La vista es espectacular ( piso 39).
Mejorable el desayuno, muy básico.
A resaltar el personal de conserjería del hotel, te asesoran bien sobre actividades y servicios.
Wifi gratuito y efectivo.

title: Relaxing Overnight Sunday to see a Show
text:
We requested an early check in so we could drop off our bags and freshen up before our 3PM show.   A room was ready and we were quickly given our key and head up
After the show, we walked through Bryant Park and the pop up shops at Christmas.

The room was clean, quiet and very comfortable.

We enjoyed our breakfast in the morning and had a new view out of the window.

RECOMMENDED

title: A good residence inn
text: Great location near all midtown attractions. The rooms are somewhat small, the views are impressive and the complimentary breakfast is above average. It is combined with a courtyard property and the staff does an excellent job handling the crowds. An above average experience all in all.

title: 飛び抜けて良い という評価はないです
text:
空港からのアクセス  マンハッタン内での立地は良いです がホテル自体は普通 という評価です
いつもは部屋数がそれほど多くないホテルを選んでいたので 客室の多いホテルはこんなものなのか
よくわかりません  スタッフの応対も悪くはないですが 何か物足りなさを感じました  部屋はまぁまぁの
広さで34？ 5階から上が客室なので眺めは良いです  ただたまたまなのか泊まった部屋の横がエレベーターのようで
夜中でも動く音が気になりました     バスタブ付きの部屋をおすすめします。 シャワーは可動式ですが
ヘッドを置く位置が高すぎてほとんど固定式のようなものでした  身長にもよるとはおもいますが…
掃除もどことなく行き届いていないような気がしました   朝食が付いているのは有難かったです  メニューは
そんなに変化はないですが 外で食べることをおもうと楽でした  簡易のキッチンが備わっておりお皿や
カトラリーが常備されていたのでデリで買って食べるには良いかなとおもいます
総合的にみて是非オススメ というホテルとは言えません  同じ金額を出すのならもっと良いところがあると
感じました

title: Best Marriott Experience in Years!
text: First time ever staying at a Residence Inn and was very pleased with my accommodations and the services.  Breakfast dinning staff very attentive and good was decent.  I enjoyed the fitness center and they offered a strengthening and conditioning class! Joanna was fantastic! And I’ll definitely be coming back for future visits to the Big Apple.

title: Great Location and Good Value
text: I don’t know if every room in the hotel is as good as the one I stayed in, but mine was quiet and offered a great view of Times Square from the 64th floor. As you get higher up in this hotel there are fewer rooms because the top of the hotel tapers. That means fewer people, less foot traffic and less noise on the upper floors. The rate was very good considering NYC hotel rates. Staff was well trained and friendly.

title: Bien situé, en revanche l’accueil est à revoir
text: L’hôtel est très bien situé en revanche l’accueil est totalement à revoir.  Notre frigo ne fonctionnait pas, malgré plusieurs réclamations.... ras ils s’en foutent et  ça sans le moindre problème.... même pas une excuse encore moins un sourire. À 300 dollars la nuit y a mieux à ny!!!

title: Great location, room with a Kitchen
text: An extremely convenient location and a comfortable hotel.  Close to central park, the metro, MOMA, the theater district and lots of great places to eat.  Easy walking from here to lots of great things to see and do. Room nice but not special, views from some of the rooms great - the hotel is high and the NY skyline is great to sit and watch.  Coffee close

title: Konum
text: Otel gercekten New Yorkun harika bir konumunda.Time square,central park,brodway,penn station daha bircok yere yurume mesafesinde.Lobi biraz kucuk personel yardimci oluyor ama giris ve cikislar biraz kalabalik.Otelin 4.katinda starbucks bulunuyor. Odalar temiz ve konforlu ama biraz kucuk.Bir hafta icerisinde iki kere kaldik.Geri gelecegimiz icin valizimizi otele birakmak istedigimizde bizden 20 dolar alinmasi bir geceligine 500 dolar odedigimiz bir otel icin hic hos olmadi ayrica bu ucret icin bir dekontda verilmedi.Birinci kaldigimiz oda 52.katta guzel manzaraya sahipti ama ikinci kaldigimizda 22. katta daha kucuk bir odada kaldik.Fiyat dengesi olarak biraz yuksek ama lokasyon ve luks dusgunlugunuz varsa tercuh edebilirsiniz.

title: We miss absolutely everything --
text:
This hotel is and will always be the only hotel we book in NYC.  The location is great, the views are amazing, the staff is friendly, and the best of all -- the room is great.  My first experience (last year) booking this hotel was completely unexpected, we had a horrible stay at a nearby hotel and I called them to see if they can take us.  Since then, our trip was absolutely perfect.  My now fiance (since this last trip!) and I are members to various hotel loyalty programs, but we've definitely prefer Marriott stays since our experience.  We're happy Gold Elite members!

We are now celebrating our 1-year engagement this weekend in NYC and we didn't even tease around searching for other hotels or price shop -- booked this place again without hesitation.

title: Perfecto!!!
text: Es increíble la vista que se tiene en este hotel!!! Estuvimos en el piso 62 y habiendo visitado nyc en varias oportunidades sin dudas, volvería una y mil veces. Hay algunas cosas mejorables como la atención en recepción pero es nada al lado de vivir esta experiencia en pleno manhattan. La ubicación también es excelente porque se llega a todos lados desde ahí. El desayuno super variado y completo. Una experiencia de ensueño: un sueño hecho realidad en una de las ciudades más fascinantes del mundo!!

title: Nice rooms
text: The rooms are very nice. We got a park view, which was nice except a building is now in front of the Marriott, so the park is chopped. We also saw a lot of the city. Get a high room. Breakfast buffet was included.

title: JFKからのアクセスもいい
text:
ニューヨークマラソンに出るために泊まりました。当日の朝にはバナナ、水、プロテインバーが用意してあり、応援の声も掛けてもらいました。ゴールのセントラルパークからは距離はありますが、歩いて戻れます。
部屋にはキッチンも食器もあるため、近くのホールフーズマーケットで買い物したものを部屋でのんびり食べることができます。
JFKからもエアトレインと地下鉄E線で簡単にアクセスできますし、行きたいところにはみんな徒歩で行けたのでとても便利でした。
食事が高いニューヨークでは朝食が無料なのも助かります。ベーグルも美味しかったですし、自分でワッフルを焼くこともできます。
唯一残念だったのはバスタブがなかったこと。マラソンの後に湯船に浸かりたかったです。
部屋も清潔ですし、景色もいい。次回も泊まりたいと思います。

title: Birthday celebration
text:
I took my daughter to NYC and a show for her 16th birthday. We selected this hotel due to it's location and brand...Excellent choice. The location is convenient to Times Square, Theater District, Central Park and 5th Ave. But the best part of this hotel is the staff, especially Pamela and Jamie. I called the day before advising them we were coming for a special occasion and requested a high floor. At check in, I reminded Pamela and she took care of us. She put us on the 63rd floor!  A nice comfortable room with spectacular views. Later, we went out for the evening; which was unseasonably cold but the desk provided hand warmers, and returned to a birthday cake in our room. My daughter was thrilled and I grateful for their generosity  and kindness.
The staff is incredible, the property nice, location excellent. The best place to stay near Central Park.

title: Boa opção em Manhattan!
text:
Este hotel é bem localizado, tem uma pequena cozinha acoplada ao quarto, o que facilita para fazer uma “boquinha” antes de sair para o programa da noite.
O café da manhã é razoável, a limpeza do quarto também. Os funcionários são muito gentis. Nas últimas vezes que vim pra NY procurei ficar neste hotel e não me arrependi !

title: Great location, excellent staff
text: The hotel is out of the mayhem of Times Square and ideally suited for walking to shows, Central Park, and all of lower Manhattan.  The staff was excellent from the reservation process through checkout.  The room was small as other reviews mention; we could barely close the bathroom door. All lampshades in the room were stained, and the drapes dragged on the side of the bed due to the small room.  However, the view was worth it - we had a perfect view of sunset, and corner views of the city and of Central Park.  I checked in by phone the day before and was guaranteed a two double room, but upon onsite check-in was given a different room.  I insisted on what I had been told, and due to my elite status, I got what I wanted, but I don't know how other guests would have been treated. The limo service provided by bell desk seemed pretty shady.  He didn't confirm my destination, he had no change and told me my credit card didn't work.  I insisted on trying it myself and it worked just fine.  It felt like a scam to get more tip from me.  Use Lyft instead.  Breakfast felt like a low rate diner  or bad airline club - I did not go back the second day.  All in all, I would return to this hotel because it is so well located and Marriott tends to deliver consistent results, albeit not perfect.

title: Amazing Views | Great Location
text:
I used to live and work in this neighborhood and whne I was coming back to visit recently, I wanted to be in my old stomping grounds. I can say that I've never seen my old stomping grounds like this - we had a room on the 63rd floor with sweeping views of Central Park, the west side and New Jersey. 

The rooms can be tight and small, but they are very nicely appointed and never does an opening door hit a mattress or a toilet. Everything is well thought out and has its place. The mini-kitchen in each unit is awesome for longer stays - the room has a fridge and a freezer and pots and pans - you could in theory heat up a very nice meal and then have it all cleaned in the dishwasher. The only downside is that ice is down on the 35th floor. We used the provided pitcher to chill water so that we didn't have to make the trip. 

The service was excellent, everyone we encountered was friendly and efficient. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Gorgeous view BUT service was lousy & the room stank
text: My husband and I (Marriott Platinum members) returned to my hometown to celebrate and renew our vows for our 10th anniversary. We wanted to be near Broadway & Central Park (our old stomping grounds) and used points for our stay. We were upgraded to a room with a spectacular view overlooking Central Park ... BUT it was a room for the disabled (which neither of us IS, OR requested); and no one asked us whether we preferred a room with NO barrier between the shower area and the rest of the bathroom (we didn't!) so everything in the bathroom became soaking wet every time one of us showered! Additionally, the entire bathroom smelled heavily of urine during our whole stay, as if people had been peeing down the shower drain. Housekeeping never came to clean our room despite repeated requests, so the dishes piled up (and the room was tiny), so we spent more than 2 days in clutter and food filth.  There was also an issue printing our boarding passes so I had to do it at the front desk and there were problems there as well because front desk staff obviously needed to be assisting check-ins.

title: Good location
text: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, the check in was fast, receptionist was friendly and accommodating, I was a little bit disappointed with our room, it was too small compared to other Residence inn that we stayed, the size of this room was only 1/3 of the size of  the residence inn in LA and other California cities. The room was clean, comfortable bed, linen was clean, bathroom was also small, they have a kitchenette but there was no stove, there was a slow cooker, bread toaster , microwave, pots & pans and other kitchen utensils, as I said the only one missing was the stove, bathroom was small and the shower room needs renovation, we had a very beautiful view of the city, this is the reason why we stayed in this hotel, the location was very convenient.Breakfast was ok but they should add more variety of food every day, it was boring to eat the same food every day. Because of the location, the price was outrageous, when I called the reservation office, I was able to get a price for $ 399 / night. because I don’t have enough rewards points to avail free night, but when my bill came, the price was not $ 399/ night but over $ 400/ night & one night over $600; I tried to complain but the receptionist that morning when we checked out but she  said it will come out same total, I had no time to argue because we have to take taxi already to the airport otherwise we will miss our flight. Next time I will have to confirm during check in about the price.

title: Nice place to stay in NYC.
text: Stayed here for 6 nights, and really enjoyed it. The check in was quick and easy. Stayed on the 52nd floor so had nice views both night and day. The room was bigger than expected considering it is NYC. It was very clean and cleaned well everyday. The bathroom was compact but the shower was lovely and powerful. Very central location on broadway, easy to walk to Central Park and Times Square. My only criticism of the hotel was I left my purse behind me when I left for the airport and when I rang the hotel in a panic I was passed off to a member of staff who really didn't seem to care or want to deal with me which made me a little annoyed.

title: Good Central Stay
text: Room was on 52nd floor with a peek a boo of Central Park and Hudson River. Room 5201, a corner unit.  Room was small in size (it's NYC, similar to London sized rooms) but efficiently designed space. Small bathroom with single vanity sink and small walk in shower that was more than adequate. Nicely decorated room, loved the Navy!  Room was clean and housekeeping was excellent, each day the room was cleaned well and replenished with a great note (thank you Cindy, you were excellent and made our stay!).  Hallways were a bit drab and dark for my taste but seemed very New York.  Check in was efficient, friendly (8 out of 1-10, script like, got me us and out).  Almost 1/2 floor dedicated to breakfast, more than continental, a good variety including "real eggs" but some days were busier than others so finding a clean table or waiting on food to be replenished took some time. Great location, about 5 blocks of walking to Central Park and close to Radio City Hall, Times Square, cafes, pharmacy and ATM.

title: 편안하고 안락한 공간 무엇보다 도심과 가깝고 깨끗해요
text:
편안하고 안락한 공간 무엇보다 도심에 있고 깨끗합니다
조식도 제공하고있어서 합리적으로 이용했네요
청결을 중시하는 분이라면. 꼭 이용해보세요

title: Great property, great rooms, location, staff, gym, breakfast is a notch above usual Residence Inn
text: Platinum member here on business, very impressive Residence, excellent Manhattan Marriott.  Location convenient to public transportation, variety of restaurants. Studio room is small but this is NYC so it's expected. Great view of the river and downtown.  Gym is a notch above typical Residence Inns as is the breakfast. Lovely staff, highly recommend this property.

title: Don’t pay over the odds for a view
text:
We decided to change our hotel and upgrade to the Residence Inn for a better view of the city and higher grade of service. 

Firstly, the view was amazing, we were over 50 floors up and looked straight out to the cruise terminal and Times Square, the room was ok, it had a kitchenette, a shower and the usual wardrobe, safe etc but was small (for the price).

We had breakfast included but it wasn’t of great quality, continental style but tasteless.

We were without hot water on our last day so had to shower in cold water, we were given $50 off our final bill, but for the price we paid, it didn’t touch the final settlement. 

All in all, the hotel was ok. We won’t be stopping there again as we feel for the price, you can go elsewhere and get better.

title: Great location
text:
Stayed for 4 nights for a getaway in NYC. Unique dual-brand concept with Courtyard on first 35 floors, then Residence Inn above. 

Had a fantastic room on the 53rd floor with views of the Hudson and Times Square. 

Location is fantastic for theatre, shopping, touring or midtown business. 

Room was clean & well-equipped. Wi-fi excellent, staff helpful & friendly.

title: Conforto aliado a praticidades
text:
O quarto é grande, com um cozinha completa (geladeira, microondas, máquina de lavar louça, cafeteira com sachês de café fornecidos diariamente e outros mimos) facilitou muito nossa estadia. E com vista bonita para a cidade.
O banheiro e grande, com banheira e um bom chuveiro!!! A camareira fazia uma excelente faxina diariamente e recolocava os itens de banheiro.
O café da manhã é fraquinho e depois de seis dias vc não aguenta mais comer o mesmo, mas ajuda, pois evita que tenha que sair sem tomar café da manhã (gostei das máquinas de waffer para fazer a sua na hora)
O problema do hotel e o chekin tardio (16hs, é oferecido um local para guardar malas e descansar, porém p quem ficou horas em aeroportos, precisa mesmo de banho e descansar sossegado!!!  Foi o primeiro hotel que me negou o quarto antes do horário estabelecido.
A equipe de atendimento é grosseira e sem paciência, fiquei espantada com tanta falta de educação...,
Eu recomendo o hotel, mas não pegue um voo que chegue cedo em NY...

title: Fantastica New York
text:
Ho alloggiato in questo hotel a luglio 2016 con la mia famiglia.
Che dire...semplicemente stupendo!!!
Camera al 42°piano...due pareti erano delle vetrate...vista mozzafiato!!
Camera pulitissima..personale molto gentile....ci tornerò!!
A 2 passi da Times square..e da Central park. Colazione abbondante e ottima..straconsigliato!!

title: Great Location, Great Property
text: Upon arrival we were upgraded to the 65th floor with a corner room overlooking Times Square. What a great property with an excellent staff. The bathroom is small, I am not sure if a larger person would be comfortable.

title: Superbe chambre avec vue extraordinaire.
text:
Nous y avons séjournes une semaine. L'hôtel est très bien situé. Proche de central park et de Time square. Notre chambre était au dernier étage au 65eme. Vue à 180 degrés. Magnifique !!! La chambre est confortable, spacieuse avec une cuisine toute équipée. Le rêve ! 
Quant au petit dej. C'était le top aussi. La salle immense avec canapés et TV individuelles. Vue magnifique également. 
Beaucoup de choix salés et sucrés. On peut même faire ses propres gaufres. 
Je recommande.

title: Great Stay - Location Perfect
text:
This is in arguably one of the best locations to stay. It is between Times Square and central park, so it is right in the heart of where I enjoy being and did not have any noise issues at night which is fantastic. Beds were comfy and room was well designed and took advantage of the space given in each room. Breakfast was great, really solid spread - cinnamon rolls were fantastic - however as others mentioned it can get crowded and items aren't refilled. but overall small in the whole scheme of things.

As others have mentioned ELEVATORS!! Slow slow slow, busy busy busy. However, having stayed in many hotels in NYC, it is common because of space and tall buildings  it makes sense. again small in the whole scheme of things.

great room, great location, gold member, this stay continue to show me why i am loyal to Marriott

title: Ruhiges Hotel an exzellenter Lage
text:
눇Das Eckzimmer im 43. Stock hatte einen tollen Ausblick (Central Park & Times Square). Es sind nur 5min zum Times Square und etwa 2min bis zur nächsten Subway. Trotz viel Verkehr war das Zimmer sehr ruhig (man hat eigentlich nur die Sirenen von Polizei etc.) gehört. Das Bett war sehr bequem. Check-in&Check-out sehr schnell. Concierge hat sich um Gepäckaufbewahrung und Flughafentransfer gekümmert. Die zentrale Lage ist toll.
Der Herr beim Check-out war nicht besonders freundlich. Die Wartezeiten beim Lift etwas lange (4 Lifte für Stock 35 - 65). Das Frühstück war nichts besonderes (wir haben nach dem 1. Tag jeweils extern gefrühstückt). Der Wasserdruck war nicht so toll (ist in Hochhäusern aber häufig so). Der Kühlschrank etwas laut (haben wir aber dann einfach ausgeschaltet).

title: How can a hotel with so much going for it leave a poor taste in one's mouth?
text:
First, the positive....*****
The hotel claims to be the tallest in Manhattan, and its views from the upper floors are amazing. Choose between the Hudson River (watch the ships), Central Park, or Downtown -- all are amazing. The rooms themselves are top notch -- spacious, clean, good fixtures in the bathrooms, and all the right amenities (large desktop, large TV, comfortable side chair, great shower, bath with large sink, and kitchen counter with sink and small refrigerator and freezer). And don't forget the location -- just blocks from Times Square, the theatre district, MOMA, and much more.

However, the rest leaves me with a 1-1/2*
There were three areas that left me wondering how I could end up in a hotel this bad. I also wish to share with you that this is my fifth visit to this property, and each time it gets worse. Perhaps they'll read this review and do something about it. Here we go:

a) There are only 4 elevators servicing this 64-story hotel (only the top half has rooms for this property, but there are still a lot of guests using the property. There are times during hotel "rush hour" where I've had to wait over 5 minutes for an elevator, and several times they are full. Part of the problem is that hotel staff (e.g., housekeeping and maintenance, each with their carts) share the same 4 elevators, and tend to go in the elevators during rush hour too; they ring for the elevator, it stops, they see that there is no room for their carts, and they let the door close; they then repeat to process. If that doesn't slow the elevators down even further,...! It is not practical to add another elevator. But it would be practical to either devote one elevator to service (at least at rush hour) or to have such staff plan their travels so they don't need to bring their carts with them during rush hour (even if they must leave them in a closet on each floor).

b) Breakfast comes included with the rooms. It is a self-service buffet comprised of a couple of fresh fruits, a few cheeses, oatmeal, waffles, scrambled eggs, meats, breads, yogurts, coffee, juice, etc. So why would I prefer to go down the street and buy a breakfast? Because this place is totally mismanaged. Food runs out; no one does anything about it until this happens, and then someone must go into the kitchen and look for it; sometimes the reinforcements are on another floor; and if it is within 20 minutes of closing time (9:30am), they don't even bother. If you wait for the food to come, any hot food you've taken will be cold. Coffee runs out (especially decaf), and no staff knows until it is reported. Has anyone in management heard of the term "proactive?" This atmosphere even causes frustration with the guests, resulting in the food hall equivalent of road rage! Once, I even had someone "steal" my waffle out of the iron as I was reaching toward it to put it on my plate! What this place needs is a full-time staff to stay in the food hall; give them an iPad to alert kitchen staff when each food is getting low, and when it needs to be replaced; also, keep general order in the area. It's not hard!

c) It shouldn't take 10 minutes for the front desk to pick up the phone. And when one tells them that the shower stayed locked in the on position and wouldn't shut off, and the bathroom was flooding, one shouldn't have to wait 10 minutes to discover that the front desk person got distracted and forgot to report it to maintenance (this was discovered when I had to call the desk again 10 minutes later); finally maintenance came up and fixed the problem, needing a special tool.

These are all examples of things that can be fixed, as long as management is doing its job. 

So to sum it all up, a 3 stars. Everything there was either great (*****) or really bad (*). The good news is that the bad can be fixed -- all it takes is better management. Let's hope it happens!

title: New York New York
text: Spent a week here. Great location close to resturants and Central Park. Hop on hop off bus was near by. Theaters were short walk as was Times Square. Nice view from 43rd floor. Clean and quite not much staff interaction. Breakfast was not much to brag about. Overall nice place.

title: Visited a friend who was staying here
text:
Parking is a huge issue, there is IKON parking 100 feet away at about 60 a day, valet parking not worth it. Steer parking not reliable.

Interior is very average. Entrance is dull and nothing to call home about. It is not a fancy hotel. The best thing about it is accessibility. It is 15 minutes walk from Central Park, Times Square, Penn Station, best side Piers, etc. Stay here if you want to walk and explore the city. 

The interior lobby I saw very average. 

Overall, this is quite expected from a NYC hotel. Hotel hunting in NYC is an art and finding the best fit for new needs takes time and effort. Websites are deceiving. 

The Staff were cold. We approached one when my friends son had a question. Overall, warmth was missing in my whole experience. I guess it is a good stay for seeing the city and exploring it and going back to the hotel to sleep and cleanup.

title: Emplacement parfait pour découvrir New-York
text: Pour une première visite à New-York, l'emplacement est parfait, une vue fantastique au 48e étage. Le personnel est très accueillant. Petit-déjeuner correct avec assez de choix. Le wifi fonctionne très bien. Je vous le conseille vivement pour vos 1ers pas à NYC.

title: Excelente
text:
Me hospede 13 nochesl.La ubicacion es muy buena,el desayuno muy variado,el unico tema que 9.30 en punto cierran y no se puede desayunar.
La vista de la habitacion del hotel excelente.
Lo recomiendo espero volver

title: Great location and rooms - helpful staff
text:
We stayed here for college move in weekend. Our room was large by New York standards and well appointed. There was even a view of Central Park between two nearby buildings. Staff was very friendly and helpful arranging transportation and helping us with our large amount of luggage. 

This now our preferred hotel in NYC.

title: Un Residence da considerare
text: Questo residence situato nella broadway 1717, e' un buon appoggio per un soggiorno a NY. Moderno, camere superior spaziose, bgno ampio. La zona cucina non ha fuochi o piastre ad induzione, ma pentole elettriche e forno a microonde. Un frigo-freezer funzionante anche se rumoroso. Pulizia quotidiana ma un po superficiale. La colazione e' inclusa. Molto graziosa la sala per il breakfast caratterizzata da poltrone e non da sedie. La colazione e' discreta, magari e' deficitaria la parte dolce. Al quarto piano si puo' fustare un aperitivo o mangiare dopo le 19. Sala fitness al 35 piano ben attrezzata. Posizione ottima per raggiingere Times square, la Fifth Avenue, la Madison, il Flatiron e, naturalmente Central Park.  Personale non sempre simpatico o disponibile ma,  sicuramente un residence da tener presente.

title: HOTEL CALME(EXCEPT CLIM) ET BIEN SITUE
text: L'hotel est semble t il dans les niveau de prix d'un 4* à NY cad trés cher. deco assez bien, lit trés confortable, chambre peu spacieuse pour 7 jours (peu de rangement). petit dejeuner inclus basique+(européen et americain ), ce qui permet de faire le plein pour la journée...la chambre vue correct au 37 ème (même si nous aurions certainement eu mieux dans les étages sup). Le gros pb c'est la clim bruyante, on la coupe la nuit , il reste un bruit de fond de ventialtion. Hormi cela elles sont tres bien insonorisées de l'extérieur et des chambres voisines.Le situation est top. (central park et times square à 2 pas)

title: Terrible elevator
text: This place is solid. The staff is nice. The rooms are large, yet simple. However: you'll spend 10-15 minutes every morning waiting for the elevator. Which is crazy, given the price you're paying. You might as well stay in Brooklyn and commute every morning.

title: Unhelpful, Will Ignore You
text:
We came for my boyfriend's birthday. We used points for the stay. Because we have a lot of points with Marriott we usually get upgraded or at least treated well. 

The hotel is well located, but that is the only positive thing I can say.  

Our room was SO small, there was not even room to open up our luggage (except on the Kitchenette floor, in front of the door)!The room was NOT as in the photos on the Marriott website where we ordered, not even as I am seeing on TripAdvisor corner-room photos. Barely enough room to walk around the bed. 

We politely asked to be upgraded to a non-tiny room (which, as I say, is usually reasonable give our 'status' with Marriott). Four different front desk people told us they would 'do their best', get back to us, tell the manager, make notes in the system, etc, etc. But NONE of them followed up, even with us staying for almost a week. 

It became clear they were just pacifying us without any attempt to help. Like I say, none of them ever got back to us. When, later in the week, I mentioned to one of the front desk people that he never got back to me as promised, he muttered excuses. 

It was all disappointing. Poor management, low level of service, and SMALL rooms. 

Disaster.

title: Great view, good location, strange room layout
text: First, the great things about this property. It's the tallest hotel in NYC, so the views are awesome. Great location just outside the theater district, easy access to city sights. Now the not-so-good. Quality of breakfast varied--choices were more limited on weekends and they tended to run out of things. Much better on weekdays, when breakfast area was not so crowded. The designer had the upper hand over practicality in the breakfast area, so almost all seating is on high-top tables or on lounge chairs / sofas with coffee tables. Not exactly the most comfortable way to eat breakfast. The room design is a bit odd, given the unusual shape of the tower floors. It was a bit awkward to have the closet and bathroom by the kitchen as opposed to by the sleeping area. More room than a typical Manhattan hotel room, but much less than your usual RI. No dining room table but you're probably not going to eat in your room unless you're a solo traveler here on an extended stay. Actually preferred the layout in the Courtyard on the lower floors of the same building--smaller room down there, but the space utilization was better.

title: Convenience and Access in Midtown Manhattan
text: We will definitely stay in this hotel on future visits to New York City. The location is a short walk to Central Park and there are some excellent restaurants in the neighborhood. My husband uses a wheelchair. Our room had a roll in shower and enough floor space for him to maneuver comfortably. We were on the 64th floor and had a spectacular view of the Hudson River and part of Central Park. The 3 pictures I included were from our room which was on the northwest corner of the building, so we had windows on 2 walls of the room. The breakfast that was included as part of the price of the room was one of the better ones I have seen. There was a wide variety of hot and cold food to choose from. The dining area adjacent was set up with attractive and comfortable furniture arranged in various seating configurations. The regular wifi connection was part of the price of the room, you could upgrade to a faster speed for an additional fee.

title: On top of the world !
text:
Stayed there for a week over New Year, and did not regret our choice !
I had asked for a high floor room, and couldn't have been happier, we were literally on the top floor of the building, making it the highest hotel room in the Americas! And what a view on snowy Central Park, a shame they are building a tower in between (guess they'll have to rename the rooms now), but we were there just in time for the superb view!
The rooms are relatively big for New York standards
The lobby gets very crowed (as shared with another hotel which occupies the bottom half of the tower), and breakfast is one of the worst I've seen in an hotel of this category. It lacks any form of service, organization. Tables are not cleared, staff is completely overwhelmed, people running everywhere. The little food that was left in the "buffet" was not great either. Good thing we tried it the first day as for the rest of the week, we just went to the local supermarket and had breakfast in our room (which was awesome!)

Location is also very central, making it a perfect place to enjoy a stay in NY (and price is decent for NY standards)

title: Perfectly Located in Midtown
text:
A great location - with nearby subway station and close enough to walk easily to the theatre.  The room was clean and had a comfortable bed and good kitchen amenities.
Check-in was quick and easy with friendly front desk staff. The buffet breakfast was ample and had enough good choices to select from in a large dining room. The 4th floor bar area was comfortable for evening nightcaps. Would definitely recommend and stay here for our future trips to NYC.

title: Eccellente hotel in posizione strategica
text: Occupa i piani dal 31° al 65°,in quanto al di sotto(strano ma vero) viene utilizzato il brand lussuoso Marriott, in un grattacielo di 67 piani, costruito soltanto nel 2013.Le 2 ultime rampe di scale sono utilizzate per la gestione di moderne attrezzature di servizio e soccorso dell'hotel più alto di NYC.Si trova a metà strada fra Times Square e Central Park, servito comodamente da subway, taxi, bus e sightseeing.E' inclusa un'eccellente e ricca prima colazione.Ci è stata assegnata la stanza 041, tipo Studio, ai piani alti, con vista sul parco e lo skyline: un panorama mozzafiato che ci ha indotto a tenere sempre aperte ,di giorno, le tendine parasole.Ottimo servizio di pulizia ed attenzione: basta dire che una volta hanno bussato per consegnarci un pettine nuovo ,in sostituzione del nostro ,casualmente danneggiato dalla cameriera.Abbiamo passato 8 giorni veramente indimenticabili, utilizzando il FLEX PASS per ammirare, con comodità, le principali attrazioni dell'entusiasmante NEW YORK.Grazie di cuore al personale ed alla direzione.THANK YOU VERY MUCH.

title: El más hermoso que visite
text: Este hotel es espléndido, la atención de todo el personal es excelente. La habitación es hermosa, súper equipada (tiene lavavajillas, microondas, todo para cocinar) la vista es increíble, todos los días te despertas asombrado. El baño es amplio re cómodo y el desayuno está buenísimo. La ubicación es perfecta. Todo lindo pienso volver mil veces más

title: hotel très bien situé
text:
les chambres sont un peu petites mon ami et moi y avons séjourné pendant dix jours; le ménage est fait tous les jours le personnel est très accueillant. une vue fantastique a condition d être au bon étage. petit déjeuner correct pas assez de choix à mon gout. il ya une petite kitchenette mais dommage pas de quoi faire à manger. la wifi fonctionne très bien
seul bémol pour les fumeurs on est obligé d aller à l'extérieur. je vous le conseille vivement.

title: On s'attend a mieux pour ce tarif
text:
Hotel très bien placé proche de times square, du métro et de central park, le personnel est accueillant sans plus.
A notre arrivée nous avons vu trois bagagistes qui nous ont regardé galérer avec nos trois valises sans bouger le petit doigt, dommage.
Notre chambre au 44 eme étage a repondu a nos attente, belle vue grand lit, la petite kitchenette plutôt pratique. 
Seul bémol, le ménage, chambre très poussiéreuse, et sol sale par endroit, nous avons signalé cela  a la réception tout de suite, le ménage a été a peu près fait le lendemain.
Pour les 7 jours suivants la femme de menage se contentait de refaire le lit et changer les serviettes de bain , laissant la poussière s'accumuler...
Je trouve cela inadmissible pour une chambre a ce prix.
Petit déjeuner correct manque peu être de charcuterie et de diversité dans le choix des fruits.
Possibilité de laisser les valises le jour du depart entre l'heure de sortie et l'heure de la prise en charge pour l'aéroport , trè pratique.
Pour résumer , bon hôtel mais qui devrait revoir sa copie niveau propreté des chambres.

title: Comfy Room, Great Location
text:
This was recommended by a bloke who works with my wife, we booked through a third party website.  The entrance is round the side and not on Broadway itself, which makes it slightly quieter.  The staff are all friendly and all really helpful.

Our room was on the 40th floor and had a view towards the river and we could see the cruise ships as they pulled in to dock.  The room was not a bad size, it had a huge bed that was really comfy.  There is a small kitchenette which includes a fridge and freezer, really useful for storing drinks.  The bathroom is a good size with great water pressure from the shower, i'm not sure if it was a deep shower tray or very shallow bath.

Breakfast is included but is a bit of a gimmick, they are not very quick at replenishing stocks, and it seems like when it's gone it's gone.

The location is brilliant it's a short walk to either Central Park or Time Square, there are also loads of subway stations nearby.  There are also loads of shops, bars and restaurants all really close.  There is also good Wi-Fi in the room, which is free to guests.

After getting a cab to the hotel we were offered a hotel car to the airport, it was a little bit dearer than the cab but should've been so much easier.  Sadly the driver was shocking, I think he kept falling asleep as he was drifting all over the road and there were lots of sudden braking incidents.

They add about 3 different taxes to the room cost which puts it up quite a lot, this can be a shock if you're not aware of them, which we weren't.

A great hotel that I would stay at again if I was to return to NYC.

title: Great location, cozy but with great view
text:
I stayed here for one night for work (Friday night) at the end of March. The room was great for one person - excellent room design to be able to include a full kitchen (though I had no need for it on this trip). Clean and simple bathroom. Room rate includes breakfast - unfortunately, breakfast starts at 7 am on the weekends and I had to leave before then to catch my flight. I asked about a grab and go breakfast, but unfortunately this hotel and no such option.

Also, my guest room door had a mechanical problem. Service was dispatched quickly to try to fix it. However, it took 45 minutes and a couple different guys before it got fixed. They worked hard and were professional and friendly. However, it did force me to change my afternoon plans. They apologized for the inconvenience, but I was not offered a discount (I would've been happy with a drink coupon!). I did not say anything or complain any more, though, in hindsight, I will complain louder should something like this happen again to me (guess I'm too nice).

title: Good location
text:
Hotel in a good location in manhattan. It is within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park. There are plenty of metro stations nearby that take you uptown/downtown with ease. 

The hotel is clean and simple, with a friendly front desk and simple lift that you need a room key to get to floors above the restaurant. 

Breakfast is free and is on floor 3. There are plenty of seating areas and you just walk in and help yourself. I personally did not have much but there is fruit, cereal, breads, yougurt, waffle machine and a small selection of sausage and scrambled eggs. I just had a selection of juice and there is a drinks machine for coffee.

The bedroom I had was on the 40th floor and had a view of the street. The bed was a super king and was extremely comfy. There is a chair and stool and small cupboard with iron/board and a desk. The bathroom is desperated by a wooden slide door, inside a small sink toilet and shower. Small shower gel, cream and shampoo replenished each day by house keeping as well as clean towels. There is a kitchen area with sink, fridge freezer and washing up area... I did not use it but it's there and clean.

I had requested an early check in and it was granted. On the morning I was checking out, our bags were stored and they booked us a private car to JFK for $75 which included the tip and toll. 

There are restaurants outside the hotel and as it's New York, there is coffee shops, gift shops, pattiserie shops and wallmarts. 

Please be aware that tax will be charged daily to the room (incase you have not been to an American hotel before).

There is free wifi in the hotel rooms. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Excelente  ubicación
text: Todas las habitaciones están a más de 36 pisos con lo cual la vista está garantizada.Las habitaciones son cómodas y tienen cafetera ,microondas,heladera  y lavavajilla.Además de platos y otros. Incluye desayuno muy completo .Lo mejor el check out a las 12.00.Está ubicado  entre Times Square y el Central Park, a 100 metros está el subway.Paramos allí una semana y fumos al US OPEN  casi todos los días en el subte  .Caminar por la zona es un placer ,hay wallgreen y  cafe orgánico Pret a manger.

title: Excellent Midtown/Central Park Location; close to Times Sq
text:
This RI/Central Park location was the perfect base location for all the touristy things we did.  Our last NYC visit, we stayed in lower Manhattan & visited the WTC memorial, S-of-Liberty.  This time we wanted to be up north closer to Central Park & the Theatre district.  

Positives:
Our suite was on the 63rd floor and we had views of CP (partially blocked by a building in construction) & Hudson River. The room had a kitchenette w/ stuff for cooking (you can request a hotplate from housekeeping).  We mainly used the frig & microwave for heating leftovers and keeping our drinks, fruit, Juniors cheesecake chilled.  Comfy bed; soft sheets; good shower pressure; fluffy towels.  Good gym; no pool.

Giving 1 less star due to these negatives; not up to Marriott standards:
- Our room had a wheel-chair accessible shower & the overall design needs to be redone.  The open shower sloped away from the drain & left the bath floor totally flooded after a shower.  To remedy this, we made a dam of towels to prevent water from flooding the floor.  Being an ADA room; we were curious that the sink/counter-top was taller than normal.  There was a round table (for extra towels) in the corner that partially blocked the doorway and took space away from the bathroom.  Shelves & hooks can be used for this instead?  The room decor is a little worn out (carpet stains, shreds), nicked furniture, sticking drawers.

- The breakfast lounge w/ plenty of tables & seating is very large & shared w/ the Courtyard.  The buffet service area & layout is way too tight to accommodate that many ppl trying to get food.  If you go during peak hrs (after 8:30am), food runs out quickly and you won't find a clean space to eat.  The tables are not bused or cleaned timely.  Sorry to say, the breakfast attendants were going through the motions to minimally get by.  

Overall, this RI is due for a remodel/refresh (suites, hallways are dark/depressing, slow & tiny elevators); re-layout of the breakfast buffet service area.  The staff are professional, but not as warm/service-oriented as other Marriott properties I've stayed. Prime location; easy walking to CP, Theatres, Hell's Kitchen restaurants & public transport. Probably would not stay here again as there are plenty of other Marriott branded hotels in NYC to experience.

title: Will Return!
text: This was my husbands first trip to New York City and we were celebrating our 25th anniversary. I couldn't have been more pleased! We had a wonderful welcome gift in our room from the guest relations manager, Jaime. Our room was on the 65th floor with amazing views of the Hudson River and Central Park. We stayed a week and came back to a clean, stocked room every day thanks to Mabel! The location is superb! Close to Central Park and Times Square but far enough away from the chaos! Also close to subway stations which we used often. We will definitely return and will definitely stay here again!

title: NY panorama mozzafiato
text: Noi siamo stati più volte a Manhattan e abbiamo studiato questa location a lungo prima di prenotare: un hotel in un nuovo grattacielo, con le camere situate a piani molto alti, una vista strepitosa e la colazione compresa (rarissima in città). Queste aspettative sono state pienamente soddisfatte. Innanzitutto per la posizione eccezionale, tra Columbus e Times Square; la sala allestita per le colazioni (gelida) è bellissima con postazioni di tutti i tipi: divani, tavoli bassi, banconi affacciati alle finestre e la scelta di cibi e bevande è adeguata. La nota negativa è che pur avendo prenotato due delle camere più costose (quelle con letto matrimoniale è un letto singolo) è pur avendo specificatamente chiesto nella prenotazione di avere il piano più alto possibile e le camere vicine nessuna delle due richieste è stata soddisfatta: 7 piani di differenza e almeno 10 piani al di sotto di quello richiesto. Le motivazioni addotte alla reception sono state: questo è quanto disponibile...peccato che avessimo prenotato con parecchio anticipo (6 mesi); hanno compensato con WI-FI gratuito in camera. Nonostante tutto ci vorremmo tornare, sperando in un trattamento più adeguato.

title: Very accommodating on my early arrival
text: I was in New York for an energy conference and arrived around 10:30 to see if I could just store my luggage for a few hours prior to checking in.  The woman at the front desk, Alla, was extremely pleasant and did all that she could to find me a room (an upgrade!) where I could settle in early.  The room had a great view, and the only issue was that there was not any shampoo or soap.  I went back down and spoke to Alla, and she promised to take care of it.  I told her that there was not any rush since I would be out for several hours. I actually returned in about an hour, and there was plenty of soap and shampoo in the room.  The hotel was great, and Alla is a great employee for Marriott!!

title: Excellent View
text: First time in NYC and couldn't have asked for a better location. Near everything and the view from our 64th floor window was amazing of the city and central park. Two thumbs up! Room very nice and staff very friendly.

title: MUY BUENO PERO SI no fuese por sus empleados seria EXCELENTE.
text:
Tema Hotel y sus instalaciones : Ubicacion impecable, para trasladarse a pie a los lugares de mayor interes turistico y con varias lineas de subte a una o dos cuadras. No queria estar en medio del ruido y en este lugar lo logre, aunque estes cerca de todo las habitaciones son de lo mas tranquilas  . Como en todo NY no es inmensa ( la habitacion) pero esta muy bien dispuesta como para mantener comodidad en toda la estadia ademas de contar con kitchinet, heladera, vajilla, lavavajillas ( TODO DE EXCELENTE CALIDAD)  , camas comodas, baño con ducha amplio . Limpieza muy buena. Desayuno super variado. Nunca tuve problemas con los ascensores incluso en dias de fin de semana  Pidan habitaciones en pisos altos , es inmejorable ver la ciudad amanecer, o atardecer con las luces de Times Square de un lado y el rio del otro ....Sobre todo el las habitaciones que dan a esquina...Piso 65 !!!!! 
Tema atencion del personal : deberían mejorar en la amabilidad y cortesia .. habia pedido early check in y me tuvieron yendo y viniendo durante horas prometiendo la habitacion cuando finalmente me la dieron a las 4 pm ( hora del check in) de haberlo sabido en primer momento, dejaba las valijas y volvia a esa hora , no a las 12, luego a las 13 y a las 15 ... nadie habla español. Ademas habia sacado un paquete que incluia ciertos amenities en la habitacion y cuando los "recorde"en recepcion la respuesta fue de mala forma que "no tenian idea de lo que les decia, que desconocian ese paquete", cuando les mostre mi reserva y esa confirmacion , inmediatamente me los dieron , pero me parece de  muy mal gusto ese tipo de respuestas . Mala atencion de la recepcion en general lamentablemente FUera de este tema, que claramente tiene que ver con algunos empleados , el hotel en si es maravilloso y volvere sin dudarlo . A pesar de sus recepcionistas . Deberian mejorar este aspecto .

title: Costoso, ma ne vale assolutamente la pena
text:
La struttura sta in un grattacielo nuovissimo e altissimo, proprio a metà tra Times Square e Central Park. Le camere sono tutte a piani alti, e si gode di una vista impagabile, specialmente al tramonto, essendo più alto degli altri grattacieli contigui.
Colazione molto buona in una sala spettacolare.
Segnale WiFi ottimo.
All'arrivo la nostra prenotazione di Booking risultava cancellata (ma così non era sul mio profilo). La receptionist ha comunque ribloccato la stanza e l'ho pagata uguale a quando avevo prenotato. 
Purtroppo non accettano la carta di credito Maestro.

title: Good location, excellent bathtub!
text:
Stayed here in February while in the city for a conference and some sightseeing. We choose this hotel over the conference hotel because it was about a block away and because we were staying for a week and liked the idea of a kitchenette. Plus, the bathtub looked amazing from the pictures and proved to be pretty fantastic in person: super deep and spacious, great for soaking after a long day of walking in the freezing cold. We had a corner room with good views, but probably not as great as the views from higher up than us.There were a few minor maintenance problems with the room, but nothing major. The bed was comfortable and laundry facilities proved useful. Not many choices for food at the bar on the 4th floor, but it was nice to be able to pop down for a drink. Breakfast was included and available on the 3rd floor.

We did have some problems with very rude staff early in our stay- to the point that we almost left the hotel- but after speaking to district manager, things were rectified and we felt comfortable enough to stay the rest of week. Overall the majority of the staff were professional, we just encountered a couple were over-the-top rude and inappropriate, such as the kitchen manager who chased my husband down to tell him he couldn't take a breakfast tray to our room despite being told by other staff it was okay and despite many other guests doing the same without issue. (What was the purpose of the trays?) Still giving the hotel 4 stars, mainly due to location, views and again the bathtub, though I'm not sure that we would stay here again due to some of the issues we encountered.

title: Ottimo hotel.. pero...
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato una settimana in questo hotel, siamo molto contenti per la posizione che aveva molto vicino a Time Square e alla metropolitana.
Camera un po piccolina, ma so che è negli standard newyorkesi. Colazione a buffet ottima.
Unica pecca è stato il frontdesk: l'hotel era stato prenotato e pagato in anticipo su Booking, ma al momento dell'arrivo e del checkin, un po per la stanchezza, abbiamo fornito una carta di credito diversa per la cauzione chiesta. E loro cosa hanno fatto? Hanno addebitato tutto il valore della settimana sulla carta, nonostante fosse gia tutto pagato. Abbiamo chiesto spiegazioni e aiuto per risolvere la questione, ma abbiamo dovuto chiamare noi booking per chiedere aiuto. Alla fine la cifra è stata cancellata ma ribloccata sulla carta iniziata per ben 15 giorni. Quindi ci siamo ritrovati con oltre 2500 dollari inutilizzabili per tutto il soggiorno!!!!!!
La responsabile del front desk è stata molto maleducata per tutte le volte che abbiamo cercato di chiedere aiuto o spiegazioni.

title: Great location.
text:
Within easy walking distance of Times Square, and Central Park ( it's actually located on Broadway). Ground Zero, was only 2 miles away, so was in steady strolling distance.
Surrounded by loads of eating and drinking options. Close to all types of shopping. Complimentary breakfast was excellent. 
Rooms were super clean, modern, and our room had a pretty good kitchenette, which was an unexpected bonus.
All the hotel staff we came in contact with, rooms service, front desk, were very helpful, and courteous.
It's location really makes this place and ideal base for exploring Manhattan, making it great value for your dollar.

title: Wonderful!
text:
Extremely helpful in making last minute reservations for our family of 6.
Saturday evening, peak season !
We felt so welcome and taken care of right away.I can highly recommend this hotel, would love to stay here again.

title: A good hotel in a great location, but with a few problems.
text: We have stayed in this hotel before, as well as in the courtyard hotel which shares the same building (residence inn rooms start on the higher floors).  We like the residence inn chain for its larger rooms that include a kitchenette.  The very best thing about this hotel is it's location at 54th and broadway.  Theaters, great restaurants, Central Park etc are all within just a few blocks.  On the downside, it is priced like a luxury hotel.  There are many good nearby hotels that are more reasonably priced.  A bigger issue for us is all of the problems in the room we had. At check in we had to call housekeeping since there was no soap, shampoo etc in our room.  Our tv lost its signal frequently over our 3 day stay and maintenance had to come up twice to repair our telephone.  Meanwhile the ice maker in our kitchen didn't work so we lost the benefit of not having to get on the elevator to find an ice machine.  We will probably move to a different hotel on our next visit to NYC

title: New York...New York
text:
Location de dernière minute...

Beaucoup de réserves!!!!
Appart hotel pour 4... mais que 3 lits, avec vue sur Central Park comme sur la Tour Eiffel depuis une lucarne!!!

Il faut montrer son mécontentement 
pour obtenir ce que nous avons réservé.

Auquel on vous répond que le 64ème étage sur 65, on devrait être content, même s'il manque un lit !!!!!!!!

Vieillot, pas propre, rien ne fonctionne, pas de poignée au placard, frigo en panne tous les jours, toilettes bouchées, ménage pas fait et jamais assez de serviettes pour 4 chaque jour pendant 8 Jours...

Petit déjeuner très bien 
Emplacement dans New-York top!! Sur Broadway.

Il serait tant de rénover !!!

title: Consigliato
text: Ottima posizione. Camera spaziosa e con una vista spettacolare. Letto comodissimo. Molto bella la sala per la colazione. Nelle aree comuni era molto (troppo) freddo a causa dell'aria condizionata a temperatura molto bassa ma è una cosa purtroppo comune nei locali a New York.

title: Great hotel!
text: Stayed at this Marriott for a last minute weekend in the city.  We have stayed in many NYC hotels. This hotel was wonderful, clean and nicely located.  Our room was on the 61st floor and had floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Hudson as well as Central Park.  The room was very updated and clean. Breakfast was included, however we were not impressed with it. The staff was not very friendly and could not keep up with the amount of guests in the room. Otherwise, an absolutely perfect hotel

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Habitaciones muy cómodas provistas con microondas, lavavajilla y refrigerador. Desayuno incluido. El hotel está en una ubicación privilegiada para disfrutar de los museos y atracciones de NYC. A pocos metros del MOMA y los teatros de Broadway.
Como suele ocurrir hay desperdicio de energía porque se mantienen abiertas las puertas del hotel con el aire acondicionado funcionando en el lobby !! no parece importarles...

title: Great location - average bed
text:
Our experience at the Residence Inn started out great. Got a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite with a great view of the city. The check in assistant was friendly and knowledgeable. The room was clean, well maintained, and the bathroom was excellent - big and spacious with three sets of towels.

Only thing that was not great for us was the bed, which is unfortunately a big deal for us. Not very comfortable, the bedding was thin and not very luxurious. Hence the 4 rating, especially in a place like midtown NYC. 
With that said, I am sure that they would have provided us with more if we asked. 

The hotel offers free breakfast, wi-fi and a lounge on the 4th floor. A fitness center is also available.

title: Bien
text:
Hôtel très bien 
Chambre réservée sur booking pour 2 Queen size, mais arrives sur place 1 lit King size pour 2 adultes et 2 enfants 
Heureusement que le personnel de la réception était super sympa et à réussi à nous trouver une chambre avec 1 lit Queen size et 1 lit simple sans supplément 
Sinon tout était top, la vue, le petit déjeuner hyper complet 
Très bien situé

title: Good location, but could improve service
text:
Upon check-in , we were told their computers were"down" and they couldn't confirm if any upper level rooms were available for us (as I requested when I booked onlineand again confirmed when I called the night before) . They told us to return in 1hr. When we returned, systems still down so they radio-ed housekeeping to confirm if any upper rooms were ready. They couldn't confirm. Whaaat?!!! We were told lower floors available. 

I mentioned that we lost a day of travel cuz our flight was stuck/cancelled in Chicago due to weather. Also said it was my family's first visit to NYC and  it would be nice if they could confirm an upper level room for us. I was met with a blank stare as if "So, you gonna take the lower level room?"
