We were all exhausted and felt defeated by lack of sympathy from front desk so we took the room. I was so disappointed, just views of buildings--no Times Square or Central Park views :(

Pros:
1. Central location to Times Square and Central Park
2. Kitchenette for families
3. Modern and clean

Cons:
1. Front desk could be more accommodating to those who experienced travel/flight fiascos
2. Breakfast is not impressive: standard scrambled eggs, pork sausage, yogurt/fruit, and all the white carbs you could want--bagels, toast, pastries and waffle maker.
3. Having to insert/and leave key card to power lights in room is inconvenient

We will not return to Residence Inn due to the service we received upon check in. First impression is everything when one is in the hospitality industry...

title: Excellent location
text: Great location, friendly staff, clean, what more could you ask for! I booked on Expedia and got a King bedroom, but when the  check-in lady saw I was with my son she upgraded us to a double and a single 😊 The views were breath taking! The only downside would be if you went to breakfast later than 8am there's a queue and not a lot of choice of food. Also the lifts are very very busy at this time. Fortunately this only happened to us once as we were early risers.

title: The City that Never Sleeps
text:
I booked this hotel due to the location, as I was taking a cruise out of NY and this hotel is only a couple of blocks from the Pier.  I arrived and was greeted by Abdul at the front desk and from that moment on, my vacation began.  He was so personable and pleasant - I booked a park view and my room was on the 65th floor on the corner overlooking what seemed like all of Manhattan.  As a long time New Yorker, now retired in Florida I know the city well but the view from the room made me feel like I was seeing it for the first time, simply stunning.
Abdul made a suggestion for dinner for the next night and he was spot on.  The next day when I was returning to the hotel he greeted me as a regular, believe me,as someone who now works in the service industry (airport) this hotel does it right.
I enjoyed the breakfast in the morning - though crowded - it is tourist season after all.
The room was clean and well appointed and the bathroom shower is a big plus.  I
will definitely return in the fall and now this hotel is my new "go to" while in NYC.

title: Awesome New York week
text: First visit, wow, what a city, luckily had the most amazing accommodation at 1717 Broadway, fabulous building, everything we needed at our fingertips walking distance to everything..breakfast included, great staff and service, NOTHING was too much trouble. Suggest the Greyline for the bus tours, saw everything from Museums, to Uptown, Midtown, Downtown, Bronx and Brooklyn. Saw Kinky Boots - wow fantastic musical, standing ovation to cast. Smith and Wollensky and Ruth Chris restaurant - fabulous food. The sights, sounds, smells and vibe of New York - wonderful

title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCIA jamas volveria a este hotel
text: Atencion recepcion malisima..limpieza mediocre...sommiers gastados....el desayuno es un CAOS..poco espacioso el lugar...Gaste mucho dinero en este hotel es mi segunda vez en NYC y totalmente arrepentido de haber estado en este hotel.teniendo otras posibilidades mejores y mas economicas NO LO VALE EN ABSOLUTO.

title: Good stay, but what's with the crinkly sheets?
text:
Hotel is centrally located to theatre district and Cental Park. Staff is friendly and helpful. We appreciated the bellmen who took care of our luggage after checkout and their recommendation of a private car to the airport.

But why do the bedsheets crinkle like they are paper? I've had this experience at other Marriot-brand hotels but thankfully only on rare occasions. I pulled the sheets to the side of the bed but could still feel/hear them all night long. Bedsheets should not make noise. That prevented a 5-star rating.

title: Two Marriott brand hotels in one - Residence Inn on the top floors
text: We had a great stay until the bill was incorrect and our experience with the accounting department of the hotel's owner was definitely less than acceptable.  The hotel is a two in one, with Courtyard rooms on the bottom and Residence Inn on the top floors.  Rooms are well appointed, but tight.  The views are amazing.  Elevators were fine, front desk was great.  Still a great value and the location is terrific too.

title: Views are amazing!
text: We stayed here for 5 nights in July 2017. Although the cost of the room is higher than what I usually pay, I splurged on this one because of the views. I surprised my husband with his first trip to NYC for his birthday. I requested a high floor, and was assigned 6402. There are 65 floors, so we were close to the top. When I made my online reservation, I noted this was a surprise for my husband's birthday. The view from the room is nothing like I've seen before. This room has a panoramic window where you could see Central Park to the north and Times Square to the south. We kept the curtains pulled open all the way the entire time we were here. To fall asleep with the lights of the city, and to wake up with the sunrise was wonderful. The bed is very comfortable. When you enter the room, you must insert your room key into a slot on the wall in order for the lights to work. Very interesting and caused no problem at all. It was nice because we always knew where one of our keys were. After our first full day out touring the city, when we arrived back to our room there was a birthday cake with a candle and champagne to celebrate my husbands birthday from the Guest Relations Manager, Jamie Bond. We were so impressed by this kind gesture. Every morning we went down to the 3rd floor for breakfast. It had a very good selection of hot and cold items, fruits, oatmeal, bagels, toast, etc. The only thing I feel that would have made my stay better was for the hotel to offer complimentary bottles of water for tourists who have been out in the heat all day. The 4th floor did have complimentary ice cold water that was easily accessible, but with tiny plastic cups. Overall, I do hope to stay here again in the future and do highly recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing view, great location for a NYC discovery trip.
text:
We stayed there for a week just a couple of weeks ago. This was our first trip to New York. We found the location of the hotel just perfect for what we wanted to see and visit (the usual stuff I guess : Manhattan, Times Square, Central Park, 9/11 memorial and museum, One World, Top of the Rock, Liberty, Ellis, …). We had booked a superior room with view on Times Square. On check-in I asked for a room on higher floors and we got a room on 59th floor, room 5907. The view was stunning ! On the right, view on the Hudson, on the front, view on Times Square. The only downside on the view was a building of about the same height under construction, which partly obstructed the view, but the hotel can’t help that and the view was great nevertheless. 

The room itself was very nice, rather small but with all you need, bed very comfortable. The only points that could be improved : the air-conditioning is rather noisy, and some details could be given more attention (joints between tiles on the shower floor not all the same color, furniture shows some signs of “wear & tear”). This room had a kitchenette with fridge (even with ice-maker), micro-wave, tea and coffee-making facilities, plates, glasses, cups, cutlery and dish-washing machine… This has been useful for having a snack in the room on some occasions. 

Based on many reviews we read here, we were skeptical about breakfast, but we found it very good actually. To be fair you really need to be there before 8.30 otherwise it gets very busy and you may not find correct seating. But they mention it in the lobby, so that doesn’t come as a surprise. If you go after 9.00, which we did once, they don’t refill the buffet anymore as they close at 9.30  so the available choice selection really shrinks.  But with all there is to see and do in NYC and also with the jet lag the first days, we didn’t feel like getting up late  and were there around 7.00 or 7.30 on most days, and that was perfect. 

The staff is very friendly, we did not ask much help as we had made our program already, but when we did they helped us and we got the answers we needed. 

We surely recommend this hotel !

title: Top
text: Emplacement idéal entre Times Square et Central Park. Au milieu de tout. Vue à couper le souffle... 1ère nuit au 62e étage, ensuite au 42e pour le reste du séjour. Très belle chambre, spacieuse et fonctionnelle. Petite kitchenette pratique avec frigo, lave vaisselle, micro-onde et nécessaire pour manger. Petit-déjeuner varié, pour tous les goûts, sucré, salé, généreux. Hôtel propre et personnel sympathique.

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as platinum elite members. Check in was at 4pm we called before we arrived to let them know we were coming, they couldn't guarantee our room would be ready but I hoped for the best. We arrived at 12, expecting to wait at least 2 hours for our room to be ready, we were surprisingly checked in right away. We were placed on the top floor in a corner room with a king bed. The room was smaller than my previous stay but the view made up for it. We were facing central park but we were so high up that we could see the Hudson River and even times square! They had free breakfast on the 3rd floor and a bar and concierge area on the 4th floor. House keeping was great and cleaned our room very well. The room got a little cold at times, whenever the A/C turned on the vent was blowing right on us. The room had a kitchen with a fridge, freezer, dishwasher, even silverware. The location was perfect for us, its right in between times square and central park and 2 blocks or less from the subway. We enjoyed our stay very much and would probably stay here a third time!

title: Tenso
text: Se não tivéssemos sido hospedados no andar 64 talvez minha avaliação fosse melhor. O prédio é compartilhado com 2 hotéis: ate andar 35 é o Courtyard; e do andar 36 até 65 é o Residence inn: Tontura direto pra descer pro cafe no andar 3, e tontura pra retornar pro apartamento. Quarto pequeno mas confortável para duas pessoas. A minicozinha deveria ser microcozinha de tão pequena. A geladeira era uma gaveta. O freezer, outra gaveta...e não fechava completamente pois brigava com a dobradiça de entrada do apto.  No segundo dia, percebi o real perigo: fomos acordados as 4h40 com alarme sonoro altissimo e mensagem no sistema de som de provável incêndio. Deveríamos aguardar nova instrução quando finalmente ouvimos mensagem de que o alarme havia disparado acidentalmente. Se eu fosse você, não me hospedaria lá novamente arriscando a vida de sua família entre andares tão altos durante suas férias que devem ser, supostamente, um momento para descontração e não de alto risco e tensão extrema. Outra opção seria ficar no courtyard que também tem acesso ao MESMO cafe da manhã.

title: ENTRE O CENTRAL PARK E TIME SQUARE
text: Os quartos são limpos com boa visão começam no 38ºandar e contem cozinha completa , a recepção e entrada do hotel fica na rua 54W entre a 8º AV e a Broadway..Cafe da manha servido no 3º andar ou se preferir vc pode preparar sua bandeja e tomar no quarto,  wi-fi perfeito

title: Not what I expected
text:
I've stayed at the residence many times across North America and usually have had positive experiences. I arrived in NYC, to be barely acknowledged by conceirge. Check in was at 4, arriving at 430 was told another 40 min wait for my room. The room turned out to be extremely small, with a token microwave, fridge, dishwasher. No hotplate, as seen in website. About a quarter of the size of the average residence Inn room I've stayed in. 
Warning to families, this isn't what you're expecting!
Staff were generally cool, but polite. 
Room was averagely clean, it was soundproof and beds were comfortable.

title: Nice hotel, good location
text: Check in process was real easy, but the clerk mentioned something about "power" that I didn't quite catch. Only when I got to the room did I realize you have to drop your key card in a slot to get the room power to come on. I guess I could have paid more attention, but a feature like this to people from out of town should be clarified more distinctly. The room was clean, and nicely organized. It is what you'd expect from a New York hotel room. Compared to other Residence Inn's around the country, the room is considered small. The continental breakfast had a lot of items, but not a lot of "no meat/no dairy" options. Most of the time it was sausage and eggs. The eating area was beautiful with great views of New York from the 3rd floor level. Overall this was a great experience.

title: Ideal location and a fantastic hotel
text: Rooms are only 35th floor and above, so every room has a view of some kind.  Paid a little extra for a TS view and could see the Freedom Tower, TS, and the Brooklyn Bridge from our room.  Rooms were cozy, but very functional, nicely appointed with good linens and a fantastic bed.  There was a kitchenette in the room which was nice for cool water and a place to store our milk for our late night visits to Juniors for desserts!  We had a breakfast 3 of our 4 mornings here, plenty of choices and good food is included with the room.  the absolute highlight of the room, however, was the shower.  Amazing pressure, great temp and wonderful shower head.  I know it sounds weird, but absolutely loved the shower!  The staff were extremely helpful, O'Neal in particular helped make our stay so memorable.  Located perfectly close enough to walk to TS but also away from it.  Easy walk to all the subway stations 50th, 57th, Columbus Circle, all in a couple of blocks.  Easy walk to Central Park and 5th Ave. I will be staying here again.

title: Fabulous, functional hotel in Midtown
text: Floor-to-ceiling views of Manhattan are unparalleled!! Friendly staff, great breakfast and a central location that can't be beat! A bonus is the incredible shower pressure and mini-kitchen that is stocked with everything you need. Within walking distance of Times Square, Park Avenue shopping, Lincoln Center and Upper West Side restaurants.

title: Amazing view, top location
text: We stayed on 55th floor, overlooking Central park (although we booked Times Square view) and the view was amazing. Room was pretty big and it had everything you need. I liked the location - near everything - subway, Times Square, Central Park, attractions and good diners.

title: Excellent views
text:
This is a mixed review based on great and not-so-great experiences with the hotel. 

The location is very good - a short stroll to Times Square (which we could see from our room), close to all the shows, close to Central Park, and easy access to transport.

The view from our room was superb. Top floor, corner room with a view that spanned from Central Park (just) right around to Times Square and across to the Hudson River. We could see clearly out to New Jersey and beyond.

The service was mostly really good, except for the occasional poor service from reception and a few requests that were forgotten. We also had a mixup with our checkout day and a lot of important paperwork was thrown out by the cleaners (not their fault, but fault of the reservation system). However, I'm sure that is just a once-off event.

Breakfast was good, but nothing spectacular.

The beds were very comfortable, and the floor-to-ceiling windows made it feel like we were on top of the world. The toilet didn't work properly, but we didn't worry about that. We just visited the lobby toilet.

title: Clean and comfy
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and in good work no order, actually bigger than expected! The shower has a rainfall shower head which was lovely and felt great after a long day walking around. Bed was very comfortable and the room overall was everything we needed. They could improve the free breakfast BUT... it is free :)

title: Pour nos 50 ans
text: Très belle hôtel. Proche de beaucoup de sites touristiques 👍🏻 une vue à couper le souffle nous étions au 43 èmes etages 😍Juste deux points noir ...quand c est férié comme a Pâques le personnel est réduit donc les chambres sont pas faites et du coup c est nous qui vidions nos poubelle et allait les mettre dans une poubelle dans la rue😔et l autre point ...le frigo 😱un bruit de malade du coup nous l avons éteint tout les soirs heureusement que nous y étions pas en pleine été.

title: Second visit!
text: This was my second visit at this hotel and really enjoyed it. The rooms are very nice with great views. It's a smaller version of the regular Residence Inn but it has everything you might need. Breakfast is also included and they have a good gym. The location is perfect with access to subway and everything NYC as to offer! Will definitely be back!

title: Beste uitzicht mogelijk voor een hotel in Manhattan
text: Groot hotel met prima kamers en een super uitzicht. Qua locatie super, maar Time Square is natuurlijk wel druk. Vraag om kamers op de 55 tot 65 verdieping!. En als mogelijk neem een upgrade naar een hoekkamer die zijn net iets wat ruimer en hebben beter uitzicht. Wat je wel merkt is dat het hotel veel gebruikt wordt en daardoor hier en daar wat slijtage te zien is aan de meubels. Maar verder wel schoon en netjes dus ach het past wel bij New York :)

title: Great location!
text: My husband and I stayed for a week in this hotel, located above the Theatre District and below Central Park. We loved the location with it being convenient to get to the busy areas, like Times Square, but not being directly in the crowd. It is an easy walk to the subway stations nearby. The hotel was nice, clean, and well-equipped, but the room, and bathroom especially, were a bit small. In reading other reviews, it seems that the rooms are pretty standard size for NYC though. It was good having a refrigerator and nice size freezer, as well as other kitchen amenities. The complimentary breakfast was good, but we did wish for pastries other than croissants and English muffins which were the only ones served for all but two days. I would stay in this hotel again.

title: Great location, good service
text:
We stayed two nights in room 5707, a king room with city view with transportation package (valet parking without in/out privileges).

The pros:
- Location is very good. The hotel is in the Theater District (54 and Broadway), but very close to Central Park and Columbus circle. 
- Amazing views. Our room had a view of he Hudson River and Times Square. The window is quite big, with floor to ceiling glass which gives light and a feel of space to the room.
- like most Residence Inn, the room was equipped with fridge/freezer, china, cutlery, dishwasher, pots, slow cooker, coffee maker, glassware, etc
- The bathroom is of decent size
- Complementary breakfast, with good cold and hot choices 
- Quiet rooms
- Valet parking

The cons:
- relatively small size room (but appropriate for Manhattan)
- the furniture is a bit worn down
- our phone line didn't work (I had to use my phone to call the front desk)
- apparently there is no housekeeping after  5pm, so that's the latest you can request a late check out even if you are paying for half the nightly rate.
- the tv selection channels is limited

Overall the hotel offers good value for money.

title: Its A Decent Hotel And Very Centrally Located
text:
I stayed here on June 30, 2017 for 3 nights traveling for pleasure with my wife and 2 kids aged 13 and 9. We had 2 rooms with a king bed in each and our rooms were 5807/5809 and included a breakfast package. Our stay here was rather enjoyable but the hotel is not over the top but very centrally located around many restaurants and shops all with in walking distance. You are with in minutes of Time Square, 5th Avenue, and Radio City.

I found our room to be a decent clean room with good towels and linens. The bathroom soap and shampoo is not enough so bring your own or ask for plenty more from housekeeping. Our room had a small kitchenette with microwave and sink and this come in handy for kids. The rooms are not very big at but this is typical of new York. If I had to guess the room was less than 250 square feet. For being in the heart of the city the noise was not too bad and you can actually get good sleep here but I suppose if you are a light sleeper you may have issues. The breakfast does not have a lot of selection and is very lacking any type of muffins and such but there is enough there to get you going in the morning. The coffee is nothing special but there is a Starbucks right across the street and we usually don't eat breakfast anyway. I would highly suggest just booking a standard room and not paying extra or taking the breakfast package. Its the location at this hotel that is very desirable and makes worth staying here. However if you like over the top luxury hotels this one is not for you.

title: Nice Room but....
text: Room was nice, but i checked into a room with a dirty bed. Made the front desk aware, but was told here are some sheets unfortunately you will have to re-make it yourself since no one is available to make it. After i made a reservation for a room size i did not get!!! Only good thing was the views, i was in the hotel in the winter, with all the windows just ask for extra blankets, the wind hits against the windows and with the heat on high its still gets very cold. Staff is not that accommodating from being told that i had to make a dirty bed to many other interactions with the staff, And i am a platinum rewards member.

title: Residence bien placée
text: C'est plus une résidence pour l'accueil (parfait pour nous), et une résidence hôtelière avec tous les services. Super séjour, avec une vue magnifique, en étage élevé sur New York et Central Park. Pas de restaurant, mais les offres ne manquent pas à proximité. Coin cuisine très fonctionnel.

title: Warning!
text:
We had clearly booked a Studio with two double beds so that we could fit 2 adults and 2 children in the room. When we arrived they tried to put us in a room with ONE king size bed! According to them, the booking was done for 2 people. I had a printout to prove that we had a reservation for 2 adults and 2 children but the guy at the check-in was not very helpful or understanding. He first told us to look at other hotels outside of Manhattan and blamed everything on Booking.com and said that the hotel was overbooked already and he could not help us.
Not until I asked to talk to the manager a solution was found. We were put in the Courtyard by Marriot hotel (in the same building) for one night and then moved to a Studio with two beds after that.
We had already prepaid for the rooms and we got no compensation for staying one night in a cheaper hotel.
Two things are upsetting about this:
1. He blamed everything on booking.com and said that this has happened many times before. Then why don't they fix that problem or stop using third party bookings?
2. The attitude of the guy at the reception. When you are tired and jetlagged you do not want to hear that you should go look elsewhere for accomodation.

Otherwise the hotel is OK. The view (when we finally got our room) was nice. The location is good. The Studio is spatious. The breakfast is OK, but was very crowded. Clean bathroom but somewhat dusty room.

title: Wonderful Property!
text:
Picked this location due to it's proximity to Broadway Theaters and everything around Central Park. The property is awesome! The staff were unbelievable during our entire stay and beyond helpful. This property does not have the standard feel other Residence Inns have, more updated and modern. The staff never made us feel like tourist, answering our questions like it was the first time hearing this request. The property's staff  gave the vide of small city even though we were in a city of millions. Nice job to all!

The breakfast area is large and the food very good. Eggs taste like eggs not powered ones or altered down like other locations. The pastries and fruit were very good and fresh!

Our room was very modern and comfortable. Liked the look and feel of the room. Not crowded and we were fortunate to have a corner room with unbelievable views of Central Park and the Hudson River.

This property also has a restaurant on the 4th floor which is unusual for this brand. We did not partake in any meals here but nice to have it on property. I believe is the Bistro from the Courtyard which is located in the same building

This is the best location to be near every sight to visit. Wonderful property!

title: Excellent
text: I stayed here last week for work. I was in room 5901, corner room with Central Park view. I didn't want to leave the room the view was so spectacular. This hotel is in a great location. You can walk to main attractions in a few minutes. There are fantastic restaurants surrounding the hotel.  The breakfast is very good. I cannot wait to stay again.

title: Excellent Hotel in Manhattan
text: Stayed three nights in June 2017.  Staff were very accommodating when I called down and requested a room with drawers as the initial central park view room I was assigned did not have a desk or drawers to put things away.  Was very pleased with the new room.  The room was surprisingly "spacious" as far as NYC hotels go. Very comfortable bed. Loved the nice blue paint color in the bathroom and was thrilled to find drawer space in the bath vanity as well! There were a couple items in my room that needed to be addressed, soap dish in bath had come loose from the wall and all the lamp shades in the room had water stains on them (humidity?), but other than that it was an excellent hotel in a great location!

title: Excelente custo x benefício
text:
O hotel tem uma excelente localização . Próximo ao central Park e times square. Há restaurantes, farmácia, mercado tudo próximo. O quarto não é grande, mas confortável, bem distribuído e com uma pequena cozinha muito conveniente. É um pequeno flat. Cama confortável, banheiro confortável com amenities de qualidade. A vota do quarto, com janelas do chão até o teto é incrível .
O café da manhã é muito bom. Farto e a área de café da manhã é bonita, confortável com vista agradável .
Limpeza dos quartos OK, com trocas de toalhas e lençóis diários.
Ficaria novamente no hotel, sem duvidas! Gostei muito!!!!

title: Wish I could give 6stars!!
text:
There is no better location, more beautiful view and catering to your every need, than this hotel in the heart of Manhattan.
I stayed here with colleagues on a business trip. Way up on the 58th floor. I did'nt have to leave my room, the view was spectacular/breathtaking. The view stretched from Central Park, Manhattan, TimeSquare right to the Hudson.

title: ABSOLUTE PERFECTION
text:
We stayed at the hotel for a special anniversary. I emailed the hotel beforehand and Jamie replied. He was extremely helpful and kind, and ensured us he would do his best to make it a special stay.

The hotel is in an excellent location, between Central Park and Times Square, both of which are perfectly walkable. It is the top half of a building that belongs to Marriott (the bottom half being the Courtyard Hotel). The rooms start at level 36 and so all have excellent views. We were allocated a room on the 65th floor and it was STUNNING. It completely made our trip. In the room were some goodies for our anniversary as well which was a lovely touch, and a card. For a hotel this large, to have such a personal touch, was simply fantastic. 

The room, was a reasonable size with a brilliant bathroom (the shower was great). It was great to have a kitchenette and the popcorn was a wonderful touch. The bed was VERY comfortable.

I have to have a separate paragraph dedicated to Housekeeping. If the hotel reads this, PLEASE thank the lady who made our room. She was the best we have EVER had. She went way beyond her duty, even emptying our dishwasher, tidying everything to an excellent degree each day, etc. The most impressive thing was one morning when I pulled the towel too hard and the towel rail came out on one side. I popped it back into the wall and you wouldn't have known it was damaged, and I intended to tell reception later in the day. When we got back a few hours later, it was already fully repaired...
She had spotted the dust on the floor from the plaster, informed maintenance, and they had repaired it back to perfection all in the few hours we were out. Contrast this to some hotels where you never get something repaired, we didn't even have to notify anyone. It was fixed before we could! Absolutely amazing.

Breakfast was reasonable and there was a nice selection. It was never too busy. 

If you want a special place to stay, then pick this hotel. The staff were all so friendly, and did everything they could have done to make the stay perfect.

title: Fabulous views
text: We stayed 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend.  We were on the 55th floor and had a wonderful room overlooking Central Park.  The room was very nice and had everything we needed including a fridge/freezer and microwave.  Breakfast was wonderful with lots of options.  We ate early each day and the crowds were light.  There were lots of seating options at breakfast, so easy to find a place to sit.  The location of the hotel was perfect as it was close to subway stations and an easy walk to Times Square and Central Park.  99 cent pizza is just around the corner and very good NY pizza.  Would love to stay here again

title: Hotel novo, quarto ótimo, café da manhã e bem localizado.
text:
Não tenho nenhum ponto negativo do hotel. A localização entre Times Square e Central Park é excelente, da pra fazer tudo a pé ou pegar o metrô a duas quadras.

Achei o quarto espaçoso, bonito, bem equipado e a vista do 64o andar?! Linda!

O café da manhã bem completo - nunca tinha visto em NY café incluído, então achei ótimo, mesmo sendo as mesmas coisas todo dia.

Atendimento cordial de todos com um plus na saída: minha irmã derrubou da mesinha de cabeceira e acabou esquecendo uma joia de grande valor sentimental. Depois do checkout ligamos no hotel e a medalha estava guardada, quando voltamos buscar estava embalada e identificada. 

Se fosse destacar algum ponto negativo seria a limpeza no geral, o carpete meio sujinho e poeira nos cantos. Mas a arrumação diária é boa.

Dica para a reserva: tinha reservado outro hotel mais simples porque este aparecida com o preço bem mais alto nos sites de busca. Mas como queria ficar nele, voltava conferir direto e numa sexta à noite entrou uma promoção com 40%, ficou quase o preço do outro, aí troquei.

Segunda dica: nos sites de busca, a opção com uma cama de casal e uma de solteiro é muito mais cara que o quarto com uma cama king. Reservei a opção mais barata, mas no checkin perguntaram qual eu preferia. Ficamos com o quarto maior sem custo extra. Dá pra arriscar a reserva mais barata e esperar o upgrade!

title: Sons first trip to NYC was a hit!
text: I brought my young teenager to NYC for his first visit to the city. We had a corner room on the 58th floor with a fantastic view!  The staff at the hotel was incredible - super helpful!  The location was great - easy access to Central Park, Times Square, Subway.  I would absolutely recommend the Residence Inn and hope to be back one day!

title: Parfait
text: Une belle découverte,chambre spacieuse avec kichinette et une vue incroyable sur Times Square et l Hudson,petit dej ds une très belle salle variés et copieux!gde propreté et situation idéale!bref parfait

title: Excelente
text: La atención impecable, al llegar nos ofrecieron una habitación doble en esquina con impresionantes vistas a Times Square de día y de noche. La habitación cuenta con kichinette con cafetera, microondas, pileta. Muy buen servicio de limpieza y mantenimiento. El desayuno es continental con cereales, yogur, wafles, tostadas, facturas, jugos, cafe, te. Tiene gimnasio y laundry autoservicio a buen precio. Los ascensores colapsaban en el horario del desayuno (del piso 49 al 3 del comedor).

title: Amazing Views and Location
text: My husband and I make a yearly trip to NYC every January. We found a great deal at this Residence Inn and are we ever happy we did. We requested a room with a view and did we ever get one!! We choose to ask for Central Park view...yes, it is partially obstructed now but it still one of the best in the city! Our room was a good size for a NYC hotel, full size bathroom, kitchenette, king size bed. Everything was very clean and in good working order, bed was super comfortable and we loved just lying in bed at night and looking out at the city. The breakfast was typical fair, a mix of hot and cold choices, nothing special but adequate. We enjoyed drinks at the bar as well, LOVED their lemon drop martini!! The Residence Inn is located in a great location, easy walking to Midtown and Central Park/Uptown, easy access to the subway for other destinations. All staff we encountered were very professional, friendly and eager to assist us with any needs or concerns. We will definitely return for a stay at this hotel!

title: Could not fault
text:
Stopped here for 4 nights. Could not fault this hotel. Excellent location, easy check in. Room was on the 50th floor. Amazing views. Room was clean, had kitchenette with microwave, fridge,coffee machine and kettle. It even had a dishwasher.   There is also a safe in the room. 

Room was very quiet. The bed was probably the best I've ever slept in, it was so comfy.   Breakfast was in included in the room rate and again could not fault it. A good variety from cereal, waffles, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, fruit etc. Breakfast room was big and wasn't that busy (we usually got there for 7am). 

 Location is 54th and Broadway. We walked from Penn station as we flew in to Newark airport. Walk took about 20 minutes. Subway stations are about a 5 minute walk. With regards to attractions you are in the theatre district with time square and central Park on your doorstep, rockefellar center is about 15 minutes walk. There is a Starbucks and pret opposite the hotel. 

Would not hesitate to stop in this hotel again.

title: Great Value, Great Rooms & Views
text: I travel to NYC quite a bit for business and need to get the best value for my $$ - this Hotel has a great price for what you get - a location on Broadway in the heart of upper mid-town with lots around it for less than $300 (usually) - the rooms have lots of windows from floor to ceiling to capture some amazing views of the city

title: Excellent service and amazing views!
text:
My husband and I stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon. He picked this hotel because the incredible views overlooking the city. With no floor below 34, every room promises some level of height! Because he notified the staff it was our first night on our honeymoon, we were greeted with a room on the top floor, champagne, and strawberries! Excellent customer service. 

The hotel is also in a great location with tons of restaurants just a few blocks over in Hell's Kitchen. Of course, Times Square and most theaters are just around the corner also. The rooms are modern with all the necessary amenities, and make for a comfortable stay. Overall, reasonable price, great location, and wonderful staff make this hotel worth while!

title: Bra frukost med kanonutsikt
text:
Vi bodde på våning 37 och fick ett superfint rum med ett litet burspråk av panoramafönstren. Fin utsikt så klart och kanonbra frukost på våning 3. Jobbigt dock för mig som inte gillar att åka hiss, men de va snabba och bra. Toppenläge mitt i smeten, bara ett par kvarter från trevliga Hells Kitchen med massa bra restauranger.
Wifin på rummet krånglade och vi fick starta om telefonerna för att kopplas upp, nästan efter varje gång man varit ute, det va ett minus. Annars helt kanon!

title: Great Location
text: We stayed for 5 nights and our first impression of our room (4201) was not good, purely because there was only a small wardrobe and no drawers at all in which to store things. Thus we ended up leaving many things in our suitcases, that was the only negative point and other friends staying here had more than adequate storage in their rooms. Our room and the hotel generally was very clean, the inclusive breakfast was excellent. The hotel is ideally located for Central Park and Broadway leading to Times Square.

title: Ny en marzo
text: Excelente hotel, habitaciones chicas pero muy completas con anafe, lavavajillas heladera y freezer.Muy buena ubicación a 3 cuadras de Columbus Circle una de las  entradas al Central Park y escasas cuadras del Time Square. Desayuno completo , Wi fi muy bueno. Sin duda volvería!

title: Great view!
text: We chose this hotel because of the views that it offered... it did not disappoint. We paid for a "city view" room and wound up getting the corner room with a partial view of Central Park as well! Our room was clean and cozy and breakfast was included which is a definite plus. Will stay here again.

title: Good Hotel, Good Location; However, it Could use a Fitness Center makeover
text:
I am a native New Yorker but now residing elsewhere. I have stayed at this hotel several times.  It is one of the busier Marriott properties in NYC.  By example, the elevator wait can sometimes be extraordinary.  This time, having stayed in April 2017, the hotel was not so busy.  

On my last visit, the staff was courteous and helpful.  The rooms are a good size in my opinion.  I understand that for some the rooms are too small.  The walls in some rooms are thin.  You hear your neighbors if they are boisterous. Best of all, the rooms are clean. 

The hotel's most significant shortcoming is its fitness center.  The equipment is very limited.  There are far too many cardiovascular machines (which appear to be seldom if ever used) but so few exercise machines or weights.  The gym space is enormous yet Marriott has squandered it by not providing adequate exercise equipment.

Overall, a good hotel.  I would stay again for one night.  In excess of one night, I would go to a Marriott hotel with a better gym or one that has a use agreement with a nearby gym.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: From the moment we arrived, and that was at 2.30am due to flight delays, we were greeted with nothing but welcome smiles from the night staff. After enduring a 30+ hour trip to NYC, it was a delight to check in to our room and then quickly head out for a bite to eat.  The location is superb, a short walk to Times Square, Central Park and various subway stations.  Our room was well appointed, we were on the 64th floor and wow what a view !!  The fitness centre, located on 35th floor, is very well equipped, all you require and also another fabulous view over the city.  The breakfast is another plus to have included, a good variety to get you started before heading out for the day.  Congratulations to all the staff, extremely welcoming, helpful and I would highly recommend this property for a very safe, midtown location.

title: A Great location in Midtown and Comfortable Stay
text: This hotel is a short walk to Times Square,Penn Station and subway stops. With my Marriott Rewards card I was able to get my room at 10 am instead of waiting until the 4 pm check-in which was a bonus.  This Marriott Residence Inn has kitchenettes in the rooms which is very convenient with a Whole Foods two blocks away.  Our room on the 30th floor was very comfortable and quiet also.  There was a small view of Bryant Park from our window which was nice.  The complementary hot breakfast buffet was pretty good with lots of options. The only negative was that if you put the do not disturb sign on the door to sleep late in the morning and take it off after 10:30 am the cleaning staff will not clean your room and I had ask the front desk to have your room cleaned.  Overall, I was happy with my stay and would recommend this hotels to other visitors to the Big Apple.

title: Breve visita a New YOrk
text:
Nelle mie visite a New York vado sempre in questo albergo. E' centrale perchè si trova su Brodway molto a metà strada da Times Square a Columbus Circle.
Il servizio è ottimo, compresa la prima colazione. 
E' l'albergo più alto di tutto in nord America, con camere che vanno dal 40° al 65°piano e offrono delle viste mozzafiato.
Lo raccomando.

title: 54th St location...convenient
text: Room very nice...NY size.  Very clean.  Nice kitchen area.  Micro, small frig, dishes, etc.  ample closet & draw space for short stay.  King bed comfortable.  Ironing board, iron, hair dryer.  Member + 1 guest get continental breakfast free.  Fresh fruit plus yogurt, choice of rolls, eggs & sausage, etc.  members may request early check-in, late check-out.  4-6pm member cheese and wine.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text:
My husband surprised me with tickets to the Derek Jeter number retirement at yankee stadium. We decided to make it a fun weekend trip for my birthday and mother's day. We are platinum Marriott rewards members. We got an alert to check in online through the app on Friday. I requested an early check-in and late checkout. On Saturday while waiting to board our flight, they sent word that our room was ready and to just come by the desk to get our keys. Sweet! They also allowed us a 130p checkout, giving us a bit more time to explore on Monday.

The studios are very nice and have a mini fridge, freezer, microwave, dishwasher, and plates and utensils. Breakfast is free daily and they have a.connected area to the courtyard hotel on 4th floor with quick food and Starbucks for purchase. Service is excellent. Staff is very friendly. 

There are several restaurants in walking distance. Also several subway options close by to get around the city. There ate numerous theaters nearby so If you are taking in a play, you won't have far to go.  

BOTTOM LINE: If you want to be close to times square without the extra cost and crowds, this residence inn by Marriott is a wonderful option.

title: Was für eine Aussicht!
text:
Wir waren eine Woche im Residence Inn New York Hotel. Im 57 Stock hatten wir ein Zimmer erhalten und es war der absolute Wahnsinn - siehe Bilder. Der Blick auf den TImes-Square ist ja schon außergewöhnlich aber vom 57 Stock ist das der Hammer. Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit bodentiefen Fenstern. Das war schon beeindruckend. In Summe ist das Zimmer sehr modern. Der Service war für uns immer toll. Wir hatten Übernachtung / Frühstück. Frühstücken im 3. OG war auch der Hammer. Leckeres Essen guter Kaffee und auch hier wieder ein toller Ausblick auf busy Broadway.
Wir werden auf jeden Fall wieder kommen.

title: Very nice great views
text:
Pretty nice for the price for NYC
Thoughts:
Pros
1. Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, Rockefeller
2. Brand new rooms, good amenities, very comfortable
3. Free breakfast that is actually pretty good
4. The gym is large and has all the gym equipment you need outside of very heavy dumbbells, bar bells and leg machines.  Nice view from the gym as well.
5. Nice/helpful/responsive service

Cons:
1. Small rooms... not the smallest in NYC by any stretch, but some of the older hotels are a little bit bigger.  That being said, the space is well used, and you will find utensils, cookwear, plates and pans hidden from sight but easily accessible.

Overall a great experience, I would stay here again

title: Breathtaking view
text:
We stayed at this Marriott for two nights. I requested an early check in on a Saturday, and sure enough I received a message at 12pm that our room was ready.
I booked a room with the panoramic view which was a corner unit. The view was just amazing, we were on the 57th floor.
Room and bathroom very clean. Quiet. Mattress firm and super comfortable.
Breakfast was great, dining room very stylish and modern.
Had drinks at the bar one night it was quiet. Staff overall friendly and professional starting from the front desk to the cleaning personnel.
I would definitely stay here again. Location is just perfect!

title: Excellent service and view at the Residence Inn Central Park
text:
I traveled to New York with my best friend the weekend of May 5th. We had hoped on the wrong subway which resulted in us walking nearly 20 blocks during the weekend's one and only downpour. Needless to say we weren't in the best of moods when we arrived. 

Kenya at the Front Desk changed that in an instant. After apologizing that our larger room was not yet available she got us in a room that was a bit smaller but still had a wonderful view - 5408. We could see Times Square and the Hudson River. To be honest, i enjoyed this more! We could see cruise ships docked etc. After hearing us apologize for getting water all over the floor (we were soaked) she gave us free drinks in the lounge. Now that is a way to kick off our trip. 

The room itself was great, no complaints there! 

Breakfast was wonderful every morning and I loved the free water station. We would fill up our bottles before heading out each day! 

Centrally located near Rockefeller Center and Stephen Colbert. It's about 6 blocks away from Times Square and one block from a subway stop on 53rd. 

All and all Kenya made this trip. She is truly an asset to the property! Fantastic customer service!

title: City Break
text:
Overall the hotel was lovely! We requested a high floor for old views and we weren't disappointed! The room was clean and perfectly big enough for our stay. 

Breakfast had a range of choice from bagels to waffles to fruit to hot food. The hot food was very limited and some I would say had to be to your liking, especially as we were from the uk, we weren't familiar with some of the meats on offer.

The hotel was very central to where we wanted to be, it was within a good walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and various other areas.

The staff were lovely and very accommodating. Our only disappointment was on my birthday, we returned to our room after being out all day to find our room door had been left open by housekeeping. We contacted reception and complained. Within 5 minutes the duty manager phoned back and we were compensated with a free drink and appetiser at the bar. Luckily nothing was taken from the room but we requested no further housekeeping for the remainder of the stay. I think the hotel was as mortified as we were this had happened.

Overall it was a pleasant and comfortable stay.

title: Great location, beautiful View
text:
We booked the hotel room a few hours before our arrival to New York City for an event the next day.  Since I arrived first, I attempted to check in at the Residence Inn by Marriott under my partner’s name (he booked it); however, the lovely lady who was helping us could not find us in the systems.  After multiple attempts to check the system in various ways, she told me to contact Booking.com (where we booked the hotel room) to verify the booking and to check if there was an error on their end, especially considering that my partner has a longer, complicated name that has given us grief in the past.  As soon as my partner landed in NYC and was en-route to the hotel, he called Booking.com to sort out the matter.  The agent at Booking.com called the hotel and spoke with Claire (I believe that was her name) regarding the issue to see what was going on.  At that point, I had been speaking with another receptionist, in case the system had updated; however, once my partner told me that the agent from Booking.com was speaking with Claire, I went over to her.  She told the agent that she would hold a room for us, and asked the agent if we were en-route.  As soon as I heard that, I let her know that I was there but my partner was en-route.  She offered to take my information and get me a room, but to avoid any further issues and/or duplicity in charges, I opted to wait until my partner arrived.

From what my partner was told, when you make a reservation on Booking.com, the reservation goes onto a server shared between the provider and the hotel.  This server must be accessed by someone to update the reservations in the hotel’s reservation systems.  Usually, the only people that have access to this system are the managers, so once they go home at the end of their shifts, and you book late, the hotel’s list of arrivals will not automatically update with the reservation.  As such, you’re a little out of luck with that.  This is good information to know for future reference when booking through third-party providers such as Booking.com and TripAdvisor. 

Once my partner arrived (past midnight), we went up to Claire, and she put in all the relevant information-name and credit card.  She honored the price that was initially shown by Booking.com when we reserved the room, and clarified that she will let her managers know about the issue we experienced.  We voiced our concerns about being charged twice for the hotel room (because Booking.com always says they will charge us), and she stated that Booking.com does not charge the clients; only the hotel does.  She eased our worries by saying that she will let her manager know via email about the name; that way, when he and other managers see our name in the shared server, they will know not to process that request and double charge us.  After a few more minutes of talk, she checked us into room on the sixty-second (62) floor of the Residence Inn (word of caution: there are two hotels, the Courtyard and Residence Inn, in one building).  

Great customer service! I could not be more pleased by how everything was handled by the team at reception. In addition, I forgot my battery pack for my phone in the lobby, and when I returned to retrieve it, Claire and the other person at reception turned to the security guy to ask him if he found it.  Immediately, he went out and got it for me, after checking to make sure that I didn’t lose anything else.  He also told me where he found the battery pack (behind the pillow on one of the chairs). It was a good reminder that I should never ever let things out of my sight. 

The room was a nice, medium sized room.  When we walked into the room, on our left, we saw a sink and countertop with lots of cabinet-space, and a coffeemaker, popcorn and some water (you have to pay for the water, everything else is free).  We were a little confused as to what that layout was for, until we realized that it is part of a kitchen (you can ask for electric stovetops).  We didn’t use it as we were staying for one night, and breakfast was included in our reservation.  I’m still not quite sure why we would want a kitchen in the hotel room, especially when you have breakfast included, but perhaps that is a good idea for lunch and dinner if you don’t want to eat out in NYC and spend a lot of money.  That said, it’s the first time I have seen a hotel provide a microwave and popcorn. I LOVED that idea!

In front of us, as we entered the room, there was a sliding door to the bathroom.  Toiletries (we asked for toothpaste and a toothbrush) were provided, and below the sink, I found a hair-dryer in a bag, next to extra towels.  The shower was a nice sized shower, with (what I like to call) a European showerhead.  It is one of those showerheads that you can remove from the hook and move it around to wash yourself or place it on a lower hook in case you didn’t want to wash your hair and good for children to shower. 

On the right side of the entrance, there was a little closet which had a safe, an iron, an ironing board and enough space to hang up clothes.  A little further down was the entrance to the room, through which you could see the king-sized bed, and the chair by the window.  To the left of the entrance, in the bedroom space, there was a large desk with a lamp and a chair.  There was plenty of space to put both my partner’s and my items.  Over it, there was a large TV, and next to it, was another table so the desk seemed longer than it was.  By the large windows, there was an ottoman and the chair, as I mentioned above.  It was comfortable to sit in and look out the windows to enjoy the beautiful views.  Each side of the bed had its own nightstand and light, with space to plug in our phones.  Everything in the room was clean, and fresh.

The views were absolutely gorgeous! We were enthralled by them and spent a good many minutes both at night and in the morning taking it in.  Our room faced towards Times Square, and you could see the bright billboards and people streaming even at such a late hour (it was almost 1 am at this point).  It was a good thing that the room came with light-blocking curtains because the lights from Times Square are so bright that they lit up the room all on their own when we tried to sleep.  On the other hand, I loved waking up in the morning to the views and seeing New York City wake up.  At five am, you could see that Times Square was quiet and empty, but by seven or eight am, people trickled in. 

The bed was comfortable and very big—more than enough for two people.  One thing that I am not a fan of—although I understand that it’s purely for aesthetic reasons—is having more than four pillows on the bed.  These extra pillows are mostly for decorative purposes as opposed to being used for sleeping.  Due to the roughness of the material on these decorative pillows, the fact that there are so many of them, and the hardness of the pillows, we simply had to get rid of them by pushing them to the sides.  The pillows provided for sleeping purposes, however, were divine.  They have a good balance of being soft and being supportive of the neck and head, aligning the spinal column for the night.  We slept very well despite going to bed around one am and having to wake up at around seven-thirty am.

We headed for breakfast, which is served from seven to around ten am on weekends.  It was all you can eat buffet in a small area within a larger, very classy area.  I loved the breakfast, especially the waffles and the apple crumble cake; however, my partner lamented the fact that there was no bacon to go with the eggs, and the eggs were a little cold and bland.  Outside of the small buffet area, there was a second area for the coffees and teas.  We sat close to the entrance to the buffet area, underneath a huge tv, in big white chairs, which were comfortable.  The rest of the area was set up with different chairs and in different configurations, all of which were done with some forethought of the guests at the hotel.  On numerous occasions, we observed guests from the hotel next door looking out of their windows, and into the dining area of our hotel.  It was a little strange to be eating breakfast while being stared at, but you can’t really help it because the dining area has huge, ceiling to floor windows, and you have a view of the street.  

After breakfast, we took one of the four elevators from the third floor (breakfast area) up to the sixty-second floor.  The elevators are very fast but very small, and get packed quickly, which is a con.  If you are claustrophobic this is not the place for you to be unless you miraculously find and get on an empty elevator.  During the ride up, we spoke with someone on the forty-second floor, who had views to Central Park, and said that it was beautiful, even though some of the views are getting obstructed by buildings at this point.  Perhaps the next time we stay at the Residence Inn, we will get attempt to get a room with a view of Central Park.  As a nature/urban photographer, I would really love to get a few shots of the park as the sun is rising.

Check out was a breeze because all we had to do was stop by a counter, give our cards in and state our hotel and room number.  No hassle, not much waiting (at nine fourty-five am, it was getting very busy with people checking in and out), and we were on our way out.  

To clarify about the two-hotels-in-one that I mentioned earlier:  The building is a joint Courtyard and Residence Inn building.  You check in for both hotels at the one reception area where they do everything relating to both hotels on two separate systems; however, the hotels are split by the elevators and there does not appear to be an interchangeable floor between the hotels above the lobby.  So if you’re in the Residence Inn, and take the elevator for it, you stay in the Residence Inn.  The way that the elevators work is if you’re in the lobby and looking at the black wall at the end of the lobby on the left side, closest to reception, are the elevators for the Residence Inn.  On the right side, further away from reception, are the elevators for the Courtyard.  I am not sure how the floors are laid out, because the Residence Inn seems to be facing Times Square, yet the individual on the forty-second floor was facing Central Park, even though he was in the Residence Inn.  

Also, you need your keycards for the elevator to work (there is a black circular sensor on the wall to swipe/ press the keycard), and for the lights and A/C in your room to turn on in the Residence Inn.  As summers tend to get hot and humid in NYC, if you are coming during the next few months, you might want to ask for an extra key card (especially if you’re a couple or with kids), so that you can leave one keycard in the room to keep the A/C going. 

I would love to return to the Residence Inn if I ever decide to stay in NYC proper again.

title: Awful experience
text:
Being a frequent traveler I spend more than 50% of my time travelling around the global.  After spending 4 nights at this hotel in late April, I feel personally obliged to write and rate it as the worst hotel that I have stayed at in recent years.
Firstly, the rooms are oddly compact. There was no place for putting up your luggage other than the top of the wall desk.  It gives me an intense sense of phobia which caused me to stay out most of the day.  
I requested for no room cleaning services during my stay other than a change of towels and bed sheets after 2 nights stay.  After making 3 separate requests of the same nature on my day 3 stay there, the housekeeper finally came to change the top sheet and pillowcases but NOT the fitted.  The duty managers were defensive when I raised my compliant.  
All staff were far from being pleasant or courteous let alone hospitable.  Senior personnel such as duty management staff set a bad example, in my view.  Rooms are uncomfortable, the air-cond produces a loud cranky noise and amenities are few and of inferior quality.
I was so gravely disappointed at this hotel that I had to cancel my back-to-back booking for an additional 3-day stay there and moved to different hotel in Manhattan.
To my surprise, the hotel separately charged my credit card for bottled water which I never consumed after my departure.  Such charged is now being disputed through my card company.
The unprofessional practices at the outfit are a disgrace to the Marriott group.  
Stay away from this hotel if you expect services of Marriott standard to be provided especially to elite Gold members.

title: Отличный отель, прекрасный вид
text:
Останавливалась в данном отеле в январе 2017 года.
Во-первых, отель находится в двух-трех минутах хотьбы от станции метро где проходит ветка, по которой можно добраться до экспресса в аэропорт JFK.  
Во-вторых, отель удобно расположен прямо на Бродвее по которому можно добраться пешком куда угодно: Центральный парк - 5 минут пешком, Таймс Сквер - 10 минут пешком, Линкольн Центр - 5-10 минут пешком, 5 Авеню - 5 минут пешком. В общем, все в пешей доступности. 
В самом отеле тоже все на уровне. Перед поездкой читала жалобы про коридор: совершенно не согласна. Да, холлы и коридоры на этаже без излишеств, но все выглядит прилично - никакой ободранной краски или отваливающихся обоев.
С лифтами тоже никогда проблем не было. Учитывая, что я жила на 46 этаже, долго ждать лифт ни разу не приходилось. Возможно, в час пик есть какие-то с этим проблемы. А так лифты скоростные, добираешься быстро, единственное уши закладывает :)) Понравилось, что для доступа на этаж необходимо приложить электронный ключ к считывающему устройству - посторонние не пройдут.
Завтраки, включенные в стоимость номера, тоже вполне приличные: хороший шведский стол с йогуртами, кашами, яйцами, мюсли, сок, чай, кофе и т.д. Всегда есть из чего выбрать. Каждое утро даже были свежие фрукты: кусочки дыни, арбуза, манго, клубники и ананаса (что зимой для русского человека очень непривычно :))) Порадовало, что можно тут же сделать кофе/чай/сок на вынос - стоят бумажные стаканчики и крышки. Можно выбрать несколько сортов кофе, чая, разные соки, также есть молоко, сливки разной жирности. И большой выбор сахара: белый, тростниковый, сахарозаменитель и т.д. Завтрак сервируют почти до 12 дня, поэтому можно прийти поесть несколько раз. Кроме того, рано утром очень немноголюдно. Единственный минус: в январе было холодно в зале, т.к. окна в пол, а отопление слабенькое (но, я так понимаю, это особенность любого дома в Америке, все-таки у них теплых месяцев в году больше, чем холодных). Но вид на город из окон прекрасный открывается - я только там и сидела (мерзла, но завтракала с шикарным видом :). 
Что касается номеров, то по Манхэтаннским меркам номер большой. При одноместном размещении мне досталась огромная кровать - мне кажется туда не то что два, а три человека могли поместиться. Опять же, маленький недостаток: зимой прохладно из-за стеклянных стен. Можно включить кондиционер на обогрев, но ненадолго (он сам выключается через какое-то время). В номере есть все, что нужно: телевизор с большим количеством каналов, кресло, шкаф (на двоих, мне кажется, был бы маловат). Большой плюс - кухня, в которой есть все, что нужно: микроволновка, холодильник, посудомоечная машина, тарелки, чашки, столовые приборы, чайник, кофеварка и тостер. Можно даже попросить на ресепшн мини электрическую плитку и готовить - есть кастрюли. Очень понравилось, что бесплатно предлагают попкорн для приготовления в микроволновке. Чай/кофе всегда пополняют по мере расходования.
В номере хорошая звукоизоляция - соседей я не слышала ни разу (не уверена, были ли они вообще). Единственный минус - если не придерживать дверь, то доводчик и замок громко захлопывают дверь. В остальном притензий нет, электронный ключ всегда работал исправно.
Ванная комната небольшая, но есть все, что нужно. Хорошая душевая кабина. Очень понравилось, что есть визуальный датчик температуры воды. Полотенца меняли регулярно и по первой просьбе. Выделяют три вида полотенец: большое для тела, среднее для ног/на пол и маленькое. При этом, в тумбе под раковиной всегда лежал еще один комплект. Я мечтала о ванной со стеклянными стенами, но мне достался другой номер с обычными стенами. О чем я потом не пожалела - в ванной холодно, из душа выходить некомфортно. Не знаю, только зимой так или всегда. Еще один маленький недостаток: несколько раз попались полотенца с пятнами - видно, что стираные, но пятна остались. Было не очень приятно - вроде бы отель претендует на высокий уровень. 
В номере есть Wi-Fi. Всегда работал стабильно, проблем с подключением не было (при заселении выдают пароль).
Но бонус этого отеля, конечно же, это вид - мне кажется, из любого номера вид прекрасный! У меня был частичный вид на Гудзон - вовсе не разочаровал, ничуть не хуже Центрального парка.
Нареканий по уборке никогда не было: мусор убирали ежедневно; постель перестилали, даже не смотря на то, что я заправляла ее сама; пылесосили регулярно. Горничные вежливые: всегда здоровались, когда сталкивались в коридоре. В номер никто ни свет ни заря не ломился с уборкой. Оставляла ценные вещи на видных местах, ничего не пропадало. 
Понравилось, что в гостинице есть кафе. Здесь советую попробовать бургер: вкусная котлета, бекон прожарен как надо; подают как положено с картошкой фри, майонезом и кетчупом. Можно заказать еду на вынос.
Здесь же в кафе стоят компьютеры с доступом в интернет. Можно распечатать билеты на самолет, в театр бесплатно.
На ресепшен работают милые молодые ребята: всегда вежливы, всегда подскажут и помогут. В последний день, уже после выезда из отеля, разрешили оставить багаж в отеле, пока я гуляла по городу до отлета. Никаких проблем с удержанием или двойным списанием денег с карты не было: бронь была гарантирована карточкой, но платила наличными.
Кстати, в отеле есть фитнес-центр (правда я его не посещала).
В целом отель оставил только приятные впечатления. С удовольствием вернулась бы сюда.

title: Nicht alles was glänzt ..
text:
Tja nu weiß ich nicht wie anfange .... am besten erst mal die Lage des Hotels, die ist natürlich ideal! Auch die Aussicht auf Broadway und Central Park ist selbst aus den unteren Etagen, aber sicher nicht in allen Zimmern, noch ein Highlight. Der Empfang war sehr freundlich.
Die Zimmer sind von der Einrichtung ok aber nicht wirklich praktisch, die Größe unseres Zimmers war recht knapp. Die kleine Küche nimmt zudem viel zu viel Platz in Anspruch. Praktische Lösungen wie Kofferablage, Kleiderständer oder einfach ein paar Garderobenhaken fehlen dagegen komplett. Auch im Bad wären praktische Lösungen für Handtuchhalter oder Ablagen sicher besser als Designlösungen. Pluspunkt ist das große Bett.
Zimmerservice - na ja, meist erst am Nachmittag und doch ein wenig oberflächlich, z. Bsp. das Radio die ganze Woche verstaubt. 
Wir hatten mit Frühstück gebucht, unsere Erwartungen waren nicht hoch aber für diese Preisklasse erwarte ich mehr als Kantinenflair. Das Frühstücksangebot war gut aber doch recht überschaubar. Das Geschirr aus Plastik - geht gar nicht! Ansonsten komplette Selbstbedienung, es wurde nur "abgeräumt" und selbst das haben die meisten Gäste noch selbst übernommen. Wenn das dann schon Mal die Mitarbeiter beräumt haben, dann würde das mit Plastekiste eingesammelt und im Frühstücksraum schon, wenig diskret, küchenfertig vorsortiert. 
Fazit: die glänzende Fassade ist nicht alles. Für Übernachtung in Manhatten ok - aber den Preis bezahlt man hier für Lage und Aussicht, aber nicht für Qualität, Service und Wohlfühlen.

title: Excelente!
text:
Hotel excelente. Funcionários amigáveis, internet boa, cafe bom, quarto limpo.
Tudo ótimo. 100%
Inclusive recebemos um upgrade para um quarto melhor do que reservamos. Com certeza vale a pena e voltaríamos novamente.

title: Fantastic stay!
text:
Just returned from a weekend stay in NYC and had to post a review complimenting this hotel. Everything about it was great. The woman at check-in was very helpful and gave us an upgrade, even though we had a Travelzoo deal. The room was spotless and the view was incredible. The room we had came with a kitchenette with microwave, fridge and dishwasher. There was even FREE popcorn.  To be honest, I could have just moved right in...
I would be happy to stay here on every visit to NYC.

title: Très bien
text: Hôtel super bien situé sur Broadway à 5 min à pieds de times square et de central park. Personnel serviable et sympathique. Chambre avec petite kitchenette agréable. Vue sur la ville. Petit déjeuner varié chaque jour.

title: Excellent
text:
Booked a King, Grand Times Square View and requested an -05 corner room on the highest floor available. When I arrived (an hour before my given arrival time and 3 hours before official check in), my room was already prepared. I asked if there was a higher floor, and they found me the same room on the 61st floor as long as I didn't mind waiting. The service in general was exemplary, but Kenaya at the front desk was terrific and worth singling out. She was extremely friendly, professional, and accommodating; an excellent first impression for the hotel.

The room was very clean and comfortable, a perfectly respectable size for a midtown hotel. The kitchenette appliances are subtle and well hidden, and the bathroom with its glass shower is efficient and pleasant, while relatively small.

While it is obviously not a boutique 5-star hotel experience, the primary reason that I booked this hotel was because of the floor to ceiling windows and the views that are offered, and they were extraordinary.

Overall, this hotel was exactly as advertised and although you can find places with slightly better amenities for comparable rates, the views and location here simply cannot be matched.

title: 환상적인 전망
text: 센트럴파크와 하드슨강이 보이는 코너룸에 묵었습니다. 뻥뚫린 시원한 전망은 최고이고, 방도 넓직하고 깔끔해 좋았습니다.

title: Natale a New York
text: Ottima struttura, posizione centralissima e personale gentile. Mozzafiato la vista dalla camera, buona la colazione ed il wifi entrambe comprese nella tariffa. Vicino alle fermate metro ed a Time Square, ideale per le passeggiate serali Ci ritorneremo!!

title: Stunning views, well equipped room. Bad smell
text:
The views with the floor to ceiling windows were wonderful. And the kitchenette was well equipped including a dishwasher, though larger mugs would have been nice!
However I am only marking it as average because the heating/fan was very noisy and 
my main complaint was the microwave stank and made the entire room smell of burnt bacon. I complained every day to reception who said it would be dealt with and it never was. Even my clothes began to smell of it after a week.

title: Great location, lovely room, good vibe
text: We stayed here for a week while doing the tourist thing. It's conveniently located near Central Park, a couple of subway stations, Times Square, and good restaurants. The corner room with a view was terrific - great to sit and watch it all happen from the 63rd floor. Check in was a breeze. Express check out a cinch. Daily breakfast offers healthy foods as well as the usual waist bulging stuff. The breakfast floor is very pleasant and a nice way to start the day (we were there before 7:30 each morning and there was never a crowd). The "hotel taxi" we were offered when leaving was the only disappointing thing. I suggest a bit more honesty with this - a private taxi where the concierge seemed to have a pecuniary interest judging by the money changing hands as we entered the car. Then the request for a tip after we were assured tips were included. Apart from this aspect that I'm sure management can clean up, I would recommend this hotel and stay here again. Oh, and good cocktails on the 4th floor, and a great laundry on the 35th floor.

title: Overbooked hotel and put in the wrong room
text: We arrived after a late flight at about 1:30am and when we got up to our room discovered it was not the King Park View we paid for, but a tiny room with a double bed and a twin bed crammed inside and no park view. When I called the front desk to tell them there must be a mistake, I was rudely told there were no other rooms available. Then I was told the hotel was actually *overbooked*. When I asked what happens to the paying customers when they overbook, I was told oh, don't worry, we put them up in another hotel. This is a terrible policy. When I explained that I paid more for the King Park View room, I was told, oh, we can probably move you to the correct room tomorrow. We travel a LOT and have never had anything like this happen. Appalling. From all the 5 star reviews I was expecting this to be a great experience. It certainly is not.

title: Vue magnifique
text:
Très bien placé à condition d'avoir une chambre en hauteur. Chambre un peu petite mais bien agencée 
À 5 minutes de Time square.
Très bonne literie, frigo très bruyant il faut l'arrêter la nuit pour dormir.
Le personnel n'est pas très poli à part à la réception 
Le buffet déjeuner n'est pas terrible on a vite fait le tour.
Pour le prix par nuit je pense qu'il pourrait offrir des bouteilles d'eau plutôt que de les facturer 6$
Attention il n'y a pas de service transfert hôtel aéroports comme indiqué dans le descriptif

title: Awesome hotel and staff!
text: We stayed 3 nights here last week and loved it! We were on the 55th floor and the views were amazing with views of Times Square and the Hudson River. We had a corner room with wrap around views. Rooms that end in 05 have the best views. Breakfast each morning was a great start to the day. Meat, eggs, waffles, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc. Yummy! The staff was all very friendly and helpful and they held our bags for us after check out so we could tour the city some more. Great location as well! Easy walk to Time Square, Central Park, and Subways. We will be staying here again!!!

title: Imposible no gustar
text: Era nuestra segunda visita a la manzana de las luces. En la primera todo fue vertiginoso, y no pude disfrutar de muchas cosas. Esta vez, sería mi desquite. Todo seria mas tranquilo, sin correr, disfrutando a Nueva York, cada minuto, cada paseo, cada viaje en metro, como nuevo recorrido, Rock Tower, Dumbo, Harlem varias veces, vimos El Rey Leon en el teatro, disfrutamos del Madison Square Garden con una noche espectacular de boxeo, comimos pastrami en Eisenberg´s y tuve la suerte de cruzarme a David Starthairn, un actor que me encanta y muy amable se saco una foto conmigo. Ahi mismo, conocimos al morocho de Gambia, amigo de un argentino hincha de Talleres. Asi podria describir lo bien que lo pasamos, pero...tengo una especial atencion al hotel, Residence Inn NY Central Park, desde sus desayunos increibles, la atencion en el cuarto piso, y la espera por las tardes de frio con un rico chocolate en la recepcion, todos super amables, y la habitacion que nos dieron en el piso 55 con vista a Time Square, que nos permitio ver la ultima nevada desde nuestra habitacion, gracias a Nicol, una recepcionista excelente en su trato y en su trabajo, habitacion super confortable, y muy bien equipada, si volviera a NY obvio que vuelvo. Gracias

title: Great hotel with a great location
text: Both my husband and I stayed at this hotel in December, 2016.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and the staff made us feel very comfortable.  The rooms are tiny, but the views are amazing. I am not sure if all of the rooms are the same size, but it can fit two people very comfortably.  The location cannot be beat.  It is so convenient to everything.  We will be staying there again in May, 2017 because everything was perfect.

title: Me encanto el hotel, en pleno Manhattan todo perfecto!!
text: Me encanto el hotel, sobre todo la habitación en la planta 59 unas vistas espectaculares en pleno Manhattan, el desayuno buffet incluido bastante bueno, y la limpieza también muy bien, el personal del hotel muy amable, pero lo mejor de todo sin duda las vistas desde las alturas...

title: Loved this place!
text: Spent three nights here to see a few shows. The location was perfect, the elevators fast and not unbearably crowded in AM. We were on the 50th floor in a corner king, and the view was spectacular. The ventilation was good (no "off" smells) and the bathroom was very nice, especially the shower, which had a visual water temperature gauge that was pretty neat. We had a minor issue with the fridge not chilling; we called and a couple of guys showed up 5 minutes later and fixed it. Didn't have a chance to check out the cafe/bar on the 4th floor, but that is a nice feature. Breakfast was good, too, with lots of comfortable seating.

title: A Great Stay with a Great Staff
text:
Best hotel on the block!  Having stayed at three other properties on this particular city block (and being a higher ranking rewards member at one of them), this Residence Inn is, by far, the best of the 4. It's hard to find the combination of overall value, quiet rooms, room size,  excellent staff and location, but this hotel has it!

The staff at this hotel is wonderful.  Everyone we encountered from the time we arrived to the time we departed was super-friendly and always asking us how our stay was going.  Even the breakfast staff, despite the craziness was always saying "my pleasure" when asked for any request (like a simple cup of ice).  They even had hot chocolate in the lobby on the (surprisingly) cold and rainy day!

Having previously stayed at the sister property located in the same building, we knew what to expect as far as location, amenities, etc.  Rooms were quite large (especially the bathroom shower..wow!).  The bed and sheets are very comfortable.   Very clean all around in public areas and room.

Are the rooms with the Central Park/Times Square worth it? If it's a first visit to NYC, I say go for it, as it adds to the experience. As someone who visits quite frequently (5-6 times a year for multiple days), it didn't really matter to us.  It's more about the service, the safety, the quality of the room and most importantly, getting a good night sleep in this city!

title: Super
text:
J'ai réserver pour 1 nuit avec vue sur la ville 
chambres très propre salle de bain aussi 
Très belle vue sur Manhattan. Chambre spacieuse avec bureau , frigo.
Le petit déjeuner et super il y en a pour tout les goûts . Salle de sport. 
L'hôtel est bien placer

title: A great find
text:
Excellent location on 54th street.  We loved being just 5 mins walk from Times Square in one direction and 3 mins from the Columbus Circle entrance to Central Park in the other direction.

We were upgraded to Room 6405 on 64th floor – a spacious room with floor to ceiling windows, providing amazing views of Times Square, the Hudson and Central Park.  The hotel was modern, clean and tidy. The room had plenty of storage space, a safe (free), enormous TV, kitchenette (with microwave, toaster and fridge) plus a coffee maker. The bathroom had an enormous walk in shower and toiletries, plenty of towels, etc were provided. The WIFI was free and worked well.

All the staff we encountered were very helpful, especially Roger, the magnificent Front Desk Manager who was so customer-focussed and amazing at his job. 
Breakfast was included in our rate and was served on 3rd floor in a lovely, big room with TVs and relaxed chairs. There was plenty of coffee, water, juices, some fresh fruit, two waffle makers and some limited hot options. 

Loved this hotel – it is reasonably priced for New York (we paid less than £200 per night on a package with Expedia) and we felt offered good value for money. We’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Pior pesadelo da minha vida
text:
Estive com o meu marido em uma viagem de férias nesse hotel em março de 2017, no entanto, passamos por uma situação extremamente constrangedora, tendo em vista que a housekeeper afirmou ter se sentido assediada pelo meu marido, isso porque a meu pedido ele abriu a porta do quarto para colocar algumas embalagens de compras que havíamos feito, nesse momento a tal housekeeper perguntou a ele se era para arrumar o quarto, ele respondeu que sim, mas não naquele momento pois estarmos arrumando para sair. 

Enfim, eu  estava no quarto com o meu marido e logo seguimos para tomar café, afinal de contas, nada havia acontecido, porém, quando retornamos a noite ao hotel fomos abordados pelo gerente de segurança chamado Willian, no qual, simplesmente nos expulsou do hotel por volta das 21:00. 

Como nosso inglês não é dos melhores, ficamos perplexos sem entender o que estava acontecendo. 

Pedimos para checar as câmeras, no entanto, o gerente de segurança disse que não era necessário provar nada, bastava apenas a acusação da housekeeper e que a decisão de nos expulsar tratava de uma norma interna do hotel. 

Procuramos a policia, que por sua vez nos informou que acreditavam no que estávamos relatando, porém, não tinham como nos ajudar pelo fato do hotel/housekeeper não terem feito ocorrência.

Foi uma situação extremamente desagradável, afinal de contas, estávamos sonhando com essas ferias que se tornou um pesadelo.

title: Great visit, nice views
