text: This hotel is great. Located very close to both time square and Central Park. I think the location is fantastic. I had views of both Central Park and time square from my corner unit. The bathrooms and rooms are clean and modern. Breakfast is standard here but still pretty good. Overall this was a great stay and the service is great!

title: New York
text:
Tesis konum olarak Newyork un tam kalbinde nerdeyse Newyork ta görülmesi gereken her yere yürüyüş mesafesinde.
Yalnız sorun otelin çoook eski donanım ve mefruşata sahip olması.
Konumu ve park sorunu olmaması gerçi yüksek park ücreti alıyırlar ama burası Newyork bu gayet normal.

Newyork un merkezinde olayım konfor da benim için önemli değil diyorsanız önermekte bir sakınca yoktur derim.

title: Fantasic views, friendly and helpful staff, great location
text: Marriott's are my go-to business hotels. This is the first time that I've stayed at this Residence Inn which overlooks Central Park. The hotel is a true skyscraper, so one can get up above the street noise easily. The Residence Inn sits directly on top of the Courtyard Marriott property which occupies the lower floors of the high rise building. The staff was warm and welcoming offering me a complimentary beverage upon arriving, I got there quite late after a flight delay. The rooms are much smaller than the usual Residence Inn properties where I've stayed, HOWEVER, the views from every room are spectacular. The hotel sacrificed room space to insure every room got a beautiful view. My room was a corner room (which I believe they all may be given the floor plan) with floor to ceiling windows on the outside walls. For those of us who are sensitive to light, the room has heavy duty, floor to ceiling curtains that block out all of the light. The room was quiet and clean and the bed comfortable and the linens of good quality. My only minor complaint was with the AC/Heating unit.(The thorn in many a frequent traveler's side). It was a tad noisy and, due to the smaller size of the room and where the vent was located,  blew with great gusto right on to my face all night. I did figure out how to close the vent at the ceiling as I found I needed to keep it on to prevent the room from getting too stuffy.  I would still stay here again, to spite the AC unit, as the hotel has so many good qualities. The wonderful breakfast buffet, which is complimentary, is a great feature as well!

title: Excellent location, safe area.
text: The location of this hotel is fantastic – W. 54th St. and Broadway. Just a few minutes walk to the theater district, Times Square, or north to Lincoln Center. The neighborhood is a little quieter and safer than right in Times square, but close enough proximity for ease of access. We have stayed at this hotel several times, and it's always been pretty good. The breakfast room on the third floor and restaurant on the fourth floor are very nice atmospheres overlooking the city streets, and the view from the 35th floor gym is wonderful. The Residence inn is from the 35th floor and above, on top of the Courtyard by Marriott. The rooms are generally clean, although this last time we became very allergic in our room. There may have been a pet that was not thoroughly cleaned up after. The service was generally good, except when we arrived and the system was down and we were not able to check into our room. We had to leave our bags so we could make our evening appointment, and when we returned to check in around 11 PM our original room request was no longer available. The staff did eventually move us to our desired room a couple days later. There was mold on the shower curtain in the bathroom, but the staff replaced this upon request. The Wi-Fi is consistent in my experience. The location is really what makes this hotel worth it.

title: Excellent Stay!
text: Surprisingly a wonderful stay.  The room I had was small and very clean and modern with an unexpected breathtaking view.  The lounge for breakfast was beyond my expectations - very spacious and clean with decent choices (meats/eggs/pastries/fruit/yogurts). I frequent NYC a lot and will make this my go to hotel.

title: Outstanding World Class Hotel
text: The Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Central Park is a world class hotel centrally located to Broadway, Times Square, meeting places for those coach day trips, outstanding restaurants and three subway stations which allow you to travel to all parts of New York. The location near Times Square and Central Park also allows you to walk to many venues. The rooms are magnificently appointed and our view was outstanding and even better on a snowy day. The kitchenette was an added bonus which allows the busy traveler to reduce costs and prepare light meals on late night returns. The staff are friendly and welcoming and assist in many ways. The breakfast is busy but selections are very good. We definitely recommend this world class hotel to anyone staying in New York.

title: An Outstanding Stay!
text: We just stayed here 3 nights for my mom's birthday and from start to end, our stay couldn't of gotten any better! When we checked in, Alla at the front desk was super friendly and gave us a corner Times Square king room up the 65th floor of the Residence Inn, (Room 6505) and a city view king room up on the 24th floor of the Courtyard. (Room 2402) Both of the rooms were amazing, but I preferred room 6505 since it felt larger and had an amazing view! We never wanted to close the curtains at night! The other staff members at this hotel are amazing as well and super friendly! The best part of the hotel is that it has no hidden smells or odors, as everything is really well taken care of! I would without a doubt stay here again the next time I come to NYC and I recommend this hotel to anyone in the area! This is our go-to hotel in NYC!

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
My husband and I planned a trip to Iceland but managed to time it so that we could spend the weekend in New York on the way.  I travel a lot for work and belong to the Marriott Rewards program so I booked two nights at the Residence Inn on Broadway with my points.  Upon check in I asked the gal behind the desk to hook us up with a view, bot did she! We were put in a corner room on the 61st floor.  One direction I could see the Hudson River and the other was Times Square and the city view.  It was awesome both day and night. 
I can't say enough about this property, the breakfast was great and included with the room.  If you have ever ate out in NYC you appreciate that.  The staff was all terrific and very helpful.  The best part though, the location.  Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, 5th avenue, we even visited the Trump Tower while there.  I would stay again and highly recommend this property.

title: Breathtaking View with Central Location
text: Booked park view King and that is exactly what we got!  We were placed on 62nd floor and we were blown away by the view.  The room is typical size for NYC.  Bathroom is spacious.  The room is very classy.  Bed is comfy.  Pillows are very soft.  A little too soft for me but there were 6 of them on the bed.  Room has amenities galore for NYC. We had stocked dishes, refrigerator, freezer, dishwasher and microwave.  Floor to Ceiling window on 2 sides creating an amazing view of Central Park.  We were treated to a snowstorm on our first night and watching the snowfall from our 62nd floor room was something we will never forget.  Great Central location within a couple blocks of Ties Square and on same street as Studio 54 and The Iguana.  Just a couple blocks from Subway.  Housekeeping was spot-on.  Staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful.

title: Unfortunately, Not Up To Par
text: I usually stay at this hotel every year and have recommended it to friends for its location, value and customer service. This was my 3rd year returning. However, my stay of 4 days didn’t meet my expectations and left me highly disappointed. I have to rethink if I will ever stay at this location again. On my 2nd day I left the hotel in the morning and returned late in the afternoon. I was surprised my hotel room had not been cleaned. I assumed since it was approaching evening the housekeeping staff should of made rounds. Thus, I called the front desk to inquire of the reason for no housekeeping. No clear answer was provided, but they eventually sent someone. This lack of service interrupted my plan to have a nap before heading out for the evening. Then, on my 3rd day to add insult to injury no housekeeping once again. What made this day even worse was I had called the front desk to personally “request” housekeeping before I left out for the day. When I returned to my room after an exhausting day at 9 PM my room was not touched nor cleaned. This was highly upsetting.  I contacted the hotel manager to complain. The only solution wasn’t housekeeping, but the hotel simply brought up a few towels 45 minutes later. My advice to others: Stay at an alternate hotel since there are so many better choices in NYC.

title: Soggiorno di 1 settimana
text: Ho soggiornato 1 settimana presso questo hotel/residence. Punti a sfavore: l'angolo cottura veramente minuscolo, senza sedie o tavoli dove potersi appoggiare e camera abbastanza piccola. Punti a favore: la posizione centralissima, con molti teatri, ristoranti e negozi nei dintorni e la vista assolutamente strepitosa.

title: Super
text: L'hôtel est très bien placé. Les chambres sont petites mais très confortables et très bien équipés. Le personnel est à l'écoute . le petit déjeuner est très bien et complet. Je le recommande vivement!!!

title: Muy Buena Opcion
text:
La primer impresión de hotel costoso queda atrás ante la excelente ubicación. Se encuentra cerca de Times Square pero lo suficientemente alejado para que el ruido y la luz no molesten. También nos encontramos cerca del Central Park si queremos ir caminando. Si piensan moverse en subte, se encuentran en el radio de 4 cuatro cuadras, 5 estaciones distintas de lineas diferentes. Una gran ventaja. 
El desayuno es americano, completo, aunque cuando ponen salchichas o una especie de longaniza, en vez de panceta, coman con cuidado porque pican realmente. Mas allá de eso hay variedad para cada gusto. 
La habitación muy limpia todo el tiempo, los ascensores rápidos (por ahí un poco congestionados en el desayuno, pero nada de que preocuparse), la atención en la recepción fue siempre cordial. 
Realmente volvería a ir.

title: Love this hotel
text: Normally when we stay in NY, we stay in Soho but we were here for the theatre and had friends staying at The W, so we were looking for a place nearby. The Residence Inn is fabulous.  We were upgraded to a Park View Room on the 61st floor and the views were spectacular. The room is equipped with a full kitchen, club chairs and table, huge bathroom (shower only which suited us) and a king sized bed. Compared to other hotels we stayed in, in NYC at a similar price, The Residence Inn is streets ahead. Our friends in The W were disappointed and thought we had a much nicer room.  Very pleasant front desk and Accommodation staff. Breakfast is complimentary but only served from 06.30 to 09.30 and the staff are very strict about shutting it down. The actual breakfast room is very pleasant and although breakfast is basic and doesn't change from day to day it is sufficient.

title: Incredible Views
text:
We loved this Residence Inn. Our suite was on the 49th floor! We had amazing views of the Hudson River on one side and Central Park on another. We had a corner room. Large for New York standards. Clean and comfortable. It's within walking distance of Broadway shows, restaurants, Central Park and the MOMA and the MET. 
Good, regular RI breakfasts.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Me and my fiancé stayed here for 5 nights and it was amazing. The staff were so friendly and helpful, rooms were outstanding. The view from our 54th floor room took our breath away! Definitely recommend this hotel to others and when we come back to New York we will be staying here again without a doubt.

title: Just brilliant!
text: Lovely rooms,comfortable bed, staff very helpful, amazing breakfast, great views. Can't recommend enough...will be staying again. Location was just perfect aswell. The address is 1717 broadway and you are literally a 2 minute walk from time square. 5 mins from central park with excellent eateries all around. Great shopping nearby. Hotel staff can't do enough for you. Lovely bar and restaurant on the forth floor, breakfast is served on the 3rd floor and is amazing. I particularly enjoyed making my own waffles! The hotels decor is very fashionable also and everywhere is spotlessly clean. Stay here, you won't be disappointed.

title: Excellent Service
text: Stayed there for a week form 4.3.-11.3.2017. We were given an upgrade due to a noisy room before. The staffer at the front desk was very helpful, her supervising manager was an extremely nice woman who offered to us an upgrade without any discussions. The allocated room was with a superbe view over the Hudson river, the room was aslo totaly quiet no noise at all,many thanks for that unforgettable stay! The Breakfast room was stunning as well as the breakfast itself. Would always choose that Hotel again, not to mention the the very close location to the City of NYC. Perfect Hotel!

title: Excellent hotel with amazing views
text:
Just leaving New York having stayed at this hotel for the past 5 nights, I can not praise this hotel enough, the room was fantastic with views over the city you would not believe. Truly amazing made extra special when it snowed. We stayed on the 63rd floor. 
Our room was cleaned daily and to the most the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was varied, fresh and well presented, Starbucks coffee available from the restaurant for an extra cost, which came in handy when we were snowed in. 
Also a great location for Central Park, broadway and time square , this hotel definitely deserves a 10/10.

title: Soddisfatta!
text:
Le cose ottime di questo hotel sono: Posizione
La vista
La colazione
Sala al 4º piano (è presente uno Starbucks)
La cortesia dello staff

Negative: frigorifero e impianto raffreddamento molto rumorosi.

Nel complesso sono molto soddisfatta, abbiamo avuto bisogno dello staff diverse volte, sono stati gentilissimi e disponibilissimi. 
Oggi era in atto una tempesta di neve, abbiamo aspettato circa 6 ore nella sala al 4º piano dove è presente Starbucks, abbiamo potuto pranzare e stare comodamente sedute. 
Abbiamo soggiornato al 37º piano, bella vista! Sicuramente ci tornerò!

title: Excelente Estadia!!! Lugar recomendable
text:
Este apart hotle me pareció excelente. Super equipado y cómodo.La ubicación super cómoda para tomar subte e ir a otras zonas de new york. El apart tiene microondas, para los que quieren ir al super y comprar algo de comida hecha y calentarla!!! Además tiene heladera con freezer, lavavajillas, pava eléctrica, tostadora y cafetera. Después tenes platos, vasos, cubiertos y distintas ollas x si queres cocinar en el microondas. Super equipado y todo de calidad.
El baño es re grande y muy lindo, al igual que la parte donde está la cama y la tele. Nosotros nos hospedamos en el piso 50!!! Hermosa vista!!!
Después el hotel incluye un desayuno completo, tostadas, media lunas, poquita fruta, yogur, cereales, wafles, huevos revueltos, queso. Para acompañar hay café libre y jugo. Podes repetir de lo que quieras.
Además tiene servicio de lavanderia, por si queres lavar todo antes de regresar a casa!!! Sólo te sale 1.25 dólares el lavado y 1.25 dólares el secado!!! Lo haces vos, utilizando las máquinas de la lavanderia.
El hotel está cerca del Time Square, la calle Broadway es preciosa para caminar, tenes cerca el Central Park. A nosotros nos encanta caminar asi que muchas cosas preferimos caminar que ir en subte, pero sino tenes muchas bocas de subtes para ir a cualquier barrio de Manhattan.
Sin dudas recomiendo este hotel!!!!!

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
text:
The Good: The Location, the rooms, stocked with microwave, dishes, fridge.
The Bad: They gave away our reservation even though it was made months in advance, did not care and were hostile about it at 1 in the morning. Front desk staff hates their job and takes it out on the customer.
The Ugly: They overcharged our bill by a huge amount we needed to push to get it fixed. 
Too bad, since this could be a fantastic place to stay but no one cares about how the hotel is run.

title: Amazing views
text: We stayed on the 64th floor, I believe the highest hotel accommodation in NYC (but I could be wrong!) The views were stunning, from the Hudson River on one side to central park on the other, at night the lights looked fab.  Clean room, very comfortable beds, great kitchenette area, however, we didn't use this.  Expected a few more toiletries, perhaps shower cap etc., slightly disappointed there was only shampoo and body wash. Breakfast selection was very adequate and set us up for the day, very nice comfortable area.  Bellboys and reception staff were extremely helpful, would I stay here again?  Absolutely.

title: Great view, great location, great breakfast
text:
Our room was on the 41st floor, a corner room with Central Park on one side and a city view on the other, it was stunning!  The hotel is literally steps away from everything...Broadway, Carnegie Hall, Late Show, a few blocks from Times Square, great restaurants. 
Breakfast was included in a lovely room on the third floor with great views and everything you could possibly want for breakfast.  
It's Manhattan so it was expensive to park, $65 but you can't beat the location because virtually everything is an easy walk.

title: Great hotel and location!!
text: Loved this Residence Inn!  We stayed here for the weekend and location is awesome.  Between Central Park and Times Square, a Starbucks Coffee just a half block away, subway station just a block and a half from the hotel. A great location to see the many NYC sights while walking and a quick commute via subway to midtown Manhattan. Good breakfast, wonderful room. I highly recommend and will stay again in a future trip to NYC.

title: Best view I have ever had in NYC
text: I have stayed at this property twice and it feels so upscale for a Residence Inn. Best of all is the wrap around window view of the city and central park I have been lucky enough to have each time I have stayed. The kitchenette in super modern and space is used so well. Breakfast is very good and the breakfast room is very chic as well. This is definitely a favorite on my list.

title: Slipstream
text: We loved this hotel. We had two rooms, one was a corner view room. The view from that room was amazing. The rooms are small but nice. It's not super fancy but a nice hotel with a friendly, helpful staff. Some of the rooms have incredible views.

title: Absolutamente recomendable
text:
Por lo general nos demoramos bastante en seleccionar un hotel, ya que siempre estudiamos en profundidad las opiniones de cada uno. Debo decir que en el caso de Residence Central Park, quedamos muy conformes del servicio prestado.

Partiendo por la excelente ubicación, está a poquísimas cuadras del Central Park y a la misma distancia del Times Square. Nos encanta caminar en las ciudades que visitamos y no contratar taxis, y en este caso nos permitió caminar hacia la mayoría de los destinos (MET, Historia Natural, MOMA, etc), además de estar muy cerca de varias líneas de metro, así que básicamente cualquier estación de Manhattan nos servían para ir y volver. 

El desayuno lo sirven hasta las 09.30 de lunes a viernes, y los fines de semana hasta las 10.00 horas, los productos son variados, pero recomiendo no llegar al filo de la hora, ya que si bien el lugar donde se presta el servicio es amplio, se llena y no hay asientos disponibles. 

La vista es maravillosa. Las habitaciones comienzan desde el piso 35, por lo que imagino que todas son buenas. Nosotros nos alojamos en el piso 53, hacia Times Square, por lo que se veía precioso de día y noche. 

El personal siempre fue muy cordial y dispuesto a ayudarnos con todo lo que necesitamos.

title: Muito Bom
text:
Hotel muito bom. Excelente localização , no coração de NY próximo a tudo. Limpeza impecável. Funcionários atenciosos. Quarto muito bom , amplo . Muito bom.
Café da manhã excelente . Recomendo fortemente .

title: Great location, great value
text:
We had a week here, fabulous room on the 48th floor.
Everything was wonderful, pleasant and helpful staff, both at the front desk as well as the food and beverage venues.
The complementary breakfast each day was an excellent preparation for the hard touristing we did each day.
This hotel was pretty much in the best location in NY, close to Broadway shows, close to the subway and bus services.
I'd highly recommend it.
It's not a five star hotel, but it is punching way above its' weight.

title: Ok for a quick getaway
text: The location is perfect and the rooms was not at all too bad, especially since we were only there for 3 nights. We were at the 62nd floor so the view was amazing, but if I were to go back to NY, I'd choose something more luxurious.

title: Excelente escolha!
text: Recomendo de olhos fechados! Para uma cidade cara como NY, gostei do custo-benefício porque as diárias incluíam café da manhã. Reservamos um quarto com vista para a Times Square e ficamos no 56º andar (pedimos um andar alto no momento da compra). Excelente vista! Elevadores rápidos, instalações limpas, café da manhã razoável, isolação térmica excelente, recepcionistas e camareiras sempre muito atenciosos. A localização do hotel é fantástica!!! Acabamos indo a pé para a maior parte das atrações.

title: Hotel eccellente in centro Manhattan
text:
Hotel a due passi da Times Square e da diverse fermate della metropolitana. 
Camera con vista spettacolare, al check-in ci è stato comunicato un upgrade della nostra prenotazione, per cui abbiamo potuto godere di una corner room su Central Park. 
Personale cortese e sempre disponibile, colazione abbondante e varia e presenza di un bar/Starbucks all'interno.
Consigliatissimo, se dovessi tornare a New York lo sceglierei nuovamente senza alcun dubbio.

title: Great Location, Rooms, Views!
text:
I stayed four nights here and appreciated much about this hotel. A note about he building: the Courtyard Hotel is on the lower floors (up to 34th) and the Residence Inn is above the 35th floor. They share a lounge on the fourth floor and the fitness center on the 35th floor. Residence Inn guests have a breakfast space on the third floor.
What I liked:
+ friendly staff
+ central location-- just minutes to the theaters, 5th Ave and Central Park
+ spacious room-- nicely furnished; I didn't use the kitchen but appreciated the space; good storage and lighting
+ terrific view-- I was on the 45th floor with a wall of glass looking north and west
+ excellent fitness center-- I worked out every day; lots of equipment and great views of the city
What I might change:
- bathroom was oddly configured and a tight squeeze to get past toilet 
- desk chair didn't fit the desk so computer work wasn't so comfortable
- breakfast was OK, but got monotonous day after day
These latter items are small when I consider the overall experience. I'll stay here again!

title: Perfect location at affordable price
text:
My husband is celebrating his birthday, a valentine day born celebrant, and I wanted to make this double celebration special.I booked this room for 3 nights.
The hotel is modern, very clean , excellent view of central park, time square and walking distance to broadway shows,St Patrick cathedral,Rockefeller  plaza ,etc.
We were upgrated to a a high floor corner room ( 6202) which gave an excellent view of NYC .
Residence Inn never disappoint us with their free breakfast which is very important in our choice of hotels.

title: Great views poor service
text:
We were uninspired by the drab lobby and cold welcome on arrival. The staff try to get you to agree to not having your room serviced on the basis that it is 'green' but clearly just a cost cutting exercise on their part. We were offered a free bottle of water in return for this and politely declined.
We were told that we were given an upgraded room and we certainly did have a stunning view from the 64th floor and could see both the Hudson and Times Square. We didn't shut the curtains the whole time as it was amazing to wake up in the night and see all the lights. The room itself was nothing special, quite small and not particularly well maintained. A bit dusty and scuffed walls. The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor and despite reporting this it was not fixed. The handle also came off in my husbands hand. This did get fixed. 
We called reception on two occasions to request a bucket of ice and ask if they had a plug adaptor. Both of these requests were met with nothing more than a "no" and the phone was hung up. We did expect more polite and friendly service. 
Breakfast was a very good selection. Loved the waffle machine. Could see how it would get very busy in peak season but in February there were plenty of tables and no queuing.

title: Great location, good value
text:
We went to NYC on a lark because we got a good price on Residence Inn Central Park on a travel website. I have no idea what the rates are normally but this rate was special. The room was great, very clean and modern. It had a small kitchenette and a great bathroom. We were on the 57th floor and looked at Central Park to the north and the Hudson River to to the east. My wife and I both loved it. An additional benefit was the breakfast which was well cared for by the staff and had a number of healthy options which we prefer.

All in all, an excellent experience.

title: Great location and accommodations
text: As I write this I'm having the complimentary breakfast in the lovely third floor eating area. Far superior to most breakfasts provided with a hotel stay and served in a much more pleasant environment. The room was lovely and equipped with everything we needed, from a coffee pot to wine glasses and the view was spectacular. We were fortunate to get a great rate by NYC standards and as Marriott rewards members, would not hesitate to stay here again. Wonderful weekend visiting our two children. Thanks Marriott and thanks Trip Advisor for helping us find a delicious nearby restaurant.

title: Espectacular
text: La ubicación es inmejorable, las habitaciones muy cómodas y limpias, bien equipadas con todo lo necesario para cocinar incluso. La cama y la ducha son excelentes, al igual que la calefacción (fundamental para nosotros que estuvimos en Diciembre/Enero con -7 C°). El desayuno es muy completo, fresco, variado y en un salón hermoso. La atención también es muy buena. El precio de la habitación es medio/alto pero teniendo en cuenta el valor del hospedaje en NY, la ubicación, desayuno incluído y comodidades hacen que sea una excelente opción.

title: Great views and value.
text: Booked on Tripadvisor for under $160/night, the hotel is on Broadway a few steps from the Ed Sullivan theater (Colbert).  Our 42nd story room had a partial view of Central Park.  The room was smallish, but reasonable by NYC standards.  The included breakfast was excellent.  We also loved the "Green" housekeeping option.  Very easy to get to/from JFK and LGA via the E train.

title: Fantastic lovation
text: We actually stayed here back in February 2015, shortly after it opened and before prices skyrocketed. It really is a fantastic location. We too had a corner room with an amazing view, especially of the sun setting over the rooftops and the manhattan river. And at nighttime you could see the snow falling in the glow of Times Square. This is out of our price range now so glad we got to stay when we could.

title: Amazing view of the city!
text:
Stayed here shortly after it opened and was lucky enough to get a rate at only $180/night. Now you can't touch this hotel for much less than $300/night. When we booked we knew it was a good rate in a good location, but we had no idea how nice the room was going to be. We felt truly spoiled with a corner room with floor to ceiling windows all around. We stayed in the top tower section of the building which made it feel like a boutique hotel - only about 10 rooms on the floor surrounding the elevator in the center. So ask for a high floor corner room when you book. 

Yes, it's a tiny room but that's to be expected in NYC. The room is modern, well organized, very comfortable and fine for two people. The location is perfect! It's easy to get to Broadway shows, Central Park, shopping and more. There's a great pizza-by-the-slice place next door and with the expansive views offered in our room, we actually enjoyed sitting in there eating our to-go lunch while looking out over the city. We could see all the way south to Times Square, and east and west to both rivers. 

This hotel made the top of our list of places to stay in the city. I almost didn't want to write this review for fear that it will always be booked at high rates now that the secret is out!

title: Great Location....Great Service
text: This Residence Inn is located a short walk from Times Square and Columbus Circle and just one block from the W 54 St Subway station. It was convenient to Central Park also. The room is smaller, typical for NYC, but does have a small refrigerator, freezer, microwave, toaster and crock pot. Bathroom is modern and my room had a great view of Times Square. While the breakfast is standard Marriott fare, the room is large with comfortable chairs, booths and high tables. Booths had a small TV. One of the nicest Residence Breakfast rooms. A good choice if you want to stay in midtown.

title: SENSACIONAL
text:
Este é o melhor hotel que já me hospedei em NY. Prestativa equipe, muito profissionais. Próximo a tudo e com várias linhas de metrô nas proximidades. O apartamento é ótimo, quentinho e espaçoso com cozinha (tem café , chá e pipoca de cortesia no quarto) , tem limpeza diária e excelente café da manhã. É considerado o hotel mais alto da América,
ficamos em dois apartamentos com 2 camas queen, no 57° e 60° andar, a vista é simplesmente extraordinária. Viamos do Central Park ao rio Hudson e também Times Square. Aqui fica meu elogio especial ao funcionário Marco, que nos recebia com um belo sorisso no café da manhã, muito gentil. No prédio tem um Starbuks no 3° andar com área de convivência com TV, filmes,etc. Ali também tem água o tempo todo para os hospedes. No 35° andar tem academia de ginastica ótima e lavanderia    self-service (funciona muito bem por $1,75 cada lavagem, o sabão em pó é fornecido pelo hotel na recepção). Tem supermercado Whoole Foods pertinho o que facilita para comprar pães, queijos, sucos... Além de ir a todos os teatros a pé, tem ótimos restaurantes como Serafina Restaurant Broadway. e lanchonetes como a Ellen's Star Dust Diner Times estarem colados ao hotel. Vale cada centavo. Voltaria mil vezes neste hotel!

title: Perfect NYC hotel.
text:
I have been a frequent traveler to NYC and have at last found a hotel I would return to tomorrow.  I arrived an hour before check in but was instantly greeted and given a room (I had requested a high floor and was on floor 60 - the hotel has 65 floors).  Upon walking into the room the first thing that will hit you is the view - I had a Times Square Grand View room which took in all of Times Square and the Hudson too - the view is so good you don't want to close the curtains at night. 
The room itself is perfect for one or two people, comfortable bed, big HD TV with premium sports channels too.  The bathroom had a shower / tub combo with instant hot water and perfect water pressure.  There is a small kitchenette with fridge, freezer, dish washer, microwave, toaster and coffee and tea facilities.  
The gym on the 35th floor is well stocked.  There was a buffet breakfast on the third floor which I didn't try but did smell good.  The E and 1 subway lines are both within a couple of blocks of the hotel. 
Overall the Residence Inn is a perfect NYC hotel, just far enough away from the hussle of Times Square but still very close to the action - I will be back!

title: I recommend it! One of the best options in Manhattan!
text:
Volví enamorada de este hotel!!! Sin dudas es MI hotel en NYC... volvería sin dudar!. Vistas impresionantes desde el piso 58, en una habitación super cuidada en todos los detalles, moderna, equipada con kitchinette con todo lo necesario para calentar o preparar algo (microondas, vajilla, heladera y... hasta lavavajillas). Las camas super confortables, muy buena la climatización y a pesar de que hay mucha presencia de vidrio, es muy buen la insonorización y la aislación térmica. Baño completo, muy cómodo y espacios generosos de guardado.
La ubicación es inmejorable, cerca de la accesos a red de subtes. Está en el núcleo de Manhattan y es muy fácil llegar desde ahí a los principales puntos de interés. El desayuno continental muy abundante y variado se sirve en el 3° piso, en un ambiente muy agradable con hermosas vistas también. Excelente atención de Marriott Customer Care Issue, especialmente del Sr Andrew S. Barry que siempre mostró disposición frente a dudas e inquietudes y contestó con celeridad mis mails. Es importante sentir que uno contrata una estadía con el respaldo de una cadena como el Marriott!

title: Awesome
text: Stayed for 5 days. Perfect 56th floor corner room of Times Square. Kitchenette was extremely useful. Comes with freezer and refrigerator, dish washer, pots and pans, silverware and glasses and cups. Free breakfast every morning and top notch fitness center. Definitely would stay again and highly recommend the hotel.

title: Good location, nice room
text: I had a decent recent stay.  Rooms are good sized for NYC and include small kitchenette.  Views are also fabulous.  Sleep quality was relatively quiet with no external noise and mostly quiet internal noise except running water / shower sound from room next door. Wi-fi is complimentary as part of room charge which is also nice.  I didn't try breakfast.  Would definitely stay again.

title: La mejor opción hotelera
text: Nos hospedamos 6 noches en este hotel y quedamos encantados con la vista de nuestra habitación: piso 52 hacia Central Park, increíble! El desayuno es muy abundante y variado y el salón en el que se sirve un verdadero placer, se hace difícil abandonarlo para arrancar el día. La habitación tiene todo lo que una estancia en NYC puede requerir y más. Una vista alucinante, un baño completo con una ducha muy moderna y productos Bath & Body Works. Heladera con freezer, microondas y hasta un lavavajillas, todo escondido estéticamente en cajoneras. Cafetera, tostadora y pava eléctrica. El sistema de ingreso a los pisos de las habitaciones es solo por tarjeta de huéspedes haciéndolo muy seguro contra personas ajenas al hotel. Sin dudas volvería..

title: Beautiful! What a view...
text: If you are looking for a city view,, here it is! We met friends here and it was the best time! If you are looking for a unique city experience then check it out ! :) The service is what was expected. We had a great time!

title: Decided to try Central Park South
text:
We are frequent travelers to NYC and have sworn off staying in the proximity of Times Square.  This hotel was a shining star and solid example of why you should never have forgone conclusions. 
Highlights:
 VIEWS-fantastic. Doesn't matter if you want city or Central Park (we had Central Park). The large oversized windows afford one of the best views of NYC. 
ROOM COMFORT-not the biggest rooms even for NYC but reasonable. Great beds, comfortable chair, and very nice bathroom layout.  
LOCATION-and I don't mean to Times Sq. Easy walking to great shopping, Central Park, and the Theatre. You can definitely go through Times Square for any event from this property. 
VALUE-it is very well priced for its amenities and quality. 

Negatives: 
ELEVATORS-slow to arrive, to be expected in a high rise. 
BREAKFAST-Ordinary standard free breakfast as in most hotels, but hey, who comes to NYC to eat a free breakfast in the hotel.....get out and try the local restaraunts. Highly recommend The Smith..upper west side was fantastic. 

This hotel is one of the tallest you will stay in in Nortj America. It is fun, enjoyable, and reasonable in the Big Apple. 

Enjoy

title: Great Hotel - impressive views
text: Absolutely phantastic stay - I was put up in 6505 and the view was just terrific. Staff was nice, pleasant and knowledgeable throughout the hotel and the breakfast was a nice add on. I will definitely be back and can fully recommend this hotel to all travellers.

title: Incroyable !
text:
Que dire .... nous avions stressé un peu avant d arriver sur place. En effet nous avions demander une chambre très haute .Mais après de nombreux mails la direction nous ne garantissait pas le résultat . 
Lorsque nous sommes arrivés à l accueil nous nous sommes vu attribué la 6405 !!!  (65 étages au total) la vue est incroyable!
Pour ce qui est du ménage, literie, clim , etc... il n y avait aucun problème 
Nous recommandons fortement cet hotel qui est effectivement onéreux mais tellement exceptionnel

title: Nice Decor
text:
I had actually booked a room at the Courtyard Marriott, which is connected to this hotel, and found out at check-in that they had run out of rooms with two beds at the Courtyard and upgraded me to the Residence Inn. It was a nice treat-- beautiful décor, a truly full kitchenette (with a dishwasher! and pots and pans, microwave, sink, cutlery, etc.). They also include a couple of bags of microwaveable popcorn-- nice touch. 

Bed was comfortable and TV screen was large. I was pleasantly surprised to find the room was quiet. Quiet, in NYC? Pretty amazing. I believe we were room 4406. 

Breakfast was okay (pretty typical), but they ran out of fruit well before closing time, and they made sure those doors to the food room were closed RIGHT at closing so you couldn't go back in to grab something you forgot (all I wanted was another syrup packet). But hey, it was breakfast, and it was filling enough, and it was a very nice stay.

title: Watching the ball drop from the 60th floor
text: We booked two rooms and asked for them to be close together, but were given a room on the 44th and a room on the 60th floor. Although inconvenient, the views from both were spectacular. The rooms are fully equipped and very nicely furnished, more can be done to brighten up the lobby area and breakfast room. Breakfast was your typical American style breakfast, but super busy and we preferred to take our meal to our room, as we only found seating once in the 8 days we were at the hotel.The lifts are super noisy, you can hear them in your sleep, but very fast. The winner from this stay was being able to watch the ball drop in Times Square from our room on the 60th floor.

title: Great location, Central Park view is obstructed by a new building
text:
The hotel has a great location, walking distance from Time Square.
There is nothing special about this hotel other than its location but we spent most of the time outside so we did not care much about it.

We booked 2 rooms and paid Central Park View rate for both of them.
Our first room (# 4609) was a corner room. It had a much obstructed view of the Central Park.
Our second room (# 6202) was also a corner room. It had a better view of the Central Park.
Beware, the Marriott web site shows an outdated photo with a great unobstructed view of the Central Park.
A new building, tallest than the hotel, is being built between the Central Park and the hotel, causing the view to be partial.
That is pretty disappointing if you pay the premium for the view.

Rooms are nicely decorated and modern. Service staff is very attentive.
Breakfast area is very nice but nobody would clean after the guests. That causes the breakfast lounge to get messy. I recommend getting there early.

title: Not special enough for New York
text: This is a perfectly fine, but generic hotel.  The location is good for Times Square, Broadway, and of course, Central Park.  We were able to walk to pretty much every place we wanted to see.  Our room (corner room) was small, but a decent size by NY standards.  Even though this is a Residence Inn, I was still surprised by the well stocked kitchenette (no stove, but a portable one can be brought in).  We didn't need a kitchen, though.  The breakfast had a lot of good choices, but the breakfast room was a mess.  Not enough seating for all the guests, and no one was there to clean up after someone left. It was actually kind of gross.  If you are in NY on business, or if the hotel itself is not a critical factor to your trip, this hotel is fine.  However, if you are looking for a memorable hotel to make your visit special, this is not it.  One last comment, service from the front desk was excellent.

title: Excellent Staff , Service and View
text: We arrived, and after reading on trip advisor about the great view from the corner room on the 55th floor we tried to get that room which was unavailable at the time. Our front desk clerk, Violetta, could not have been more patient with us as we pondered and pondered all the options she gave to us and then asked her to go through them again. Anyways, we picked the best room for us thanks to her.  It was a great modern clean room with an excellent view and comfortable bed and bedding.We awoke to a fresh hot and cold breakfast buffet complete with make your own waffles which it was included!  Definitely Residence Inn New York/Central Park has won us over. Thank you Violetta and your team members.

title: 2a no Residence Inn Central Park!
text: Estive hospedada pela 2a vez neste hotel. Desta vez no  63 andar, com vista para a Times Square. O hotel é novo, muito confortável e a vista é deslumbrante! O café da manhã é tipicamente americano com muitas opções. Porém, o hotel estava muito cheio, consequentemente o café também sempre muito cheio, sendo recomendável chegar cedo, mas nada que prejudique a estadia.  A localização é excelente!

title: Awesome View, Very Busy Location
text:
Overall, the location and the view were outstanding.  Due to the amount of people coming thru, there is little tiny mistakes around the hotel, still it's quite awesome experience.

The breakfast area can be a war zone, especially if you visit after 8:45am and if you happen to be in NYC during Christmas and New Year period.

title: 6 noites em NYC
text: Minha resrva contemplava 2 camas King, mas só havia uma no quarto. Na recepção foi me dito que não havia disponibilidade. No restante, muito bom. Acessórios como microondas, geladeira, com talheres, pratos e copos. Bom box. Senti falta da banhaeira. Posição do Hotel, muito boa.

title: Monotonous breakfast, noise from lifts (room 5207), dust - great views and location.
text:
10 nights at the Residence Inn Manhattan/ Central Park, over Christmas and New Year; 25/12/16 to 04/01/17. Our 2nd visit to this hotel, in just over 12 months. 

The Good:
1) The views from room 5207 were outstanding; a king bed, city view room. We could see the Hudson on one side and the top of the ball-drop to the other; just stunning.
 
2) Fantastic location between Central Park and Times Square. Slightly closer to the park than the square. Tasty 99c pizza (shop) just around the corner (broadway), subway just down the road and at the other end (turn right) there's a Macdonalds/ Wendy's. Across that road is the Westerly Natural Market which sells amazing (natural) fresh salads (starting at $3.49) sandwiches and soup(s) - a vitamin lovers paradise too!! 

3)The staff were polite and helpful. 

The Bad:
1) Over a 10 day period the breakfast options barely changed; variations between sausage/ turkey patties (looked vile), spicy sausages (husband loved these), scrambled egg (tasteless) and/ or bread/ gravy (didn't try this). On one occasion, over cooked bacon was served. On the hot side, they serve porridge too (didn't try this). Two kinds of  fresh fruit (chopped) are served daily, there was usually apples/ bananas in limited supply and on a couple of days, we had lovely tasty strawberries. The yougurt selection (not bad) also varies daily, bread/ bagels, fresh cheese (one choice daily) and theres the usual condiments (jam, nutella, syrup, philidelphia etc). The best (and only thing) that was really good about breakfast was the waffle machine - lovely fresh waffles in abundance IF you beat the crowds to one of the two machines. Beware of the dust up the walls to the ceiling, as you stand in front of the waffle machine though (its clearly visible). Theres also cake (tasteless stodgy junk) served daily, along with 3 choices of juice (concentrated/ sweet junk), coffee (quite good) and milk available - along with 3/4 choices of cereal (no granola though). 

If you are an early riser you'll beat the crowds (<8am) but after that be prepared to queue/ wait for trays, plates/ cutlery (check these are clean, as I encountered some that weren't), waffles, toasted 'anything' and for the hot food to be replenished. During the week you'll quite easily find a seat but of a weekend, you may well have to wait to sit and eat your breakfast comfortably; you are probably better off taking it back to your room in this instance. The breakfast area where the food is, gets very, very busy, very quickly - to the extent you are knocking into others. So my advice is get there early if you want to eat without any hassle at all. Newspapers are available to read and there are TVs dotted around the room. The longest I waited for a lift to/ from breakfast was approx' 5 minutes. That's breakfast in a nutshell!! 

After 3/4 days breakfast becomes very tiresome, due to a lack of variation. Why is there only scrambled eggs everyday? Cooking up fried/ poached eggs would make a nice change!! Don't overcook the bacon, throw on some beans, cooked tomatoes and some mushrooms in the mix please!!? My husband can eat for England but even he was fed up after a few days, to the extent he stopped going down for breakfast. He also couldn't tolerate the rude people who'd literally stand and watch you eat (3/4 feet away) - ready and waiting to pounce when you moved from the table. 

Fact is - we/ you pay for the breakfast as it's included in the price - it's not free. Take or leave it folks, it fills a void but that's about it. Certainly nothing to get excited about. 

The Ugly:
1) From the point of arrival onwards, there was constant layer of dust around the whole room which seems to get worse when the air-cons switched on. I could write my name in this on the bedside table. This never seemed to go away and I also noticed the floor could have done with a really good/ proper hoover (dyson kind x 2!!). On our arrival, we also found the remnants of cardboard shoe shapers (cardboard things that go in shoes to help them retain their shape) under the chair in our room. The cleaners surface clean - but the room clearly needed a proper, deep clean. It felt dusty/ dirty and when we switched the air-con on, every single time we both start coughing (uncontrollably) - I presumed this was all dust related too. 

2) Following my first nights sleep - I awoke to a huge, swollen 'nasty' bite on the back of my neck. I didn't see any bugs (and didn't check for any, as that would have freaked me out) - but given that it normally takes 12 hours for a bite to show/ come up - the timing indicated that it happened in the room. Obviously - I'm unable to prove this was the case. 

3) The bed sheets were not changed for at least 5 nights - how and why I do not know. When they were changed the top (noisy, crinkly) sheet/ cover had part of a sweet stuck to it !! Not the standard we expect in any hotel. The pillowcases were changed after a couple of days. Otherwise, the bed was very comfy. 

4) On some days the clean towels were stark white, lovely and fluffy - but on others they were thin/ tired and stained. 

5) We stayed in room 5207 which was near the lifts. As soon as those lifts moved we could hear them from our room. Not to the extent they would keep us awake at night but they certainly woke me up a couple of mornings (very early); I'm not a light sleeper either. I'd ask for a room that's located as far away from the lifts, as possible. 

Other:
1) A very comfy SUV to JFK or Newark from the hotel door, will cost you $75 (inc tip) and $95 (inc tip) respectively. Last year the journey to JFK took us nearly two hours and this year, the journey to Newark took us approx 25 minutes. The luggage guys in the hotel lobby will organise this for you; just ask. A cab to Penn Station/ MSG will set you back around $11 (without tip).

2) The shopping is amazing (not cheap due to the exchange rate) - but beware all UK shoppers, you'll pay New York tax on anything over $109. I purchased some running pants which cost $115 and the New York tax on top of this was $10; so the pants actually cost me $125. 

Woodbury Common (outlet) - is a nice/ worthwhile shopping day out; clothes, shoes, bags etc. It's not unlike the outlet villages in the UK - it's about an hour from the city and costs $40 return per person. Check out 'Woodbury Common' online for the booking and pick-up/ drop-off details; 3 morning/ evening, pick-up/ drop-off times but the locations vary for pick-ups and there's only one drop-off point (not far from Times Sq area). 
Note - on both occasions when I've been, I did not book online - I went to the pick-up point at the Sheraton Hotel (8am) and spoke to the driver who said I could pay on the bus. That said, the website states you aren't guaranteed a seat on the busy if it's full but it wasn't on either occasion, when I went in January.  

3) I've flown with AA (JFK) and UA (Newark) direct from/ to the UK. The latter was after Virgin changed my return direct flight to indirect, so I cancelled with them and I eventually rebooked with UA. Both flights were absolutely fine; I rated our UA flight better (overall) as we had in seat entertainment (free with free headphones) and the staff were up/ down the cabin, constantly serving drinks etc....whereas with AA there was no in seat entertainment and the regularity of service was less frequent. 

So - that covers the things I think are worth mentioning and the rest is up to you decide. 

Would I stay in this hotel again? - maybe/ possibly - but that would solely depend upon the price. That said there are plenty of hotels to choose from; they all have their pros and cons!! Like I've said, the pros with this hotel are the location and views!!!

One constant is the fact that NYC is a totally, amazing city to visit - for anyone of any age. So don't hesitate in booking!!

title: Il top!
text: Il soggiorno non poteva andare meglio: mi hanno fatto il check-in già alle 9 di mattina e mi hanno fatto pure un upgrade gratuito alla camera corner con vista central park strepitosa. Non potevo volere di più! Stare in camera era già un'attrazione! I soldi spesi in più per aver scelto questa struttura rispetto ad altre li ho poi risparmiati cucinando in camera, così ho sempre mangiato con una vista di una bellezza incredibile. Bagno abbastanza grande con ottima vasca/doccia.

title: Noise in room 4706 is horrible
text:
In NYC staying 3 nights for work.  Wound up at Residence Inn.  Pretty bad experience.  

There were 2 primary problems we had with this stay.  First is the size of the room.  It's  so damn small.  I get it that NYC has small hotel rooms, but for two people it's just too small, and the layout of the room is terrible where the area for the entry and little kitchenette is really wasted space.  There was nowhere really good for us to put our suitcase so it was left just kind of sitting on the floor in that area.  And there was nowhere comfortable to sit.  There was one chair that one person could sit in, so then the other person was left sitting on the bed which isn't comfortable as a place to sit upright.  

But the real significant problem was noise.  The heater is horrible and blows like a jet engine when it's on.  Why hotels end up having small rooms with loud jet engines is beyond me.  But that's what this one was.  Then there was the elevator.  We still don't understand how that made so much noise in our room.  Our best theory is that it was the rattling of the counterweights of the elevator (which you can hear just standing there waiting for an elevator) and that the noise came in the room through the vents.  Regardless, the noise from the elevators was seriously like a truck driving through the room.  You'd hear it at a distance, then it would get louder and louder, rattling, and then pass.  The third noise was the refrigerator in the room which rattled and was horrible.  Thankfully we were able to pull the refrigerator out from under the counter and unplug it so at least we could eliminate 1 out of the 3 noises.  

This all added up to a terrible stay.  Not a single restful night's sleep out of the 3 nights we stayed there.  

Beyond that, the room was mostly clean, although the packet of sugar sitting under the bed stayed there through our entire stay so the cleaning folk's attention to detail was not the highest.  The hotel itself is a bit run down overall.  In hindsight we should have stayed at the Hilton next door.  

Definitely will never stay at this particular property again.

title: Una de las mejores opciones
text:
La habitaciones son tan lindas y las vistas tan espectaculares como lo muestran la fotos. El hotel se ubica entre el piso 35 y el 65 con lo cual no hay forma de que la vista no sea buena.

El hotel es nuevo y moderno con una decoración sencilla pero muy agradable y de buena calidad. 

Todo funciona. La cama es cómoda. La Cocina súper equipada y de excelente calidad de vajilla te permite disfrutar de las grandes opciones de comida para llevar que hay en la ciudad.

El desayuno es bueno aunque muchas veces está superado por la cantidad de gente. 

La ubicación no puede ser mejor. Nos permitió disfrutar la ciudad contando con un lugar agradable y cómodo para reponer energías. 

Vale la pena.

title: fantastico
text: excelente ubicacion, excelente vista a la ciudad, muy comoda la habitacion, bien equipada, impecable la limpieza y muy buen servicio. nos toco piso 65 con vista a Broadway. la habitacion muy comoda, con buenos servicios.

title: Fantastic Location, Great Staff and We Saw Hamilton!
text:
1.  Outstanding Location - easy, easy walk to Time Square, Half Price Tickets, and
      all the Main Shows!  Very Safe.  We eased over to Hamilton at Richard Rogers 
     Theater and were in the cancellation line at 6 AM in the snow (and felt completely
     safe walking over-10 min walk but we are in late 60's so we walk a little slower 
     these days).  We were first in line and got magnificent seats at 6:20 PM and 
     Hamilton was absolutely worth the wait!!!!!  Paid the full price for regular 
     orchestra seats.  If you want to see a GREAT SHOW - see Hamilton!  We tried 8 
     times last year and didn't make it - so we MADE it this year!
2.  Hotel had good restaurants (including walk up and carry away "No Soup for YOU!"
     shown on Seinfeld which had great soups.  Also grocery stores near by
     which are small compared to most in Southern states but they were excellent.
3.  We had a corner room with superb view of Central Park which was easy walking 
     distance.
4.  Staff was really  nice and very friendly.  
5.  Breakfast was included in our price -- very good but they lack good seating and you
     eat slumped over a coffee table or at the bar with single seats looking out 
    over the street.  You come in and if you walk directly left past the coffee, and
    place you put your dirty dishes - turn left and there are 3 booths (highly coveted)
    with their own tvs.  
6.  My wife is Gluten Free and if you ask - they have gluten free bread.  Breakfast
    was juices, fresh scrambled eggs, tortillas (warm), a meat (usually sausage but 
    once there was bacon), hot self make waffles, rolls/danishes, boiled eggs, 
   yogurt, diet yogurt, some kind of veggie dish that was hot, etc.  
7.  Their "Happy Hour" was really nice - good prices and hot appetizers4902.  These 
    appetizers are priced individually but were a good size for 2.  
8.  Rooms had kitchen, microwave, dishes, dishwasher (did not have stove 
    burners but you could order a portable one for no charge.)  The fridge is set up
  in roll out drawers and was very spiffy.  You can get ice on 35th floor for no
  cost.
9.  We had room 4902 and it was a corner room with great views.
10. We also saw "On Your Feet" which was good and wanted to see "Dear
     Evan Hanson" but ran out of time!

We plan to use this hotel again next year because of location, safety, quality of room
and friendliness of staff.

title: Just ok
text: The administrations we're welcoming on arrival, we waited for our rooms to be prepared.  They don't really walk you through the hotel with info, inlets you ask. Our rooms were quite nite and comfortable but they disturb to service even if you put the "do not disturb sign". In the morning you might not even find food for breakfast as the diner is very small to accommodate the whole hotel guest.  Same food served each morning.  So if you are staying for long rather not include breakfast in your stay.  The hotel is far than the exciting center, but close to business centrex.bear in mind a 3star

title: Excellent
text: Can't beat this location! Stayed on the top floor 65 in a corner room, small but typical of NYC, had everything you would need and most importantly an amazing view (worth the extra money). Very attentive staff who made us feel very welcome. Good buffet breakfast. Would return again.

title: Superbe
text: Hôtel géniale avec vue magnifique sur Time square au 53 ème étages. Le petit déjeuner n'était pas encore au point mais n'empêche que le personnel fut très sympathiques. L'hôtel est très bien situé sur brodway, les chambres assez spacieuse avec pour certaines une kitchenette.

title: Awful Stay
text: This was the worst NYC hotel stay I or my mom have ever had. We couldn't sleep! This hotel has no business booking rooms directly behind their elevator or they should at half price and warn people.  The noise from the elevator was so loud it sounded like we were sleeping above a subway station. It went on a couple times every 5 minutes, we both didn't get to sleep till about 2 am as that's when the noise finally started to slow down and we were up by 5 am. At times the elevator had such force we could feel the vibration in our room. Actually we should have just slept at a subway station for free! I have been in rooms near elevator at other hotels and it was nothing like this. Luckily our stay was just one night or we would have checked out and went somewhere else, that's how bad it was. I will never stay here again and I recommend whoever reads this doesn't either and if you do don't stay near the elevator. I felt like I was staying at nothing more than a cheap budget motel hiding behind a good name.

title: Отличный отель!
text:
Отель понравился всем:
1. Расположение - в шаговой доступности все основные достопримечательности - Центральный Парк, Тайм Сквер, Бродвей и другие.
2. Вид - на какой бы этаж вас не заселили, вид будет супер. 
3. Завтрак - многие пишут, что завтраки в США гораздо хуже европейских и это так, но могу однозначно сказать, что в этом отели он на достойном уровне. Фрукты, овощи, пан кейки и многое другое было.

На счёт депозита могу сказать, что я платил 100$ наличными и мне его вернули при выселение. 

Единственный минус - ковролине в номере был плохо убран.

title: Rooms near the stars
text:
This hotel is the tallest in the US at the least.  The views are spectacular.  Some of the rooms are small but there is a clever use of space.  Check-in is easy; the bottom 35 floors are a Courtyard and the upper rooms are a Residence Inn.  Breakfast is served on floor 4.  Standard fare width over cooked dry scrambled eggs but otherwise normal selection.
The view is what makes it special.

title: Desayuno de los dioses
text:
Espectacular, cercano, limpio, ordenado, funcional, muy buen servicio.
Muy moderno, todo nuevo...el personal muy amable y el hotel es muy tranquilo.
Iría nuevamente de todas maneras.
El desayuno muy completo y variado, ideal para poder caminar muuucho.
Cercano a polos de interés familiares, como es el Central Park y en mi caso, el Museo de Historia Natural.

title: Great Place
text:
Great place to enjoy New York 
We highly recommend to select room with wide view time square. It is amazing!  You are between 61th and 65 th floor above manhattan! So great!
Do not hesitate. The place to be to enjoy your stay in Manhattan !

title: Chambre petite mais literie très confortable
text:
La Chambre est petite mais la literie très confortable. Elle bénéficie d'une petite cuisine, ce qui peut s'avérer très pratique quand on connait les tarifs des restaurants (même les plus mauvais et il y en a beaucoup). Le ménage gagnerait à être un peu plus méticuleux mais globalement c'est satisfaisant.
Le vrai plus se situe dans la position qui est sur broadway à 10 minutes à pieds maximum de times square. Par ailleurs nous avons eu la chance d'avoir une chambre au 63ème étage avec vue sur times square.
Le petit déjeuner est très correct. Il est même possible de se faire des gaufres (grande mode aux US).
Le personnel est très serviable, même si il ne comprend pas toujours vos demandes et que le hall d'accueil est plutôt très impersonnel.
Personnellement je recommande.

title: Such a Great Choice
text: We were really impressed with our accommodations here. Perfect location for getting to and from places around Manhattan. The complimentary breakfast is high quality. And the 3rd and 4th floor lounges were great places that hang out and relax after a day of walking. Would absolutely come back here.

title: Muy bueno
text: Es buen hotel, de conveniente relación precio/calidad teniendo en cuenta su excelente ubicación. La vista desde las piezas es espectacular. El único inconveniente es el desayuno, el lugar no da abasto para los comensales, se requiere paciencia. Es muy seguro, la atención en recepción es normal

title: Great hotel in a perfect central location
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our 4 day family stay.  We were upgraded to a wonderful room on the 63rd floor that had a great view of the city.  Staff was so friendly and helpful in every way.  The room we spectacular,  clean,  and modern.  Including pics of view from our room.

title: Horrendous experience
text:
We had previously stayed at the Residence Inn by Marriott back in January 2015 for 3 weeks. Our experience in 2015 was outstanding and we had fond memories associated with staying there, so when planning our next trip to New York City for December 2016 we didn't have to think twice on where to stay. Our fond memories and feelings of this accomodation fell well short of everything we imagined it could be. It is safe to say that all our troubles began the moment we checked in with hostile and unfriendly staff at the desk, not even bothering to glance up at us to warmly welcome us. Our room was not ready for a 'couple of hours', it was a little after 1pm at this point in time. By the time we arrived later at 5pm our room was finally ready!  My partner and I had requested a specific room type that was booked online according to images and description, obviously costing a lot more than the standard room. We did not receive a room that matched the description or photos that they included on their website. When this was communicated to an employee I said that this is considered false and deceptive advertising and he agreed! We communicated this to other staff at the desk but the issues we were experiencing went unresolved. We spoke with the reservation team on the phone at least twice and also approached reception twice. We were given the repeated line that the hotel's itinerary was undergoing an update because we had checked availability of the room we sought (and not received) and found several vacancies. This ultimately left us upset and confused that the room we had paid for was still available but we had not been given it. After also having contact with the 'manager' who was unhelpful and did not seem to understand our issues we finally went downstairs again for a third visit to a staff member in person. It took this many times to finally get our issue resolved, this staff member was the only employee to treat us with the upmost respect and kindness to ensure we were comfortable, happy and satisfied with our stay. As a result of all the trouble we went through, we checked out the very next day, even though we had a two week long stay that was prepaid. We have never been disrespected, treated this poorly or spoken down to before. It took far too many times finally have our feelings and thoughts understood correctly. We repeat that this was at the exception of only one employee there, because it is clear that everyone else we dealt with need a refresher on their customer service skills, and basic manners. To anyone reading this, yes it has great location near Times Square but you're wasting your time to book here. If you have any issues, I wish you luck in having them resolved, as they will fall upon deaf ears. In our experience, this hotel will not cater to even the simplest requests. It is safe to say we will not be staying here ever again. 

NB. A rating needs to be included but if I could, I would put 0/5.

title: Bom
text: O quarto eh muito bom, a vista é excelente , o banheiro é otimo! Qdo chegamos a cozinha do quarto tinha lixo ! A limpeza diaria era fraca, faziam a cama e tiravam o lixo do banheiro apenas. O Lobby era muito confuso !

title: Most stylish, best location for a Residence Inn, but minor issues
text: Ideal NY location -- within walking distance of many areas (Lincoln Center, Central Park, theaters,  museums) but far enough out of the Times Square chaos to be able to get places without having to navigate difficult crowds.  Normally RI's are in the outskirts of central city locations; this one was perfect for us.  Further, this is the most stylish of any of the perhaps dozen RI's I've stayed in over the decades. The view from our corner room was also the best we've had in NYC.  The downside was the breakfast service.  The food was among the poorest in part because things ran out and were slow to be replenished, the toaster required several trips through to properly toast anything, the juice dispenser more often than not dispensed the wrong beverage and was dilute.  The dining room staff was hostile (note that all other staff were very pleasant and gracious consistent with Marriott standards).  Perhaps some of this is due to the arrangement of the breakfast room which simply can't cope with the throngs of people.  I would think that it would be a simple thing to rearrange how the food was provided and the comfortable but very inefficient seating area.  In spite of this, we will definitely stay again the next time we are in NY.

title: Laut, dreckig und überteuert
text: Waren für eine Woche in diesem Hotel. Von Aussen wirkt das Hotel nobel aber innendrin sieht es anders aus. Die Zimmer sind klein und extrem laut. Man hat das Gefühl der Lift fahre durch den Raum. Die Zimmer sind ungenügend geputzt. Überall Dreck wo man hinschaut. Es gibt keinen Service in diesem Hotel und nur unnötige Dinge, die kein Mensch braucht wie eine Abwaschmaschine oder Mikrowelle. Dafür wurde sonst an allen Ecken gespart. Das Hotel ist insgesamt masslos überteuert. Dies war mein erster und letzter Aufenthalt in diesem Bunker.

title: Situation ideale dans Manhattan
text:
Studio au 40e étage. Avec bien sûr une vue exceptionnelle ,sur la rivière et la ville (même si j'aurais préféré sur central park mais la rivière au loin et tout ce ciel,les reflets sur les immeubles, c'était superbe aussi!)
Grand lit et  très bon matelas (mais pourquoi des draps ridiculement  petits et peu pratique?),salle de bains et coin cuisine très pratiques. Petit dejeuner au 3 eme bien sympatique . petit plus:  des  bonbons dans la chambre

title: Great location. Great sized rooms.
text:
Location perfect for getting around NYC.
Easy check in - were able to check in around 1pm. However, toilet in the room was not clean at all. When we asked front desk to have it cleaned and we were told it would be sorted. 3 hours later we came back and the toilet was still dirty. We then had to ask a second and third time before housekeeping came. 
Breakfast perfectly fine. 
View ok- can't see it from laying in bed like some marketing shots show. 
Would recommend and stay again.

title: 景色が良い
text: 58階に泊まりました。タイムズスクエアやハドソン川が見えました。アメリカンブレイクファストが付いています。簡易キッチンが付いているので、デリで買ったものを温めなおして頂けます。

title: Nice Position in the Heart of NY.
text: It is a in a great position. Our room was small but was clean and adequate. We have a nice view of the park, however they are building two buildings, one of which partially obscures that view. I did not see that mentioned  when booking the hotel. The second building will only make it worse. The other thing to mention is the breakfast. The food is ok however it is very busy and unregulated. We decided not to go a couple of mornings as it seemed less busier on crowded Times Square streets. They have to improve that as it is a big let down and shows that they are not bothered to make this a better experience.

title: Great stay - recommend!
text:
Wonderful location – less than a 10-minute walk to pretty much anything in midtown with the subway nearby.
The rooms were clean, and decent-sized – especially for NYC. Staff was kind and helpful if asked. 
Residence Inn and Courtyard are in the same building – Residence Inn’s room are at the top of the building, which gives you an incredible view. In our case, you could see Central Park in one direction and Times Square in the other. 
The breakfast is one of the best I’ve experienced at a Residence Inn, just make certain you are there before it ends because the staff stops bringing out fresh food about 15 minutes prior to closing and they shut the doors the moment the time is over. There is a large amount of food to choose from, so you and your party will certainly find something you can eat.
Will likely stay here next time I’m in the city!

title: Beautiful room, beautiful view, beautiful hotel!
text:
REQUESTING A CORNER ROOM IS A MUST!! I'm sure the view is beautiful corner room or not, but my god. Having two full walls of windows from the floor to ceiling is breathtaking. I had a studio king room on the Times Square side. The room was very clean and the perfect size for my boyfriend and I. The bathroom is a good size along with the shower. We were on the 54th floor, room 5405. I believe the hotel goes up to 64 floors, but even on the 54th floor, you have a great view of everything-- no buildings are blocking your view. We didn't even close the blinds to sleep. You also have a perfect view of the sunrise. It shines directly into the room and its the most stunning thing I've ever seen. 

The breakfast was delicious. We read other reviews saying they run out of food fast, so we got down there around 7:30am and they had plenty of everything. 

It's only about a 8 minute walk to Times Square, not even. This was one of the best city trips I've ever had, and this hotel played a main part in that. I HIGHLY recommend :)

title: In the heart of NY city!
text: It is hard to beat the location of this hotel... The service and everything else was pretty much what you'd expect for a hotel at a location like that... About a minute from the hotel you could find a Subway (for those on a budget) and a Starbucks as well...

title: Great Stay!
text:
We were here for 5 days over Christmas. The location is great. My room (5105) was a corner room that had a fantastic view of Times Square and the city. 

Best of all were the people. Jeffery at the Front Desk was very helpful. Orlando the bellman was also very helpful. And a special shout-out to the world's greatest Marriott employee and our new BFF ERIC. Here's very friendly and took care of us personally on several occasions. We will definitely be staying here again.

title: Great view, great location, great value
text:
We had a corner room on the 41st floor so two walls were floor to ceiling windows, providing a wonderful view overlooking Broadway and the city to the southeast (and a bit of Central Park), and also back toward the Hudson on the southwest.  Although not a large room, it was certainly comfortable.  The bathroom was nicely situated (I had changed my reservation from the Renaissance Manhattan Midtown when I read they had a glass-walled bathroom and door) and had surfaces and drawers so you could unpack your toiletries.  The shower was good too, with an option of handheld shower head and actual temperature controls.  Would be nice to have a towel rod or hook inside the shower, though, as there is not one on either side of the shower door and, as it is completely enclosed door to ceiling, no option to hang it across the top. 

Although we didn't need it on this trip, the kitchenette had everything you need including pans/dishes/silverware as well as teapot/coffeepot/microwave/fridge/dishwasher, with an option to request a stovetop if needed, and you can also request groceries delivered and expensed to your room. 

Although we were high above the street level noise so the room was quiet, if you are a light sleeper I would recommend a sound machine to camouflage the sound of the elevator all night.  (Took me a while to figure out what the constant "rolling barrel" sound was.)  The curtains were wonderfully heavy to block out light.

Upon arrival at the 3rd floor breakfast room at 9:15 am Christmas morning, nearly all seating was occupied. There was a good selection of breakfast items, hot and cold.  It's a large area with nice decor and varied seating options:  table/chairs, armchairs/sofas, computer stations, center long table with chairs, bar/chairs overlooking windows.

We looked in on the 4th floor bistro but didn't have an opportunity to use it.  This hotel shares the building and the above common areas with the Marriott Courtyard.  

We had walked to Rockefeller Center the previous evening to see the tree and decorations - was about 0.6 mile. 

Yes, would definitely stay here again!

title: Amazing views
text: Pictures speak for themselves. This hotel must have some of the best views in the city! The location couldn't be better, a very short walk (10 min or less) in either direction and your in Central Park or Time square! Breakfast is amazing and the customer service is outstanding. I've stayed at many hotels in NY, this one is by far the best! We will definitely be back!

title: Sejour New York 2016 - 17 au 24 dec 2016
text:
Tout était PARFAIT ou presque 

L'emplacement est IDÉAL 

L'accueil et la prise en charge à l'hôtel sont efficaces. Les employés étaient très sympathiques et tjs souriants. Toutes questions liées à un itinéraire, restaurant, visites... étaient accompagnées de réponses précises et argumentées (du moins cher au plus cher).

Quant aux chambres (nous en avions 2), spacieuses et propres . Suggestions : compte tenu de la durée de notre sejour (1 semaine) il aurait été plaisant que de temps en temps l'aspirateur soit passé + un petit coup de chiffon sur le lustre (pour retirer la poussière stagnante depuis x temps) + un petit nettoyage du siphon de l'évier de la salle de douche.

Seul point négatif :
Le petit déjeuner, qui reste une option facutative,  est très bof car tres ordinaire et très fadasse . Le prix de 11€ est excessif au regard de la qualité proposée. Autant aller au Starbucks !!

Malgré tout, la situation géographique de l'hôtel, le rapport qualité /prix reste extrêmement correcte.

À recommander +++

title: Great experience, definitely stay again!
text:
I booked two rooms for myself and my family for a Christmas holiday and would recommend to all looking for a great experience in NYC.

This hotel has so many pros:

The room very clean, and cleaned early in the morning also. My room was actually quite big for a New York hotel and we had a nice view over the city and could see Times Square. If you can book a corner room do so as the view is so good especially over Central Park! 

All staff are very friendly and polite and happy to help at all times. Check staff were friendly and arranged for an SUV transfer to the airport and helped with any directions needed.

The breakfast area has a relaxed feels to it and the seats are comfortable. Breakfast is standard but very filling and there is something there for everyone. Helps having the free breakfast with a full day ahead.

The free wifi has a really good connection all over the hotel including the rooms. 

The location is perfect! I did not realise how close the hotel was to all attractions until actually being there. It is only about 10 blocks from Times Square about 5 to Central Park so 5/10 minutes walk each way. Ellen's starlight diner is a two minute walk and is on 7th avenue. 

The only cons I could say about the hotel is that it is slightly dark in the corridors and the hotels can be a bit slow around breakfast time because everyone is going for breakfast around the same time. 

Would 100% stay here again as enjoyed the experience so much and was made to feel very welcome. Thank you to all the staff that made the experience!!

title: Great option in midtown/no Times Sq
text:
Had been meaning to try this hotel for a while & was not disappointed; took 2 rooms, both of which were upgraded to 55th floor (of 65 I believe) & of all the rooms I have stayed in in NYC over the years, I have NEVER had a view like this one. Talk about feeling at the beating heart of the city! Room also looked out over CP. Jane on reception did an excellent job & was genuinely welcoming on arrival. 

Rooms clean, modern & adequate which is the same for the hotel in general. There is a great bar (Three Monkeys) directly across the street & plenty of other options in the immediate vicinity. 

Left the hotel to move on to the JW on the park...I can honestly say I wish I'd stayed on...

title: Great view and Location
text:
65th floor, Corner room facing Times Square

Pros: View,View,View. Tallest hotel un NYC. 

Clean rooms. Customer service is good. 
Proximity to shows, Radio City, Times Square....15min walk.

4th Floor Bar/Lounge-Ladies at the bar are very nice and helpful. Drinks are good. Not a real bar scene, just a quiet place to relax. Lots of comfortable seating, coaches,etc and many TVs that you can change the channel on.

3rd Floor Breakfast - Food is good, not great. Very crowded but it'll do.

Cons: A little late to check us in, but got us a great room with a view, so worth the wait.

Hallways are very dark and dingey. Why not add some lights? White paint?

Can't beat this place for the view, location and price.

We will certainly stay here again.

title: Great views and location; has everything you need
text:
Great location in midtown; walking distance from Broadway, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue and more. Hotel rooms on high floors with great views over Central Park or Times Square although lifts can be slow to arrive at busy times. The views are definitely the draw card.

Well appointed breakfast buffet included, decently equiped gym and guest laundry for a small fee was useful.
