Rooms have kitchenette facilities which are great if you want to prepare your own meals (we didn't though). Staff were helpful, if not overly friendly.

title: Great Location with a world class breakfast
text: Located off Broadway (nest to Ed Sullivan theater), great location to times square and central park. Modern, clean rooms with flat panel television. Great breakfast room with hot and cold offerings. Friendly and accommodating staff.

title: Exceptionnel
text: Nous avons séjourné une semaine à l'hôtel Résidence Inn (Marriot). Tout l'intérêt de cet hôtel est qu'il se trouve dans le même building que le Courtyard (Marriott). Le Courtyard va du rez de chaussée au 35ème étage et le Résidence Inn va du 36ème au 65ème étage. Donc en réservant dans le Résidence Inn, vous êtes certains d'avoir un étage déjà haut et donc une plus belle vue. Nous avons pris une chambre avec vue sur Central Park, un peu plus chère. Ce séjour étant notre voyage de noces, nous avions demandé par mail lors de la réservation et aussi une deuxième foi par téléphone par précaution, à avoir une chambre à un étage le plus élevé possible. Malgré ces deux demandes, nous étions au 37ème étage, soit le 2ème étage du Résidence Inn, donc déception à l'arrivée. Malgré tout, la vue était fabuleuse. Néanmoins, aucune petite attention du fait que ce soit notre voyage de noces, même pas lors de notre arrivée; l'accueil fût souriant mais assez impersonnel. La chambre était spacieuse et fonctionnelle, nous ne nous sommes pas vraiment servis de la petite kitchenette car nous n'avons pas "cuisiné", mais le frigo,le micro onde et la vaisselle ont permis de manger sur le pouce une fois ou deux. La propreté de la chambre était IRREPROCHABLE, et je tiens à en féliciter le personnel d'entretien, faisant partie des personnes très exigeantes sur ce point, ce compliment a d'autant plus de poids venant de ma part. La décoration est soignée, le linge de lit et de bain de qualité. A noter que la chambre est très bien insonorisée ce qui est très important dans une ville comme New York! Concernant la salle de bain, rien à redire, tout est parfait. Le petit déjeuner buffet est copieux et la salle très agréable; il est dommage qu'il finisse si tôt, pas de grasse matinée possible quand on a profité très très tard de la ville qui ne s'arrête jamais! Le jour de notre départ, nous avons pu laisser nos bagages auprès de la réception et avons encore pu profiter de la ville avant de prendre notre avion. Nous avons donc passé un excellent séjour au sein de cet établissement qui allie confort haut de gamme et emplacement idéal à deux pas de Central Park et Times Square. A recommander vivement!

title: Superb location and views
text: Excellent location , superb views from 56th floor corner room. Well worth upgrading to a deluxe room. One of the few hotels in New York with a free breakfast. Not a huge selection but there was always something. Walking distance of Central Park , Times Square , Rockefeller centre and 5th ave.

title: Just as good as the first time
text:
This was our second stay at the RI and it was just as good as the first time. However, being a little pickier this time (without deducting a star) I'd say that the armchair in the rooms are just too big. Smaller armchair = more space in the room. 

Great breakfast, AMAZING views and chirpy staff. 

I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

title: Great location + nice staff
text: Loved the hotel. Great location, friendly staff and comfortable room. The room is very modern with big windows allowing a lot of natural light in + provides a great view to the City. We had a basic room and it had a sink, hot plate, microwave, refrigerator + complimentary coffee. There is also a complimentary full gym in the building with modern equipment. The hotel also provide a nice breakfast buffet to the guests with a nice selection of items. We walked everywhere from there. Central Park, Broadway shows, restaurants, subway, all within few blocks from the hotel.Definitely a place that we will be back for the next trip.

title: Almost perfect
text: I am currently staying at The Residence Inn NYC/Central Park & I can definitely recommend it. I was thrilled to be upgraded to a corner room with Central Park views on the 58th floor. The location is perfect, breakfast is a nice bonus & everyone is friendly. My reason for a 4 star review versus a 5 has to do with security. Although you need a card to get to the hotel floors the hallways are very  dimly lit.  So much so that I look around the corners to check the hallway before proceeding. Today when I returned after being out all day I discovered my door was ajar!  I called security & they checked the room with me. Nothing seems to be missing & security thinks the maid simply didn't close it all the way but as a woman traveling  alone this is very disturbing therefore  the 4 stars.

title: Great hotel for a weekend in the city
text:
Stayed at the Residence Inn Central Park Dec. 9-11 with my wife. Excellent location, right on Broadway, a few blocks south of Central Park & north of Times Square, so lots of places within easy walking distance. The Courtyard is basically floors 5-35 of the tower, & the Residence Inn is floors 36-65, so it has the better views of the two. Our room was small, but that was to be expected in NYC & was all that we needed, not an issue at all. King bed was comfy, & the room stayed dark in the morning. Bathroom was decent-sized. We had a corner room (request one if possible) on the 62nd floor and had a fantastic view of both the park & back down into the city. Complimentary breakfast on the 3rd floor, which had more choices than your typical hotel of this type. There was also a bar/Starbucks on the 4th floor. My only complaint as far as the rooms went was that we requested extra pillows & towels both before our stay and after we arrived, and they were never brought up- not a huge deal though.

We had a mid-afternoon flight on Sunday so we stored our bags, and it took a little while for them to be brought out because a lot of other people were in the same situation, so make sure to plan a few extra minutes for that. The hotel arranged for a car service to take us to the airport when we dropped our bags off, and they were waiting when we walked out- very easy. It was a little more than a cab or Uber but worth it.

We would definitely stay here again on a future trip to NYC.

title: The perfect place to stay! Great Location!!
text:
We stayed here in November for our 10 day trip to New York. The Residence is very well located to all of the main attractions - walking distance to most and only a few streets away from Central Park. The room was very clean and serviced daily which was lovely to come back to in the evening. We stayed on the 52nd floor in a corner room which was amazing. We had city views and time square. It was perfect for our first visit to NY. 
Breakfast was good with a good amount of selections to get you started for the day. The only complaint would be is to have a better selection of tea available and for staff to keep the supply full as there were a few mornings where there weren't any tea bags left. Trying to find a staff member was difficult. 
The air conditioner does run a little on the loud side, so if you're a light sleeper you may not wish to stay here. Having said that, we would definitely return. It's a fabulous place to stay in the Midtown area!

title: Mother / Daughter visit to NYC for Thanksgiving Parade
text:
Perfect Midtown location - central to Times Square but far enough away from the madness! Easy walk to Subway 2 blocks away and great restaurants nearby eg Serafina's highly recommended! Safe to walk around at night - we would be coming back at 1am and lots of people out and about. Room was large, view of Times Square from 59th floor was superb, and the corner location meant you could glimpse Central Park to the north and the Hudson River to the south. Breakfast included was generous buffet style on 3rd floor and usually meant we would only need to dine again at night. The in-room kitchen included microwave, refrigerator and dishwasher. Casual bar/lounge on 4th floor was a good spot to relax after a day of sightseeing.
Staff were lovely, bed so comfortable and concierge were happy to store luggage until our late night departure. Recommend for business, families, girlfriends, mother/daughter vacation.
Thanksgiving - the hotel is only a short 3 block walk from the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade route along 6th Avenue.

title: Comfortable and Convenient
text:
A great location for a visit to Midtown NY, just above Times Square and below Central Park.  This Residence Inn is unique in that it shares a building with a Marriott Courtyard.  Courtyard on floors 5-35 and RI 36 and above.  They share a breakfast room on 3 and a cafe on 4.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had a Studio King on the SW corner of the 48th floor that provided a view of the city and Hudson River.  The room was not large, but furnished in a way that maximized the available space, and was very clean.  There was an easy chair and a footstool that doubled as a cocktail table, another  table and a desk chair.  The desk had short but deep drawers, and the closet was adequate and equipped with a safe.  The small kitchen was fully equipped including dish ware, but why would you want to cook in NYC with all those great restaurants?
The breakfast was a typical buffet with plenty of choice.  The only issue we experienced was a shortage of coffee and some food items on day one and two, probably caused by staffing shortages.  By day 3 and 4 these issues were resolved and breakfast went smoothly.  The cafe was a comfortable place for coffee or a cocktail.  We did not have occasion to dine there.
Hotel prices increased substantially on Tuesday and Wednesday evenings, but I guess that's NY.
Highly Recommend.

title: Great locale but....
text:
I have to give the good first - this hotel is in a great location. The rooms are very clean. Great mini kitchen is nice to have (coffee maker, fridge, freezer, microwave, etc.).  Free breakfast and internet were huge pluses.  But now the bad.  

We made our reservations 5 months ahead of time (based on Trip Advisor reviews).  I called the hotel directly and requested a corner room.  When we checked in we were given a very small studio room.  I told the clerk we had requested a corner room to which she replied "we're sold out".  I asked her how they could be sold out when I made my reservations more than 5 months ago. She shrugged her shoulders and said I made the wrong type of reservation.  I asked her if I had made the wrong type of reservation, why had I not been told that when I called to request a corner room.  Again, she just shrugged.  Never once did she try to escalate to a manager or offer any type of solution. She just handed our key cards to us and smiled. My second complaint is breakfast.  Breakfast ends at 10 AM sharp on weekends.  I got my breakfast items and set them down at a table.  I went back to make a waffle and a Marriott employee closed the sliding door before I got back to the kitchen area.  I got up to the door and told her I needed to make my waffle and she said no.  I looked at her with a funny look and she said absolutely no exceptions after the door is closed.  I wanted to say "Lady, this is breakfast not world peace. I'm paying $500 a night so give me my damn waffle."  Nope. No waffle, no hot coffee, nada.  Marriott really needs to work on their check-in and breakfast Nazis. A smile and a little kindness goes a long way.  Management might want to remind their employees of this.  

But the final insult was the bellman who hailed a taxi for us as we were leaving.  Money changed hands and words were mumbled.  We were all settled and ready to pull away from the curb when the taxi driver told us there was a lot of traffic on the way to JFK.  We told him we were only going to Penn Station and he stopped the taxi and told us to get out.  Apparently the "deal" he had with the bellman was for long trips and we were not worthy.  The taxi driver even tried to find the bellman to ask him what was going on (and get his money back) but couldn't find him.  So there we were, kicked out of a taxi and left to our devices to get to Penn Station.  One of the other bellman saw what happened and tried to help but at that point we were DONE!!!  

So for all of these things (mainly the check-in clerk), we will not stay here again.

title: Location Is Great On Broadway
text: It's Christmas Time in the City! This hotel is in walking distance to all the Midtown sights from Times Square to Central Park. The rooms may be a bit smaller than what you might be used to at other Residence Inns but my room was modern and very functional (no stove, however). I had a "city view" room that looked out towards the Hudson River and the view was especially pretty at night with all the lights on. No complaints about the full breakfast included except I wish they had regular tables & chairs to eat at. For me, a room is simply a place to sleep since I was out both day & night taking in all the Christmas sights. Suggestion: when checking in, be sure to ask how the lights work in the room and how the small refrigerator & freezer work (how to make ice). I think the front desk should provide instructions on this off the bat. A shout out to the bellmen who were extremely helpful in getting around. I had a really nice stay!

title: Une semaine à New York.
text: C'était notre énième séjour à Manhattan mais la première fois ici. Le Residence Inn est la partie supérieure du Courtyard Marriott et propose des chambres avec vues sur Times square ou Central Park. Notre chambre d'angle donnait sur la ville mais nous apercevions également central park. Petit coin kitchenette qui nous a permis de diner ou petit déjeuner dans la chambre. Belle salle de sport et petit déjeuner buffet compris. Nous avons profité des 2. Ambiance décontractée et confort de l'hôtel tres apprécié. Situation géographique idéale pour profiter de la ville. Très bon rapport qualité prix compte tenu des prix de l'hôtellerie à New York. Nous reviendrons probablement.

title: Ice-Cold Customer Service; Smelly Room
text: I requested an early check-in when reserving the hotel.  Upon arrival, a room was not available.  Disappointing, but perhaps understandable.  I left bags at the hotel and returned well after check-in time.  With great sterility, the agent gave me a room key.  My Marriott elite status was even not mentioned.  I went to the assigned room, which smelled foul.  I then returned to the front desk, waited on line again, and reported the problem.  The new desk agent said only, "What room was it?," then gave me a new key card.  No "sorry for the inconvenience of lugging suitcases up and down, for having to wait on line, etc."  In the new room, the heat turned on only when the thermostat was set at the maximum temperature of 80 degrees.  But surely I was not going back downstairs again for yet a different room.  One of the bath towels had a strong chemical smell.  Overall, this was not a good stay.

title: Достойный отель в сердце Манхэттена
text:
Этот отель был завершающим в нашем путешествии по Штатам.
Расположен он очень удачно. И Центральный Парк и 5 Авеню в шаговой доступности. Вокруг полно приличных заведений, чтобы и перекусить и с удовольствием поесть.
Номер, естественно, маленькие, но при таких ценах на недвижимость оно и неудивительно.
Единственный минус - очень маленький и тесный ресторан для завтрака. Трудно найти свободное место. На такой большой отель он явно не рассчитан.
Но сама гостиница понравилась, будем еще в Нью-Йорке, снова здесь с удовольствием остановимся.

title: Central Park Residence In
text: The hotel is lovely, chic and well decorated in the rooms and public spaces such as the 3rd floor breakfast area.  The location is fabulous, given the easy walks to Central Park, Broadway theaters, Times Square and Rockefeller Center.  Rooms were well arranged, the white and navy bedding, furnishings and carpet is beautiful and clean, and the beds are cozy.  The kitchenware, refrigerator and microwave were all welcome.  Closet space was adequate.  Water pressure in shower and space to place toiletries in the bathroom are excellent.  Could have used more large towels.  Constructive criticisms:  1.  Room could have more chairs for eating -- we had one for 3 people; 2. I could not find a good space for placing 3 bags so we were tripping on them; 3. Breakfast service ran out of hot foot for extended periods all 3 mornings and fruit once -- need to fix that; 4. Breakfast ends too early for vacationers in a late night city -- latest is 10 on weekends and then they literally closed the doors to those still in the dining area so we could not get more food; 5.  Organization of plates and utensils in the breakfast area is lousy -- one guest and I fixed it ourselves to put them by the door rather than having guests have to reach through folks waiting in line for waffle makers -- better to have at both door entries too than none by the hot food; 6. Check-in was easy as was valet service for car and bag check at the outset, but getting car at the end takes a half hour so plan ahead!  One overall negative of our stay is that we asked for a Central Park facing view and a corner room (I had read they are bigger) and the view of park was a 2-foot window with a much bigger (5 or so foot) view of the Hudson River.  Given that this was my first NYC trip with my children and selecting this hotel was in large part due to the views pictured on the website, that was a big disappointment.  Of course, there is high rise going up right in the path of the park view so it blocked our view even from the top floor, but I suspect Marriott cannot do anything about that!  Other negative is that because I used points I was not allowed to reserve a room with two queen beds as I had requested; was left to the manager's discretion upon our arrival.  We made due with the king bed for 3 of us, which worked out okay.  We had a delicious, reasonably priced Thanksgiving turkey dinner at Iguana right across the street; both the hostess and our server Juan were top notch!  We also loved 99c Pizza!!!

title: 뷰가 끝내주는 곳!
text: 늦게 예약한 통에 2박밖에 하지 못했지만 호텔을 나올때 더 있고 싶다고 생각한 호텔이다. 하루종일 어디 가지 않고 뷰만 바라봐도 좋은 곳. 성수기에는 값이 엄청 뛰는데 뷰만 으로도 상당한 값을 지불할 가치가 있는 곳. 맛있는 조식도 있고 와이파이도 무료다.

title: Lindo hotel, super ubicación!
text:
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, y desde las habitaciones de pisos altos , se tiene una vista genial !! Estan bien equipadas, con secador, tabla y plancha, caja de seguridad y el sector de la cocina tambien es muy completo , ( hasta con lavavajilla)
Está a 1 1/2 cuadra de línea E  y D de subte ( si vienes del JFK, con airtrain y subte -E-es perfecto) y a 2 de otra boca N, Q , 
El desayuno se sirve en el 3°piso con vistas magníficas y el lugar es agradable .... realmente es muy completo

title: Please don't book here
text: So we checked in at 10pm.  Gold members with two nights to Platinum status.  Called earlier and asked for a corner suite.  Booked a king suite on points.  Was assured no problems.  Arrived and told we could not have an upgrade.  Even though they have corner suites available to book online.  Nasty woman at front desk.  The room is so tiny no space to tunn around.  Lousy view.  Nothing that I expected based on the online preview.  Room lights only work if your key is in a slot just inside a drawer.  Refrigerator is actually just a drawer.  We requested extra blankets on the online app 2 times.  Finally we called.  They brought a filthy blanket with crusty, tricky residue no hair all over it.  They may advertise a king, but these re definitely queen beds.  There is no way they could even fit a king bed in this room.  TV does not work either.  Halls are filthy no dark.  This is a nightmare.  Please think twice before booking here.  It has no resemblance to what they put online.  I stay at Marriott every month all over the country for work.  Hands down, this is the worst I've ever encountered.

title: Outstanding Location and Great Room With Outstanding View
text: My wife and I are spending 5 days in New York in December this year. We come once a year in November or December to shop and experience the New York Christmas excitement. This is the first time that we have stayed at this hotel and it's been a wonderful experience and we likely will stay here every year when we come back. They gave us a corner room and we had a beautiful view of central park and the city facing east. The north and east side of our room is all windows and we literally have a 180 degree panoramic view...by far the best view that we've ever had in New York.  The room is NOT small as described by another reviewer maybe because it is a corner room. Our room was actually large by New York standards with a refrigerator, freezer, dish washer. There is a clothes washer and dryer on another floor. The bed is firm and comfortable and the pillows are just the right size, not overstuffed and too thick like you see in other hotels now days. We brought our own pillows but in retrospect didn't really need to. The only disappointment in regards to the room was the shower which had minimal pressure but that's not a deal breaker. The breakfast is average but complimentary. Review of the staff is mixed. The lady that checked us in was very pleasant and professional but interaction with other front desk staff since check in have not been as impressive.  The room was very clean...and my wife has very high standards in this regard and housekeeping were also very pleasant and professional. An unexpected perk was that the hotel is right next to the Ed Sullivan Theatre. We were lucky enough to have Colbert tickets which made our location ideal. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Best yet.......
text:
Just getting round to reviewing this hotel, we stayed for 2 nights here in April after a cruise and booked this hotel because of the view from the corner suites that we had heard about, well we weren't disappointed, the views of Central Park to the north and the Hudson river to the west were unbelievable, we even saw the cruise ship that we had just gotten off of sailing down the Hudson.

Location is excellent as its an easy walk to Central Park, Bryant Park and Times Square etc all only a few minutes walk away.

The corner suite had kitchen facilities that we didn't need except for the fridge, bathroom was a decent size with a great power shower but the view made this place worth every penny (not cheap).

Breakfast was busy but that's always the case in NYC hotels, plenty to choose from and a good start to the day.

Great pub just across the road for a few lagers at the end of a long day before heading up to the room and seeing NYC in full glory all lit up.

title: Non Descript - Very Very Very Small room
text: Very small - I mean very small rooms, so if planning to lounge in a room here, go elsewhere. These are unusually tight, even by midtown Manhattan standards and of course, come at a premium. Staff was outstanding, however, and common areas on floors 3&4 are functional, yet only a tad above mediocrity by Courtyard/Residence standards. Decent location, good views from our room on floor 61. Too bad room was so tiny. It really detracted from our stay and as a Marriott Rewards elite member, my room was considered an upgrade!

title: Perfect place to stay (if you come to town as a tourist)
text:
Wife and I stayed here 3 nights over Thanksgiving 2016.  We’ve stayed at other Marriott’s up/downtown many times that we've come here but this Residence Inn was chosen for the convenience of what we wanted to do.  (we had grandstand tickets for the parade)

To me, it's the perfect location if you are coming to town as a sightseer.  10 minutes from Central Park, 10 minutes from Times Square, Broadway shows are right in the area along with great Hell’s Kitchen restaurants.  Bar Bacon is a must eat!! 20 minute walk to Radio City and Rock Center.  No need for a taxi - walk everywhere!!   Great Irish Bar right around the corner – McGee’s.

We had a Grand Suite - Times Square view and it was awesome. View was so good we said forget "top of the rock" and enjoyed our own private observation deck  :)      Bed was comfortable, water pressure great. Nice bathroom and more than enough room for two with luggage.   Breakfast was a madhouse - but it was a holiday weekend.  Bistro is nice for the happy hour every evening. Work out room was cool - 35th floor and a nice view.  Staff was very nice from front desk to cleaning crews. Great elevator service too!!

For a NYC hotel  - this room was bigger than most apartments, trust me, I know (daughter lived here).    I will stay here again when we return and will recommend to all friends heading to NYC!

title: 3rd stay!
text:
As the title says this is the 3rd time and year in a row that we have booked here. There are literally hundreds of hotels in New York but none of them have this view if you can get one of the top floors which is why we keep coming back.

Good points:
Fantastic and safe location just a few minutes walk from Times square and Central Park, 
Unbeatable views, 
spacious and modern rooms (by New York standards) if you get a corner room.
Free breakfast
Free WiFi in your room

Bad points:

Breakfast is free but make sure you are there early! Breakfast finishes at 9.30 on week days and 10.00 on weekends and when i say finish, i really mean it! I saw the door shut right in the face of some guests at 9.25 without any warning and all the food is cleared like its black Friday at Harrods! I understand that there is a time to clear up but it could be done with a bit more grace. The breakfast staff always seemed to be in a bad mood and reluctant to help...this is not the case for the rest of the hotel staff which have always been very professional, attentive and happy to help.
The dining area for breakfast  as well as the pantry is WAY too small for the number of guests. The seating in the dining area consists of very large chairs which take up far too much room and would be much better if replaced with smaller ones allowing more people to eat rather than standing around or having to take their food back to their rooms.

When checking out we were told that our bags could be stored safely at the hotel while we enjoyed our last few hours. This however is not the case nor was it last year. We requested to store our bags but they were just left in the hotel reception along with dozens of others being told that the room was full. This area is fully open to anyone who walks in off the street so we were forced to pack anything of value into one bag and drag it around New York to ensure it was safe. Upon returning to collect the bags we were not even challenged for our baggage slip or identity when i took them straight out the door.

Tips:
Get a corner room! The 05 rooms have the best overall view ( ie. 6505, 6405 etc)
From these rooms you can see all of Times Square, the Hudson river, and if you stretch your neck you can even see Central Park. These corner rooms also have the most windows.
Turn the air con OFF at night, it makes so much noise when it starts it will wake you!

When booking avoid the online compare sites such as Hotels and Booking.com. Call the hotel direct and ask for the Manager's special, this will always be cheaper and you can specify the corner room which is referred to as 'Times Square Grand View'

This review may look like the hotel is a bad choice but it is not. All hotels have their good and bad points and this ones good points outweigh the bad every time.  :)

title: Serviceable but not Memorable
text: Stayed here for 1 night Thanksgiving weekend. If you are not planning on spending much time at the hotel, the Residence Inn CP might be a good choice for you. Service was adequate. Room was efficiently size (read: tiny) with floor to ceiling windows. Decent views - although there is a new construction high rise going up creating a bit of an obstruction to the park - obviously not the hotel's fault. Breakfast was OK - was pretty hectic down there and the staff seemed to have a bit of a struggle keeping up (although they tried!). No real lobby - common areas are on the 3rd and 4th floors. I am SPG gold and did not get much in elite status value. No complimentary waters or anything - I think they put me a high floor facing the park as my gold status upgrade. The location works - its not a particularly exciting place to be - Midtown west between the park and times square but its close to broadway and the subways. The bed was OK. Everything seemed clean and serviceable - so for that purpose, this hotel works. If you are looking for luxury, maybe keep looking.

title: Great location and views
text: Hotel is in a great location, and the views from my 64th floor room ranged from Central Park to Times Square.  It had all the amenities one would expect from a fine hotel.  My only nit-pick criticism would be that the complimentary breakfast was served on paper plates...surprising when rooms are $300+.  The rooms are compact, but this is New York.  I will definitely return.

title: Não aceita cartão de crédito com chip
text: Tinha reservado este hotel, mas chegando lá não foi possível porque o hotel não utiliza maquineta para leitura de cartão de crédito com chip. Quase todos os cartões de crédito no Brasil possuem este dispositivo de segurança. O hotel não avisou com antecedência sobre isso e o atendimento foi muito ruim. Quer um conselho? Se seu cartão de crédito for com chip não reserve este hotel.

title: Fantástico!!!!
text:
Un hotel maravilloso! Nos hospedamos en este hotel durante 10 días, en la suite con vistas a Times Square. Sin duda fue la mejor elección.
La ubicación es perfecta, ya que está en el centro. A unos pocos metros hay una parada de metro, por lo que hace muy fácil moverse por la ciudad.
El desayuno fue muy bueno y te dejaban subirlo a la habitación. Desayunar con vistas a Times Square es una maravilla.
La habitación no es muy grande, pero es suficiente. Llevamos tres maletas grandes y dos pequeñas y aun así había sitio. Tenía una cocina, pero no la utilizamos ningún día. Las vistas desde la habitación son espectaculares, ya que no hay ningún edificio que obstaculice dichas vistas.

title: What a view!
text: Perfect for a great stay in New York.  Reception was great even though we were early.  Requested a high floor and they accommodated us.  The breakfast area was very nice and food changed daily.  Have been to the city over two dozen times and this was the best place I've stayed.

title: Convenient
text:
Pros:
Location, staff, kitchenette, view, bistro
Cons:
Bedding, breakfast quality, 
Just your average hotel nothing bad. Some parts the hotel got right others were slightly off. Would stay again if there was a deal. Keep away from the hot breakfast items, but there's enough options to have a filling breakfast. Staff was friendly. Beds were average at best. Bistro was good for starbucks coffee and the bartender, she was nice. Nice view to wake up to. Kitchenette was a nice touch if needed.

title: Not What I Expected
text: Hotel has a great location, good breakfast and comfortable beds... but photos on webpage differ from reality. We had a great view and rooms are pretty small (no space for luggage!!), but our biggest concern was  the cleanliness of the room. Bed sheets where not changed between guests, they were dirty and stained when we arrived. We stayed there for a week, and they only make up the bed and changed towels, but they didn't clean up the room, or the bathroom (not even once). Average service at front desk. High price for what you get.

title: Awesome rooms- no lobby bar
text:
Rooms were awesome! Modern, updated, amazing beds and linens, beautiful view of Central Park even though you are several blocks from it. Nice location.

Room- small kitchen- good, coffee needs upgrading though, not enough sugar or cream left for you, and only two coffee packets per day. 

No lobby bar- and unfortunately the The Three Monkeys Across the street is NOT awesome- typical bar food, not a great business bar to have a business meeting and glass of wine. 

Food in lobby to take to your room- very limited choices- they need to add to the options here!

title: Great choice for a foreign tourist like me
text:
The highlights: View, location, staff, breakfasts, comfort, style, price.
Overlooking central park, you've got million dollar views of the Hudson river, midtown too (corner suite). Step outside and you're in times square. Decor is tasteful throughout. Bathtub is tiny but... the fact you get one in nyc at this price is quite something. Check on time late (4pm), but they got us in by 12 by prior request. Most of the staff are very friendly. Considering the size of the place and the frenetic pace of the environment it's in, I think the staff do really well to be so helpful and sincere. All I'm all. I highly recommend this place for a first time visit to new York.

title: Functional NYC
text: As someone that averages 175 nights a year in a hotel, I know of what I speak. In a city that has such a range of hotels Res Inn Central Park is a great stop! Roomier than most of the high rise conversions. Includes a functional kitchenette. Not generally needed, but a nice touch. Great views! Friendly staff by any standard, but really a trade up for NY. Gets you out of Times Square madness while still being walking distance. Easy access to Central Park, Upper East side, etc. Highly recommend.

title: Another Great Stay In New York City
text:
This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel.  The experience was every bit as good as the first time, two years ago.
Upon arriving at my room, I noted the refrigerator was not working, was not turned on.   I contacted the front desk, stated someone would be up shortly to check the unit.  Maintenance arrived with five to ten minutes, checked the unit,  stated it had to be replaced.  The units are modular; a new unit was brought in (already cold) within thirty or so minutes.  This was critical for me since I have a medication which needs to be kept cold.  Other than that, no problems with the room were encountered.  
I've always  been very satisfied with the breakfast served.  It's not fancy, but good for starting the day.

One thing to keep in mind.  I rarely had to wait long for an elevator, but on Sunday morning around 09:00 AM, the wait was extremely long.  Another person waiting with me contacted the front desk, maintenance checked, was simply a matter of a large number of guests going to breakfast at the same.   Keep  this in mind if you are on a tight schedule.  

Other than that, the stay was  excellent.  Would (and probably will) stay here again.

title: Vista mozzafiato
text:
Una delle migliore viste su New York... direttamente dalla camera! Impressionante!
Ottima posizione centrale per visitare la grande mela.
Molto pulito, possibilità di "cucinare" (piccola cucina attrezzata a disposizione), rifornendosi in uno dei negozi appena sotto l'albergo sull'8a Avenue.
Da consigliare assolutamente! Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.

title: Superb!
text: We stayed here one night following the NYC marathon.  Check in was  easy and quick. Our room was  excellent - very large for a city room.   Kitchen was stocked with popcorn and  water.  Bedding was  very new and clean and comfortable.  Bathroom was  fantastic and  spotless.  Extra space in the room helped to move about easily. Views from our high floor were  awesome.   The  comp breakfast was excellent. Many selections of foods,  with  healthy choices.  Area  was clean, neatly arranged and  enticing. We highly recommend this location for  price, locality and  comfort. We will surely return.

title: Great stay. Highly recommended when in NY
text:
Stayed for one night in NY before getting on a cruise sailing out of the nearby cruise port. It was pricey, $300 for one night which hit us Canadians hard but as I'm loyal to Marriott as far as I can be, it was the most reasonably priced Marriott in the area I wanted. The building also has a Courtyard and we were able to enjoy some drinks at the Bistro when we arrived. 
Due to the flight delay out of Toronto we didn't get to look around the neighborhood at all. But we passed Ed Sullivan Theatre just around the corner from the hotel and Central Park is super close. 
The room had floor to ceiling windows looking out onto Broadway which was really cool. The decor was lovely and a big comfy arm chair was great for looking out over the city. The bathroom looked newly renovated an the shower was fancy and there were zero issues to complain about with the room. There was even microwave popcorn in the kitchen area!
The included breakfast the next morning was fabulous. Lots of fresh fruit, I made a breakfast burrito. Hubs said coffee was some of the best he had ever had. 
Next time I'm in Ny for longer I will definitely stay again.

title: Ótima opção
text: Antes da hospedagem,  buscamos muitas opções até escolher este hotel.  Acertamos.  Fomos recebidos com muita atenção e foi possível realizar check-in antecipado.  O quarto era excelente,  limpo,  com vista para cidade e Central Park.  A mini cozinha é completa.  Ficamos no 64o andar.  O hotel nos ofereceu um drink especial porque celebravamos nosso aniversário de casamento.  O café da manhã é bom e atendeu às expectativas.  A localização é excelente! Voltaremos e indicaremos aos amigos.

title: Mixed review
text:
The rooms were good, but the food / breakfast was poor.   We stayed three nights.  The first two mornings they were out of scrambled eggs.  The third they had over cooked eggs and bland flat turkey sausage.

One of the reasons we residence Inn is the free bfast.  But the food was horrible.

Good location.  Nice rooms.  But poor food.

title: Wonderful Views
text:
We were luck enough to get a corner room on a very high floor as we had requested. This was made possible because or Jeffrey Castillo at the front desk who was kind enough to listen and make sure that it happened. 
The view was fabulous. The room was immaculate and we loved the extremely compact kitchen as an added feature.

title: Good staying but something needs to be improved
text:
Hotel location, room view, contemporary style, breakfast were great but room was little bit tiny than any other Marriott brand hotels in NYC.
The hotel is located in between Times Square and Central Park so you can easily access both spots by walk and Columbus circle is just 3 blocks away from this hotel so this hotel has a perfect location for dining and shopping. 
Residence Inn(Higher level 33~65?) and Courtyard Marriott (Lower level 5~32?) are occupying the building together.
I like their Bath & Body Work amenity and their multi function shower head can be used for a hand shower and my wife really liked it.  
The hotel doesn't provide any complimentary water for Gold Elite member while I had received it from any other Marriott brand hotels in NYC. Even though it is a brand new hotel but Heating/AC system made a noise and didn't work properly.
The bottom line is I recommend this hotel because it's amazing view, modern style Residence Inn and cost effective.

title: Il top
text: Sono stato qui a novembre è stata una vacanza favolosa . Hotel è una favola con camere meravigliose e la piccola cucina all'interno bagno grande e ovviamente vista mozzafiato al 63 esimo piano! Colazione e wi-fi incluso è X ny è una cosa speciale !! Colazione molto buona ed abbondante a buffet . Organizzato bene ed completo di palestra zona lavanderia e in camera c'è il ferro da stiro e l'asse !! Mi è piaciuto un sacco

title: Wow what a disappointment!!!
text:
Chose the hotel because of the acclaimed great views. Booked a park view room, called a week before to reconfirm as we would arrive around midnight. No problem. 
Upon arrival we get the room where the park view require you stand in the corner of the room behind the tv!!! When we point out that this can hardly account for park view, we are informed that because of our late arrival we can't expect a room with the "so proudly advertised" view......
Well then don't sell me one, don't confirm a week before, and don't completely neglect when we point it out!!!!

title: Great View
text: We got a corner room with both park and city view. It was nice looking out of room at night into the city. The room wasn't large, but probably normal for NYC. Staff was efficient and friendly. They helped us out with getting a car to the airport, which was on time. We were there for the marathon, they provided goody bags on race morning. It was a nice touch. Breakfast was good.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Una habitación con vistas espectaculares y con todas las comodidades de un departamento. Buen desayuno y una ubicación para tener todo Manhattan al alcance de la mano. Vista al Central Park y a Times Square

title: Amazing views
text:
We received a suite overlooking central park. Our room was on a corner with floor to ceiling windows and the views were spectacular! We were staying on floor 41. It was my birthday and on our check in received a complimentary drink! Even though I accidentally knocked the glass off the table and broke it (I promise I wasn't drunk!) the staff were lovely! 
It's really quiet and a great location to explore the city. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you for a lovely stay.

title: Efficient Set Up on a High Floor With a High Showerhead
text: The Residence Inn is in the same building as the Courtyard -- it is simply the upper floors. While my room was a typical size for New York (i.e., smallish), it was clean and well appointed, with a very efficient kitchenette. NOTE FOR TALL TRAVELERS: The shower head was at about 6'6" -- no ducking to get your head wet!

title: vue et studio top .
text:
le studio est confortable et le coin cuisine assez bien agencé. manque quand même 
une plaque de cuisson. bizarre.
sinon , literie impec et salle de bain désigne.
et Evidemment cette vue sur central park...  mais bientôt amputée.  
et oui.. des ptits malins rehaussent un autre building devant ce mariott.. 
service d ascenseur efficace et ptits dej inclus vraiment complet .
bref .. une belle adresse.

title: Smart hotel, excellent location with certain room for improvements
text: Residence Inn Mariot hotel offers a very good package to explore the Big Apple: smart and cosy interior, kind and friendly staff, excellent location both to key places of interest (Broadway, Central ParK) and subway stations. Of course it comes with a price which is not a cheap one. 2 sectors where I see certain  room for improvements: 1) breakfast options (if you stay more than 2-3 days you run out of options and especially fresh options) and 2) check-in/check out hours. I fail to understand why with check out time at 11.00 the check in time starts at 16.00 ?!! We checked in at 17.00-17.30 cause our room was not ready.

title: Great hotel
text: Very convenient location, rooms on 56th floor with a spectacular view. The rooms are rather small,but clean, quiet and equippped with a small kitchen and,very important during night,with an ac practically unhearable. In addition, they offer a good continental breakfast. The gym on the 35th floor is ok, again ,with a nice view. Staff is friendly . Checking in and out very fast

title: great location, near central park
text:
Everything is a few Streets away.
Take a studio room so you Can Go to the market and Save money on restaurant.

Breakfast very Good too. 

3streets from Central Parc.  We were on the 47th floor and could see time square.

title: Turismo
text: Muito bom hotel, os colaboradores são gentis e solícitos, o café da manhã é ótimo o hotel tem uma bela vista do Central Park, a localização é muito boa, entre o Central Park e a Broadway, os quartos são Bins principalmente para o meu tipo de cliente que passa o dia fora e só chega para dormir, cama confortável.

title: Outstanding
text:
Sits on the upper 30 or so floors of this new (2015?) high rise with excellent views!
(the lower floors are Court yard Inn) Small ny rooms but very clean. A great place for me because I usually wake up around 3 am and read and there is a great "business center--computer stations--on , i believe the 3rd floor which is open 24-7.
The location is very good about 2 short blocks south central park.

title: Vue magnifique
text: 9 nuits passé dans une chambre au 56eme étage, avec une vue magnifique sur Times Square. Chambres bien insonorisées, propres et bien agencées. Personnel agréable et serviable. Nous avons trouvé que le petit déjeuner n'était pas très fourni et que la fin du petit dej programmé a 9h30 était trop tôt.

title: Muy buen hotel, gran desayuno y vistas espectaculares
text:
Estuve en el piso 62 con vista a time square y al rio hudson. Algo espectacular que disfrute todo el tiempo.
La cocina esta mas equipada que mi casa, con lavavajillas incluido. 
El desayuno muy bueno en un lugar muy comodo y lindo.
El unico punto flojo es el lobby, pequeño para mis gustos.
Pidan habitaciones altas y en esquina.
La ubicacion es inmejorable para pasear por new york

title: Best Hotel Stay We've Ever Had!
text: This place is amazing. Our room on the 62nd floor looking out at Times Square on the left to the Hudson on the right was as good as an observation deck at a tall building--except it was ours! The room was perfectly set up for the size and the shower was really nice with great water pressure and a glass wall/door. Breakfast on the 3rd floor was well done and the fitness center on the 35th floor with floor to ceiling windows was very cool. The staff was friendly...honestly, I just can't say enough good about this property...not one hitch the whole time we were there. Totally clean too.

title: The Best
text: My favorite hotel. Anywhere. Best views, best service. Best location. Full hot breakfast. Full kitchen and cookware, utensils. Very clean. Worth every penny. I wouldnt stay anywhere else im Manhattan.

title: Great location for a quick visit
text: The hotel itself is clean, staff is friendly and efficient, room is small but clean with a small pantry.  Location is very convenient with restaurants and major Broadway theaters close by.  The section of Broadway where the hotel is located is not as crowded with tourists therefore a relatively friendlier environment.  Overall a good experience.

title: Really bad experence
text:
As a frequent guest at this hotel with 15 + stays under my belt, I enjoy good relationships with the staff. However one individual- the front office manager Ashley Diechert has gone out of her way to make my stays not only uncomfortable, but antagonistic. 
I am a platinum elite through Marriott and utilize the benefits and rewards. One of them being mobile check in. Back on October 8th, I contacted the hotel two hours before my arrival. I was told that the room would be available in an hour or an hour and a half. Upon checking in, one of the newer front desk reps told me the room that I requested was not available. I told her that I did a mobile check in for a Park view on a high floor which I paid for.  She went back into the office and talked to guess who- Ms. Diechert. She told the rep to tell me to come back at 4PM- regular check in. Now, with 125 nights in Marriott's this year- not one property ever stated that to a platinum elite member. 
When I dug a bit deeper- I was told that the people in that room were in it until 4  manager would do her best to get me in by 5pm. One of the front desk specialist whom I know by name- checked the system and came over to me and stated the room became available when the previous guest kid out at noon. He stated "what the manager is doing to you is plain wrong"
I confronted the girl and asked to speak to the manager on duty but was told "they are in a meeting (Sunday at 2:30 pm- yeah-right).
Then the new excuse was the maids would get to the room in rotation. I offered that if you have a platinum guest waiting in the lobby for a room they were told they can check into through mobile check-in at 2PM, you think they would get to that room as quickly as possible. That would've been the right thing to do. When the front desk girl went back to the manager I overheard the manager say  "let them wait".
This manager- Ms. Diechert was so unprofessional and used her authority to make it a point OR statement that she had control over me. I came to find out from an employee that he issue with me was that I tend to request the 65/64th floors overlooking the park. Prior to her coming to the hotel, the staff always accommodated my request asa platinum member. She put a stop to that and I always have had problems since.
While the staff overall is outstanding, I do not think Marriott or Interstate Hotels and Resorts who owns the property even knows of this woman's hostility and behavior towards their guests.
I recommend that if you want to pay these prices- there are more luxurious hotels with views. By the way, the park view is now obstructed  by a new high rise apartment building going up literally in front of the Residence Inn. They won't tell you that- I just did.
Most likely will not go back after spending 35 nights at this hotel so far in 2016.

title: Outstanding Service
text:
The hotel is really good and new.  When my husband and I arrived we were outstandingly checked in by the guest service agent Nicole Batista. We were surprised by the apartment level (57th floor) which had a really nice view and it was recommended by her. She was always nice and helpful.
We were really pleased by the accommodations: nice bed, awesome shower and beautiful view of part of Central Park (partially blocked by a huge building in front). 
The breakfast was included in our fare and it was delicious and totally worthy! 
The hotel is a few blocks from the Times Square, the Central Park and the Columbus Circle. Metro/Subways are nearby too.
We not only recommend it as we'd return for sure!
And Nicole: thank you very much! 😊

title: Fantástico y muy bien situado
text:
Estupendo hotel muy bien situado, sobre todo si se trata de la primera visita a Nueva York. 
Habitaciones espaciosas con mobiliario moderno,bonita decoración y espectaculares vistas de la ciudad. La cama es comodísima. 
Desayuno incluído muy variado y completo.
Totalmente recomendable.

title: Birthday Celebration in Manhattan
text: Great location, great breakfast. Staff helpful and friendly. The rooms are on the smaller side but love having a kitchenette. As busy as it was, did not have to wait long for our car. Would recommend for out ot town travelers.

title: Pleasant stay just as it was the last time
text: I like this place for its cleanliness, friendliness of its stuff, THE great view and the location.  This time I was staying alone again on a business trip.  It did not fail to satisfy me!  On one night I dropped my contact lens into bathroom sinc drainage, the front desk I called sent a janitor in right away.  I forgot his name, but he was a very nice and pleasant person, sympathetic and searched for my lens hard and found it!  I had a meeting on the following day, so he saved my day!!   On the same night, I used up all the toilet roll I had, but a call gave me a new roll right away.  I appreciated their attentivenss.  I was a little shocked to find a thin, tall building(probably a new or renovated hotel) standing inbetween me and the central park which was not there two years ago, but the veiw was still great.  I also appreciate the mini kitchen.  I do not cook in the room, but coffee maker, kettle, microwave PLUS plates and utencils are nice things to have in your room, when you stay for more than one night.  Keep up the good service!  I will definitely come back for my business trip next time.

title: Good position
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights and had a good room on the 61st floor.  The room was very clean and well maintained.  Only slight downside was the breakfast. There was ample choice but it felt a little industrial (probably me being picky).
The hotel is in a good location for Midtown New York, close to Central Park & the up-market shops & easy walk to the subway.  Would stay again.

title: Stupid Mistake
text:
On the 11th of Oct, this year, we decided to take a quick trip to New York City.  The Residence Inn at 1717 Broadway was at the right location for the places we were to visit. we alway choose a Marriott Brand since we are reward members and they are always consistent across the brand.  I signed on to the Marriott website and intended to reserve a room for the night of October 17th.  I did reserve the room but I failed to update the date and reserved a room for the night I logged on, October 11.  

The Marriott website has a feature which shows you upcoming reservations.  I logged on the morning of October 12th and was surprised when I didn't see the reservation I thought I'd made the night before.  When I looked further, I realized my mistake, this was at 6:00 AM.  I immediately called the reservation desk at the hotel.  The young lady who answered was very pleasant, saying that this had happened in the past.  She could not do anything about the charge but did make the correct reservation and referred me to the front desk manager.  I was transferred to the font desk and asked for the manager.  I was sent to a voicemail.  I left a message.  I did not receive a call back.  I called back 2 additional times, leaving voicemail with my phone number on both occasions.  I never got the courtesy of a return call.

I am a longtime customer of Marriott and I did expect some kind of accommodation for my expensive error. I would have accepted a response that the hotel policy is to expect full charge on a mistaken reservation.  What really annoys me is that there was no return call.  Very poor customer service on the part of the front desk manager.

title: Excellent Location and friendly staff
text:
My young adult daughter (who is a tiny wee thing) and I stayed here for part of our 2 week stay.
It was in a great location, we visited at a high price time of year, so booked to stay in a King room rather than 2 doubles to help our budget, thinking she won't take up much room!

The pre stay emails and information & confirmation processes were excellent.

I unfortunately became ill with a virus that turned to a chest infection, so we were now not wanting to share a bed.

I phoned the hotel and explained the situation & asked would there be any chance of a room with 2 seperate beds for us (at the same cost).
A lovely lady, I'm sorry I don't have her name, said of course we can do that.

This was so good and they didn't have to do it, could have said you should've thought of this before etc
So I am very happy to stay there again or at a hotel of this company.

I did read the review about breakfast bowls runnng out etc.
Out room was absolutely spotlessly clean.
Breakfast did run low at the end of a 3 or 4 hour time slot on a weekend day.
We just adapted and went down as soon as we woke up then showered & got ready for the day after that.
The view from the room was also exactly as described, we booked the less expensive 'City view', but if we looked left we could still see the corner of Central Park in 1 direction, with the city skyline in the other.

title: Upgrade from Courtyard to Residence Inn
text: We arrived super late on friday night and were received with super good news! We got an upgrade we were very tired so I think we didn´t even say thank you in that moment... but really thank you!!! Next morning we opened the curtains and the view was spectacular! and no city noice since we were in a high floor.

title: Conveniently located
text: This is two hotels in one - Residence Inn and Courtyard. Not sure what the room difference is but these rooms are small by normal standards but not so much for NYC. They are very 'green'. Lights are kept on with your key card which was not explained very well.  Some of the staff clearly wished they were elsewhere.  Food was mediocre with little to offer in the bar/sandwich shop.  Doormen were a bright spot and they do have a car service to the airport which was reasonable and quick.

title: Hotel close to Broadway Shows
text: Spent two nights in Manhattan at the Residence Inn. Was surprised to find out that the same building was shared by two hotels of the same chain. New York is New York and the price of this hotel is right up there for the location. The room was not large and it was more like a Japanese business hotel. We traveled from oversees and found it not so easy to open up our two suitcases at the same time. Other than the size of the room, the service at the front desk as well as the concierge was friendly and very helpful. The daily breakfast was very good and timing an important  factor to be able to chose a seat. Overall a good experience and happy that we used points to book the room.

title: Situation idéale et services de qualité
text:
Beaucoup de chance mais pas le Jackpot :
Nous étions au 63/65 étage mais à l'est donc vues sur central park dans l'angle droit mais quel point de vue et levers du soleil fabuleux...
Nous somme restés 5 jours dans une chambre belle, fonctionnelle et bien équipé, en particulier la kitchenette qui nous a dépanné quelque fois...
Le centre de Fitness au 35eme est super équipé et inclus dans les prestations.
Le petit dej au 3eme est complets et de bonne qualité.
L'ensemble est propre, en bon état et le personnel très sympa (normal à NewYork)
La situation est idéale pour le tourisme :
Au centre de tout, à quelques minutes de Bus ou Metro pour aller loin dans tous les sens mais également à moins de 10 minutes à pied de Central Park au nord Hell's kitchen à l'ouest, Time Square au sud et les boutiques de la 5th av à l'est.
Le rapport prestation prix avec le breakfast compris nous semble imbattable...

title: Don't waste your money!!!!!
text:
Filthy. Way over priced. I've been to Manhattan often and stayed in different locations. Decided at this hotel for all the rave reviews. After one night (and we had booked for a weeks stay) we left. Tiny room as I expected because like I said I've stayed in many hotels in NYC. Went down for the complimentary breakfast at 8:30. Not on clean dish available for cereal. Checked out ASAP and will never return. Talked to many different front desk staff as well as managers and no one seemed to care how dirty our bathroom was (toothpaste in the sink, hair on the floor, etc.) and upon arrival ONE bath towel for the two of us. Yes, views are nice and location is good but there are hundreds if not more hotels with nice views all in the same location.
Ended up in Hell's Kitchen two blocks from the Residence in and love it. Will stay here every time we come back.

title: また泊まりたい！
text: 今年の3月、最上階（65階）のタイムズスクエアビューの部屋に5泊しました。角部屋だったのでハドソン川とニュージャージーも一望できて朝から夜までカーテンを開けたまま景色を満喫。特に夜景の美しさはずっと眺めていても飽きなくて、夜はレストランに行かずに近くのホールフーズでお惣菜を買ってきて部屋で食事していたほど。部屋には結構な容量の冷蔵庫があり、飲み物やフルーツを常備しておくのに便利でした。朝食のクオリティは今ひとつでしたが、明るいラウンジで毎朝ヨーグルトやシリアルを手軽に食べられたのは良かったです。コーヒーもあまり美味しくなかったので、建物内にあるスタバでコーヒーだけ買い、朝食のラウンジに持って行って飲んでました。スタッフは良心的で親切。3月という時期のおかげもあってレイトチェックアウトができ、空港に行く車の手配も速やかにしてくれました。立地も個人的には最高の場所なので、次回もまたここに泊まりたいと思っています。

title: Great views for that magical experience unlike no other
text:
I'm going to start by advising anyone going here to request a room with the full skyline view.

The first time we stayed here, we woke early every morning to watch the sunrise on the skyline. This was for New years in 2014/15 with our 2 year old son. The curtains were never shut and i couldn't dream this experience up it was so spectacular. We fell in love with this place and it was the only contender when we came back to the states with our family to get married in August. Unfortunately, our previous visit had given us high expectations, and we were left a little disappointed to get a room with a wall opposite to the bed instead of glass and a smaller window to the side that you had to go up to to get a partial view. This is not to say it wasn't still great. 
However, knowing this we probably wouldn't have spent the extra at the busy time of year. 

The staff are always friendly and helpful, and the breakfast has plenty of options included. There's plenty of equipment in the gym also. The location is just the right distance from central park and times square. You can get a great view of Times square from the terrace if it's open (Door seemed to be locked the one time we tried to visit, but assuming weather etc dictates access).
Of course this hasn't put us off and wouldn't stop us staying here again.

It's a pity also that there appears to be a new building being put up in front of the Central Park view. This doesn't take the affect of the high rise views though as there is plenty to look at and Central Park can still be seen either side.

To reiterate, this is a great hotel, but i'm writing this so that guests might be able to request one of the 'better' views unlike us who didn't know.

Thanks again for the experiance

title: Great location and tallest hotel in North America
text: We picked this hotel due to its central location in Manhattan as well as being a Marriott brand (we are Rewards members at Gold level). We were on the 59th floor with excellent views especially of Central Park. Nice amenities including breakfast, concierge ( we got opera tickets through them) and help with directions and ride services. We would definitely stay there again!

title: Best View, best location, great buffet breakfast
text:
This hotel is the best! Great staffs. The lady in the front desk was nice to give us a room at 52nd floor, overlooking the city (make sure to request for high floor when you make your reservation). Room has lots of space and a kitchenette (love it!).  Times Square and Central park are walking distance and lots of restaurants nearby. Breakfast is a big bonus. They have eggs, sausage, bagels and fruits. You need to be early though coz they don't refill 30 mins before it closes and scrambled eggs easily get cleaned up. 
Taxi can be arranged or you can ask the doorman to get taxi for you (they are all waiting outside). The taxi that brought us to the airport was a nice SUV with comfortable seats and lots of room (kind of pricey though, Uber is a little bit cheaper). 
The elevators are slow. One time, it won't let us press level 3 so we had to go to 4th floor and try the other elevator. 
Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will stay here again.

title: Wonderful service, great location, beautiful views
text: We were visiting NYC for our 30th wedding anniversary. We just briefly mentioned this at check-in and Glenn, who was checking us in, took it upon himself to make sure we had a room with a tremendous view.  And, we were shocked and over-whelmed to find a personalized welcome gift from Glenn in our room later in the day.  A bottle of wine and a lovely plate of cheese, fruit, and crackers with a hand-written note of congratulations were awaiting us.  Glenn went above and beyond!

title: Beste uitzicht room 6505
text: Hoogste hotel van Verenigde Staten. Wij hadden kamer 6505 op de bovenste verdieping. Vooraf een mailtje gestuurd met de vraag of we deze kamer konden krijgen en dat is gelukt. Het ontbijt is inbegrepen en is erg goed. We zaten er 10 dagen en dan wordt het wat veel van hetzelfde qua ontbijt. Super vriendelijk personeel, erg schoon en zeer centraal. In het hotel zelf is niet zoveel te doen, maar dat is geen probleem omdat zeer veel op loopafstand is. In een paar minuten in Central Park en ook zo bij Times Square. Geen last van geluiden van buiten gehad. Laatste dag was het mistig en dan zie je niet zoveel. We gaan zeker terug naar dit hotel. Rechtstreeks boeken via Marriott was het goedkoopste.

title: Beautiful View!!
text: I had a Northeast corner room, and the walls were all glass. At night, with the curtains drawn open, you can rest looking at a panorama of glass and light; it's like sitting on a cloud! They have a bar that is open to windows and has a high ceiling to create an uncrowded feeling. They offer continental breakfast. But it's the room views of Central Park that are stunning! Ask for a corner room. It's unforgettable.

title: Nice hotel, good location
text: I read a lot of reviews from various sites and decided to go with this hotel and get the king room times square view, small room but great view. My boyfriend and I were in NYC for the weekend for The Meadows Music festival in queens. Although we got lost on the trains, they were pretty close to the hotel which was good. And we got a ride back to JFK using the Hotel's car service, our driver was cool and got us there in time. Breakfast was good. The only thing that I disliked was that the hallways and elevators of the Hotel's weren't clean. We were gone most of the day at the festival and still came back to them being dirty. But overall it was a good stay I would come back.

title: A visit to ABC Studio...Dr. Oz
text:
Just a short jaunt into the city to attend Dr. Oz show at the ABC Studio. The hotel was close to Central Park and Times Square (comfortable walking distances). The hotel offers a full buffet breakfast (included with the room rate), which takes the pressure off trying to find someplace to eat early and begin the day touring the city. Since this was a 2-night stay; we were able to do the Central Park Pedi-Cab tour, which was awesome; visit the 9/11Memorial; then the Oz show. We accomplished much more than expected to see/do during our 3 day/2 night stay.

We were on the 57th floor which gave us a very impressive city/park view with 2 solid glass walls to view from; the King/Studio room that we had was pristine; the staff were friendly/helpful; and their rooms are sound proof!

title: Not for us
text:
We spent just one night here on a layover from Europe, and I'm sad to say we left feeling underwhelmed. After booking the room (Times Square view category), I called the hotel to request one specific floor plan of the three they had listed on their website, based on a tip from a fellow Tripadvisor member. It was the only one with a tub and had much larger windows than the other two. The woman who took my request sounded hurried and hung up before I could even thank her.

When we arrived, there was no note about our request on our reservation, but the woman at the front desk (I regret that I did not get her name) was very friendly and accommodating. She did however inform us that none of the rooms in the category we booked had tubs. We said fine, it wasn't about the tub, more about the larger windows. We had only one night, we really wanted to sit by the window and gaze at the city lights.

When we got to our room, I was disappointed to find the small window and view completely blocked by a desk with no room to lounge or even walk up to the window. Not at all what was represented on the floor plans I saw. We went back to her and explained our disappointment. She upgraded us to a Grand Times Square view room, which did have a fantastic view (still no tub, though).

We enjoyed the room, mostly because of the view, but noticed that it wasn't very clean. Nightstand and desk felt dirty and dust was on my hand when I wiped the surface. A stray shampoo bottle cap was on the ground next to the bed. The sliding door between bathroom and bedroom didn't offer much privacy. Kitchenette is nice for longer stays and was well-appointed.

Breakfast was included and the offerings were more than adequate. However, service a little less so. I could not find salt & pepper and when I asked, the bus boy just pointed at the general area of the buffet from the next room and said "It's in there." Well yes, I knew that, but where exactly? Just a little thing, but in the hospitality business, friendliness matters.

Things we missed in comparison to hotels in the same price class: room service, robes and complimentary water. You could purchase water at the small shop in the lobby, but in the room all that was offered were two small Fiji bottles at $6 each. At $500+ a night, we have come to expect just a little more than what this hotel offered, and we will not be returning.

title: Ottimo
text:
Ottimo sotto diversi punti di vista 
Innanzitutto è in posizione strategica, a piedi si arriva comodamente a Times square e a Central Park 
Camere nuove , pulite con vetrate che offrono viste spettacolari (consiglio corner room)
Zona per la colazione (compresa nella tariffa ) ampia , elegante con vista 
Nessun punto negativo da segnalare

title: Good location, courteous staff
text:
We stayed here for one night so that we could be close enough for our reservations to an early morning TV show taping. 

Staff - The hotel employees were very helpful - from the staff at the front desk answering all our questions during check in to the bell hop patiently hailing for over 10 minutes just to get us a taxi during rush hour.

Rooms - We had a double room with a view of Central Park. Now, keep in mind that a couple buildings block part of the view, but you can still get to see a good portion of the park.  Also, the hotel is barely 3 years old, so the furniture and decor still feel very new.  Though, in our bathroom, our shower drain was very slow, even after the maintenance staff came to fix it, but that was the only setback we had.

Location - The hotel is within walking distance of both Times Square, Central Park and restaurants.

Breakfast - The food was comparable to other Residence Inn locations.  I do like how they designed/decorated the breakfast room. It has more of a coffee shop feel - very relaxing.

title: City slumber
text:
We've stayed at this hotel several times in the past and this visit was the very best.  Our room, although rather small, was well designed and included huge windows which offered panoramic views of the city.  We like the fridge/microwave which Residence Inns always provide.  The bed was super comfy, the linens very soft.  Having stayed in this facility previously, it's easy to figure out where to store luggage, utilize drawers, and find my way to the 35th floor with its much needed self laundry facilities.  
The location cannot be beat.  It's close to everything and makes it very easy to get around the city whether walking, taking a taxi or the Metro.  Central Park is close by, restaurants abound, theaters are a few blocks away.
This year the staff was incredible.  We especially enjoyed chatting with Roger who works at the check in desk in the evenings.  He's a true treasure and indicative of Marriott quality service.
Traveling to Manhattan at least once a year, this is our hotel of choice.

title: Отличный вид!
text:
Очень красивый вид на город с 54 этажа. Закаты обалденные! Скоростные лифты.
Включен завтрак, хоть и скромный, но приятно. Самый центр. В номере чисто, кровать удобная, душ с хорошим напором. Есть миникухня с посудой. Рекомендую.
2 раза сняли деньги за проживание. Вот уже 3 недели прошло, так и не вернули!

title: Great views, tight spaces
text: Stayed here for a total of 4 weeks on business.  The RI is stacked on top of the Courtyard in a 65 story building in Midtown near Central Park and Columbus Circle,  I was on the 44th floor - the views were good.  Be aware that the rooms are much smaller than what you see at a typical Residence Inn. The front desk staff was very friendly.

title: What a Refreshing Surprise in NYC!
text: The front desk clerks were courteous and very helpful!! They were very accommodating and always ready to assist. Getting a free breakfast ANYWHERE in New York is great! The food was fresh and tasty! The room was TOP NOTCH! CLEAN!! small but very accommodating! The Bell Desk was even helpful. Could not complain about one thing! Can't wait to go back!!

title: Great views of the city!
text:
My daughter and I stayed at this Marriott during our 5 day visit to New York.   It was in a great location, close to Times Square and Central Park.   The room was cosy and the beds were comfortable.  The breakfast area was busy each morning but had an average selection of food.
the only thing that i was disappointed with was that some of the reception staff were miserable and barely smiled when we checked in or out.
I would stay here again for the views and the location.

title: Шикарный вид из окна!
text:
Отличный отель: панорамный вид, кухня, завтрак, wi-fi. Желательно брать этаж повыше. Завтрак не сказать, что шикарный, но тосты, сок, омлет готовят.
С кухней очень удобно, недалеко от отеля есть супермаркет.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed here at the beginning of September lovely hotel, comfy beds, amazing views. Kitchen area came in handy, would definitely recommend staying here. Special mention to kenaya on reception she was a star helping us out several times with phone calls.

title: Esperava mais
text:
Escolhemos este hotel por ter instalaçoes novas e mais modernas.
O cafe da manhã, incluido na diária, ate nos surpreendeu pois servia o basico, variando as frutas e em alguns dias queijos. Mas a grande decepçao foi quanto ao serviço de limpeza dos quartos. No nosso quarto ficou jogado atras da cortina um lençol durante toda a semana, no quarto dos meus filhos foi recolhido pelo serviço de camareira o pote de yogurte que ele consumiu e a colher que caiu no chão foi deixada no chão mesmo.
A localizaçao é muito boa, muitos restaurantes perto, estação de metro e bem perto do Central Park.
O pessoal da recepçao muito atencioso, mas nao conseguimos nem entrar no hotel quando chegamos pela manha e nem late check out na saida.

title: Overbooking
text: Io e mia moglie avevamo deciso di passare qui una settimana della nostra luna di miele. Abbiamo prenotato tramite booking con 2 mesi di anticipo approfittando di un prezzo molto conveniente. Al nostro arrivo 930 pm (3:30 am ore italiane dopo 15 ore di viaggio) una spiacevole sorpresa, residence tutto completo e la nostra prenotazione inesistente. Una volta esibiti i documenti di prenotazione si sono resi conto di aver venduto tutte le camere a prezzo pieno snobbando la nostra. A quel punto hanno contattato booking e ci volevano dirottare la prima notte in un altro albergo e le successive 5 da loro. A quel punto fortunatamente abbiamo optato per tutto il periodo per un albergo lì vicino, the knickerbocker che ci ha riservato una piacevole accoglienza ed un offerta conveniente. Sconsiglio vivamente il residence inn by marriot e tutti gli alberghi che vanno in over booking per accaparrarsi le prenotazioni a prezzo pieno, mettendo offerte su booking non rispettandole.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: Fantastic hotel with the most amazing views! Seriously wow! The bed was super comfortable & we found the staff to be friendly. It's in a great location too, near all the sites & close to the subway. Will definitely stay here again!

title: First leg
text: We booked into the Residence Inn for the beginning of our New York Canada trip. The room was a bit smaller than I expected but none the less offered spectacular city views. The hotel was conveniently placed between Times Square and Central Park and put everything within easy reach. Breakfast was included in our package . Very basic but provided a good start to the day. Rooms are made up daily and staff are very friendly. Would recommend to anyone staying in New York.

title: I feel scammed
text:
Checked in after midnight. Night staff looked like they couldn’t care less. Had a reservation in the Residence Inn (which I chose because of its views) but was checked in into the Courtyard, on the lower floors of the same building, “because of IT problems.” Pay for the view, get nothing — I fail to be impressed by the views from the 12th floor, you might as well look up from the street. I feel scammed.

Hotel itself looks modern but already quite tired. A strange mixture of old and new. My bedside lampshades look like a thousand greasy hands have handled them.

title: Its Newyork! Get used to be treated like one
text:
New Yorkers are not very friendly. Reception staff not very friendly. Not surprised at all. 
Hotel is nice. Gave me a room in the corner with a window to see buildings! 

Service is good. Beds are nice.  Loved the bathroom. 
Kitchenette nice.

title: Estadia perfeita
text: Este hotel tem todas as comodidades que tornam a viagem mais agradável ainda. Super bem localizado, quarto e banheiro limpos e espaçosos. Cozinha completa, inclusive com máquina de lavar louça. Ficamos no 46   andar com linda vista e muito silencioso. Elevadores rápidos e sem espera. E café da manhã excelente em um ambiente elegante e agradável. Wifi ótimo, TV excelente.. Super recomendo!!

title: Views and MORE
text: What a pleasant surprise.  I picked the hotel primarily for the location (in the Theatre District), without realizing that it was the tallest hotel in North America!  My wife and I were coming back from Spain, and stopping over in NYC - the front desk staff were able to arrange for an early check-in (wonderful after an 8 hour morning flight), and the view from our room was simply stunning!  It took us a few minutes to also realize that the room was quite large (by NYC standards), and COMPLETELY equipped with kitchen utensils, microwave, dishwasher, and a portable range top available on request.  The fitness center wrapped around most of the 35th floor, and the amazing view almost overshadowed how well equipped it was, with a fairly nice array of aerobic equipment, dumbbells, weight machines, and a stretching/yoga area with complimentary daily yoga classes.  Wow!  Shortly after our arrival, we noticed that the door to the bathroom was off the runners, and hotel engineering quickly responded to repair it.  Oh, and breakfast is included!  A beautiful great room on the 3rd floor had a really nice breakfast buffet that was a perfect conclusion to our brief stay in New York.  A wonderful place at an unbeatable price!  I cannot imagine staying anywhere else on future NY trips.  Thanks to everyone who helped make our stay so nice.

title: Great Stay!
text:
Still love the fast elevators, the breakfast and coffee, and the big view of NYC!
It's near everything and It's expensive! 
Our second stay and no complaints except for the happy hour liquors.
The taste didn't make us very happy!

title: Chiquito pero cumplidor
text: Buen hotel. Ubicado en Brodway y la calle 54 A 8 caminables cuadras de Time Square y  a 5 de Central Park. En medio de la ciudad. Piso 61 . Elegí una habitación con vista a central park. 472, 19 diarios. Estuve 9 noches. La habitación tiene todo.  Micro hondas, platos, lavavajillas, refrigerador. Una mesita dos sillas. Un sillón. Todo en pequeñito. Una cama queen. Dos veladores pequeños. Un closet de 1 x 1 mt. Con caja de seguridad. Baño independiente. Aislado. Un muy buen desayuno autoservicio. Café simple, negro, decaf. Te, leche, de todos tipos. Avenas, cereales, frutas, panqueques, huevos, cecinas, panes. Nadie queda con hambre y nadie te molesta si sacas cosas a tu habitación. Chek inn a las 16, pero llegue a las 11. Avisé por una aplicación de Marriot. La habitación estaba lista. Check out expedito. Salí a las 11 am. Pero pude guardar maletas hasta las 19 horas pm.  Cerca del metro. En el piso que estaba, ningún ruido de la ciudad. Excelente vista. No todos hablan español, pero no hace falta. Cerca de todo. Un poco caro, pero bueno.

title: Amazing base to explore NYC!
text:
My husband and I stayed here from 19-26 August 2016. We're from the UK and wanted a good base from which to explore NYC by foot and subway.

The Residence Inn proved the perfect hotel for this. Our room, on the 41st floor, had a 'city view' which wowed us as soon as we walked in the door.
