It was a 'studio' (as all the rooms are) and included a little kitchen part with fridge, microwave, cutlery and crockery, and a lovely bathroom with huge shower. The bedroom part was relatively small compared to other US hotels we've stayed in, but this is completely expected in New York. However, the space was filled so well - with a huge comfy king size bed, armchair and desk. Our view looked out to the Met Life building and we could even see down to the Hudson river.

We found the hotel a great base for exploring - it was a short walk to several subway stations, and only a 10 minute walk to Central Park and Times Square. It was so nice to come back to such a comfy, well air conditioned room after exploring a hot and humid New York all day! Being near Times Square was great for the evenings when we could go out to eat an shop, and just wander.

Breakfast was included (think it is for all residents). There was a good selection - it's self serve and there are hot options, like scrambled egg, sausage and bacon, and even waffle machines, where you can make your own waffle. There are also fruit, pastries, bagels, muffins, toast etc. The breakfast room is on the 3rd floor and has floor to ceiling windows, so it's a great place to watch the world go by. It has more of a comfy lounge feel than a dining room feel, which was lovely.

All the staff we encountered were very nice and always polite. They were especially helpful in organising a taxi (more like a massive luxury SUV) to Newark airport for us at the end of our trip. Thanks to everyone who made our stay so wonderful - we'd definitely love to return some day and will be recommending this hotel to our friends.

title: Room with a view, room to improve
text:
Cashed in my Marriott points for a three day stay at this hotel. They have my guest requirements on file so I was given a high floor, the 65th floor.the look on my wives face at reception was one that will stay with me forever.
Check in etc all very efficient and the express elevator get you up to the top floor quickly. The rooms are modern and have a view you don't forget. But ours was a little tight in places, especially around the kitchen and bathroom door. Some of the kitchen units did not open as they rammed into the door frames, same with the wardrobe door that only partially opened as it hit the bathroom door frame. Microwave door had smashed glass as well. 
But it was clean, had a kettle and coffee maker so they where a bonus. 
Location was on Broadway. halfway between Central Park and Times Square. Bar is on 4th floor, but totally lacking in any atmosphere, so go out, don't stay in.
Staff are helpful and polite.

title: Fantástico
text: Fantástico todo: vista, ubicación, comodidad, servicios. Lo recomiendo. Después de varias visitas a NY ha sido el mejor lugar donde me he hospedado. En diciembre regresaré. Tiene un bistro en el cuarto piso, buen desayuno, excelente.

title: Perfeito!
text:
Hotel bem localizado, próximo ao Bryant Park, Times Square e Brodway. Dá para fazer praticamente tudo a pé. Os apartamentos são do tipo estúdio, amplos, limpos e dispõem de uma cozinha completa. Não tive nenhum problema relativo à segurança e os funcionários me atenderam muito bem. O café da manhã é maravilhoso, farto e muito variado, completamente diferente( para melhor) do que costuma-se encontrar nos EUA.
Eu voltaria a me hospedar nele tranquilamente.

title: Another fabulous week
text: We returned to the Marriott again this summer.  The room was awesome.  We had a corner room on the 48th floor and the view was amazing.  Two nights we did not want to go to a restaurant so we brought food in.  Looking out on the view felt like we were in the best restaurant.  The lights, the moon--so romantic.  The small room was very well designed and everything had a place.  The staff was wonderful and anything we needed was attended to immediately.

title: Perfect place for us
text: The staff are all friendly & helpful & for once the room we got looked exactly like the photos on their website. We were extremely happy with the room on 59th floor, the fantastic New York view from our large corner windows, in room safe, the kitchenette (which had a fridge, frezer, dishwasher & microwave) & the location. With breakfast  included & free wifi we had everything we needed. There is a 24hour gym & free yoga/core classes.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Good location for first timers
text:
This was our fist time in NYC.  As far as location goes, we loved this hotel.  Close to many subway stations to get you anywhere.  We checked in on a Tuesday.  We requested a check in time of 2:30 knowing it wasn't guaranteed until 4.  Got there at 2:30 and was told our Central Park view room wasn't ready.  It was fine, they stored our luggage for us and we wandered down to Times Square.  What annoyed the hell out of me is when I had to come back 2x times to finally get our room.  By 4 we wound up just sitting in the lobby waiting for them to finish.  I don't understand why they didn't clean our room when they knew we were there at 230.  We didn't get up there until 4:30 which is a half hour past their "guaranteed" check-in time.  

Anyway... Back to the hotel.  Once we got in our room we were pleasantly surprised by the views.... Mostly.  The hotel has failed to mention a huge building is currently being built between the hotel and the park.  The views you see online of Central Park? Not what you currently see.  Still great views nonetheless, I just think they should be a little more honest.  Beds were super comfortable and the kitchen area was nice.  As a whole the hotel wasn't as clean as I expected it to be but then again either is New York!!! 

Will I stay again? Probably not.  Was it a good hotel to feel safe and comfortable at our first time? Yes.

title: Ótima localização.
text: Estive em abril e ficamos na cidade por dez dias. Ótimo quarto bem limpo e tudo novo. Vista excepcional. Diaria acompanhando café da manhã. Excelente localização, permitindo visitas diárias ao Central Park para minhas corridas. Muito próximo da TS. Várias linhas de metrô próximas. Retornarei com certeza.

title: Fabulous Stay In NYC!
text:
The Residence Inn was an excellent place to stay and truly made my trip to New York incredible. The hotel was centrally located, and places like times square and central park were just walking distance from there. There was also easy access to many of the nearby subway stations. 
I wanted to take the time to really commend and show my utmost appreciation for Nicole Bautista, who had helped us with booking a room during our stay. Nicole was so kind and extremely helpful, and she was able to block a phenomenal corner room that gave an excellent view of times square and the rest of the city. She went above and beyond to make sure that we were comfortable and that all of our needs were met. She is truly an excellent employee and a wonderful person. 
The room that I had stayed it truly made the whole trip to NYC. Windows replace the outside facing walls in order to give guests a breath-taking panoramic view of the city. It also lovely to have breakfast included with our room.The breakfast buffet was very good, and had a many different choices and options for people each day. After walking around NYC and taking in all the sights and people, it was lively to come back to the hotel in the evenings and just sit with a glass of wine and look at the spectacular view. It still made you feel like you were immersed in the city. 
Overall, the Residence Inn was an amazing find, and really made our trip to New York memorable. The room was amazing, the staff were extremely courteous and helpful, and the central location made it extremely easy to visit and navigate nearby attractions. I would definitely give this hotel an outstanding recommendation and highly encourage people to stay here for one of the best experiences in New York!

title: Value for money
text:
Første gang i NYC. Og havde bestilt hotel hjemmefra. Vi blev ikke skuffet. Tværtimod. Dejligt hotel med stort hjørneværelse på 39. Etage med udsigt til Central Park, selvom en ny bygning skyder op, og tager en del af udsigten.
Fint værelse med masser af plads - også på badeværelset. Dejligt med masser af håndklæder. Desværre kunne det lille vindue nederst ikke åbnes, fordi åbne-mekanismen var i stykker.
Rengøring var helt i top.
God morgenmad -især den græske yoghurt kan anbefales.

Serviceminded receptions-personale.

God beliggenhed på 54.street ved Broadway. Centralt i forhold til Times Square og Central Park. 
God italiensk restaurant på Broadway bag hotellet Serafina. Et besøg værd.

En cykeltur i Central Park kan også anbefales. Dog lidt dyrt - 30 dollars for to timer.  Men du kommer mere rundt end ved at gå.

Konklusion: Vi kommer gerne igen til Residence Inn New York Manhattan Central Park.

title: Excelente ubicación y mucha comodidad
text:
El lugar es perfecto para caminar hacia un montón de lugares de interés y también está rodeado de medios de transporte para llegar a todos lados. 
Como era nuestro aniversario, nos ofrecieron un upgrade gratuito por lo que la habitación tenía una maravillosa vista al Central Park y a los rascacielos de Manhattan. La habitación es compacta pero muy cómoda, con muebles de guardado y todo lo necesario para cocinar. El baño es amplio y la ducha espectacular.
El desayuno es muy completo (incluso con comida caliente) y el lugar donde lo sirven muy agradable. Hay que llegar temprano para evitar las aglomeraciones.
A pesar de ser un hotel grande y nuestra habitación encontrarse en el piso 50, los ascensores venían enseguida y eran rapidísimos. Realmente recomendable!!

title: Perfect stay in NYC!
text:
This is my new fav in NYC! Our room was on one of the lower floors (42) and still had an amazing view. I loved the tiny but complete little kitchen area. Very clean, modern, updated feeling. Great bed, tons of pillows. And SO quiet...up high and great windows blocked out city noise. The free hot breakfast was pretty standard as far as these things go...but the room it was served in was lovely. 
We paid for our stay using points, but I think the rate would have been around $200...totally worth it. Not to mention the great location.  I will definitely stay here again!

title: Muy buena elección
text:
Tomamos una habitación en los pisos residenciales, con cocina y vista al Central Park. Si bien la habitación en muy pequeña, es preciosa y la vista es lo más importante. Solo diría que es demasiado pequeño el lugar para guardar la ropa.
Los servicios son excelentes. Lo mejor es comprar exquisiteces en los cientos de lugares que ofrece la ciudad y cenar con la vista. El desayuno es muy bueno. El servicio de recepción de compras por internet es excelente. Te la dejan directamente en la habitación. La ubicación es muy buena.

title: Comodissimo
text:
Stanze con vista mozzafiato, comoda

cucinetta, colazione varia e abbondante.
Uso di aria condizionata nei locali comuni
Esagerato...ma sembra essere comune in USA
Per chi ama Broadway e vuole andare a teatro
È un ottima soluzione con prezzi abbordabili

title: Disappointed
text:
I'm actually sad I have to give a bad review to this hotel as this was our last night in the States and we expected it to be awesome. 

The problem is: when you book through their website (we did it specifically to avoid problems) there are 2 kinds of bedrooms with Time Square Views: 

1) "Studio GRAND Times Sq. view"
2) "Studio Times Sq. view"

The first one is slightly more expensive, which leads you to believe you will have the room shown in all the pictures (a whole wall is a big window facing East Manhattan and you can see Times Square from the corner of the window). 

We basically assumed this because when you select a "Studio Times Sq. view" they show you 3 different floor plans and none matches the picture with the big window. While when you select the "Studio GRAND Times Sq. view" they don't show any floor plan, just the awesome bedroom with the huge window. So as this one is more expensive, you assume you'll get the cool bedroom for sure.

Our surprise was when, although we booked "GRAND Times Square View" we were given a small room like the ones shown in the "Studio Times Sq. view" (see picture with floor plan). 

Don't get me wrong, they also have great views and you can perfectly see Times Square, but if you can be given that room when you book a "Studio GRAND Times Sq. view", why is it more expensive?!?!

We felt disappointed with this. We were spending only one night and we were so exhausted from our trip that we didn't have the energy to go down again with our luggage and ask for an explanation that would end up in the typical "website states that pictures shown may not match your final bedroom". 

Anyways, I suggest you don't go with high expectations, so that you are amazed by the views anyways.

Also, if you book a Central Park View room, take into account they're building a new building between central Park and the Hotel. So 70% of the views over central park are about to disappear (although they don't tell you this on their website).

Having said that: it has a great location, nice views and nice breakfast. 

Anyways, we wouldn't go back unless they could guarantee we could have the exact room we wanted. And even like that, we felt deceived so we would probably look for other options.

title: vistas increíbles
text:
Nos alojamos durante una semana para las navidades y fue muy agradable.

Las habitaciones son de buen tamaño y cómodas y tuvimos la suerte de que nos colocaron en la planta 65 ofreciéndonos unas vistas impresionantes. 

El desayuno es genial, un buffet enorme con mucha variedad y la sala donde se sirve está decorada con mucho gusto

Los puntos negativos:

En el Check in nos pidieron una tarjeta como garantía,  pero no nos avisaron de que la preautorizarían. Nos dimos un susto al ver un bloqueo de cerca de 3000 euros en la cuenta. 

El personal no es muy atento,  al ir a hacer el check Out nos preguntaron un poco bordes que a qué estábamos esperando. 

algunas noches hubo mucho ruido que nos despertó más de una vez. Creo que estaban realizando algún trabajo de mantenimiento o obra justo encima de nuestra habitación. 

aparte de estas pequeñas cositas lo demás ha sido increíble,  no dudaría en repetir.

title: Our new favorite hotel  - location, views, service and price!!
text:
We travel a lot for business.  In fact, my husband has nearly 1 million Marriott points and we have lots on most of the other major hotel brands.  Generally speaking, we stay away from hotels when traveling for pleasure and use Home Away or Airbnb.  Hotels no matter how nice just remind us of work.  But not this time.  Marriott Residence Inn has changed our minds.

This was a mix of business and pleasure trip so we decided to give the Marriott Residence Inn a try.  We absolutely loved it.  We will be back and highly recommend it to those of you traveling for business or pleasure.

Why the great review?  First – location, location, location.  So centrally located.  Very close to the park.  Great restaurants.  The theatre district.  Extremely convenient to multiple subway lines.  Next – great service.  Everyone we came in contact with was pleasant, helpful and seemed to like their jobs.

The price was extremely fair at under $300 night.  Really a great value.  Almost too good to be true.

The vibe felt like a W.  The rooms are great.  Incredible views from the upper floors.  Among the best at any hotel we have stayed at in Manhattan.  The design of the rooms is so well done.  Super comfortable bed.  Kitchenette with fridge, freezer, microwave, stovetop on demand.  Great gym.  “Free” breakfast buffet that includes the usual fair….eggs, waffles, potatoes, meat, fruit, breads, cereal, etc.  We liked that they had some fresh spinach.  

I am a picky eater so I wouldn't eat much of what was served at breakfast.  I am that pain in the butt person who wants a certain type of bread, egg whites only, etc.  The Whole Foods at Columbus Circle is a 10 minute walk away and there is plenty of room to store your own food choices.

It is quiet and the sleep quality is very good.  The bathroom is clean and efficiently designed.

The gym is large enough, has nice equipment and very clean.

One thing to note that is a little confusing upon arrival…the address says 1717 Broadway but the entrance is actually around the corner on 54th Street.

Should you stay at this spot, Serafina just across the street is a very good restaurant.  We also liked Cognac but not quite as much as Serafina.

title: Gran lugar
text: Nos trataron de forma inimaginable, todo perfecto y el desayuno, muy entretenido hacer los wafles uno mismo y muy rico. Recomendable.  La calidad de las habitaciones, todo impecable, nada sucio y cada cosas que necesitábamos sin dudar nos ayudaban.

title: Second time at the Residence Inn
text: I had booked a city view but they put us in a room with both the city and Central Park. I use Marriott Rewards credit card often and I a lot of points and it was worth it to use them at this hotel. It's always a pleasure.  The fact that the there are windows around 75% of the room is wonderful. You just don't get these views and the space that you get from this hotel in most other hotels for the money.  The staff were courteous, the bartender great, everything was perfect. I did online check-in and we got into our room at 12pm. I know that can't happen every time but I just love Marriott and the rewards program. I will definitely stay in this hotel again.  Thank you so much Marriott and Residence Inn!!!

title: Genial
text:
El hotel es muy lindo. Es el hotel más alto de Norteamérica y se nota. La vista desde la habitación es impresionante. La habitación estaba muy limpia y la cocina es muy completa. El baño estaba impecable. 
Está situado a pasos de Times Square, cerca del metro, cerca de Central Park, de Broadway. En fin, la ubicación es perfecta, la zona no es para nada fea de noche y no se escucha un solo ruido.
El hotel cuenta con un Starbucks dentro y con una sala con algunas computadoras de uso gratuito (incluso la impresora). 
El personal es muy atento. Si realizás una compra por internet, no tienen problema en recibirte el paquete.
El desayuno es muy completo y el comedor donde se sirve es amplio, muy lindo y la vista también es preciosa.
Volvería!!

title: Second time and still a winner
text: This hotel has it all beginning with the staff at the front desk. Everyone in the hotel is very friendly and accommodating. Our room on the 64th floor had an amazing view and very comfortable bed. Room is not large but everything you might need for extended stay is there. We never had to wait more than a minute for elevator. Breakfast is first class and complimentary. Happy hour 4-7 had wonderful 1/2 off appetizers, enough to eat for a meal.

title: Great for a short stop
text:
Reserved a great king room with Central Park view on 50+ floor. New furnishings and decor.
Room was super efficient - small kitchenette, small bathroom, comfy bed, incredible park views. Note that the rooms are very small. Too bad that none connect as it would be a super place for families. It's a busy hotel, so reception is a bit of a production line, but there is vale for money here if traveling alone or as a couple.

title: Excelente. Un hotel para volver siempre!!
text: Las habitaciones están ubicadas desde el piso 40 a 60, de modo que siempre tendrán una vista espectacular.  En nuestro caso elegimos la vista a la ciudad, por lo que veíamos perfectamente los rascacielos de NY a través de nuestro ventanal vidriado.  La habitación es pequeña, pero muy bien decorada y con todo lo necesario para una estadía más que confortable (tiene una pequeña kichinette).  El desayuno también es espectacular.  Además, lo que su ubicación es excelente, está a 3 cuadras del central Park y a 5 de Time Square.  Es de esos hoteles que han quedado en mi memoria.  Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: Fantastic stay
text: Perfect position for us. Fab room. Very comfortable bed. Extremely clean. Complementary breakfast. Great to have a kitchen and a laundry on site. Staff very helpful. Valet parking great.Easy walking to everything. 10 our of 10

title: Last-minute
text: It has the largest breakfast area and it is clean. Friendly and efficient. It was a pleasure to Start my day there. As usual the staff was professional and friendly and the rooms were large and clean. We highly recommend this facility for a centrally located place to stay.

title: AN UNBELIEVABLE EXPERIENCE!
text: We originally were supposed to stay for 2 nights after experiencing a problem with the Marriott in Times Square, but this hotel overall was UNBELIEVABLE that we ended up staying 3 nights instead! When we checked in early that day, we were greeted by Alla and told her that we wanted the highest floor possible. She immediately gave us 2 rooms up on the 65th floor with one of them facing Times Square (Room 6507) and a corner/panoramic Central Park view room! (Room 6502) The views from both of the rooms are beyond breathtaking and the air quality was outstanding! Plus the rooms were spotless including the bathroom! But everything about this hotel was amazing including the staff who were the nicest people that I've ever encountered at any Marriott hotel! I would totally recommend staying at this hotel the next time we're in NYC and I would recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat! From the breakfast to the view, everything was absolutely without a doubt unforgettable! But I would recommend this hotel to anyone in the area and this is our official go-to hotel in NYC! But I couldn't be any happier with our stay and overall this hotel is beyond outstanding!

title: Perfect location near Central Park!
text: We chose this Residence Inn bc it's only a couple of blocks from Central Park.  The concierge gave us discount tickets to rent bikes at Central Park Sightseeing--2 blocks away and still only a couple of blocks from the park.  My husband asked for a room with a view when we checked in.  Two walls were floor to ceiling windows looking out at the city.  The room and bathroom looked brand new.  The breakfast was delicious.  Every employee we encountered was very friendly and helpful.  The location is Broadway and 54th.  For us this was not a bad walk to Times Square and to take the subway at 49th down to Brooklyn.  Wonderful time in the city!!

title: Pretty good hotel, definitely pretty good
text: Jeffrey checked us in.  He was good at that.  I liked him.  Valet parked our car, that was good.  Location was good, which was definitely good.   Room 5809 had good views, which were good to enjoy.  Saw a lot of things from the room.

title: Amazing View from 51st floor corner room!!
text: We loved our stay here at the Residence Inn.  We are Gold Elite Marriott members.  Check-in was easy and very very fast and the staff was very friendly - Jeffrey was superb!  We stayed in Room 5105 which is a corner room with a gorgeous view of Broadway towards Times Square, the Hudson River and a peek at Central Park.  The room is not large but very comfortable with a stocked kitchen, lots of storage and a great shower in the bathroom.  We had a king bed which was comfortable for a good nights sleep.  We enjoyed the chair, ottoman and table at the large corner window.  The room is also very quiet.  Breakfast is typical Residence Inn fare - it was good.  It does get very crowded and sometimes staff can't keep up with the demand.  This was a memorable room and we hope to return.

title: Awesome hotel with incredible view of Central Park
text: Beautiful room with corner view of Central Park from 52nd floor. We had a spacious king bed that was very comfortable. The AC worked great in super hot weather. Modern bathroom design as you will see in pictures. Flat screen TV had lots of HD channels. Very central location not far from Times Square. Was typical free Residence Inn breakfast: not great, not bad--hey, it's free. Lots of fast elevators. 4th floor concierge hang out area. Check in and check out was efficient. Would stay here again.

title: 2nd time liked it even better!
text: Came with my son for our annual trip to NYC and had a blast.  Joe at the desk intuited it was a special trip and gave us a room on 65th floor with city view!  We loved it.  While we did not cook anything, the tiny kitchen is really functional.  We used the drawer frig a lot.  room is clean and comfortable.  Breakfast standard but room has a lot of Windows and comfy seating areas.  My only complaint is the elevators are slow but maybe they all are in NYC?  It is a great location ... We used the Columbus circle subway stop a lot.

title: nos encanto!
text: La ubicacion es genial! cerca de central park y de times square las cuadras son real mente pequenas llegas super rapido caminando, hay muchos restaurantes cerca.La habitacion era muy comoda y tiene cocina, las vistas espectaculares, me sentia en casa.

title: Super
text:
Chambre sympa avec une vue imprenable sur Central Park, même si, avec les constructions atour de l'hôtel, les vues CP ou Times Square risquent de plus avoir le même sens…
Pour le reste, la salle du petit-déjeuner est agréable avec beaucoup de choix, le cadre moderne, idéalement placé. 
Pour le personnel, il y a comme partout les super sympa et les plus distants. 
Je n'ai pas de point de comparaison concernant les Residence Inn et les Courtyard, donc je ne sais pas trop comment situé mon niveau d'exigence. 
Il y a des petits détails qui sont sûrement gênants (peinture, joint, ménage incomplet un jour sur 2), mais rien de rédhibitoire lorsque l'on veut une chambre agréable après une grosse journée à Manhattan. 
Concernant le bruit de l'extérieur, aucun souci. La clim et le frigo seront les vrais compagnons sonores. 
N'hésitez pas à demander les higher levels lors de la réservation.

title: Excellent - Grandissime
text: Nous avons passé 5 nuits dans ce magnifique hôtel , la tête dans les étoiles, nous étions au soixantième étage , une chambre entièrement vitrée avec une vue extraordinaire allant de Central Park à Times Square. Grande chambre avec tout le confort, literie excellente, salle de bain très fonctionnelle avec une douche à l'italienne. Propreté irréprochable . Le petit déjeuner était compris dans le prix de la chambre , très varié , on s'est régalé avec les gaufres faites soit même , la variété des fruits (melons, fraises, ananas, oranges,.....), omelette, bacon, Burgers, 4 plats chauds différents tous les matins, un choix de viennoiseries......excellent et grandissime. Pour bien digérer, on passe à la salle de sport au 35 eme étage, avec de multiples appareils pour brûler les calories. Sans oublier un coin sympa au 4 eme pour boire ou se restaurer. Un accueil et un personnel sympa . Pour finir, un excellent rapport qualité / prix sur NY. Les hôtels 4 étoiles sur Paris sont bien inférieurs.

title: Great stay!
text: We just returned from a visit to NYC where we stayed 3 nights at the Residence Inn and 6 nights at the Courtyard. I will write a separate review on the Courtyard. We really enjoyed our stay overall and highly recommend both the Residence Inn and Courtyard at this location. The location is superb right there on Broadway and W 54th. So many great restaurants and all manner of shops within walking distance as well as Central Park, fifth ave and Columbus circle shopping, Broadway, you name it, it was right at our doorstep. Our room at Residence Inn was fab! I considered it spacious by new York city standards, very clean, modern, nicely laid out. Neat contemporary kitchenette with all of the necessary appliances for a comfortable stay and then some.  Quiet. We had no issues with noise although I will say that when the air con kicked on it was quite loud. Floor to ceiling windows even in the bathroom affording views of central park. Lovely! The bathroom was small and had just a shower stall but that was fine by me. I liked the showerhead and the water pressure was great. Just having the view while I sat on the loo was a good thing!  I can't say enough about this property. Our room was beautiful, we were comfortable, the location was first class and the price was very reasonable for what we got and when one considers the hotel rates generally in New York city. This hotel will not break the bank.  I will most definetly stay here again and have already recommended it to a few friends. Having had the benefit of staying in both properties in the building, I prefer the Residence Inn. I really was not expecting much as it had been a while since I stayed in a Residence Inn and it was very basic. This property far exceeded my expectations.

title: No lo vale
text: Las habitaciones son diminutas. El desayuno es malo. Te cobran un plus de 25 usd por dia al hacer el check in como garantia por si se compra algo y no avisan. Me entere porque recibi un mail de advertencia del banco. Estoy esperando la devolucion del dinero. No hacen storage de equipaje. Sin embargo, antes de reservar llame para preguntar y me informaron que si, razon por la cual hice 2 reservas ya que el fin de semana debia viajar a filadelfia con poco equipaje. Al llegar al hotel me dijeron que no, que el informe previo era errado- no se entiende que prometan una cosa antes de reservar y luego de pagar sea otra

title: Tres bien
text:
Hotel tres bien place idealement placé meme. On a demander chambre en hauteurs on avait une au 61 etage sur 65. Une vue magnifique sur times square de nyit comme de jour.
Lit confortable avec grande douche. Petite cuisine pratique. Propre. Un bar au 4 eme etage. Personnel sympa et souriant.

title: VISTA ESPECTACULAR
text: Normalmente me suelo hospedar en otros hoteles de la cadena Marriott pero esta vez opte por quedarme en este hotel y la verdad es que me pareció genial , perfecto para pasear por Nueva York !!! No se si será un hotel nuevo pero al menos así parecía , a pesar de que el lobby y hotel es pequeño , las habitaciones son muy  cómodas es mas tienen una pequeña cocina equipada, camas muy cómodas y unas vistas espectaculares hacia la ciudad y hacia el parque . El hotel queda a pocas cuadras del Central Park y Time Square  excelente porque esta al centro de la isla , con muchísimos bares, restaurantes y teatros para conocer y pasear . También hay estaciones del subway muy cerca.  Definitivamente muy recomendado !!!

title: Great Hotel
text: I love this hotel. It's the only place that I stay when I come too New York. The staff and management are so accomdating. I love the views and the kitchenettes. The location is ideal. It get 5 stars from me.

title: Excellent location
text:
Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, multiple subway routes and excellent complimentary breakfast, fitness center, laundry facilities and fully stocked kitchenette 
Good views of Central park and multiple nearby late nite restaurants, bars and Starbucks

title: Très central
text:
Endroit très agréable bien choisir les étages supérieurs pour le bruit de L avenue de  Brodway  
La proximité cet hôtel est un atout majeur pour un séjour court 
Très belle vue sur central park 
Service agréable et professionnel 
Bar sympa à L étage 
Petit déjeuner en dessous du reste de L hôtel

title: Très bien placé
text:
Idéalement placé en haut de Broadway, à 5' à pied de Central Park (pour le footing matinal) et du métro pour le reste ...
Accueil sympa et serviable, ambiance moderne, propre chambre fonctionnelle avec une salle de bain très bien faite, un coin cuisine équipée suffisant pour un repas sur le pouce (micro-onde), une literie géniale et un coin bureau pour bosser ou surfer ...
Très bien insonorisée, la vue sur l'Hudson et Big Apple est très sympa. Ceux qui veulent voir Central Park ... dépêchez-vous ... une tour se construit ... et par ailleurs la meilleure vue est à la Rockfeller Tower.
L'hôtel est à 40' en taxi de JFK.
Le prix est élevé comme un peu partout à NY, en s'y prennant tôt les prix sont meilleurs.
Le concierge est votre service pour "attraper un taxi" et sur d'autres sujets.
Un bémol : le p'tit dèj ! Allez à l'extérieur, c'est plus sympa.

title: Consigliatissimo
text:
Molto carino, pulito ed organizzato. Ottima colazione americana ed internazionale. Inoltre, palestra sempre aperta e lavanderia self service. Per me hotel quattro stelle. Consiglio forse superfluo: portatevi l'adattatore EU/USA.
Vicino a Times Square ma non nel caos.

title: Residence Inn versus Courtyard on Broadway
text: We had to opportunity to stay at both the Residence Inn and the Courtyard (which is the lower half of the building at this address) in May and July. My husband is a platinum member and we booked corner suites and standard rooms in both hotels. So how do the rooms compare? Overall we would book the Courtyard again and preferred these rooms. The Courtyard corner suites are much more spacious and roomier. We had a room on the 29th floor. The view is just as nice as being on the 45th floor of the Residence Inn. Both hotels use the same staff and we found them very nice and helpful both trips. The bathroom in the corner suite for the Courtyard was also much bigger than the Residence Inn. It had a bathtub, plus shower, and floor to ceiling window versus the Residence Inn which was tight with no bathtub or window. We did not hear much street noise from either room. My son found the bed uncomfortable in his room at the Courtyard, but comfy at the RI. I thought both beds were great. All of our rooms were nicely decorated, clean and modern. Again, the corner suite is the room with more space. We stayed at another hotel further south and preferred this location. It's easy to get to Rockefeller Center, which I loved and also Central Park and shopping at Avenue of Americas. The only feature of the kitchenette  we care about is a mini frig and both rooms had that. I would definitely recommend a stay here regardless of whether it's the upper or lower half of the hotel. My husband stays at a lot of Marriott Hotels and he said this is one of the nicest ones in comparison to many others in the US.

title: Bella vista su NY
text: Monolocale con cottura e bagno vista spettacolare dal 65 piano su Time Square , colazione compresa : tutto dolce e poco salato , frutta sempre la stessa tutti i giorni. Camere pulite, abbastanza piccole, ma a NY è normale . Sala palestra ben attrezzata , locale lavanderia a gettoni, minuto market con prezzi assurdi ! Personale abbastanza gentile. In ogni caso caro per quanto offre.

title: Great stay, amazing views, comfortable room
text: My wife and I stayed here last week and this was the best place we stayed at during our trip.  We were on the 56th floor with a wrap around view of the park and midtown which was amazing.  The room was modern with a really comfortable bed, and some nice amenities like a fridge/freezer, dishwasher, plates/silverware/etc.  It's a good location about 4 blocks from Central Park and surrounded by great food options (and cheap ones - the $1 pizza is solid).  Breakfast offered a lot of different options and got the morning started right.  I would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Great Stay, Solid Hotel
text:
This was my third stay here mainly because I like the location.  This trip was four nights in Corner View Room with spectacular views on the 60th floor – I believe it was worth extra cost (well, maybe not -they kill you w/ weekday rates).  I’ve had Central Park and Times Square views and like both.  Beware if booking standard room as they’re matchboxes – fine if traveling alone and/or if you truly don’t care or spend time in your room except to sleep.  And not all rooms have great views.  I was w/ my 10-yr-old and we had plenty of room.  It was compact but had everything we needed including kitchen (all rooms have kitchens).  This room had small closet, several large drawers and bathroom had good counter space, also bathrobes which was a first.  Very nice big walk-in shower.  The star of the room is the view - it was pretty spectacular.  I loved having glass of wine enjoying view at dusk before heading to dinner.  Unfortunately, there’s only one chair to sit and enjoy the view!   Wifi is included. 

I am over the included breakfast and won't factor in when planning future trips.  It’s pretty awful unless 1.  You'll eat anything  2. You simply want cereal or bagel and/or 3.  you're trying to save money.  The hot (lukewarm) food items are tasteless. You can grab an apple or banana.  We ended up eating around corner at Applejack Diner a few days – decent old-school diner where you can get real eggs vs. powdered.

My son was unhappy there was no Golf Channel...not likely going to bother most of you!  

You’ll be happy here if you book the right room and/or temper your expectations re the size of room.  For instance, if I was travelling w/ my husband and 6 ft teen son, this hotel is not in running because they don't offer rollaways and double double rooms would be too tight for us.

title: Only Studios
text:
This Residence is the most modern one I have stayed at and it has the most stunning views from the floor to ceiling windows if you have a high floor. I was able to see both the Hudson River and Central Park from my corner room. 

There is a kitchen area with a refrigerator and a dishwasher nicely hidden behind the cabinet doors. Also, there is a nice sized flat TV, but it should have been mounted on a moveable arm so one can see it from other than the bed.

The bathroom has a nice sized shower, however, the toilet bowl was not spaced properly between the sink and shower door.

Also, the wifi was poor, but the biggest negative it that the hotel only has studios.

Nevertheless, the location, the lovely lounge area and breakfast area (and breakfast) make it a place I would go back to.

title: Nice room but too small
text: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a vacation, therefore we had the usual luggage. Although it was a nice room with a kitchenette, it was tiny and there was only one wardrobe for two people (with one shelf) to store all our belongings and cases. The bed was comfortable, as usual for Marriott, and the location was good. Breakfast was included and was only ok but if you arrive late then many things were finished. We were told we had been given an 'upgrade' but if this is the case then i would not like to be in an ordinary room. The staff were always friendly though.

title: Good Stay - could have been better - room 6405 July 2016 - Marriott Platinum member
text:
The hotel is a brand new tower, on Broadway, right between Times Sq and Columbus Circle - so perfect location if you're a fan of midtown and easy access to explore NY. Since I'm a Platinum member they gave me a very high room (floor 64 out of the 65 floors it has) - Times Sq view. There are 4 elevators and despite busy at times no complaints here always worked. Room is not noisy either which is good.

The finishings and size of the room could be better, especially for the price they charge, but its NY so you can expect smaller rooms and not so clean rooms either, overall was ok. Bed was comfy. Toilet was really small, too small especially if you're two.

Gym was really good although WiFi for residence inn strangely does not connect at the gym, only connects to the nearby courtyard which was annoying. brought to the attention of the staff twice, but they didn't seem to care much. Is this, the staff attitude that dissapointed me the most. Don't get me wrong, some staff were nice, but overall they were not helpful and found them very fake, not genuine. 

I travel a lot for work and can tell straight away when they offer good service and unfortunately is not the case for this property - they need to work on this, especially in such competitive market as NY...just to give an example, i had placed an order online on amazon which arrived a couple of days before we arrived (confirmed by UPS) - i had to go down and ask at reception after waiting for 2 days for the box to be sent to me.....despite putting my name, marriott rewards number and even confirmation number on the delivery address....whoever received the parcel should have had common sense and have this given/sent to me upon arrival.....the worst is when i came down in person to ask they made me wait for over 15 minutes, after which i left back to my room and asked them to please bring it up....they looked at me funny, and told me they would do with A LOT of attitude, to make things worse the staff who brought the parcel upstairs stood by for a long time waiting for a tip and gave me a lot of attitude as well - not the service you would expect for the price they charge, not to mention since im a platinum member - is this how they treat elite members? hmmm

Room has a mini mini but cool kitchen inside, so not really like other residences inn, a lot smaller, but was good and has a dishwasher and mini fridge/freezer. 

Breakfast was ok, clean but very basic...i was missing bacon and some low-car / healthier options....all food seemed very artificial....still was ok to get you by. restaurant was clean.

Overall was OK, could have been better and service SHOULD have been better.. i have already booked my next stay at NY already and certainly will not be at this property. despite the view the service /staff really put me down. 

I may go back at some point if i see they have improved their service...a bit disappointed to be honest although they were set on arrival offered us a bottle of wine.

title: Amazing Views! GREAT Hotel!
text:
You won't find a better view than this in the city!  Amazing! We stayed here on a Saturday night on the 60th floor.  This hotel offers a great location, very close to many Broadway shows, great food, and a short walk to the park.  Our room was sparkling clean, modern, and the was very spacious for NYC standards, the bathroom especially!   The lounge the free breakfast is located has plenty of seating, and the food great!  We will definitely stay here again!   

Tip if you are driving....there is an ICON parking garage across the street, which makes parking easy peasy (we waited for the valet at the hotel, but they never came out, and this was the same garage they park  your car in and cheaper with a Groupon).

title: Stunning views, nice modern rooms
text:
Can be pricey the rooms are not huge, but nicely planned kitchenette .
Highlights are the floor to ceiling windows and rooms start on 35th floor thru 65
Great breakfast - love the waffles but it closes quite early , don't sleep in!
Room 6005 is a double and a single bed , cosy for 3 people but ok

title: Very nice hotel in midtown
text: This hotel is fairly new and is one of the tallest (65 floors) if not the tallest hotel in NYC, which affords you a magnificent view of the city and the Hudson River.  The rooms are small but larger than average for NYC.  Each room has a serviceable kitchen area with microwave, toaster, refrigerator and freezer and silverware and dinner ware. The breakfast is free and is very good with lots of choices of hot and cold food.  The business center, bar and lounge are all large and very nice.  The location is ideal, near theaters, Central Park, and shopping. The photo is from our room on the 47th floor.

title: Fabulous hotel in an ideal location.
text: We arrived early in the morning and although we couldn't check in, the hotel were happy to hold our luggage, so that we could explore. We were told to come back around 2.30pm which we did and wow we were given a room on the 64th floor! Looking out of the window the Rockefeller building was in front of us, Times Square to the right and Central Park to the left. We even watched the 4th of July fireworks from our room. The room was small for our family but hey this is NYC and who cares when you have a view like so. There was a small kitchen area with fridge/dishwasher/microwave and a stove on request should you desire. A supermarket is only mins away. Exit hotel, turn right and you will find one at the first set of traffic lights, on the corner. Housekeeping was excellent. A laundry room is available with many washers and dryers. $1.75 is required for both. Free yoga classes are available at set times however sadly, although I wanted to do this I never got to do so during our 5 night stay. Our only little let down was breakfast. There never seemed to be enough tables for the volume of people regardless of the time you went. We also had a late check out, 2pm and then again the hotel held our bags until it was time to leave where we used the hotel's car service to JFK. Well worth the fixed rate of $75 including tolls and tip to airport. Special mentions...first go to Roger who looked after us so well. He was always asking how we were and if we'd had fun on that day's activity however the "star" for us was one, Mr Agron Hallil. He happened to over hear my asking for a hotel umbrella and disappointment when told there were none. it was pouring down. At this point he stepped in and was so very apologetic and asked us to wait a few mins, he'd be back, we did. This true gent came back with his own personal umbrella so that we could go out in the rain. That's customer service!! Thank you kind sir. I hope you got your umbrella back, as requested we left it at reception. Finally, location is ideal, near to all major sights and broadway without being in the middle of it. We will be back!!

title: Great weekend stay for our anniversary
text: Can't say enough about how great our weekend stay was at this hotel. It's a great location in midtown. Close enough to time square by walking, but far enough away to have some peace and quiet. Only a few blocks away from Columbus circle and south side of Central Park. Great restaurants and food trucks close by. There is valet for $55 they are pretty quick to get your car. Got a slightly early check in being a rewards member. I highly recommend corner room, check out our pictures. 4th floor lobby and bar very nice. BC it was our anniversary they gave us  2 free drinks! Rooms are small but very nice and we loved the comfy bed. The views are amazing you can stare out the window forever. New construction does slightly block view of park. Staff is friendly and helpful. This will be our go to hotel in NYC. Price is very reasonable to for NYC. Category 8 for Marriott rewards.  Can't wait to go back!

title: リピーターになりそう
text:
部屋は60Fのタイムズスクエアビュー。角部屋だったので、南側はタイムズスクエア、西側はハドソン川を望みます。部屋そのものは小さめですが、窓が足元からあり開放的なため、狭さは全く感じませんでした。60Fということは地上200ｍ近くだと思います。目線を遮るビルは近くにはなかったので、一日中カーテンを閉めることもなく素晴らしい眺望を楽しむことができました。でも、次回は逆側のセントラルパークビューにしようと思います。
ロケーションは最高。どこに行くにも便利です。人通りは絶えないので帰りが夜中になっても全く不安はありません。
エレベーターの待ち時間もなくストレスなく使用できますが、唯一、細かい振動が気になりました。勤務先の高層ビルは動いているのがわからないほど全く揺れないので・・・。
フリーの朝食も、豪華さはないけど、機能的で気に入りました。セルフサービスで案内されることなく、勝手に好きなところに座って好きなものもってきて食べるスタイルでした。
豪華ホテルだと緊張してしまうのですが、とてもアットホームな感じで、とても気に入りました。

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel close to times Square but away from the crowds. Rooms are spacious for Midtown at a decent price. Most important is that the entire staff is super helpful and friendly.  Short walk to theater district and restaurants.

title: Nice 4 day NYC family visit.
text: Granddaughter's HS band played at Carnegie Hall (one block from our hotel.  Five of us took subway(1/2 block)  to WTC for $16.00 total and faster than a taxi. Good food at iris pub around the corner.  3 block to Times Squire, 1/2 block to Late Night with Stephen Colbert. Close to McD's, food market, took a jazz cruise which was great! Staff at hotel were very friendly, rooms are small and nice, we were on the 8th floor and did not hear any street noise day or night, fridge in the room, and coffee maker (K cups). No crime, streets are clean, lots of young people.   Great trip!

title: Wonderful location, Great service
text:
Took my Son for his first visit to NYC, and this place was wonderful.   The staff went out of there way to give us a great room overlooking Time Square, and made us feel welcome every time we came in and out. i

Really cool to be in the tallest hotel in North America.

Will certainly come back.

title: Decent choice but not up to Marriott standards
text:
This hotel is ok but not great as a MR Platinum member I have stayed in many Marriott properties and this one is sub par in terms of cleanliness and upkeep. The rooms are all a little broken (kitchen cabinets, bathroom faucets, noisy refrigerators etc) we switched rooms and just decided to settle on the last room as we didn't want to switch again.

The staff there is ok, the day shift manager was good as she was always attentive and made sure check in was a breeze. 

Our floor was a bit smelly during the entire stay (44th floor) the views on the website are no longer accurate as there is construction adjacent to the park and the new high-rise under construction obstructs the park view.

The one thing that is excellent is the location, you are smack in the middle of town and two blocks to several different metro lines.

title: A Room with a View!
text: Booked....and would re-book! Stayed there a week...and enjoyed the view of Times Square, breakfast and Johnson's help, the Porter Orlando as he hailed a much needed taxi and the many helpful front desk staff. Relaxing lounge on the 4th floor for drinks after spending the day out and about. Central spot for shows, restaurants, museums and transportation around the city.  Only hiccup was the delayed maid service for the room...but even that was dealt with expertly.

title: Great Hotel in Perfect Location
text: I chose the Residence Inn near Central Park for my first trip to New York in over 30 years.  It turned out to be a perfect choice!   My room had an incredible view of Central Park and Midtown.   It looked exactly like the featured picture, except for a new building under construction a few blocks to the north.   The room was very well designed and included a mini kitchenette.   The included breakfast was great, it included the largest selection I have ever seen for a hotel breakfast of its kind, and it was in a large room with great views on the third floor.   The location is perfect...close to Times Square (but far away from the chaos), Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park, and Lincoln Center.   The neighborhood is great with a nice mix of visitors and locals.  Most of all, the staff is superb.   This is clearly a well run operation based on the friendliness and upbeat demeanor of all of the staff I encountered.   Special thanks to Andrew, Joe and Bill (?) for ensuring that I got the best rate and best available room!   To prove how much I liked this hotel, my outbound flight from LaGuardia was cancelled and I returned and stayed another night!

title: Love this hotel
text: New hotel is highest in the city.  Rooms are small but the views are great.  This hotel is on the upper floors of the building.  Modern appearance.  Green hotel.  Breakfast in am is generous especially in NYC.  Very close to everything.  Lots of restaurants nearby.  Central Park walking distance away. Nice place

title: Ubicación inmejorable, personal esmerado, falta limpieza más profunda y algo de mantenimiento general.
text:
Muchos puntos a favor y sólo uno en contra (la limpieza no tan exaustiva y el mantenimiento general).
Nos alojamos en el piso 57, con vista a Time Square: impagable abrir las cortinas y tener esa vista!! 
Tanto el salón donde se sirve como la calidad del desayuno, excelentes! Todo el personal del hotel sumamente amable y simpre bien predispuesto.
Genial contar con cocina, refrigerador, lavavajillas, etc, en la habitación.
Lo mejor: la ubicación!!
A mejorar: limpieza de las habitaciones y mantenimiento general de las mismas y los pasillos (no el lobby y el salón del tercer piso, impecables ambos).
Volvería s

title: NYC
text: Checked in promptly, beautiful room on 42nd floor looking over Hudson river. Room immaculate, central location, subway on 53rd. Buffet breakfast set you up for a day of sightseeing. Wasn't aware of traffic noise, would recommend for comfort, location and amentities

title: Mixed feelings but overall satisfied
text:
The location of the hotel is perfect for sightsseing.
Check in was quick and courteous.
I had a room on the 40th floor overlooking midtown 
I found the room rather small. I had no other option but to leave my suitcase on the floor between the wall and the bed. Impossible to put it in the closet or under the bed. This could be a problem for those travelling with more than one suitcase.
The kitchenette was perfect.
I had two issues : the sliding door between the bedroom and the bathroom/shower never stayed closed and I was never able to stop the flooding each time I showered.
Other than that the room was fine (very clean, excellent bed and quiet) 
Breakfast was included. It was very ordinary.
I wouldn't hesitate to return if the rate was good.

title: Good hotel in a great location
text:
Each trip to New York my wife and I try to stay at a different hotel just to get a new feel of the city. This year we stayed here and had a great stay. As mentioned in other reviews the rooms are on the small side but the view more than makes up for it. We were on the 60th floor with a corner room looking at Times Square. You could also see the park looking back to the left. The view was simply amazing and even better at night when the city was bright with lights. Check in was easy and the elevators moved quickly considering how many floors there are. 
The hotel is located directly across the street from the Stephen Colbert show and has many choices of restaurants and dive bars on the block it's located. Easy access to the subway is also a plus. You are a 5 minute walk from both then park and Times Square.  
Breakfast was another plus. Getting up and not worrying about finding somewhere to eat each morning before a long day of walking the city was a huge plus for us. The area overlooks the streets so you can sit and eat breakfast and people watch to begin your day.  The food was as good as any complementary breakfast I have had and has a decent selection of choices. 
If your looking for nice views, great location, and easy access to a lot of New York attractions then to hotel is good for you.

title: Perfect Location!
text:
We found this perfect hotel nestled in between the craziness of Times Square and Broadway. The location makes it super perfect for walking around all the places in NY near Manhattan, TS and Central Park. For farther distance, you can easily get a taxi at the corner.  The space is not too huge, but then again it is NY. And just out of the window, I could see Central Park. The room was perfect for us and the shower is fantastic :-)
The breakfast experience is something really good. First of all, it is very aesthetically decorated and the views , oh my gosh! The breakfast spread was by far the best I had at any Marriott establishment.  The front desk people are super helpful. I would always come back to this place. A great experience!

title: AMAZING!!
text: OUTSTANDING!!! I emailed the GM Tim McGlinchey a week before my reservation and Tim along with Andrew Barry, a manager upgraded my reservation. I was staying for 8 nights and booked all on points a city view room and they upgraded me to a Grand Times Square View Room. I ended up on the 58th floor overlooking Times Square & the Hudson River. Bed was super comfy, nice soft pillows, excellent water pressure from the shower and super fast elevators. Tim and his staff made me feel like a valued customer! The location is amazing, wedged between Times Square & Central Park. Subway is right nearby along with lots of great nightlife. Just can't say enough about this hotel!
